TouristDestination.name: TouristDestination
TouristDestination.help:
A tourist destination. In principle any [[Place]] can be a [[TouristDestination]] from a [[City]], Region or [[Country]] to an [[AmusementPark]] or [[Hotel]]. This Type can be used on its own to describe a general [[TouristDestination]], or be used as an [[additionalType]] to add tourist relevant properties to any other [[Place]].  A [[TouristDestination]] is defined as a [[Place]] that contains, or is colocated with, one or more [[TouristAttraction]]s, often linked by a similar theme or interest to a particular [[touristType]]. The [UNWTO](http://www2.unwto.org/) defines Destination (main destination of a tourism trip) as the place visited that is central to the decision to take the trip.
  (See examples below.)

inputs.name: includesAttraction
inputs.label: includesAttraction
inputs.help: Attraction located at destination.

inputs.name: touristType
inputs.label: touristType
inputs.help: Attraction suitable for type(s) of tourist. E.g. children, visitors from a particular country, etc.

Rating.name: Rating
Rating.help: A rating is an evaluation on a numeric scale, such as 1 to 5 stars.

inputs.name: author
inputs.label: author
inputs.help: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

inputs.name: bestRating
inputs.label: bestRating
inputs.help: The highest value allowed in this rating system. If bestRating is omitted, 5 is assumed.

inputs.name: ratingExplanation
inputs.label: ratingExplanation
inputs.help: A short explanation (e.g. one to two sentences) providing background context and other information that led to the conclusion expressed in the rating. This is particularly applicable to ratings associated with "fact check" markup using [[ClaimReview]].

inputs.name: ratingValue
inputs.label: ratingValue
inputs.help:
The rating for the content.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

inputs.name: reviewAspect
inputs.label: reviewAspect
inputs.help: This Review or Rating is relevant to this part or facet of the itemReviewed.

inputs.name: worstRating
inputs.label: worstRating
inputs.help: The lowest value allowed in this rating system. If worstRating is omitted, 1 is assumed.

SurgicalProcedure.name: SurgicalProcedure
SurgicalProcedure.help: A medical procedure involving an incision with instruments; performed for diagnose, or therapeutic purposes.

ComicSeries.name: ComicSeries
ComicSeries.help:
A sequential publication of comic stories under a
    	unifying title, for example "The Amazing Spider-Man" or "Groo the
    	Wanderer".

StatusEnumeration.name: StatusEnumeration
StatusEnumeration.help: Lists or enumerations dealing with status types.

SellAction.name: SellAction
SellAction.help: The act of taking money from a buyer in exchange for goods or services rendered. An agent sells an object, product, or service to a buyer for a price. Reciprocal of BuyAction.

inputs.name: buyer
inputs.label: buyer
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant/person/organization that bought the object.

inputs.name: warrantyPromise
inputs.label: warrantyPromise
inputs.help: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

MedicalCause.name: MedicalCause
MedicalCause.help: The causative agent(s) that are responsible for the pathophysiologic process that eventually results in a medical condition, symptom or sign. In this schema, unless otherwise specified this is meant to be the proximate cause of the medical condition, symptom or sign. The proximate cause is defined as the causative agent that most directly results in the medical condition, symptom or sign. For example, the HIV virus could be considered a cause of AIDS. Or in a diagnostic context, if a patient fell and sustained a hip fracture and two days later sustained a pulmonary embolism which eventuated in a cardiac arrest, the cause of the cardiac arrest (the proximate cause) would be the pulmonary embolism and not the fall. Medical causes can include cardiovascular, chemical, dermatologic, endocrine, environmental, gastroenterologic, genetic, hematologic, gynecologic, iatrogenic, infectious, musculoskeletal, neurologic, nutritional, obstetric, oncologic, otolaryngologic, pharmacologic, psychiatric, pulmonary, renal, rheumatologic, toxic, traumatic, or urologic causes; medical conditions can be causes as well.

inputs.name: causeOf
inputs.label: causeOf
inputs.help: The condition, complication, symptom, sign, etc. caused.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: actors
inputs.label: actors
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: caption
inputs.label: caption
inputs.help: The caption for this object. For downloadable machine formats (closed caption, subtitles etc.) use MediaObject and indicate the [[encodingFormat]].

inputs.name: director
inputs.label: director
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: directors
inputs.label: directors
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: embeddedTextCaption
inputs.label: embeddedTextCaption
inputs.help: Represents textual captioning from a [[MediaObject]], e.g. text of a 'meme'.

inputs.name: musicBy
inputs.label: musicBy
inputs.help: The composer of the soundtrack.

inputs.name: transcript
inputs.label: transcript
inputs.help: If this MediaObject is an AudioObject or VideoObject, the transcript of that object.

inputs.name: videoFrameSize
inputs.label: videoFrameSize
inputs.help: The frame size of the video.

inputs.name: videoQuality
inputs.label: videoQuality
inputs.help: The quality of the video.

Product.name: Product
Product.help: Any offered product or service. For example: a pair of shoes; a concert ticket; the rental of a car; a haircut; or an episode of a TV show streamed online.

inputs.name: additionalProperty
inputs.label: additionalProperty
inputs.help: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristic of the entity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

inputs.name: aggregateRating
inputs.label: aggregateRating
inputs.help: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

inputs.name: asin
inputs.label: asin
inputs.help:
An Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN) is a 10-character alphanumeric unique identifier assigned by Amazon.com and its partners for product identification within the Amazon organization (summary from [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_Standard_Identification_Number)'s article).

Note also that this is a definition for how to include ASINs in Schema.org data, and not a definition of ASINs in general - see documentation from Amazon for authoritative details.
ASINs are most commonly encoded as text strings, but the [asin] property supports URL/URI as potential values too.

inputs.name: audience
inputs.label: audience
inputs.help: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

inputs.name: award
inputs.label: award
inputs.help: An award won by or for this item.

inputs.name: awards
inputs.label: awards
inputs.help: Awards won by or for this item.

inputs.name: brand
inputs.label: brand
inputs.help: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

inputs.name: category
inputs.label: category
inputs.help: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

inputs.name: color
inputs.label: color
inputs.help: The color of the product.

inputs.name: colorSwatch
inputs.label: colorSwatch
inputs.help: A color swatch image, visualizing the color of a [[Product]]. Should match the textual description specified in the [[color]] property. This can be a URL or a fully described ImageObject.

inputs.name: countryOfAssembly
inputs.label: countryOfAssembly
inputs.help: The place where the product was assembled.

inputs.name: countryOfLastProcessing
inputs.label: countryOfLastProcessing
inputs.help: The place where the item (typically [[Product]]) was last processed and tested before importation.

inputs.name: countryOfOrigin
inputs.label: countryOfOrigin
inputs.help:
The country of origin of something, including products as well as creative  works such as movie and TV content.

In the case of TV and movie, this would be the country of the principle offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie. For other kinds of [[CreativeWork]] it is difficult to provide fully general guidance, and properties such as [[contentLocation]] and [[locationCreated]] may be more applicable.

In the case of products, the country of origin of the product. The exact interpretation of this may vary by context and product type, and cannot be fully enumerated here.

inputs.name: depth
inputs.label: depth
inputs.help: The depth of the item.

inputs.name: funding
inputs.label: funding
inputs.help: A [[Grant]] that directly or indirectly provide funding or sponsorship for this item. See also [[ownershipFundingInfo]].

inputs.name: gtin
inputs.label: gtin
inputs.help:
A Global Trade Item Number ([GTIN](https://www.gs1.org/standards/id-keys/gtin)). GTINs identify trade items, including products and services, using numeric identification codes.

The GS1 [digital link specifications](https://www.gs1.org/standards/Digital-Link/) express GTINs as URLs (URIs, IRIs, etc.). Details including regular expression examples can be found in, Section 6 of the GS1 URI Syntax specification; see also [schema.org tracking issue](https://github.com/schemaorg/schemaorg/issues/3156#issuecomment-1209522809) for schema.org-specific discussion. A correct [[gtin]] value should be a valid GTIN, which means that it should be an all-numeric string of either 8, 12, 13 or 14 digits, or a "GS1 Digital Link" URL based on such a string. The numeric component should also have a [valid GS1 check digit](https://www.gs1.org/services/check-digit-calculator) and meet the other rules for valid GTINs. See also [GS1's GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) and [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_Trade_Item_Number) for more details. Left-padding of the gtin values is not required or encouraged. The [[gtin]] property generalizes the earlier [[gtin8]], [[gtin12]], [[gtin13]], and [[gtin14]] properties.

Note also that this is a definition for how to include GTINs in Schema.org data, and not a definition of GTINs in general - see the GS1 documentation for authoritative details.

inputs.name: gtin12
inputs.label: gtin12
inputs.help: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: gtin13
inputs.label: gtin13
inputs.help: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceding zero. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: gtin14
inputs.label: gtin14
inputs.help: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: gtin8
inputs.label: gtin8
inputs.help: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: hasAdultConsideration
inputs.label: hasAdultConsideration
inputs.help: Used to tag an item to be intended or suitable for consumption or use by adults only.

inputs.name: hasCertification
inputs.label: hasCertification
inputs.help: Certification information about a product, organization, service, place, or person.

inputs.name: hasEnergyConsumptionDetails
inputs.label: hasEnergyConsumptionDetails
inputs.help: Defines the energy efficiency Category (also known as "class" or "rating") for a product according to an international energy efficiency standard.

inputs.name: hasMeasurement
inputs.label: hasMeasurement
inputs.help: A measurement of an item, For example, the inseam of pants, the wheel size of a bicycle, the gauge of a screw, or the carbon footprint measured for certification by an authority. Usually an exact measurement, but can also be a range of measurements for adjustable products, for example belts and ski bindings.

inputs.name: hasMerchantReturnPolicy
inputs.label: hasMerchantReturnPolicy
inputs.help: Specifies a MerchantReturnPolicy that may be applicable.

inputs.name: height
inputs.label: height
inputs.help: The height of the item.

inputs.name: inProductGroupWithID
inputs.label: inProductGroupWithID
inputs.help: Indicates the [[productGroupID]] for a [[ProductGroup]] that this product [[isVariantOf]].

inputs.name: isAccessoryOrSparePartFor
inputs.label: isAccessoryOrSparePartFor
inputs.help: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is an accessory or spare part.

inputs.name: isConsumableFor
inputs.label: isConsumableFor
inputs.help: A pointer to another product (or multiple products) for which this product is a consumable.

inputs.name: isFamilyFriendly
inputs.label: isFamilyFriendly
inputs.help: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

inputs.name: isRelatedTo
inputs.label: isRelatedTo
inputs.help: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

inputs.name: isSimilarTo
inputs.label: isSimilarTo
inputs.help: A pointer to another, functionally similar product (or multiple products).

inputs.name: isVariantOf
inputs.label: isVariantOf
inputs.help: Indicates the kind of product that this is a variant of. In the case of [[ProductModel]], this is a pointer (from a ProductModel) to a base product from which this product is a variant. It is safe to infer that the variant inherits all product features from the base model, unless defined locally. This is not transitive. In the case of a [[ProductGroup]], the group description also serves as a template, representing a set of Products that vary on explicitly defined, specific dimensions only (so it defines both a set of variants, as well as which values distinguish amongst those variants). When used with [[ProductGroup]], this property can apply to any [[Product]] included in the group.

inputs.name: itemCondition
inputs.label: itemCondition
inputs.help: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition specifying the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer. Also used for product return policies to specify the condition of products accepted for returns.

inputs.name: keywords
inputs.label: keywords
inputs.help: Keywords or tags used to describe some item. Multiple textual entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas, or by repeating the property.

inputs.name: logo
inputs.label: logo
inputs.help: An associated logo.

inputs.name: manufacturer
inputs.label: manufacturer
inputs.help: The manufacturer of the product.

inputs.name: material
inputs.label: material
inputs.help: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

inputs.name: mobileUrl
inputs.label: mobileUrl
inputs.help:
The [[mobileUrl]] property is provided for specific situations in which data consumers need to determine whether one of several provided URLs is a dedicated 'mobile site'.

To discourage over-use, and reflecting intial usecases, the property is expected only on [[Product]] and [[Offer]], rather than [[Thing]]. The general trend in web technology is towards [responsive design](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Responsive_web_design) in which content can be flexibly adapted to a wide range of browsing environments. Pages and sites referenced with the long-established [[url]] property should ideally also be usable on a wide variety of devices, including mobile phones. In most cases, it would be pointless and counter productive to attempt to update all [[url]] markup to use [[mobileUrl]] for more mobile-oriented pages. The property is intended for the case when items (primarily [[Product]] and [[Offer]]) have extra URLs hosted on an additional "mobile site" alongside the main one. It should not be taken as an endorsement of this publication style.

inputs.name: model
inputs.label: model
inputs.help: The model of the product. Use with the URL of a ProductModel or a textual representation of the model identifier. The URL of the ProductModel can be from an external source. It is recommended to additionally provide strong product identifiers via the gtin8/gtin13/gtin14 and mpn properties.

inputs.name: mpn
inputs.label: mpn
inputs.help: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

inputs.name: negativeNotes
inputs.label: negativeNotes
inputs.help:
Provides negative considerations regarding something, most typically in pro/con lists for reviews (alongside [[positiveNotes]]). For symmetry 

In the case of a [[Review]], the property describes the [[itemReviewed]] from the perspective of the review; in the case of a [[Product]], the product itself is being described. Since product descriptions 
tend to emphasise positive claims, it may be relatively unusual to find [[negativeNotes]] used in this way. Nevertheless for the sake of symmetry, [[negativeNotes]] can be used on [[Product]].

The property values can be expressed either as unstructured text (repeated as necessary), or if ordered, as a list (in which case the most negative is at the beginning of the list).

inputs.name: nsn
inputs.label: nsn
inputs.help: Indicates the [NATO stock number](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/NATO_Stock_Number) (nsn) of a [[Product]].

inputs.name: offers
inputs.label: offers
inputs.help: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

inputs.name: pattern
inputs.label: pattern
inputs.help: A pattern that something has, for example 'polka dot', 'striped', 'Canadian flag'. Values are typically expressed as text, although links to controlled value schemes are also supported.

inputs.name: positiveNotes
inputs.label: positiveNotes
inputs.help:
Provides positive considerations regarding something, for example product highlights or (alongside [[negativeNotes]]) pro/con lists for reviews.

In the case of a [[Review]], the property describes the [[itemReviewed]] from the perspective of the review; in the case of a [[Product]], the product itself is being described.

The property values can be expressed either as unstructured text (repeated as necessary), or if ordered, as a list (in which case the most positive is at the beginning of the list).

inputs.name: productID
inputs.label: productID
inputs.help: The product identifier, such as ISBN. For example: ``` meta itemprop="productID" content="isbn:123-456-789" ```.

inputs.name: productionDate
inputs.label: productionDate
inputs.help: The date of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

inputs.name: purchaseDate
inputs.label: purchaseDate
inputs.help: The date the item, e.g. vehicle, was purchased by the current owner.

inputs.name: releaseDate
inputs.label: releaseDate
inputs.help: The release date of a product or product model. This can be used to distinguish the exact variant of a product.

inputs.name: review
inputs.label: review
inputs.help: A review of the item.

inputs.name: reviews
inputs.label: reviews
inputs.help: Review of the item.

inputs.name: size
inputs.label: size
inputs.help: A standardized size of a product or creative work, specified either through a simple textual string (for example 'XL', '32Wx34L'), a  QuantitativeValue with a unitCode, or a comprehensive and structured [[SizeSpecification]]; in other cases, the [[width]], [[height]], [[depth]] and [[weight]] properties may be more applicable.

inputs.name: sku
inputs.label: sku
inputs.help: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

inputs.name: slogan
inputs.label: slogan
inputs.help: A slogan or motto associated with the item.

inputs.name: weight
inputs.label: weight
inputs.help: The weight of the product or person.

inputs.name: width
inputs.label: width
inputs.help: The width of the item.

SpeakableSpecification.name: SpeakableSpecification
SpeakableSpecification.help: A SpeakableSpecification indicates (typically via [[xpath]] or [[cssSelector]]) sections of a document that are highlighted as particularly [[speakable]]. Instances of this type are expected to be used primarily as values of the [[speakable]] property.

inputs.name: cssSelector
inputs.label: cssSelector
inputs.help: A CSS selector, e.g. of a [[SpeakableSpecification]] or [[WebPageElement]]. In the latter case, multiple matches within a page can constitute a single conceptual "Web page element".

inputs.name: xpath
inputs.label: xpath
inputs.help: An XPath, e.g. of a [[SpeakableSpecification]] or [[WebPageElement]]. In the latter case, multiple matches within a page can constitute a single conceptual "Web page element".

Periodical.name: Periodical
Periodical.help: A publication in any medium issued in successive parts bearing numerical or chronological designations and intended to continue indefinitely, such as a magazine, scholarly journal, or newspaper.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

MolecularEntity.name: MolecularEntity
MolecularEntity.help: Any constitutionally or isotopically distinct atom, molecule, ion, ion pair, radical, radical ion, complex, conformer etc., identifiable as a separately distinguishable entity.

inputs.name: chemicalRole
inputs.label: chemicalRole
inputs.help: A role played by the BioChemEntity within a chemical context.

inputs.name: inChI
inputs.label: inChI
inputs.help: Non-proprietary identifier for molecular entity that can be used in printed and electronic data sources thus enabling easier linking of diverse data compilations.

inputs.name: inChIKey
inputs.label: inChIKey
inputs.help: InChIKey is a hashed version of the full InChI (using the SHA-256 algorithm).

inputs.name: iupacName
inputs.label: iupacName
inputs.help: Systematic method of naming chemical compounds as recommended by the International Union of Pure and Applied Chemistry (IUPAC).

inputs.name: molecularFormula
inputs.label: molecularFormula
inputs.help: The empirical formula is the simplest whole number ratio of all the atoms in a molecule.

inputs.name: molecularWeight
inputs.label: molecularWeight
inputs.help: This is the molecular weight of the entity being described, not of the parent. Units should be included in the form '<Number> <unit>', for example '12 amu' or as '<QuantitativeValue>.

inputs.name: monoisotopicMolecularWeight
inputs.label: monoisotopicMolecularWeight
inputs.help: The monoisotopic mass is the sum of the masses of the atoms in a molecule using the unbound, ground-state, rest mass of the principal (most abundant) isotope for each element instead of the isotopic average mass. Please include the units in the form '<Number> <unit>', for example '770.230488 g/mol' or as '<QuantitativeValue>.

inputs.name: potentialUse
inputs.label: potentialUse
inputs.help: Intended use of the BioChemEntity by humans.

inputs.name: smiles
inputs.label: smiles
inputs.help: A specification in form of a line notation for describing the structure of chemical species using short ASCII strings.  Double bond stereochemistry \ indicators may need to be escaped in the string in formats where the backslash is an escape character.

TypeAndQuantityNode.name: TypeAndQuantityNode
TypeAndQuantityNode.help: A structured value indicating the quantity, unit of measurement, and business function of goods included in a bundle offer.

inputs.name: amountOfThisGood
inputs.label: amountOfThisGood
inputs.help: The quantity of the goods included in the offer.

inputs.name: businessFunction
inputs.label: businessFunction
inputs.help: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

inputs.name: typeOfGood
inputs.label: typeOfGood
inputs.help: The product that this structured value is referring to.

inputs.name: unitCode
inputs.label: unitCode
inputs.help: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

inputs.name: unitText
inputs.label: unitText
inputs.help: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

TherapeuticProcedure.name: TherapeuticProcedure
TherapeuticProcedure.help: A medical procedure intended primarily for therapeutic purposes, aimed at improving a health condition.

inputs.name: adverseOutcome
inputs.label: adverseOutcome
inputs.help: A possible complication and/or side effect of this therapy. If it is known that an adverse outcome is serious (resulting in death, disability, or permanent damage; requiring hospitalization; or otherwise life-threatening or requiring immediate medical attention), tag it as a seriousAdverseOutcome instead.

inputs.name: doseSchedule
inputs.label: doseSchedule
inputs.help: A dosing schedule for the drug for a given population, either observed, recommended, or maximum dose based on the type used.

inputs.name: drug
inputs.label: drug
inputs.help: Specifying a drug or medicine used in a medication procedure.

EmployerReview.name: EmployerReview
EmployerReview.help: An [[EmployerReview]] is a review of an [[Organization]] regarding its role as an employer, written by a current or former employee of that organization.

BroadcastChannel.name: BroadcastChannel
BroadcastChannel.help: A unique instance of a BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

inputs.name: broadcastChannelId
inputs.label: broadcastChannelId
inputs.help: The unique address by which the BroadcastService can be identified in a provider lineup. In US, this is typically a number.

inputs.name: broadcastFrequency
inputs.label: broadcastFrequency
inputs.help: The frequency used for over-the-air broadcasts. Numeric values or simple ranges, e.g. 87-99. In addition a shortcut idiom is supported for frequences of AM and FM radio channels, e.g. "87 FM".

inputs.name: broadcastServiceTier
inputs.label: broadcastServiceTier
inputs.help: The type of service required to have access to the channel (e.g. Standard or Premium).

inputs.name: genre
inputs.label: genre
inputs.help: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

inputs.name: inBroadcastLineup
inputs.label: inBroadcastLineup
inputs.help: The CableOrSatelliteService offering the channel.

inputs.name: providesBroadcastService
inputs.label: providesBroadcastService
inputs.help: The BroadcastService offered on this channel.

VideoObjectSnapshot.name: VideoObjectSnapshot
VideoObjectSnapshot.help: A specific and exact (byte-for-byte) version of a [[VideoObject]]. Two byte-for-byte identical files, for the purposes of this type, considered identical. If they have different embedded metadata the files will differ. Different external facts about the files, e.g. creator or dateCreated that aren't represented in their actual content, do not affect this notion of identity.

Reservation.name: Reservation
Reservation.help: Describes a reservation for travel, dining or an event. Some reservations require tickets. \n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, restaurant reservations, flights, or rental cars, use [[Offer]].

inputs.name: bookingAgent
inputs.label: bookingAgent
inputs.help: 'bookingAgent' is an out-dated term indicating a 'broker' that serves as a booking agent.

inputs.name: bookingTime
inputs.label: bookingTime
inputs.help: The date and time the reservation was booked.

inputs.name: broker
inputs.label: broker
inputs.help: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

inputs.name: modifiedTime
inputs.label: modifiedTime
inputs.help: The date and time the reservation was modified.

inputs.name: priceCurrency
inputs.label: priceCurrency
inputs.help: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

inputs.name: programMembershipUsed
inputs.label: programMembershipUsed
inputs.help: Any membership in a frequent flyer, hotel loyalty program, etc. being applied to the reservation.

inputs.name: provider
inputs.label: provider
inputs.help: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

inputs.name: reservationFor
inputs.label: reservationFor
inputs.help: The thing -- flight, event, restaurant, etc. being reserved.

inputs.name: reservationId
inputs.label: reservationId
inputs.help: A unique identifier for the reservation.

inputs.name: reservationStatus
inputs.label: reservationStatus
inputs.help: The current status of the reservation.

inputs.name: reservedTicket
inputs.label: reservedTicket
inputs.help: A ticket associated with the reservation.

inputs.name: totalPrice
inputs.label: totalPrice
inputs.help:
The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

inputs.name: underName
inputs.label: underName
inputs.help: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

PerformanceRole.name: PerformanceRole
PerformanceRole.help: A PerformanceRole is a Role that some entity places with regard to a theatrical performance, e.g. in a Movie, TVSeries etc.

inputs.name: characterName
inputs.label: characterName
inputs.help: The name of a character played in some acting or performing role, i.e. in a PerformanceRole.

ActivateAction.name: ActivateAction
ActivateAction.help: The act of starting or activating a device or application (e.g. starting a timer or turning on a flashlight).

ReadAction.name: ReadAction
ReadAction.help: The act of consuming written content.

Place.name: Place
Place.help: Entities that have a somewhat fixed, physical extension.

inputs.name: additionalProperty
inputs.label: additionalProperty
inputs.help: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristic of the entity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

inputs.name: address
inputs.label: address
inputs.help: Physical address of the item.

inputs.name: aggregateRating
inputs.label: aggregateRating
inputs.help: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

inputs.name: amenityFeature
inputs.label: amenityFeature
inputs.help: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

inputs.name: branchCode
inputs.label: branchCode
inputs.help: A short textual code (also called "store code") that uniquely identifies a place of business. The code is typically assigned by the parentOrganization and used in structured URLs.\n\nFor example, in the URL http://www.starbucks.co.uk/store-locator/etc/detail/3047 the code "3047" is a branchCode for a particular branch.

inputs.name: containedIn
inputs.label: containedIn
inputs.help: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

inputs.name: containedInPlace
inputs.label: containedInPlace
inputs.help: The basic containment relation between a place and one that contains it.

inputs.name: containsPlace
inputs.label: containsPlace
inputs.help: The basic containment relation between a place and another that it contains.

inputs.name: event
inputs.label: event
inputs.help: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

inputs.name: events
inputs.label: events
inputs.help: Upcoming or past events associated with this place or organization.

inputs.name: faxNumber
inputs.label: faxNumber
inputs.help: The fax number.

inputs.name: geo
inputs.label: geo
inputs.help: The geo coordinates of the place.

inputs.name: geoContains
inputs.label: geoContains
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a containing geometry to a contained geometry. "a contains b iff no points of b lie in the exterior of a, and at least one point of the interior of b lies in the interior of a". As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoCoveredBy
inputs.label: geoCoveredBy
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that covers it. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoCovers
inputs.label: geoCovers
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a covering geometry to a covered geometry. "Every point of b is a point of (the interior or boundary of) a". As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoCrosses
inputs.label: geoCrosses
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that crosses it: "a crosses b: they have some but not all interior points in common, and the dimension of the intersection is less than that of at least one of them". As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoDisjoint
inputs.label: geoDisjoint
inputs.help: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) are topologically disjoint: "they have no point in common. They form a set of disconnected geometries." (A symmetric relationship, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).)

inputs.name: geoEquals
inputs.label: geoEquals
inputs.help: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) are topologically equal, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM). "Two geometries are topologically equal if their interiors intersect and no part of the interior or boundary of one geometry intersects the exterior of the other" (a symmetric relationship).

inputs.name: geoIntersects
inputs.label: geoIntersects
inputs.help: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) have at least one point in common. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoOverlaps
inputs.label: geoOverlaps
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that geospatially overlaps it, i.e. they have some but not all points in common. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoTouches
inputs.label: geoTouches
inputs.help: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) touch: "they have at least one boundary point in common, but no interior points." (A symmetric relationship, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).)

inputs.name: geoWithin
inputs.label: geoWithin
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to one that contains it, i.e. it is inside (i.e. within) its interior. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: globalLocationNumber
inputs.label: globalLocationNumber
inputs.help: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

inputs.name: hasCertification
inputs.label: hasCertification
inputs.help: Certification information about a product, organization, service, place, or person.

inputs.name: hasDriveThroughService
inputs.label: hasDriveThroughService
inputs.help: Indicates whether some facility (e.g. [[FoodEstablishment]], [[CovidTestingFacility]]) offers a service that can be used by driving through in a car. In the case of [[CovidTestingFacility]] such facilities could potentially help with social distancing from other potentially-infected users.

inputs.name: hasMap
inputs.label: hasMap
inputs.help: A URL to a map of the place.

inputs.name: isAccessibleForFree
inputs.label: isAccessibleForFree
inputs.help: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

inputs.name: isicV4
inputs.label: isicV4
inputs.help: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

inputs.name: keywords
inputs.label: keywords
inputs.help: Keywords or tags used to describe some item. Multiple textual entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas, or by repeating the property.

inputs.name: latitude
inputs.label: latitude
inputs.help: The latitude of a location. For example ```37.42242``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

inputs.name: logo
inputs.label: logo
inputs.help: An associated logo.

inputs.name: longitude
inputs.label: longitude
inputs.help: The longitude of a location. For example ```-122.08585``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

inputs.name: map
inputs.label: map
inputs.help: A URL to a map of the place.

inputs.name: maps
inputs.label: maps
inputs.help: A URL to a map of the place.

inputs.name: maximumAttendeeCapacity
inputs.label: maximumAttendeeCapacity
inputs.help: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

inputs.name: openingHoursSpecification
inputs.label: openingHoursSpecification
inputs.help: The opening hours of a certain place.

inputs.name: photo
inputs.label: photo
inputs.help: A photograph of this place.

inputs.name: photos
inputs.label: photos
inputs.help: Photographs of this place.

inputs.name: publicAccess
inputs.label: publicAccess
inputs.help: A flag to signal that the [[Place]] is open to public visitors.  If this property is omitted there is no assumed default boolean value.

inputs.name: review
inputs.label: review
inputs.help: A review of the item.

inputs.name: reviews
inputs.label: reviews
inputs.help: Review of the item.

inputs.name: slogan
inputs.label: slogan
inputs.help: A slogan or motto associated with the item.

inputs.name: smokingAllowed
inputs.label: smokingAllowed
inputs.help: Indicates whether it is allowed to smoke in the place, e.g. in the restaurant, hotel or hotel room.

inputs.name: specialOpeningHoursSpecification
inputs.label: specialOpeningHoursSpecification
inputs.help: The special opening hours of a certain place.\n\nUse this to explicitly override general opening hours brought in scope by [[openingHoursSpecification]] or [[openingHours]].

inputs.name: telephone
inputs.label: telephone
inputs.help: The telephone number.

inputs.name: tourBookingPage
inputs.label: tourBookingPage
inputs.help: A page providing information on how to book a tour of some [[Place]], such as an [[Accommodation]] or [[ApartmentComplex]] in a real estate setting, as well as other kinds of tours as appropriate.

FundingAgency.name: FundingAgency
FundingAgency.help:
A FundingAgency is an organization that implements one or more [[FundingScheme]]s and manages
    the granting process (via [[Grant]]s, typically [[MonetaryGrant]]s).
    A funding agency is not always required for grant funding, e.g. philanthropic giving, corporate sponsorship etc.
    
Examples of funding agencies include ERC, REA, NIH, Bill and Melinda Gates Foundation, ...

DataType.name: DataType
DataType.help: The basic data types such as Integers, Strings, etc.

ComputerLanguage.name: ComputerLanguage
ComputerLanguage.help: This type covers computer programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, as well as other language-like computer representations. Natural languages are best represented with the [[Language]] type.

CreativeWork.name: CreativeWork
CreativeWork.help: The most generic kind of creative work, including books, movies, photographs, software programs, etc.

inputs.name: about
inputs.label: about
inputs.help: The subject matter of the content.

inputs.name: abstract
inputs.label: abstract
inputs.help: An abstract is a short description that summarizes a [[CreativeWork]].

inputs.name: accessMode
inputs.label: accessMode
inputs.help: The human sensory perceptual system or cognitive faculty through which a person may process or perceive information. Values should be drawn from the [approved vocabulary](https://www.w3.org/2021/a11y-discov-vocab/latest/#accessMode-vocabulary).

inputs.name: accessModeSufficient
inputs.label: accessModeSufficient
inputs.help: A list of single or combined accessModes that are sufficient to understand all the intellectual content of a resource. Values should be drawn from the [approved vocabulary](https://www.w3.org/2021/a11y-discov-vocab/latest/#accessModeSufficient-vocabulary).

inputs.name: accessibilityAPI
inputs.label: accessibilityAPI
inputs.help: Indicates that the resource is compatible with the referenced accessibility API. Values should be drawn from the [approved vocabulary](https://www.w3.org/2021/a11y-discov-vocab/latest/#accessibilityAPI-vocabulary).

inputs.name: accessibilityControl
inputs.label: accessibilityControl
inputs.help: Identifies input methods that are sufficient to fully control the described resource. Values should be drawn from the [approved vocabulary](https://www.w3.org/2021/a11y-discov-vocab/latest/#accessibilityControl-vocabulary).

inputs.name: accessibilityFeature
inputs.label: accessibilityFeature
inputs.help: Content features of the resource, such as accessible media, alternatives and supported enhancements for accessibility. Values should be drawn from the [approved vocabulary](https://www.w3.org/2021/a11y-discov-vocab/latest/#accessibilityFeature-vocabulary).

inputs.name: accessibilityHazard
inputs.label: accessibilityHazard
inputs.help: A characteristic of the described resource that is physiologically dangerous to some users. Related to WCAG 2.0 guideline 2.3. Values should be drawn from the [approved vocabulary](https://www.w3.org/2021/a11y-discov-vocab/latest/#accessibilityHazard-vocabulary).

inputs.name: accessibilitySummary
inputs.label: accessibilitySummary
inputs.help: A human-readable summary of specific accessibility features or deficiencies, consistent with the other accessibility metadata but expressing subtleties such as "short descriptions are present but long descriptions will be needed for non-visual users" or "short descriptions are present and no long descriptions are needed".

inputs.name: accountablePerson
inputs.label: accountablePerson
inputs.help: Specifies the Person that is legally accountable for the CreativeWork.

inputs.name: acquireLicensePage
inputs.label: acquireLicensePage
inputs.help: Indicates a page documenting how licenses can be purchased or otherwise acquired, for the current item.

inputs.name: aggregateRating
inputs.label: aggregateRating
inputs.help: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

inputs.name: alternativeHeadline
inputs.label: alternativeHeadline
inputs.help: A secondary title of the CreativeWork.

inputs.name: annotator
inputs.help: The participant produced an annotation of this or a related resource.

inputs.name: archivedAt
inputs.label: archivedAt
inputs.help: Indicates a page or other link involved in archival of a [[CreativeWork]]. In the case of [[MediaReview]], the items in a [[MediaReviewItem]] may often become inaccessible, but be archived by archival, journalistic, activist, or law enforcement organizations. In such cases, the referenced page may not directly publish the content.

inputs.name: assesses
inputs.label: assesses
inputs.help: The item being described is intended to assess the competency or learning outcome defined by the referenced term.

inputs.name: associatedMedia
inputs.label: associatedMedia
inputs.help: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

inputs.name: audience
inputs.label: audience
inputs.help: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

inputs.name: audio
inputs.label: audio
inputs.help: An embedded audio object.

inputs.name: author
inputs.label: author
inputs.help: The author of this content or rating. Please note that author is special in that HTML 5 provides a special mechanism for indicating authorship via the rel tag. That is equivalent to this and may be used interchangeably.

inputs.name: author
inputs.help: The participant contributed original writings to the resource.

inputs.name: award
inputs.label: award
inputs.help: An award won by or for this item.

inputs.name: awards
inputs.label: awards
inputs.help: Awards won by or for this item.

inputs.name: character
inputs.label: character
inputs.help: Fictional person connected with a creative work.

inputs.name: citation
inputs.label: citation
inputs.help: A citation or reference to another creative work, such as another publication, web page, scholarly article, etc.

inputs.name: comment
inputs.label: comment
inputs.help: Comments, typically from users.

inputs.name: commentCount
inputs.label: commentCount
inputs.help: The number of comments this CreativeWork (e.g. Article, Question or Answer) has received. This is most applicable to works published in Web sites with commenting system; additional comments may exist elsewhere.

inputs.name: compiler
inputs.help: The participant is responsible for collecting the sub-parts of the resource together.

inputs.name: conditionsOfAccess
inputs.label: conditionsOfAccess
inputs.help: Conditions that affect the availability of, or method(s) of access to, an item. Typically used for real world items such as an [[ArchiveComponent]] held by an [[ArchiveOrganization]]. This property is not suitable for use as a general Web access control mechanism. It is expressed only in natural language.\n\nFor example "Available by appointment from the Reading Room" or "Accessible only from logged-in accounts ".

inputs.name: consultant
inputs.help: The participant contributes expertise to the creation of a work.

inputs.name: contentLocation
inputs.label: contentLocation
inputs.help: The location depicted or described in the content. For example, the location in a photograph or painting.

inputs.name: contentRating
inputs.label: contentRating
inputs.help: Official rating of a piece of content—for example, 'MPAA PG-13'.

inputs.name: contentReferenceTime
inputs.label: contentReferenceTime
inputs.help: The specific time described by a creative work, for works (e.g. articles, video objects etc.) that emphasise a particular moment within an Event.

inputs.name: contributor
inputs.label: contributor
inputs.help: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

inputs.name: copyrightHolder
inputs.label: copyrightHolder
inputs.help: The party holding the legal copyright to the CreativeWork.

inputs.name: copyrightNotice
inputs.label: copyrightNotice
inputs.help: Text of a notice appropriate for describing the copyright aspects of this Creative Work, ideally indicating the owner of the copyright for the Work.

inputs.name: copyrightYear
inputs.label: copyrightYear
inputs.help: The year during which the claimed copyright for the CreativeWork was first asserted.

inputs.name: correction
inputs.label: correction
inputs.help: Indicates a correction to a [[CreativeWork]], either via a [[CorrectionComment]], textually or in another document.

inputs.name: countryOfOrigin
inputs.label: countryOfOrigin
inputs.help:
The country of origin of something, including products as well as creative  works such as movie and TV content.

In the case of TV and movie, this would be the country of the principle offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie. For other kinds of [[CreativeWork]] it is difficult to provide fully general guidance, and properties such as [[contentLocation]] and [[locationCreated]] may be more applicable.

In the case of products, the country of origin of the product. The exact interpretation of this may vary by context and product type, and cannot be fully enumerated here.

inputs.name: creativeWorkStatus
inputs.label: creativeWorkStatus
inputs.help: The status of a creative work in terms of its stage in a lifecycle. Example terms include Incomplete, Draft, Published, Obsolete. Some organizations define a set of terms for the stages of their publication lifecycle.

inputs.name: creator
inputs.label: creator
inputs.help: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

inputs.name: creditText
inputs.label: creditText
inputs.help: Text that can be used to credit person(s) and/or organization(s) associated with a published Creative Work.

inputs.name: data_inputter
inputs.help: The participant was responsible for entering, re-typing, and/or structuring the data contained in the resource.

inputs.name: dateCreated
inputs.label: dateCreated
inputs.help: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

inputs.name: dateModified
inputs.label: dateModified
inputs.help: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

inputs.name: datePublished
inputs.label: datePublished
inputs.help: Date of first publication or broadcast. For example the date a [[CreativeWork]] was broadcast or a [[Certification]] was issued.

inputs.name: depositor
inputs.help: The participant was responsible for depositing the resource in an archive.

inputs.name: developer
inputs.help: The participant developed the methodology or tools that constitute the resource, or that were used to create the resource.

inputs.name: digitalSourceType
inputs.label: digitalSourceType
inputs.help: Indicates an IPTCDigitalSourceEnumeration code indicating the nature of the digital source(s) for some [[CreativeWork]].

inputs.name: discussionUrl
inputs.label: discussionUrl
inputs.help: A link to the page containing the comments of the CreativeWork.

inputs.name: editEIDR
inputs.label: editEIDR
inputs.help:
An [EIDR](https://eidr.org/) (Entertainment Identifier Registry) [[identifier]] representing a specific edit / edition for a work of film or television.

For example, the motion picture known as "Ghostbusters" whose [[titleEIDR]] is "10.5240/7EC7-228A-510A-053E-CBB8-J" has several edits, e.g. "10.5240/1F2A-E1C5-680A-14C6-E76B-I" and "10.5240/8A35-3BEE-6497-5D12-9E4F-3".

Since schema.org types like [[Movie]] and [[TVEpisode]] can be used for both works and their multiple expressions, it is possible to use [[titleEIDR]] alone (for a general description), or alongside [[editEIDR]] for a more edit-specific description.

inputs.name: editor
inputs.label: editor
inputs.help: Specifies the Person who edited the CreativeWork.

inputs.name: editor
inputs.help: The participant reviewed, corrected, and/or tested the resource.

inputs.name: educationalAlignment
inputs.label: educationalAlignment
inputs.help:
An alignment to an established educational framework.

This property should not be used where the nature of the alignment can be described using a simple property, for example to express that a resource [[teaches]] or [[assesses]] a competency.

inputs.name: educationalLevel
inputs.label: educationalLevel
inputs.help: The level in terms of progression through an educational or training context. Examples of educational levels include 'beginner', 'intermediate' or 'advanced', and formal sets of level indicators.

inputs.name: educationalUse
inputs.label: educationalUse
inputs.help: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

inputs.name: encoding
inputs.label: encoding
inputs.help: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for associatedMedia.

inputs.name: encodingFormat
inputs.label: encodingFormat
inputs.help:
Media type typically expressed using a MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) and [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types)), e.g. application/zip for a SoftwareApplication binary, audio/mpeg for .mp3 etc.

In cases where a [[CreativeWork]] has several media type representations, [[encoding]] can be used to indicate each [[MediaObject]] alongside particular [[encodingFormat]] information.

Unregistered or niche encoding and file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia/Wikidata entry.

inputs.name: encodings
inputs.label: encodings
inputs.help: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork.

inputs.name: exampleOfWork
inputs.label: exampleOfWork
inputs.help: A creative work that this work is an example/instance/realization/derivation of.

inputs.name: expires
inputs.label: expires
inputs.help: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. For example a [[VideoObject]] or [[NewsArticle]] whose availability or relevance is time-limited, a [[ClaimReview]] fact check whose publisher wants to indicate that it may no longer be relevant (or helpful to highlight) after some date, or a [[Certification]] the validity has expired.

inputs.name: fileFormat
inputs.label: fileFormat
inputs.help: Media type, typically MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml)) of the content, e.g. application/zip of a SoftwareApplication binary. In cases where a CreativeWork has several media type representations, 'encoding' can be used to indicate each MediaObject alongside particular fileFormat information. Unregistered or niche file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia entry.

inputs.name: funder
inputs.label: funder
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

inputs.name: funding
inputs.label: funding
inputs.help: A [[Grant]] that directly or indirectly provide funding or sponsorship for this item. See also [[ownershipFundingInfo]].

inputs.name: genre
inputs.label: genre
inputs.help: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

inputs.name: hasPart
inputs.label: hasPart
inputs.help: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that is part of this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense).

inputs.name: headline
inputs.label: headline
inputs.help: Headline of the article.

inputs.name: illustrator
inputs.help: The participant contributed drawings or other illustrations to the resource.

inputs.name: inLanguage
inputs.label: inLanguage
inputs.help: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

inputs.name: interactionStatistic
inputs.label: interactionStatistic
inputs.help: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

inputs.name: interactivityType
inputs.label: interactivityType
inputs.help: The predominant mode of learning supported by the learning resource. Acceptable values are 'active', 'expositive', or 'mixed'.

inputs.name: interpretedAsClaim
inputs.label: interpretedAsClaim
inputs.help: Used to indicate a specific claim contained, implied, translated or refined from the content of a [[MediaObject]] or other [[CreativeWork]]. The interpreting party can be indicated using [[claimInterpreter]].

inputs.name: interpreter
inputs.help: The participant translates in real-time or explains the discourse recorded in the resource.

inputs.name: interviewer
inputs.help: The participant conducted an interview that forms part of the resource.

inputs.name: isAccessibleForFree
inputs.label: isAccessibleForFree
inputs.help: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

inputs.name: isBasedOn
inputs.label: isBasedOn
inputs.help: A resource from which this work is derived or from which it is a modification or adaptation.

inputs.name: isBasedOnUrl
inputs.label: isBasedOnUrl
inputs.help: A resource that was used in the creation of this resource. This term can be repeated for multiple sources. For example, http://example.com/great-multiplication-intro.html.

inputs.name: isFamilyFriendly
inputs.label: isFamilyFriendly
inputs.help: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

inputs.name: isPartOf
inputs.label: isPartOf
inputs.help: Indicates an item or CreativeWork that this item, or CreativeWork (in some sense), is part of.

inputs.name: keywords
inputs.label: keywords
inputs.help: Keywords or tags used to describe some item. Multiple textual entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas, or by repeating the property.

inputs.name: learningResourceType
inputs.label: learningResourceType
inputs.help: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

inputs.name: license
inputs.label: license
inputs.help: A license document that applies to this content, typically indicated by URL.

inputs.name: locationCreated
inputs.label: locationCreated
inputs.help: The location where the CreativeWork was created, which may not be the same as the location depicted in the CreativeWork.

inputs.name: mainEntity
inputs.label: mainEntity
inputs.help: Indicates the primary entity described in some page or other CreativeWork.

inputs.name: maintainer
inputs.label: maintainer
inputs.help: A maintainer of a [[Dataset]], software package ([[SoftwareApplication]]), or other [[Project]]. A maintainer is a [[Person]] or [[Organization]] that manages contributions to, and/or publication of, some (typically complex) artifact. It is common for distributions of software and data to be based on "upstream" sources. When [[maintainer]] is applied to a specific version of something e.g. a particular version or packaging of a [[Dataset]], it is always  possible that the upstream source has a different maintainer. The [[isBasedOn]] property can be used to indicate such relationships between datasets to make the different maintenance roles clear. Similarly in the case of software, a package may have dedicated maintainers working on integration into software distributions such as Ubuntu, as well as upstream maintainers of the underlying work.

inputs.name: material
inputs.label: material
inputs.help: A material that something is made from, e.g. leather, wool, cotton, paper.

inputs.name: materialExtent
inputs.label: materialExtent
inputs.help: The quantity of the materials being described or an expression of the physical space they occupy.

inputs.name: mentions
inputs.label: mentions
inputs.help: Indicates that the CreativeWork contains a reference to, but is not necessarily about a concept.

inputs.name: offers
inputs.label: offers
inputs.help: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

inputs.name: participant
inputs.help: The participant was present during the creation of the resource, but did not contribute substantially to its content.

inputs.name: pattern
inputs.label: pattern
inputs.help: A pattern that something has, for example 'polka dot', 'striped', 'Canadian flag'. Values are typically expressed as text, although links to controlled value schemes are also supported.

inputs.name: performer
inputs.help: The participant performed some portion of a recorded, filmed, or transcribed resource.

inputs.name: photographer
inputs.help: The participant took the photograph, or shot the film, that appears in or constitutes the resource.

inputs.name: position
inputs.label: position
inputs.help: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

inputs.name: producer
inputs.label: producer
inputs.help: The person or organization who produced the work (e.g. music album, movie, TV/radio series etc.).

inputs.name: provider
inputs.label: provider
inputs.help: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

inputs.name: publication
inputs.label: publication
inputs.help: A publication event associated with the item.

inputs.name: publisher
inputs.label: publisher
inputs.help: The publisher of the creative work.

inputs.name: publisherImprint
inputs.label: publisherImprint
inputs.help: The publishing division which published the comic.

inputs.name: publishingPrinciples
inputs.label: publishingPrinciples
inputs.help:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual, e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

inputs.name: recordedAt
inputs.label: recordedAt
inputs.help: The Event where the CreativeWork was recorded. The CreativeWork may capture all or part of the event.

inputs.name: recorder
inputs.help: The participant operated the recording machinery used to create the resource.

inputs.name: releasedEvent
inputs.label: releasedEvent
inputs.help: The place and time the release was issued, expressed as a PublicationEvent.

inputs.name: research_participant
inputs.help: The participant acted as a research subject or responded to a questionnaire, the results of which study form the basis of the resource.

inputs.name: researcher
inputs.help: The resource was created as part of the participant's research, or the research presents interim or final results from the participant's research.

inputs.name: responder
inputs.help: The participant was an interlocutor in some sort of discourse event.

inputs.name: review
inputs.label: review
inputs.help: A review of the item.

inputs.name: reviews
inputs.label: reviews
inputs.help: Review of the item.

inputs.name: schemaVersion
inputs.label: schemaVersion
inputs.help:
Indicates (by URL or string) a particular version of a schema used in some CreativeWork. This property was created primarily to
    indicate the use of a specific schema.org release, e.g. ```10.0``` as a simple string, or more explicitly via URL, ```http://schema.org/docs/releases.html#v10.0```. There may be situations in which other schemas might usefully be referenced this way, e.g. ```http://dublincore.org/specifications/dublin-core/dces/1999-07-02/``` but this has not been carefully explored in the community.

inputs.name: sdDatePublished
inputs.label: sdDatePublished
inputs.help: Indicates the date on which the current structured data was generated / published. Typically used alongside [[sdPublisher]].

inputs.name: sdLicense
inputs.label: sdLicense
inputs.help: A license document that applies to this structured data, typically indicated by URL.

inputs.name: sdPublisher
inputs.label: sdPublisher
inputs.help:
Indicates the party responsible for generating and publishing the current structured data markup, typically in cases where the structured data is derived automatically from existing published content but published on a different site. For example, student projects and open data initiatives often re-publish existing content with more explicitly structured metadata. The
[[sdPublisher]] property helps make such practices more explicit.

inputs.name: signer
inputs.help: The participant was a principal signer in a resource that consists of a recording, a film, or a transcription of a recorded resource.

inputs.name: singer
inputs.help: The participant sang, either individually or as part of a group, in a resource that consists of a recording, a film, or a transcription of a recorded resource.

inputs.name: size
inputs.label: size
inputs.help: A standardized size of a product or creative work, specified either through a simple textual string (for example 'XL', '32Wx34L'), a  QuantitativeValue with a unitCode, or a comprehensive and structured [[SizeSpecification]]; in other cases, the [[width]], [[height]], [[depth]] and [[weight]] properties may be more applicable.

inputs.name: sourceOrganization
inputs.label: sourceOrganization
inputs.help: The Organization on whose behalf the creator was working.

inputs.name: spatial
inputs.label: spatial
inputs.help:
The "spatial" property can be used in cases when more specific properties
(e.g. [[locationCreated]], [[spatialCoverage]], [[contentLocation]]) are not known to be appropriate.

inputs.name: spatialCoverage
inputs.label: spatialCoverage
inputs.help:
The spatialCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the place(s) which are the focus of the content. It is a subproperty of
      contentLocation intended primarily for more technical and detailed materials. For example with a Dataset, it indicates
      areas that the dataset describes: a dataset of New York weather would have spatialCoverage which was the place: the state of New York.

inputs.name: speaker
inputs.help: The participant was a principal speaker in a resource that consists of a recording, a film, or a transcription of a recorded resource.

inputs.name: sponsor
inputs.label: sponsor
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. E.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

inputs.name: sponsor
inputs.help: The participant contributed financial support to the creation of the resource.

inputs.name: teaches
inputs.label: teaches
inputs.help: The item being described is intended to help a person learn the competency or learning outcome defined by the referenced term.

inputs.name: temporal
inputs.label: temporal
inputs.help:
The "temporal" property can be used in cases where more specific properties
(e.g. [[temporalCoverage]], [[dateCreated]], [[dateModified]], [[datePublished]]) are not known to be appropriate.

inputs.name: temporalCoverage
inputs.label: temporalCoverage
inputs.help:
The temporalCoverage of a CreativeWork indicates the period that the content applies to, i.e. that it describes, either as a DateTime or as a textual string indicating a time period in [ISO 8601 time interval format](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601#Time_intervals). In
      the case of a Dataset it will typically indicate the relevant time period in a precise notation (e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 would be written "2011/2012"). Other forms of content, e.g. ScholarlyArticle, Book, TVSeries or TVEpisode, may indicate their temporalCoverage in broader terms - textually or via well-known URL.
      Written works such as books may sometimes have precise temporal coverage too, e.g. a work set in 1939 - 1945 can be indicated in ISO 8601 interval format format via "1939/1945".

Open-ended date ranges can be written with ".." in place of the end date. For example, "2015-11/.." indicates a range beginning in November 2015 and with no specified final date. This is tentative and might be updated in future when ISO 8601 is officially updated.

inputs.name: text
inputs.label: text
inputs.help: The textual content of this CreativeWork.

inputs.name: thumbnail
inputs.label: thumbnail
inputs.help: Thumbnail image for an image or video.

inputs.name: thumbnailUrl
inputs.label: thumbnailUrl
inputs.help: A thumbnail image relevant to the Thing.

inputs.name: timeRequired
inputs.label: timeRequired
inputs.help: Approximate or typical time it usually takes to work with or through the content of this work for the typical or target audience.

inputs.name: transcriber
inputs.help: The participant produced a transcription of this or a related resource.

inputs.name: translationOfWork
inputs.label: translationOfWork
inputs.help: The work that this work has been translated from. E.g. 物种起源 is a translationOf “On the Origin of Species”.

inputs.name: translator
inputs.label: translator
inputs.help: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

inputs.name: translator
inputs.help: The participant produced a translation of this or a related resource.

inputs.name: typicalAgeRange
inputs.label: typicalAgeRange
inputs.help: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

inputs.name: usageInfo
inputs.label: usageInfo
inputs.help:
The schema.org [[usageInfo]] property indicates further information about a [[CreativeWork]]. This property is applicable both to works that are freely available and to those that require payment or other transactions. It can reference additional information, e.g. community expectations on preferred linking and citation conventions, as well as purchasing details. For something that can be commercially licensed, usageInfo can provide detailed, resource-specific information about licensing options.

This property can be used alongside the license property which indicates license(s) applicable to some piece of content. The usageInfo property can provide information about other licensing options, e.g. acquiring commercial usage rights for an image that is also available under non-commercial creative commons licenses.

inputs.name: version
inputs.label: version
inputs.help: The version of the CreativeWork embodied by a specified resource.

inputs.name: video
inputs.label: video
inputs.help: An embedded video object.

inputs.name: workExample
inputs.label: workExample
inputs.help: Example/instance/realization/derivation of the concept of this creative work. E.g. the paperback edition, first edition, or e-book.

inputs.name: workTranslation
inputs.label: workTranslation
inputs.help: A work that is a translation of the content of this work. E.g. 西遊記 has an English workTranslation “Journey to the West”, a German workTranslation “Monkeys Pilgerfahrt” and a Vietnamese  translation Tây du ký bình khảo.

inputs.name: endorsee
inputs.label: endorsee
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The person/organization being supported.

TrackAction.name: TrackAction
TrackAction.help:
An agent tracks an object for updates.

Related actions:

* [[FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, TrackAction refers to the interest on the location of innanimates objects.
* [[SubscribeAction]]: Unlike SubscribeAction, TrackAction refers to  the interest on the location of innanimate objects.

inputs.name: deliveryMethod
inputs.label: deliveryMethod
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. The method of delivery.

ExhibitionEvent.name: ExhibitionEvent
ExhibitionEvent.help: Event type: Exhibition event, e.g. at a museum, library, archive, tradeshow, ...

LifestyleModification.name: LifestyleModification
LifestyleModification.help: A process of care involving exercise, changes to diet, fitness routines, and other lifestyle changes aimed at improving a health condition.

Mass.name: Mass
Mass.help: Properties that take Mass as values are of the form '<Number> <Mass unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 kg'.

CableOrSatelliteService.name: CableOrSatelliteService
CableOrSatelliteService.help: A service which provides access to media programming like TV or radio. Access may be via cable or satellite.

SearchResultsPage.name: SearchResultsPage
SearchResultsPage.help: Web page type: Search results page.

EnergyStarEnergyEfficiencyEnumeration.name: EnergyStarEnergyEfficiencyEnumeration
EnergyStarEnergyEfficiencyEnumeration.help: Used to indicate whether a product is EnergyStar certified.

LiquorStore.name: LiquorStore
LiquorStore.help: A shop that sells alcoholic drinks such as wine, beer, whisky and other spirits.

DrugPrescriptionStatus.name: DrugPrescriptionStatus
DrugPrescriptionStatus.help: Indicates whether this drug is available by prescription or over-the-counter.

WearableSizeGroupEnumeration.name: WearableSizeGroupEnumeration
WearableSizeGroupEnumeration.help: Enumerates common size groups (also known as "size types") for wearable products.

Statement.name: Statement
Statement.help: A statement about something, for example a fun or interesting fact. If known, the main entity this statement is about can be indicated using mainEntity. For more formal claims (e.g. in Fact Checking), consider using [[Claim]] instead. Use the [[text]] property to capture the text of the statement.

Continent.name: Continent
Continent.help: One of the continents (for example, Europe or Africa).

RentAction.name: RentAction
RentAction.help: The act of giving money in return for temporary use, but not ownership, of an object such as a vehicle or property. For example, an agent rents a property from a landlord in exchange for a periodic payment.

inputs.name: landlord
inputs.label: landlord
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The owner of the real estate property.

inputs.name: realEstateAgent
inputs.label: realEstateAgent
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The real estate agent involved in the action.

CampingPitch.name: CampingPitch
CampingPitch.help:
A [[CampingPitch]] is an individual place for overnight stay in the outdoors, typically being part of a larger camping site, or [[Campground]].\n\n
In British English a campsite, or campground, is an area, usually divided into a number of pitches, where people can camp overnight using tents or camper vans or caravans; this British English use of the word is synonymous with the American English expression campground. In American English the term campsite generally means an area where an individual, family, group, or military unit can pitch a tent or park a camper; a campground may contain many campsites.
(Source: Wikipedia, see [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite).)\n\n
See also the dedicated [document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations](/docs/hotels.html).

TelevisionChannel.name: TelevisionChannel
TelevisionChannel.help: A unique instance of a television BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

Order.name: Order
Order.help: An order is a confirmation of a transaction (a receipt), which can contain multiple line items, each represented by an Offer that has been accepted by the customer.

inputs.name: acceptedOffer
inputs.label: acceptedOffer
inputs.help: The offer(s) -- e.g., product, quantity and price combinations -- included in the order.

inputs.name: billingAddress
inputs.label: billingAddress
inputs.help: The billing address for the order.

inputs.name: broker
inputs.label: broker
inputs.help: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

inputs.name: confirmationNumber
inputs.label: confirmationNumber
inputs.help: A number that confirms the given order or payment has been received.

inputs.name: customer
inputs.label: customer
inputs.help: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

inputs.name: discount
inputs.label: discount
inputs.help: Any discount applied (to an Order).

inputs.name: discountCode
inputs.label: discountCode
inputs.help: Code used to redeem a discount.

inputs.name: discountCurrency
inputs.label: discountCurrency
