inputs.help: The currency of the discount.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

inputs.name: isGift
inputs.label: isGift
inputs.help: Indicates whether the offer was accepted as a gift for someone other than the buyer.

inputs.name: merchant
inputs.label: merchant
inputs.help: 'merchant' is an out-dated term for 'seller'.

inputs.name: orderDate
inputs.label: orderDate
inputs.help: Date order was placed.

inputs.name: orderDelivery
inputs.label: orderDelivery
inputs.help: The delivery of the parcel related to this order or order item.

inputs.name: orderNumber
inputs.label: orderNumber
inputs.help: The identifier of the transaction.

inputs.name: orderStatus
inputs.label: orderStatus
inputs.help: The current status of the order.

inputs.name: orderedItem
inputs.label: orderedItem
inputs.help: The item ordered.

inputs.name: partOfInvoice
inputs.label: partOfInvoice
inputs.help: The order is being paid as part of the referenced Invoice.

inputs.name: paymentDue
inputs.label: paymentDue
inputs.help: The date that payment is due.

inputs.name: paymentDueDate
inputs.label: paymentDueDate
inputs.help: The date that payment is due.

inputs.name: paymentMethod
inputs.label: paymentMethod
inputs.help: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

inputs.name: paymentMethodId
inputs.label: paymentMethodId
inputs.help: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

inputs.name: paymentUrl
inputs.label: paymentUrl
inputs.help: The URL for sending a payment.

inputs.name: seller
inputs.label: seller
inputs.help: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

RsvpAction.name: RsvpAction
RsvpAction.help: The act of notifying an event organizer as to whether you expect to attend the event.

inputs.name: additionalNumberOfGuests
inputs.label: additionalNumberOfGuests
inputs.help: If responding yes, the number of guests who will attend in addition to the invitee.

inputs.name: comment
inputs.label: comment
inputs.help: Comments, typically from users.

inputs.name: rsvpResponse
inputs.label: rsvpResponse
inputs.help: The response (yes, no, maybe) to the RSVP.

LodgingBusiness.name: LodgingBusiness
LodgingBusiness.help: A lodging business, such as a motel, hotel, or inn.

inputs.name: amenityFeature
inputs.label: amenityFeature
inputs.help: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

inputs.name: audience
inputs.label: audience
inputs.help: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

inputs.name: availableLanguage
inputs.label: availableLanguage
inputs.help: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]].

inputs.name: checkinTime
inputs.label: checkinTime
inputs.help: The earliest someone may check into a lodging establishment.

inputs.name: checkoutTime
inputs.label: checkoutTime
inputs.help: The latest someone may check out of a lodging establishment.

inputs.name: numberOfRooms
inputs.label: numberOfRooms
inputs.help:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

inputs.name: petsAllowed
inputs.label: petsAllowed
inputs.help: Indicates whether pets are allowed to enter the accommodation or lodging business. More detailed information can be put in a text value.

inputs.name: starRating
inputs.label: starRating
inputs.help: An official rating for a lodging business or food establishment, e.g. from national associations or standards bodies. Use the author property to indicate the rating organization, e.g. as an Organization with name such as (e.g. HOTREC, DEHOGA, WHR, or Hotelstars).

MedicalDevicePurpose.name: MedicalDevicePurpose
MedicalDevicePurpose.help: Categories of medical devices, organized by the purpose or intended use of the device.

SolveMathAction.name: SolveMathAction
SolveMathAction.help: The action that takes in a math expression and directs users to a page potentially capable of solving/simplifying that expression.

inputs.name: eduQuestionType
inputs.label: eduQuestionType
inputs.help: For questions that are part of learning resources (e.g. Quiz), eduQuestionType indicates the format of question being given. Example: "Multiple choice", "Open ended", "Flashcard".

DigitalDocumentPermissionType.name: DigitalDocumentPermissionType
DigitalDocumentPermissionType.help: A type of permission which can be granted for accessing a digital document.

ReplaceAction.name: ReplaceAction
ReplaceAction.help: The act of editing a recipient by replacing an old object with a new object.

inputs.name: replacee
inputs.label: replacee
inputs.help: A sub property of object. The object that is being replaced.

inputs.name: replacer
inputs.label: replacer
inputs.help: A sub property of object. The object that replaces.

AllocateAction.name: AllocateAction
AllocateAction.help: The act of organizing tasks/objects/events by associating resources to it.

DanceGroup.name: DanceGroup
DanceGroup.help: A dance group—for example, the Alvin Ailey Dance Theater or Riverdance.

FlightReservation.name: FlightReservation
FlightReservation.help: A reservation for air travel.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

inputs.name: boardingGroup
inputs.label: boardingGroup
inputs.help: The airline-specific indicator of boarding order / preference.

inputs.name: passengerPriorityStatus
inputs.label: passengerPriorityStatus
inputs.help: The priority status assigned to a passenger for security or boarding (e.g. FastTrack or Priority).

inputs.name: passengerSequenceNumber
inputs.label: passengerSequenceNumber
inputs.help: The passenger's sequence number as assigned by the airline.

inputs.name: securityScreening
inputs.label: securityScreening
inputs.help: The type of security screening the passenger is subject to.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: actors
inputs.label: actors
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: countryOfOrigin
inputs.label: countryOfOrigin
inputs.help:
The country of origin of something, including products as well as creative  works such as movie and TV content.

In the case of TV and movie, this would be the country of the principle offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie. For other kinds of [[CreativeWork]] it is difficult to provide fully general guidance, and properties such as [[contentLocation]] and [[locationCreated]] may be more applicable.

In the case of products, the country of origin of the product. The exact interpretation of this may vary by context and product type, and cannot be fully enumerated here.

inputs.name: director
inputs.label: director
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: directors
inputs.label: directors
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: duration
inputs.help: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: musicBy
inputs.label: musicBy
inputs.help: The composer of the soundtrack.

inputs.name: productionCompany
inputs.label: productionCompany
inputs.help: The production company or studio responsible for the item, e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

inputs.name: subtitleLanguage
inputs.label: subtitleLanguage
inputs.help: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in [IETF BCP 47 standard format](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).

inputs.name: titleEIDR
inputs.label: titleEIDR
inputs.help:
An [EIDR](https://eidr.org/) (Entertainment Identifier Registry) [[identifier]] representing at the most general/abstract level, a work of film or television.

For example, the motion picture known as "Ghostbusters" has a titleEIDR of  "10.5240/7EC7-228A-510A-053E-CBB8-J". This title (or work) may have several variants, which EIDR calls "edits". See [[editEIDR]].

Since schema.org types like [[Movie]], [[TVEpisode]], [[TVSeason]], and [[TVSeries]] can be used for both works and their multiple expressions, it is possible to use [[titleEIDR]] alone (for a general description), or alongside [[editEIDR]] for a more edit-specific description.

inputs.name: trailer
inputs.label: trailer
inputs.help: The trailer of a movie or TV/radio series, season, episode, etc.

inputs.name: hasDigitalDocumentPermission
inputs.label: hasDigitalDocumentPermission
inputs.help: A permission related to the access to this document (e.g. permission to read or write an electronic document). For a public document, specify a grantee with an Audience with audienceType equal to "public".

EnergyConsumptionDetails.name: EnergyConsumptionDetails
EnergyConsumptionDetails.help: EnergyConsumptionDetails represents information related to the energy efficiency of a product that consumes energy. The information that can be provided is based on international regulations such as for example [EU directive 2017/1369](https://eur-lex.europa.eu/eli/reg/2017/1369/oj) for energy labeling and the [Energy labeling rule](https://www.ftc.gov/enforcement/rules/rulemaking-regulatory-reform-proceedings/energy-water-use-labeling-consumer) under the Energy Policy and Conservation Act (EPCA) in the US.

inputs.name: energyEfficiencyScaleMax
inputs.label: energyEfficiencyScaleMax
inputs.help: Specifies the most energy efficient class on the regulated EU energy consumption scale for the product category a product belongs to. For example, energy consumption for televisions placed on the market after January 1, 2020 is scaled from D to A+++.

inputs.name: energyEfficiencyScaleMin
inputs.label: energyEfficiencyScaleMin
inputs.help: Specifies the least energy efficient class on the regulated EU energy consumption scale for the product category a product belongs to. For example, energy consumption for televisions placed on the market after January 1, 2020 is scaled from D to A+++.

inputs.name: hasEnergyEfficiencyCategory
inputs.label: hasEnergyEfficiencyCategory
inputs.help: Defines the energy efficiency Category (which could be either a rating out of range of values or a yes/no certification) for a product according to an international energy efficiency standard.

DatedMoneySpecification.name: DatedMoneySpecification
DatedMoneySpecification.help: A DatedMoneySpecification represents monetary values with optional start and end dates. For example, this could represent an employee's salary over a specific period of time. __Note:__ This type has been superseded by [[MonetaryAmount]], use of that type is recommended.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.label: amount
inputs.help: The amount of money.

inputs.name: currency
inputs.label: currency
inputs.help: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

inputs.name: endDate
inputs.label: endDate
inputs.help: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: startDate
inputs.label: startDate
inputs.help: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

Language.name: Language
Language.help: Natural languages such as Spanish, Tamil, Hindi, English, etc. Formal language code tags expressed in [BCP 47](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/IETF_language_tag) can be used via the [[alternateName]] property. The Language type previously also covered programming languages such as Scheme and Lisp, which are now best represented using [[ComputerLanguage]].

WPAdBlock.name: WPAdBlock
WPAdBlock.help: An advertising section of the page.

RestrictedDiet.name: RestrictedDiet
RestrictedDiet.help: A diet restricted to certain foods or preparations for cultural, religious, health or lifestyle reasons.

ReactAction.name: ReactAction
ReactAction.help: The act of responding instinctively and emotionally to an object, expressing a sentiment.

MusicReleaseFormatType.name: MusicReleaseFormatType
MusicReleaseFormatType.help: Format of this release (the type of recording media used, i.e. compact disc, digital media, LP, etc.).

BusinessAudience.name: BusinessAudience
BusinessAudience.help: A set of characteristics belonging to businesses, e.g. who compose an item's target audience.

inputs.name: numberOfEmployees
inputs.label: numberOfEmployees
inputs.help: The number of employees in an organization, e.g. business.

inputs.name: yearlyRevenue
inputs.label: yearlyRevenue
inputs.help: The size of the business in annual revenue.

inputs.name: yearsInOperation
inputs.label: yearsInOperation
inputs.help: The age of the business.

PreOrderAction.name: PreOrderAction
PreOrderAction.help: An agent orders a (not yet released) object/product/service to be delivered/sent.

Muscle.name: Muscle
Muscle.help: A muscle is an anatomical structure consisting of a contractile form of tissue that animals use to effect movement.

inputs.name: antagonist
inputs.label: antagonist
inputs.help: The muscle whose action counteracts the specified muscle.

inputs.name: bloodSupply
inputs.label: bloodSupply
inputs.help: The blood vessel that carries blood from the heart to the muscle.

inputs.name: insertion
inputs.label: insertion
inputs.help: The place of attachment of a muscle, or what the muscle moves.

inputs.name: muscleAction
inputs.label: muscleAction
inputs.help: The movement the muscle generates.

inputs.name: nerve
inputs.label: nerve
inputs.help: The underlying innervation associated with the muscle.

EUEnergyEfficiencyEnumeration.name: EUEnergyEfficiencyEnumeration
EUEnergyEfficiencyEnumeration.help: Enumerates the EU energy efficiency classes A-G as well as A+, A++, and A+++ as defined in EU directive 2017/1369.

Poster.name: Poster
Poster.help: A large, usually printed placard, bill, or announcement, often illustrated, that is posted to advertise or publicize something.

PublicationIssue.name: PublicationIssue
PublicationIssue.help: A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or publication volume, often numbered, usually containing a grouping of works such as articles.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

inputs.name: issueNumber
inputs.label: issueNumber
inputs.help: Identifies the issue of publication; for example, "iii" or "2".

inputs.name: pageEnd
inputs.label: pageEnd
inputs.help: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

inputs.name: pageStart
inputs.label: pageStart
inputs.help: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

inputs.name: pagination
inputs.label: pagination
inputs.help: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

BuyAction.name: BuyAction
BuyAction.help: The act of giving money to a seller in exchange for goods or services rendered. An agent buys an object, product, or service from a seller for a price. Reciprocal of SellAction.

inputs.name: seller
inputs.label: seller
inputs.help: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

inputs.name: vendor
inputs.label: vendor
inputs.help: 'vendor' is an earlier term for 'seller'.

inputs.name: warrantyPromise
inputs.label: warrantyPromise
inputs.help: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

BusReservation.name: BusReservation
BusReservation.help: A reservation for bus travel. \n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

DefinedTerm.name: DefinedTerm
DefinedTerm.help: A word, name, acronym, phrase, etc. with a formal definition. Often used in the context of category or subject classification, glossaries or dictionaries, product or creative work types, etc. Use the name property for the term being defined, use termCode if the term has an alpha-numeric code allocated, use description to provide the definition of the term.

inputs.name: inDefinedTermSet
inputs.label: inDefinedTermSet
inputs.help: A [[DefinedTermSet]] that contains this term.

inputs.name: termCode
inputs.label: termCode
inputs.help: A code that identifies this [[DefinedTerm]] within a [[DefinedTermSet]].

Episode.name: Episode
Episode.help: A media episode (e.g. TV, radio, video game) which can be part of a series or season.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: actors
inputs.label: actors
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: director
inputs.label: director
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: directors
inputs.label: directors
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: duration
inputs.help: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: episodeNumber
inputs.label: episodeNumber
inputs.help: Position of the episode within an ordered group of episodes.

inputs.name: musicBy
inputs.label: musicBy
inputs.help: The composer of the soundtrack.

inputs.name: partOfSeason
inputs.label: partOfSeason
inputs.help: The season to which this episode belongs.

inputs.name: partOfSeries
inputs.label: partOfSeries
inputs.help: The series to which this episode or season belongs.

inputs.name: productionCompany
inputs.label: productionCompany
inputs.help: The production company or studio responsible for the item, e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

inputs.name: trailer
inputs.label: trailer
inputs.help: The trailer of a movie or TV/radio series, season, episode, etc.

MedicalEntity.name: MedicalEntity
MedicalEntity.help: The most generic type of entity related to health and the practice of medicine.

inputs.name: code
inputs.label: code
inputs.help: A medical code for the entity, taken from a controlled vocabulary or ontology such as ICD-9, DiseasesDB, MeSH, SNOMED-CT, RxNorm, etc.

inputs.name: funding
inputs.label: funding
inputs.help: A [[Grant]] that directly or indirectly provide funding or sponsorship for this item. See also [[ownershipFundingInfo]].

inputs.name: guideline
inputs.label: guideline
inputs.help: A medical guideline related to this entity.

inputs.name: legalStatus
inputs.label: legalStatus
inputs.help: The drug or supplement's legal status, including any controlled substance schedules that apply.

inputs.name: medicineSystem
inputs.label: medicineSystem
inputs.help: The system of medicine that includes this MedicalEntity, for example 'evidence-based', 'homeopathic', 'chiropractic', etc.

inputs.name: recognizingAuthority
inputs.label: recognizingAuthority
inputs.help: If applicable, the organization that officially recognizes this entity as part of its endorsed system of medicine.

inputs.name: relevantSpecialty
inputs.label: relevantSpecialty
inputs.help: If applicable, a medical specialty in which this entity is relevant.

inputs.name: study
inputs.label: study
inputs.help: A medical study or trial related to this entity.

GeoCoordinates.name: GeoCoordinates
GeoCoordinates.help: The geographic coordinates of a place or event.

inputs.name: address
inputs.label: address
inputs.help: Physical address of the item.

inputs.name: addressCountry
inputs.label: addressCountry
inputs.help: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

inputs.name: elevation
inputs.label: elevation
inputs.help: The elevation of a location ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)). Values may be of the form 'NUMBER UNIT\_OF\_MEASUREMENT' (e.g., '1,000 m', '3,200 ft') while numbers alone should be assumed to be a value in meters.

inputs.name: latitude
inputs.label: latitude
inputs.help: The latitude of a location. For example ```37.42242``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

inputs.name: longitude
inputs.label: longitude
inputs.help: The longitude of a location. For example ```-122.08585``` ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)).

inputs.name: postalCode
inputs.label: postalCode
inputs.help: The postal code. For example, 94043.

DataDownload.name: DataDownload
DataDownload.help: All or part of a [[Dataset]] in downloadable form.

inputs.name: measurementMethod
inputs.label: measurementMethod
inputs.help: A subproperty of [[measurementTechnique]] that can be used for specifying specific methods, in particular via [[MeasurementMethodEnum]].

inputs.name: measurementTechnique
inputs.label: measurementTechnique
inputs.help:
A technique, method or technology used in an [[Observation]], [[StatisticalVariable]] or [[Dataset]] (or [[DataDownload]], [[DataCatalog]]), corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (for datasets, described using [[variableMeasured]]; for [[Observation]], a [[StatisticalVariable]]). Often but not necessarily each [[variableMeasured]] will have an explicit representation as (or mapping to) an property such as those defined in Schema.org, or other RDF vocabularies and "knowledge graphs". In that case the subproperty of [[variableMeasured]] called [[measuredProperty]] is applicable.
    
The [[measurementTechnique]] property helps when extra clarification is needed about how a [[measuredProperty]] was measured. This is oriented towards scientific and scholarly dataset publication but may have broader applicability; it is not intended as a full representation of measurement, but can often serve as a high level summary for dataset discovery. 

For example, if [[variableMeasured]] is: molecule concentration, [[measurementTechnique]] could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence". If the [[variableMeasured]] is "depression rating", the [[measurementTechnique]] could be "Zung Scale" or "HAM-D" or "Beck Depression Inventory". 

If there are several [[variableMeasured]] properties recorded for some given data object, use a [[PropertyValue]] for each [[variableMeasured]] and attach the corresponding [[measurementTechnique]]. The value can also be from an enumeration, organized as a [[MeasurementMetholdEnumeration]].

InteractAction.name: InteractAction
InteractAction.help: The act of interacting with another person or organization.

DonateAction.name: DonateAction
DonateAction.help: The act of providing goods, services, or money without compensation, often for philanthropic reasons.

inputs.name: recipient
inputs.label: recipient
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

ParcelDelivery.name: ParcelDelivery
ParcelDelivery.help: The delivery of a parcel either via the postal service or a commercial service.

inputs.name: carrier
inputs.label: carrier
inputs.help: 'carrier' is an out-dated term indicating the 'provider' for parcel delivery and flights.

inputs.name: deliveryAddress
inputs.label: deliveryAddress
inputs.help: Destination address.

inputs.name: deliveryStatus
inputs.label: deliveryStatus
inputs.help: New entry added as the package passes through each leg of its journey (from shipment to final delivery).

inputs.name: expectedArrivalFrom
inputs.label: expectedArrivalFrom
inputs.help: The earliest date the package may arrive.

inputs.name: expectedArrivalUntil
inputs.label: expectedArrivalUntil
inputs.help: The latest date the package may arrive.

inputs.name: hasDeliveryMethod
inputs.label: hasDeliveryMethod
inputs.help: Method used for delivery or shipping.

inputs.name: itemShipped
inputs.label: itemShipped
inputs.help: Item(s) being shipped.

inputs.name: originAddress
inputs.label: originAddress
inputs.help: Shipper's address.

inputs.name: partOfOrder
inputs.label: partOfOrder
inputs.help: The overall order the items in this delivery were included in.

inputs.name: provider
inputs.label: provider
inputs.help: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

inputs.name: trackingNumber
inputs.label: trackingNumber
inputs.help: Shipper tracking number.

inputs.name: trackingUrl
inputs.label: trackingUrl
inputs.help: Tracking url for the parcel delivery.

3DModel.name: 3DModel
3DModel.help:
A 3D model represents some kind of 3D content, which may have [[encoding]]s in one or more [[MediaObject]]s. Many 3D formats are available (e.g. see [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Category:3D_graphics_file_formats)); specific encoding formats can be represented using the [[encodingFormat]] property applied to the relevant [[MediaObject]]. For the
case of a single file published after Zip compression, the convention of appending '+zip' to the [[encodingFormat]] can be used. Geospatial, AR/VR, artistic/animation, gaming, engineering and scientific content can all be represented using [[3DModel]].

inputs.name: isResizable
inputs.label: isResizable
inputs.help: Whether the 3DModel allows resizing. For example, room layout applications often do not allow 3DModel elements to be resized to reflect reality.

RadioSeason.name: RadioSeason
RadioSeason.help: Season dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

MerchantReturnEnumeration.name: MerchantReturnEnumeration
MerchantReturnEnumeration.help: Enumerates several kinds of product return policies.

Occupation.name: Occupation
Occupation.help: A profession, may involve prolonged training and/or a formal qualification.

inputs.name: educationRequirements
inputs.label: educationRequirements
inputs.help: Educational background needed for the position or Occupation.

inputs.name: estimatedSalary
inputs.label: estimatedSalary
inputs.help: An estimated salary for a job posting or occupation, based on a variety of variables including, but not limited to industry, job title, and location. Estimated salaries  are often computed by outside organizations rather than the hiring organization, who may not have committed to the estimated value.

inputs.name: experienceRequirements
inputs.label: experienceRequirements
inputs.help: Description of skills and experience needed for the position or Occupation.

inputs.name: occupationLocation
inputs.label: occupationLocation
inputs.help: The region/country for which this occupational description is appropriate. Note that educational requirements and qualifications can vary between jurisdictions.

inputs.name: occupationalCategory
inputs.label: occupationalCategory
inputs.help:
A category describing the job, preferably using a term from a taxonomy such as [BLS O*NET-SOC](http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html), [ISCO-08](https://www.ilo.org/public/english/bureau/stat/isco/isco08/) or similar, with the property repeated for each applicable value. Ideally the taxonomy should be identified, and both the textual label and formal code for the category should be provided.\n
Note: for historical reasons, any textual label and formal code provided as a literal may be assumed to be from O*NET-SOC.

inputs.name: qualifications
inputs.label: qualifications
inputs.help: Specific qualifications required for this role or Occupation.

inputs.name: responsibilities
inputs.label: responsibilities
inputs.help: Responsibilities associated with this role or Occupation.

inputs.name: skills
inputs.label: skills
inputs.help: A statement of knowledge, skill, ability, task or any other assertion expressing a competency that is desired or required to fulfill this role or to work in this occupation.

MedicalObservationalStudyDesign.name: MedicalObservationalStudyDesign
MedicalObservationalStudyDesign.help: Design models for observational medical studies. Enumerated type.

Collection.name: Collection
Collection.help: A collection of items, e.g. creative works or products.

inputs.name: collectionSize
inputs.label: collectionSize
inputs.help: The number of items in the [[Collection]].

inputs.name: hasMember
inputs.label: hasMember
inputs.help: Links to a subsidiary Object or Collection. Typically used to link to component parts, such as a book linking to a page.  Note on transitivity: hasMember is   not defined as transitive, but applications may treat it as transitive as local needs   dictate.

inputs.name: memberOf
inputs.label: memberOf
inputs.help: Links from an Object or Collection to a containing Object or Collection.

MediaReviewItem.name: MediaReviewItem
MediaReviewItem.help: Represents an item or group of closely related items treated as a unit for the sake of evaluation in a [[MediaReview]]. Authorship etc. apply to the items rather than to the curation/grouping or reviewing party.

inputs.name: mediaItemAppearance
inputs.label: mediaItemAppearance
inputs.help: In the context of a [[MediaReview]], indicates specific media item(s) that are grouped using a [[MediaReviewItem]].

LibrarySystem.name: LibrarySystem
LibrarySystem.help: A [[LibrarySystem]] is a collaborative system amongst several libraries.

BroadcastService.name: BroadcastService
BroadcastService.help: A delivery service through which content is provided via broadcast over the air or online.

inputs.name: area
inputs.label: area
inputs.help: The area within which users can expect to reach the broadcast service.

inputs.name: broadcastAffiliateOf
inputs.label: broadcastAffiliateOf
inputs.help: The media network(s) whose content is broadcast on this station.

inputs.name: broadcastDisplayName
inputs.label: broadcastDisplayName
inputs.help: The name displayed in the channel guide. For many US affiliates, it is the network name.

inputs.name: broadcastFrequency
inputs.label: broadcastFrequency
inputs.help: The frequency used for over-the-air broadcasts. Numeric values or simple ranges, e.g. 87-99. In addition a shortcut idiom is supported for frequences of AM and FM radio channels, e.g. "87 FM".

inputs.name: broadcastTimezone
inputs.label: broadcastTimezone
inputs.help: The timezone in [ISO 8601 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601) for which the service bases its broadcasts.

inputs.name: broadcaster
inputs.label: broadcaster
inputs.help: The organization owning or operating the broadcast service.

inputs.name: callSign
inputs.label: callSign
inputs.help: A [callsign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Call_sign), as used in broadcasting and radio communications to identify people, radio and TV stations, or vehicles.

inputs.name: hasBroadcastChannel
inputs.label: hasBroadcastChannel
inputs.help: A broadcast channel of a broadcast service.

inputs.name: inLanguage
inputs.label: inLanguage
inputs.help: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

inputs.name: parentService
inputs.label: parentService
inputs.help: A broadcast service to which the broadcast service may belong to such as regional variations of a national channel.

inputs.name: videoFormat
inputs.label: videoFormat
inputs.help: The type of screening or video broadcast used (e.g. IMAX, 3D, SD, HD, etc.).

MedicalGuidelineRecommendation.name: MedicalGuidelineRecommendation
MedicalGuidelineRecommendation.help: A guideline recommendation that is regarded as efficacious and where quality of the data supporting the recommendation is sound.

inputs.name: recommendationStrength
inputs.label: recommendationStrength
inputs.help: Strength of the guideline's recommendation (e.g. 'class I').

DigitalDocumentPermission.name: DigitalDocumentPermission
DigitalDocumentPermission.help: A permission for a particular person or group to access a particular file.

inputs.name: grantee
inputs.label: grantee
inputs.help: The person, organization, contact point, or audience that has been granted this permission.

inputs.name: permissionType
inputs.label: permissionType
inputs.help: The type of permission granted the person, organization, or audience.

Mountain.name: Mountain
Mountain.help: A mountain, like Mount Whitney or Mount Everest.

JobPosting.name: JobPosting
JobPosting.help: A listing that describes a job opening in a certain organization.

inputs.name: applicantLocationRequirements
inputs.label: applicantLocationRequirements
inputs.help: The location(s) applicants can apply from. This is usually used for telecommuting jobs where the applicant does not need to be in a physical office. Note: This should not be used for citizenship or work visa requirements.

inputs.name: applicationContact
inputs.label: applicationContact
inputs.help: Contact details for further information relevant to this job posting.

inputs.name: baseSalary
inputs.label: baseSalary
inputs.help: The base salary of the job or of an employee in an EmployeeRole.

inputs.name: benefits
inputs.label: benefits
inputs.help: Description of benefits associated with the job.

inputs.name: datePosted
inputs.label: datePosted
inputs.help: Publication date of an online listing.

inputs.name: directApply
inputs.label: directApply
inputs.help: Indicates whether an [[url]] that is associated with a [[JobPosting]] enables direct application for the job, via the posting website. A job posting is considered to have directApply of [[True]] if an application process for the specified job can be directly initiated via the url(s) given (noting that e.g. multiple internet domains might nevertheless be involved at an implementation level). A value of [[False]] is appropriate if there is no clear path to applying directly online for the specified job, navigating directly from the JobPosting url(s) supplied.

inputs.name: educationRequirements
inputs.label: educationRequirements
inputs.help: Educational background needed for the position or Occupation.

inputs.name: eligibilityToWorkRequirement
inputs.label: eligibilityToWorkRequirement
inputs.help: The legal requirements such as citizenship, visa and other documentation required for an applicant to this job.

inputs.name: employerOverview
inputs.label: employerOverview
inputs.help: A description of the employer, career opportunities and work environment for this position.

inputs.name: employmentType
inputs.label: employmentType
inputs.help: Type of employment (e.g. full-time, part-time, contract, temporary, seasonal, internship).

inputs.name: employmentUnit
inputs.label: employmentUnit
inputs.help: Indicates the department, unit and/or facility where the employee reports and/or in which the job is to be performed.

inputs.name: estimatedSalary
inputs.label: estimatedSalary
inputs.help: An estimated salary for a job posting or occupation, based on a variety of variables including, but not limited to industry, job title, and location. Estimated salaries  are often computed by outside organizations rather than the hiring organization, who may not have committed to the estimated value.

inputs.name: experienceInPlaceOfEducation
inputs.label: experienceInPlaceOfEducation
inputs.help: Indicates whether a [[JobPosting]] will accept experience (as indicated by [[OccupationalExperienceRequirements]]) in place of its formal educational qualifications (as indicated by [[educationRequirements]]). If true, indicates that satisfying one of these requirements is sufficient.

inputs.name: experienceRequirements
inputs.label: experienceRequirements
inputs.help: Description of skills and experience needed for the position or Occupation.

inputs.name: hiringOrganization
inputs.label: hiringOrganization
inputs.help: Organization or Person offering the job position.

inputs.name: incentiveCompensation
inputs.label: incentiveCompensation
inputs.help: Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.

inputs.name: incentives
inputs.label: incentives
inputs.help: Description of bonus and commission compensation aspects of the job.

inputs.name: industry
inputs.label: industry
inputs.help: The industry associated with the job position.

inputs.name: jobBenefits
inputs.label: jobBenefits
inputs.help: Description of benefits associated with the job.

inputs.name: jobImmediateStart
inputs.label: jobImmediateStart
inputs.help: An indicator as to whether a position is available for an immediate start.

inputs.name: jobLocation
inputs.label: jobLocation
inputs.help: A (typically single) geographic location associated with the job position.

inputs.name: jobLocationType
inputs.label: jobLocationType
inputs.help: A description of the job location (e.g. TELECOMMUTE for telecommute jobs).

inputs.name: jobStartDate
inputs.label: jobStartDate
inputs.help: The date on which a successful applicant for this job would be expected to start work. Choose a specific date in the future or use the jobImmediateStart property to indicate the position is to be filled as soon as possible.

inputs.name: occupationalCategory
inputs.label: occupationalCategory
inputs.help:
A category describing the job, preferably using a term from a taxonomy such as [BLS O*NET-SOC](http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html), [ISCO-08](https://www.ilo.org/public/english/bureau/stat/isco/isco08/) or similar, with the property repeated for each applicable value. Ideally the taxonomy should be identified, and both the textual label and formal code for the category should be provided.\n
Note: for historical reasons, any textual label and formal code provided as a literal may be assumed to be from O*NET-SOC.

inputs.name: physicalRequirement
inputs.label: physicalRequirement
inputs.help: A description of the types of physical activity associated with the job. Defined terms such as those in O*net may be used, but note that there is no way to specify the level of ability as well as its nature when using a defined term.

inputs.name: qualifications
inputs.label: qualifications
inputs.help: Specific qualifications required for this role or Occupation.

inputs.name: relevantOccupation
inputs.label: relevantOccupation
inputs.help: The Occupation for the JobPosting.

inputs.name: responsibilities
inputs.label: responsibilities
inputs.help: Responsibilities associated with this role or Occupation.

inputs.name: salaryCurrency
inputs.label: salaryCurrency
inputs.help: The currency (coded using [ISO 4217](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)) used for the main salary information in this job posting or for this employee.

inputs.name: securityClearanceRequirement
inputs.label: securityClearanceRequirement
inputs.help: A description of any security clearance requirements of the job.

inputs.name: sensoryRequirement
inputs.label: sensoryRequirement
inputs.help: A description of any sensory requirements and levels necessary to function on the job, including hearing and vision. Defined terms such as those in O*net may be used, but note that there is no way to specify the level of ability as well as its nature when using a defined term.

inputs.name: skills
inputs.label: skills
inputs.help: A statement of knowledge, skill, ability, task or any other assertion expressing a competency that is desired or required to fulfill this role or to work in this occupation.

inputs.name: specialCommitments
inputs.label: specialCommitments
inputs.help: Any special commitments associated with this job posting. Valid entries include VeteranCommit, MilitarySpouseCommit, etc.

inputs.name: title
inputs.label: title
inputs.help: The title of the job.

inputs.name: totalJobOpenings
inputs.label: totalJobOpenings
inputs.help: The number of positions open for this job posting. Use a positive integer. Do not use if the number of positions is unclear or not known.

inputs.name: validThrough
inputs.label: validThrough
inputs.help: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

inputs.name: workHours
inputs.label: workHours
inputs.help: The typical working hours for this job (e.g. 1st shift, night shift, 8am-5pm).

Code.name: Code
Code.help: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

inputs.name: defaultValue
inputs.label: defaultValue
inputs.help: The default value of the input.  For properties that expect a literal, the default is a literal value, for properties that expect an object, it's an ID reference to one of the current values.

inputs.name: maxValue
inputs.label: maxValue
inputs.help: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

inputs.name: minValue
inputs.label: minValue
inputs.help: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

inputs.name: multipleValues
inputs.label: multipleValues
inputs.help: Whether multiple values are allowed for the property.  Default is false.

inputs.name: readonlyValue
inputs.label: readonlyValue
inputs.help: Whether or not a property is mutable.  Default is false. Specifying this for a property that also has a value makes it act similar to a "hidden" input in an HTML form.

inputs.name: stepValue
inputs.label: stepValue
inputs.help: The stepValue attribute indicates the granularity that is expected (and required) of the value in a PropertyValueSpecification.

inputs.name: valueMaxLength
inputs.label: valueMaxLength
inputs.help: Specifies the allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

inputs.name: valueMinLength
inputs.label: valueMinLength
inputs.help: Specifies the minimum allowed range for number of characters in a literal value.

inputs.name: valueName
inputs.label: valueName
inputs.help: Indicates the name of the PropertyValueSpecification to be used in URL templates and form encoding in a manner analogous to HTML's input@name.

inputs.name: valuePattern
inputs.label: valuePattern
inputs.help: Specifies a regular expression for testing literal values according to the HTML spec.

inputs.name: valueRequired
inputs.label: valueRequired
inputs.help: Whether the property must be filled in to complete the action.  Default is false.

GameAvailabilityEnumeration.name: GameAvailabilityEnumeration
GameAvailabilityEnumeration.help: For a [[VideoGame]], such as used with a [[PlayGameAction]], an enumeration of the kind of game availability offered.

MedicalStudy.name: MedicalStudy
MedicalStudy.help: A medical study is an umbrella type covering all kinds of research studies relating to human medicine or health, including observational studies and interventional trials and registries, randomized, controlled or not. When the specific type of study is known, use one of the extensions of this type, such as MedicalTrial or MedicalObservationalStudy. Also, note that this type should be used to mark up data that describes the study itself; to tag an article that publishes the results of a study, use MedicalScholarlyArticle. Note: use the code property of MedicalEntity to store study IDs, e.g. clinicaltrials.gov ID.

inputs.name: healthCondition
inputs.label: healthCondition
inputs.help: Specifying the health condition(s) of a patient, medical study, or other target audience.

inputs.name: sponsor
inputs.label: sponsor
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. E.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

inputs.name: status
inputs.label: status
inputs.help: The status of the study (enumerated).

inputs.name: studyLocation
inputs.label: studyLocation
inputs.help: The location in which the study is taking/took place.

inputs.name: studySubject
inputs.label: studySubject
inputs.help: A subject of the study, i.e. one of the medical conditions, therapies, devices, drugs, etc. investigated by the study.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.label: amount
inputs.help: The amount of money.

inputs.name: funder
inputs.label: funder
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

Recommendation.name: Recommendation
Recommendation.help: [[Recommendation]] is a type of [[Review]] that suggests or proposes something as the best option or best course of action. Recommendations may be for products or services, or other concrete things, as in the case of a ranked list or product guide. A [[Guide]] may list multiple recommendations for different categories. For example, in a [[Guide]] about which TVs to buy, the author may have several [[Recommendation]]s.

inputs.name: category
inputs.label: category
inputs.help: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

UserPlusOnes.name: UserPlusOnes
UserPlusOnes.help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

ReportageNewsArticle.name: ReportageNewsArticle
ReportageNewsArticle.help:
The [[ReportageNewsArticle]] type is a subtype of [[NewsArticle]] representing
 news articles which are the result of journalistic news reporting conventions.

In practice many news publishers produce a wide variety of article types, many of which might be considered a [[NewsArticle]] but not a [[ReportageNewsArticle]]. For example, opinion pieces, reviews, analysis, sponsored or satirical articles, or articles that combine several of these elements.

The [[ReportageNewsArticle]] type is based on a stricter ideal for "news" as a work of journalism, with articles based on factual information either observed or verified by the author, or reported and verified from knowledgeable sources.  This often includes perspectives from multiple viewpoints on a particular issue (distinguishing news reports from public relations or propaganda).  News reports in the [[ReportageNewsArticle]] sense de-emphasize the opinion of the author, with commentary and value judgements typically expressed elsewhere.

A [[ReportageNewsArticle]] which goes deeper into analysis can also be marked with an additional type of [[AnalysisNewsArticle]].

TheaterGroup.name: TheaterGroup
TheaterGroup.help: A theater group or company, for example, the Royal Shakespeare Company or Druid Theatre.

BefriendAction.name: BefriendAction
BefriendAction.help:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone (object) mutually/bidirectionally/symmetrically.

Related actions:

* [[FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, BefriendAction implies that the connection is reciprocal.

Artery.name: Artery
Artery.help: A type of blood vessel that specifically carries blood away from the heart.

inputs.name: arterialBranch
inputs.label: arterialBranch
inputs.help: The branches that comprise the arterial structure.

inputs.name: supplyTo
inputs.label: supplyTo
inputs.help: The area to which the artery supplies blood.

PostalCodeRangeSpecification.name: PostalCodeRangeSpecification
PostalCodeRangeSpecification.help: Indicates a range of postal codes, usually defined as the set of valid codes between [[postalCodeBegin]] and [[postalCodeEnd]], inclusively.

inputs.name: postalCodeBegin
inputs.label: postalCodeBegin
inputs.help: First postal code in a range (included).

inputs.name: postalCodeEnd
inputs.label: postalCodeEnd
inputs.help: Last postal code in the range (included). Needs to be after [[postalCodeBegin]].

TipAction.name: TipAction
TipAction.help: The act of giving money voluntarily to a beneficiary in recognition of services rendered.

inputs.name: recipient
inputs.label: recipient
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

DefinedRegion.name: DefinedRegion
DefinedRegion.help:
A DefinedRegion is a geographic area defined by potentially arbitrary (rather than political, administrative or natural geographical) criteria. Properties are provided for defining a region by reference to sets of postal codes.

Examples: a delivery destination when shopping. Region where regional pricing is configured.

Requirement 1:
Country: US
States: "NY", "CA"

Requirement 2:
Country: US
PostalCode Set: { [94000-94585], [97000, 97999], [13000, 13599]}
{ [12345, 12345], [78945, 78945], }
Region = state, canton, prefecture, autonomous community...

inputs.name: addressCountry
inputs.label: addressCountry
inputs.help: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

inputs.name: addressRegion
inputs.label: addressRegion
inputs.help: The region in which the locality is, and which is in the country. For example, California or another appropriate first-level [Administrative division](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_administrative_divisions_by_country).

inputs.name: postalCode
inputs.label: postalCode
inputs.help: The postal code. For example, 94043.

inputs.name: postalCodePrefix
inputs.label: postalCodePrefix
inputs.help: A defined range of postal codes indicated by a common textual prefix. Used for non-numeric systems such as UK.

inputs.name: postalCodeRange
inputs.label: postalCodeRange
inputs.help: A defined range of postal codes.

BookSeries.name: BookSeries
BookSeries.help: A series of books. Included books can be indicated with the hasPart property.

MusicAlbumReleaseType.name: MusicAlbumReleaseType
MusicAlbumReleaseType.help: The kind of release which this album is: single, EP or album.

ResearchOrganization.name: ResearchOrganization
ResearchOrganization.help: A Research Organization (e.g. scientific institute, research company).

InstallAction.name: InstallAction
InstallAction.help: The act of installing an application.

TechArticle.name: TechArticle
TechArticle.help: A technical article - Example: How-to (task) topics, step-by-step, procedural troubleshooting, specifications, etc.

inputs.name: dependencies
inputs.label: dependencies
inputs.help: Prerequisites needed to fulfill steps in article.

inputs.name: proficiencyLevel
inputs.label: proficiencyLevel
inputs.help: Proficiency needed for this content; expected values: 'Beginner', 'Expert'.

MedicalTherapy.name: MedicalTherapy
MedicalTherapy.help: Any medical intervention designed to prevent, treat, and cure human diseases and medical conditions, including both curative and palliative therapies. Medical therapies are typically processes of care relying upon pharmacotherapy, behavioral therapy, supportive therapy (with fluid or nutrition for example), or detoxification (e.g. hemodialysis) aimed at improving or preventing a health condition.

inputs.name: contraindication
inputs.label: contraindication
inputs.help: A contraindication for this therapy.

inputs.name: duplicateTherapy
inputs.label: duplicateTherapy
inputs.help: A therapy that duplicates or overlaps this one.

inputs.name: seriousAdverseOutcome
inputs.label: seriousAdverseOutcome
inputs.help: A possible serious complication and/or serious side effect of this therapy. Serious adverse outcomes include those that are life-threatening; result in death, disability, or permanent damage; require hospitalization or prolong existing hospitalization; cause congenital anomalies or birth defects; or jeopardize the patient and may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes in this definition.

PlayAction.name: PlayAction
PlayAction.help:
The act of playing/exercising/training/performing for enjoyment, leisure, recreation, competition or exercise.

Related actions:

* [[ListenAction]]: Unlike ListenAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to performing for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming music.
* [[WatchAction]]: Unlike WatchAction (which is under ConsumeAction), PlayAction refers to showing/displaying for an audience or at an event, rather than consuming visual content.

inputs.name: audience
inputs.label: audience
inputs.help: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

inputs.name: event
inputs.label: event
inputs.help: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

ExercisePlan.name: ExercisePlan
ExercisePlan.help: Fitness-related activity designed for a specific health-related purpose, including defined exercise routines as well as activity prescribed by a clinician.

inputs.name: activityDuration
inputs.label: activityDuration
inputs.help: Length of time to engage in the activity.

inputs.name: activityFrequency
inputs.label: activityFrequency
inputs.help: How often one should engage in the activity.

inputs.name: additionalVariable
inputs.label: additionalVariable
inputs.help: Any additional component of the exercise prescription that may need to be articulated to the patient. This may include the order of exercises, the number of repetitions of movement, quantitative distance, progressions over time, etc.

inputs.name: exerciseType
inputs.label: exerciseType
inputs.help: Type(s) of exercise or activity, such as strength training, flexibility training, aerobics, cardiac rehabilitation, etc.

inputs.name: intensity
inputs.label: intensity
inputs.help: Quantitative measure gauging the degree of force involved in the exercise, for example, heartbeats per minute. May include the velocity of the movement.

inputs.name: repetitions
inputs.label: repetitions
inputs.help: Number of times one should repeat the activity.

inputs.name: restPeriods
inputs.label: restPeriods
inputs.help: How often one should break from the activity.

inputs.name: workload
inputs.label: workload
inputs.help: Quantitative measure of the physiologic output of the exercise; also referred to as energy expenditure.

HyperTocEntry.name: HyperTocEntry
HyperTocEntry.help: A HyperToEntry is an item within a [[HyperToc]], which represents a hypertext table of contents for complex media objects, such as [[VideoObject]], [[AudioObject]]. The media object itself is indicated using [[associatedMedia]]. Each section of interest within that content can be described with a [[HyperTocEntry]], with associated [[startOffset]] and [[endOffset]]. When several entries are all from the same file, [[associatedMedia]] is used on the overarching [[HyperTocEntry]]; if the content has been split into multiple files, they can be referenced using [[associatedMedia]] on each [[HyperTocEntry]].

inputs.name: associatedMedia
inputs.label: associatedMedia
inputs.help: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

inputs.name: tocContinuation
inputs.label: tocContinuation
inputs.help: A [[HyperTocEntry]] can have a [[tocContinuation]] indicated, which is another [[HyperTocEntry]] that would be the default next item to play or render.

inputs.name: utterances
inputs.label: utterances
inputs.help: Text of an utterances (spoken words, lyrics etc.) that occurs at a certain section of a media object, represented as a [[HyperTocEntry]].

MobileApplication.name: MobileApplication
MobileApplication.help: A software application designed specifically to work well on a mobile device such as a telephone.

inputs.name: carrierRequirements
inputs.label: carrierRequirements
inputs.help: Specifies specific carrier(s) requirements for the application (e.g. an application may only work on a specific carrier network).

RealEstateListing.name: RealEstateListing
RealEstateListing.help:
A [[RealEstateListing]] is a listing that describes one or more real-estate [[Offer]]s (whose [[businessFunction]] is typically to lease out, or to sell).
  The [[RealEstateListing]] type itself represents the overall listing, as manifested in some [[WebPage]].

inputs.name: datePosted
inputs.label: datePosted
inputs.help: Publication date of an online listing.

inputs.name: leaseLength
inputs.label: leaseLength
inputs.help: Length of the lease for some [[Accommodation]], either particular to some [[Offer]] or in some cases intrinsic to the property.

ParkingFacility.name: ParkingFacility
ParkingFacility.help: A parking lot or other parking facility.

BusOrCoach.name: BusOrCoach
BusOrCoach.help: A bus (also omnibus or autobus) is a road vehicle designed to carry passengers. Coaches are luxury busses, usually in service for long distance travel.

inputs.name: acrissCode
inputs.label: acrissCode
inputs.help: The ACRISS Car Classification Code is a code used by many car rental companies, for classifying vehicles. ACRISS stands for Association of Car Rental Industry Systems and Standards.

inputs.name: roofLoad
inputs.label: roofLoad
inputs.help:
The permitted total weight of cargo and installations (e.g. a roof rack) on top of the vehicle.

Typical unit code(s): KGM for kilogram, LBR for pound

* Note 1: You can indicate additional information in the [[name]] of the [[QuantitativeValue]] node.
* Note 2: You may also link to a [[QualitativeValue]] node that provides additional information using [[valueReference]]
* Note 3: Note that you can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

CreateAction.name: CreateAction
CreateAction.help: The act of deliberately creating/producing/generating/building a result out of the agent.

LegalValueLevel.name: LegalValueLevel
LegalValueLevel.help: A list of possible levels for the legal validity of a legislation.

AdultOrientedEnumeration.name: AdultOrientedEnumeration
AdultOrientedEnumeration.help: Enumeration of considerations that make a product relevant or potentially restricted for adults only.

SendAction.name: SendAction
SendAction.help:
The act of physically/electronically dispatching an object for transfer from an origin to a destination. Related actions:

* [[ReceiveAction]]: The reciprocal of SendAction.
* [[GiveAction]]: Unlike GiveAction, SendAction does not imply the transfer of ownership (e.g. I can send you my laptop, but I'm not necessarily giving it to you).

inputs.name: deliveryMethod
inputs.label: deliveryMethod
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. The method of delivery.

inputs.name: recipient
inputs.label: recipient
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

MedicalObservationalStudy.name: MedicalObservationalStudy
MedicalObservationalStudy.help: An observational study is a type of medical study that attempts to infer the possible effect of a treatment through observation of a cohort of subjects over a period of time. In an observational study, the assignment of subjects into treatment groups versus control groups is outside the control of the investigator. This is in contrast with controlled studies, such as the randomized controlled trials represented by MedicalTrial, where each subject is randomly assigned to a treatment group or a control group before the start of the treatment.

inputs.name: studyDesign
inputs.label: studyDesign
inputs.help: Specifics about the observational study design (enumerated).

RadioEpisode.name: RadioEpisode
RadioEpisode.help: A radio episode which can be part of a series or season.

Property.name: Property
Property.help: A property, used to indicate attributes and relationships of some Thing; equivalent to rdf:Property.

inputs.name: domainIncludes
inputs.label: domainIncludes
inputs.help: Relates a property to a class that is (one of) the type(s) the property is expected to be used on.

inputs.name: inverseOf
inputs.label: inverseOf
inputs.help: Relates a property to a property that is its inverse. Inverse properties relate the same pairs of items to each other, but in reversed direction. For example, the 'alumni' and 'alumniOf' properties are inverseOf each other. Some properties don't have explicit inverses; in these situations RDFa and JSON-LD syntax for reverse properties can be used.

inputs.name: rangeIncludes
inputs.label: rangeIncludes
inputs.help: Relates a property to a class that constitutes (one of) the expected type(s) for values of the property.

inputs.name: supersededBy
inputs.label: supersededBy
inputs.help: Relates a term (i.e. a property, class or enumeration) to one that supersedes it.

ControlAction.name: ControlAction
ControlAction.help: An agent controls a device or application.

USNonprofitType.name: USNonprofitType
USNonprofitType.help: USNonprofitType: Non-profit organization type originating from the United States.

ShippingDeliveryTime.name: ShippingDeliveryTime
ShippingDeliveryTime.help: ShippingDeliveryTime provides various pieces of information about delivery times for shipping.

inputs.name: businessDays
inputs.label: businessDays
inputs.help: Days of the week when the merchant typically operates, indicated via opening hours markup.

inputs.name: cutoffTime
inputs.label: cutoffTime
inputs.help: Order cutoff time allows merchants to describe the time after which they will no longer process orders received on that day. For orders processed after cutoff time, one day gets added to the delivery time estimate. This property is expected to be most typically used via the [[ShippingRateSettings]] publication pattern. The time is indicated using the ISO-8601 Time format, e.g. "23:30:00-05:00" would represent 6:30 pm Eastern Standard Time (EST) which is 5 hours behind Coordinated Universal Time (UTC).

inputs.name: handlingTime
inputs.label: handlingTime
inputs.help: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup. Typical properties: minValue, maxValue, unitCode (d for DAY).  This is by common convention assumed to mean business days (if a unitCode is used, coded as "d"), i.e. only counting days when the business normally operates.

inputs.name: transitTime
inputs.label: transitTime
inputs.help: The typical delay the order has been sent for delivery and the goods reach the final customer. Typical properties: minValue, maxValue, unitCode (d for DAY).

DrugClass.name: DrugClass
DrugClass.help: A class of medical drugs, e.g., statins. Classes can represent general pharmacological class, common mechanisms of action, common physiological effects, etc.

inputs.name: drug
inputs.label: drug
inputs.help: Specifying a drug or medicine used in a medication procedure.

MovieSeries.name: MovieSeries
MovieSeries.help: A series of movies. Included movies can be indicated with the hasPart property.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: actors
inputs.label: actors
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: director
inputs.label: director
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: directors
inputs.label: directors
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: musicBy
inputs.label: musicBy
inputs.help: The composer of the soundtrack.

inputs.name: productionCompany
inputs.label: productionCompany
inputs.help: The production company or studio responsible for the item, e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

inputs.name: trailer
inputs.label: trailer
inputs.help: The trailer of a movie or TV/radio series, season, episode, etc.

InvestmentOrDeposit.name: InvestmentOrDeposit
InvestmentOrDeposit.help: A type of financial product that typically requires the client to transfer funds to a financial service in return for potential beneficial financial return.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.label: amount
inputs.help: The amount of money.

MediaEnumeration.name: MediaEnumeration
MediaEnumeration.help: MediaEnumeration enumerations are lists of codes, labels etc. useful for describing media objects. They may be reflections of externally developed lists, or created at schema.org, or a combination.

TaxiService.name: TaxiService
TaxiService.help: A service for a vehicle for hire with a driver for local travel. Fares are usually calculated based on distance traveled.

inputs.name: addressCountry
inputs.label: addressCountry
inputs.help: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

inputs.name: addressLocality
inputs.label: addressLocality
inputs.help: The locality in which the street address is, and which is in the region. For example, Mountain View.

inputs.name: addressRegion
inputs.label: addressRegion
inputs.help: The region in which the locality is, and which is in the country. For example, California or another appropriate first-level [Administrative division](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_administrative_divisions_by_country).

inputs.name: postOfficeBoxNumber
inputs.label: postOfficeBoxNumber
inputs.help: The post office box number for PO box addresses.

inputs.name: postalCode
inputs.label: postalCode
inputs.help: The postal code. For example, 94043.

inputs.name: streetAddress
inputs.label: streetAddress
inputs.help: The street address. For example, 1600 Amphitheatre Pkwy.

BioChemEntity.name: BioChemEntity
BioChemEntity.help: Any biological, chemical, or biochemical thing. For example: a protein; a gene; a chemical; a synthetic chemical.

inputs.name: associatedDisease
inputs.label: associatedDisease
inputs.help: Disease associated to this BioChemEntity. Such disease can be a MedicalCondition or a URL. If you want to add an evidence supporting the association, please use PropertyValue.

inputs.name: bioChemInteraction
inputs.label: bioChemInteraction
inputs.help: A BioChemEntity that is known to interact with this item.

inputs.name: bioChemSimilarity
inputs.label: bioChemSimilarity
inputs.help: A similar BioChemEntity, e.g., obtained by fingerprint similarity algorithms.

inputs.name: biologicalRole
inputs.label: biologicalRole
inputs.help: A role played by the BioChemEntity within a biological context.

inputs.name: funding
inputs.label: funding
inputs.help: A [[Grant]] that directly or indirectly provide funding or sponsorship for this item. See also [[ownershipFundingInfo]].

inputs.name: hasBioChemEntityPart
inputs.label: hasBioChemEntityPart
inputs.help: Indicates a BioChemEntity that (in some sense) has this BioChemEntity as a part.

inputs.name: hasMolecularFunction
inputs.label: hasMolecularFunction
inputs.help: Molecular function performed by this BioChemEntity; please use PropertyValue if you want to include any evidence.

inputs.name: hasRepresentation
inputs.label: hasRepresentation
inputs.help: A common representation such as a protein sequence or chemical structure for this entity. For images use schema.org/image.

inputs.name: isEncodedByBioChemEntity
inputs.label: isEncodedByBioChemEntity
inputs.help: Another BioChemEntity encoding by this one.

inputs.name: isInvolvedInBiologicalProcess
inputs.label: isInvolvedInBiologicalProcess
inputs.help: Biological process this BioChemEntity is involved in; please use PropertyValue if you want to include any evidence.

inputs.name: isLocatedInSubcellularLocation
inputs.label: isLocatedInSubcellularLocation
inputs.help: Subcellular location where this BioChemEntity is located; please use PropertyValue if you want to include any evidence.

inputs.name: isPartOfBioChemEntity
inputs.label: isPartOfBioChemEntity
inputs.help: Indicates a BioChemEntity that is (in some sense) a part of this BioChemEntity.

inputs.name: taxonomicRange
inputs.label: taxonomicRange
inputs.help: The taxonomic grouping of the organism that expresses, encodes, or in some way related to the BioChemEntity.

ReplyAction.name: ReplyAction
ReplyAction.help:
The act of responding to a question/message asked/sent by the object. Related to [[AskAction]].

Related actions:

* [[AskAction]]: Appears generally as an origin of a ReplyAction.

inputs.name: resultComment
inputs.label: resultComment
inputs.help: A sub property of result. The Comment created or sent as a result of this action.

BreadcrumbList.name: BreadcrumbList
BreadcrumbList.help: A BreadcrumbList is an ItemList consisting of a chain of linked Web pages, typically described using at least their URL and their name, and typically ending with the current page.\n\nThe [[position]] property is used to reconstruct the order of the items in a BreadcrumbList. The convention is that a breadcrumb list has an [[itemListOrder]] of [[ItemListOrderAscending]] (lower values listed first), and that the first items in this list correspond to the "top" or beginning of the breadcrumb trail, e.g. with a site or section homepage. The specific values of 'position' are not assigned meaning for a BreadcrumbList, but they should be integers, e.g. beginning with '1' for the first item in the list.

HowToTool.name: HowToTool
HowToTool.help: A tool used (but not consumed) when performing instructions for how to achieve a result.

NewsMediaOrganization.name: NewsMediaOrganization
NewsMediaOrganization.help: A News/Media organization such as a newspaper or TV station.

inputs.name: actionableFeedbackPolicy
inputs.label: actionableFeedbackPolicy
inputs.help: For a [[NewsMediaOrganization]] or other news-related [[Organization]], a statement about public engagement activities (for news media, the newsroom’s), including involving the public - digitally or otherwise -- in coverage decisions, reporting and activities after publication.

inputs.name: correctionsPolicy
inputs.label: correctionsPolicy
inputs.help: For an [[Organization]] (e.g. [[NewsMediaOrganization]]), a statement describing (in news media, the newsroom’s) disclosure and correction policy for errors.

inputs.name: diversityPolicy
inputs.label: diversityPolicy
inputs.help: Statement on diversity policy by an [[Organization]] e.g. a [[NewsMediaOrganization]]. For a [[NewsMediaOrganization]], a statement describing the newsroom’s diversity policy on both staffing and sources, typically providing staffing data.

inputs.name: diversityStaffingReport
inputs.label: diversityStaffingReport
inputs.help: For an [[Organization]] (often but not necessarily a [[NewsMediaOrganization]]), a report on staffing diversity issues. In a news context this might be for example ASNE or RTDNA (US) reports, or self-reported.

inputs.name: ethicsPolicy
inputs.label: ethicsPolicy
inputs.help: Statement about ethics policy, e.g. of a [[NewsMediaOrganization]] regarding journalistic and publishing practices, or of a [[Restaurant]], a page describing food source policies. In the case of a [[NewsMediaOrganization]], an ethicsPolicy is typically a statement describing the personal, organizational, and corporate standards of behavior expected by the organization.

inputs.name: masthead
inputs.label: masthead
inputs.help: For a [[NewsMediaOrganization]], a link to the masthead page or a page listing top editorial management.

inputs.name: missionCoveragePrioritiesPolicy
inputs.label: missionCoveragePrioritiesPolicy
inputs.help: For a [[NewsMediaOrganization]], a statement on coverage priorities, including any public agenda or stance on issues.

inputs.name: noBylinesPolicy
inputs.label: noBylinesPolicy
inputs.help: For a [[NewsMediaOrganization]] or other news-related [[Organization]], a statement explaining when authors of articles are not named in bylines.

inputs.name: ownershipFundingInfo
inputs.label: ownershipFundingInfo
inputs.help: For an [[Organization]] (often but not necessarily a [[NewsMediaOrganization]]), a description of organizational ownership structure; funding and grants. In a news/media setting, this is with particular reference to editorial independence.   Note that the [[funder]] is also available and can be used to make basic funder information machine-readable.

inputs.name: unnamedSourcesPolicy
inputs.label: unnamedSourcesPolicy
inputs.help: For an [[Organization]] (typically a [[NewsMediaOrganization]]), a statement about policy on use of unnamed sources and the decision process required.

inputs.name: verificationFactCheckingPolicy
inputs.label: verificationFactCheckingPolicy
inputs.help: Disclosure about verification and fact-checking processes for a [[NewsMediaOrganization]] or other fact-checking [[Organization]].

OrderItem.name: OrderItem
OrderItem.help: An order item is a line of an order. It includes the quantity and shipping details of a bought offer.

inputs.name: orderDelivery
inputs.label: orderDelivery
inputs.help: The delivery of the parcel related to this order or order item.

inputs.name: orderItemNumber
inputs.label: orderItemNumber
inputs.help: The identifier of the order item.

inputs.name: orderItemStatus
inputs.label: orderItemStatus
inputs.help: The current status of the order item.

inputs.name: orderQuantity
inputs.label: orderQuantity
inputs.help: The number of the item ordered. If the property is not set, assume the quantity is one.

inputs.name: orderedItem
inputs.label: orderedItem
inputs.help: The item ordered.

IgnoreAction.name: IgnoreAction
IgnoreAction.help: The act of intentionally disregarding the object. An agent ignores an object.

ReviewAction.name: ReviewAction
ReviewAction.help: The act of producing a balanced opinion about the object for an audience. An agent reviews an object with participants resulting in a review.

inputs.name: resultReview
inputs.label: resultReview
inputs.help: A sub property of result. The review that resulted in the performing of the action.

Answer.name: Answer
Answer.help: An answer offered to a question; perhaps correct, perhaps opinionated or wrong.

inputs.name: answerExplanation
inputs.label: answerExplanation
inputs.help: A step-by-step or full explanation about Answer. Can outline how this Answer was achieved or contain more broad clarification or statement about it.

inputs.name: parentItem
inputs.label: parentItem
inputs.help: The parent of a question, answer or item in general. Typically used for Q/A discussion threads e.g. a chain of comments with the first comment being an [[Article]] or other [[CreativeWork]]. See also [[comment]] which points from something to a comment about it.

MovieClip.name: MovieClip
MovieClip.help: A short segment/part of a movie.

MediaReview.name: MediaReview
MediaReview.help:
A [[MediaReview]] is a more specialized form of Review dedicated to the evaluation of media content online, typically in the context of fact-checking and misinformation.
    For more general reviews of media in the broader sense, use [[UserReview]], [[CriticReview]] or other [[Review]] types. This definition is
    a work in progress. While the [[MediaManipulationRatingEnumeration]] list reflects significant community review amongst fact-checkers and others working
    to combat misinformation, the specific structures for representing media objects, their versions and publication context, are still evolving. Similarly, best practices for the relationship between [[MediaReview]] and [[ClaimReview]] markup have not yet been finalized.

inputs.name: mediaAuthenticityCategory
inputs.label: mediaAuthenticityCategory
inputs.help: Indicates a MediaManipulationRatingEnumeration classification of a media object (in the context of how it was published or shared).

inputs.name: originalMediaContextDescription
inputs.label: originalMediaContextDescription
inputs.help: Describes, in a [[MediaReview]] when dealing with [[DecontextualizedContent]], background information that can contribute to better interpretation of the [[MediaObject]].

inputs.name: originalMediaLink
inputs.label: originalMediaLink
inputs.help: Link to the page containing an original version of the content, or directly to an online copy of the original [[MediaObject]] content, e.g. video file.

ReserveAction.name: ReserveAction
ReserveAction.help:
Reserving a concrete object.

Related actions:

* [[ScheduleAction]]: Unlike ScheduleAction, ReserveAction reserves concrete objects (e.g. a table, a hotel) towards a time slot / spatial allocation.

PathologyTest.name: PathologyTest
PathologyTest.help: A medical test performed by a laboratory that typically involves examination of a tissue sample by a pathologist.

inputs.name: tissueSample
inputs.label: tissueSample
inputs.help: The type of tissue sample required for the test.

AlignmentObject.name: AlignmentObject
AlignmentObject.help:
An intangible item that describes an alignment between a learning resource and a node in an educational framework.

Should not be used where the nature of the alignment can be described using a simple property, for example to express that a resource [[teaches]] or [[assesses]] a competency.

inputs.name: alignmentType
inputs.label: alignmentType
inputs.help: A category of alignment between the learning resource and the framework node. Recommended values include: 'requires', 'textComplexity', 'readingLevel', and 'educationalSubject'.

inputs.name: educationalFramework
inputs.label: educationalFramework
inputs.help: The framework to which the resource being described is aligned.

inputs.name: targetDescription
inputs.label: targetDescription
inputs.help: The description of a node in an established educational framework.

inputs.name: targetName
inputs.label: targetName
inputs.help: The name of a node in an established educational framework.

inputs.name: targetUrl
inputs.label: targetUrl
inputs.help: The URL of a node in an established educational framework.

RegisterAction.name: RegisterAction
RegisterAction.help:
The act of registering to be a user of a service, product or web page.

Related actions:

* [[JoinAction]]: Unlike JoinAction, RegisterAction implies you are registering to be a user of a service, *not* a group/team of people.
* [[FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, RegisterAction doesn't imply that the agent is expecting to poll for updates from the object.
