* [[SubscribeAction]]: Unlike SubscribeAction, RegisterAction doesn't imply that the agent is expecting updates from the object.

MedicalBusiness.name: MedicalBusiness
MedicalBusiness.help: A particular physical or virtual business of an organization for medical purposes. Examples of MedicalBusiness include different businesses run by health professionals.

RiverBodyOfWater.name: RiverBodyOfWater
RiverBodyOfWater.help: A river (for example, the broad majestic Shannon).

EventReservation.name: EventReservation
EventReservation.help: A reservation for an event like a concert, sporting event, or lecture.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

FilmAction.name: FilmAction
FilmAction.help: The act of capturing sound and moving images on film, video, or digitally.

ExchangeRateSpecification.name: ExchangeRateSpecification
ExchangeRateSpecification.help: A structured value representing exchange rate.

inputs.name: currency
inputs.label: currency
inputs.help: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

inputs.name: currentExchangeRate
inputs.label: currentExchangeRate
inputs.help: The current price of a currency.

inputs.name: exchangeRateSpread
inputs.label: exchangeRateSpread
inputs.help: The difference between the price at which a broker or other intermediary buys and sells foreign currency.

Seat.name: Seat
Seat.help: Used to describe a seat, such as a reserved seat in an event reservation.

inputs.name: seatNumber
inputs.label: seatNumber
inputs.help: The location of the reserved seat (e.g., 27).

inputs.name: seatRow
inputs.label: seatRow
inputs.help: The row location of the reserved seat (e.g., B).

inputs.name: seatSection
inputs.label: seatSection
inputs.help: The section location of the reserved seat (e.g. Orchestra).

inputs.name: seatingType
inputs.label: seatingType
inputs.help: The type/class of the seat.

UnRegisterAction.name: UnRegisterAction
UnRegisterAction.help:
The act of un-registering from a service.

Related actions:

* [[RegisterAction]]: antonym of UnRegisterAction.
* [[LeaveAction]]: Unlike LeaveAction, UnRegisterAction implies that you are unregistering from a service you were previously registered, rather than leaving a team/group of people.

WarrantyScope.name: WarrantyScope
WarrantyScope.help:
A range of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Labor-BringIn
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-BringIn
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PartsAndLabor-PickUp

Atlas.name: Atlas
Atlas.help: A collection or bound volume of maps, charts, plates or tables, physical or in media form illustrating any subject.

ChooseAction.name: ChooseAction
ChooseAction.help: The act of expressing a preference from a set of options or a large or unbounded set of choices/options.

inputs.name: actionOption
inputs.label: actionOption
inputs.help: A sub property of object. The options subject to this action.

inputs.name: option
inputs.label: option
inputs.help: A sub property of object. The options subject to this action.

MedicalCondition.name: MedicalCondition
MedicalCondition.help: Any condition of the human body that affects the normal functioning of a person, whether physically or mentally. Includes diseases, injuries, disabilities, disorders, syndromes, etc.

inputs.name: associatedAnatomy
inputs.label: associatedAnatomy
inputs.help: The anatomy of the underlying organ system or structures associated with this entity.

inputs.name: differentialDiagnosis
inputs.label: differentialDiagnosis
inputs.help: One of a set of differential diagnoses for the condition. Specifically, a closely-related or competing diagnosis typically considered later in the cognitive process whereby this medical condition is distinguished from others most likely responsible for a similar collection of signs and symptoms to reach the most parsimonious diagnosis or diagnoses in a patient.

inputs.name: drug
inputs.label: drug
inputs.help: Specifying a drug or medicine used in a medication procedure.

inputs.name: epidemiology
inputs.label: epidemiology
inputs.help: The characteristics of associated patients, such as age, gender, race etc.

inputs.name: expectedPrognosis
inputs.label: expectedPrognosis
inputs.help: The likely outcome in either the short term or long term of the medical condition.

inputs.name: naturalProgression
inputs.label: naturalProgression
inputs.help: The expected progression of the condition if it is not treated and allowed to progress naturally.

inputs.name: pathophysiology
inputs.label: pathophysiology
inputs.help: Changes in the normal mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions that are associated with this activity or condition.

inputs.name: possibleComplication
inputs.label: possibleComplication
inputs.help: A possible unexpected and unfavorable evolution of a medical condition. Complications may include worsening of the signs or symptoms of the disease, extension of the condition to other organ systems, etc.

inputs.name: possibleTreatment
inputs.label: possibleTreatment
inputs.help: A possible treatment to address this condition, sign or symptom.

inputs.name: primaryPrevention
inputs.label: primaryPrevention
inputs.help: A preventative therapy used to prevent an initial occurrence of the medical condition, such as vaccination.

inputs.name: riskFactor
inputs.label: riskFactor
inputs.help: A modifiable or non-modifiable factor that increases the risk of a patient contracting this condition, e.g. age,  coexisting condition.

inputs.name: secondaryPrevention
inputs.label: secondaryPrevention
inputs.help: A preventative therapy used to prevent reoccurrence of the medical condition after an initial episode of the condition.

inputs.name: signOrSymptom
inputs.label: signOrSymptom
inputs.help: A sign or symptom of this condition. Signs are objective or physically observable manifestations of the medical condition while symptoms are the subjective experience of the medical condition.

inputs.name: stage
inputs.label: stage
inputs.help: The stage of the condition, if applicable.

inputs.name: status
inputs.label: status
inputs.help: The status of the study (enumerated).

inputs.name: typicalTest
inputs.label: typicalTest
inputs.help: A medical test typically performed given this condition.

DeactivateAction.name: DeactivateAction
DeactivateAction.help: The act of stopping or deactivating a device or application (e.g. stopping a timer or turning off a flashlight).

NonprofitType.name: NonprofitType
NonprofitType.help: NonprofitType enumerates several kinds of official non-profit types of which a non-profit organization can be.

TrainTrip.name: TrainTrip
TrainTrip.help: A trip on a commercial train line.

inputs.name: arrivalPlatform
inputs.label: arrivalPlatform
inputs.help: The platform where the train arrives.

inputs.name: arrivalStation
inputs.label: arrivalStation
inputs.help: The station where the train trip ends.

inputs.name: departurePlatform
inputs.label: departurePlatform
inputs.help: The platform from which the train departs.

inputs.name: departureStation
inputs.label: departureStation
inputs.help: The station from which the train departs.

inputs.name: trainName
inputs.label: trainName
inputs.help: The name of the train (e.g. The Orient Express).

inputs.name: trainNumber
inputs.label: trainNumber
inputs.help: The unique identifier for the train.

RadioChannel.name: RadioChannel
RadioChannel.help: A unique instance of a radio BroadcastService on a CableOrSatelliteService lineup.

GovernmentBenefitsType.name: GovernmentBenefitsType
GovernmentBenefitsType.help: GovernmentBenefitsType enumerates several kinds of government benefits to support the COVID-19 situation. Note that this structure may not capture all benefits offered.

SuperficialAnatomy.name: SuperficialAnatomy
SuperficialAnatomy.help: Anatomical features that can be observed by sight (without dissection), including the form and proportions of the human body as well as surface landmarks that correspond to deeper subcutaneous structures. Superficial anatomy plays an important role in sports medicine, phlebotomy, and other medical specialties as underlying anatomical structures can be identified through surface palpation. For example, during back surgery, superficial anatomy can be used to palpate and count vertebrae to find the site of incision. Or in phlebotomy, superficial anatomy can be used to locate an underlying vein; for example, the median cubital vein can be located by palpating the borders of the cubital fossa (such as the epicondyles of the humerus) and then looking for the superficial signs of the vein, such as size, prominence, ability to refill after depression, and feel of surrounding tissue support. As another example, in a subluxation (dislocation) of the glenohumeral joint, the bony structure becomes pronounced with the deltoid muscle failing to cover the glenohumeral joint allowing the edges of the scapula to be superficially visible. Here, the superficial anatomy is the visible edges of the scapula, implying the underlying dislocation of the joint (the related anatomical structure).

inputs.name: associatedPathophysiology
inputs.label: associatedPathophysiology
inputs.help: If applicable, a description of the pathophysiology associated with the anatomical system, including potential abnormal changes in the mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions of the system.

inputs.name: relatedAnatomy
inputs.label: relatedAnatomy
inputs.help: Anatomical systems or structures that relate to the superficial anatomy.

inputs.name: relatedCondition
inputs.label: relatedCondition
inputs.help: A medical condition associated with this anatomy.

inputs.name: relatedTherapy
inputs.label: relatedTherapy
inputs.help: A medical therapy related to this anatomy.

inputs.name: significance
inputs.label: significance
inputs.help: The significance associated with the superficial anatomy; as an example, how characteristics of the superficial anatomy can suggest underlying medical conditions or courses of treatment.

GameServer.name: GameServer
GameServer.help: Server that provides game interaction in a multiplayer game.

inputs.name: game
inputs.label: game
inputs.help: Video game which is played on this server.

inputs.name: playersOnline
inputs.label: playersOnline
inputs.help: Number of players on the server.

inputs.name: serverStatus
inputs.label: serverStatus
inputs.help: Status of a game server.

Optician.name: Optician
Optician.help: A store that sells reading glasses and similar devices for improving vision.

WebPage.name: WebPage
WebPage.help: A web page. Every web page is implicitly assumed to be declared to be of type WebPage, so the various properties about that webpage, such as breadcrumb may be used. We recommend explicit declaration if these properties are specified, but if they are found outside of an itemscope, they will be assumed to be about the page.

inputs.name: breadcrumb
inputs.label: breadcrumb
inputs.help: A set of links that can help a user understand and navigate a website hierarchy.

inputs.name: lastReviewed
inputs.label: lastReviewed
inputs.help: Date on which the content on this web page was last reviewed for accuracy and/or completeness.

inputs.name: mainContentOfPage
inputs.label: mainContentOfPage
inputs.help: Indicates if this web page element is the main subject of the page.

inputs.name: primaryImageOfPage
inputs.label: primaryImageOfPage
inputs.help: Indicates the main image on the page.

inputs.name: relatedLink
inputs.label: relatedLink
inputs.help: A link related to this web page, for example to other related web pages.

inputs.name: reviewedBy
inputs.label: reviewedBy
inputs.help: People or organizations that have reviewed the content on this web page for accuracy and/or completeness.

inputs.name: significantLink
inputs.label: significantLink
inputs.help: One of the more significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

inputs.name: significantLinks
inputs.label: significantLinks
inputs.help: The most significant URLs on the page. Typically, these are the non-navigation links that are clicked on the most.

inputs.name: speakable
inputs.label: speakable
inputs.help:
Indicates sections of a Web page that are particularly 'speakable' in the sense of being highlighted as being especially appropriate for text-to-speech conversion. Other sections of a page may also be usefully spoken in particular circumstances; the 'speakable' property serves to indicate the parts most likely to be generally useful for speech.

The *speakable* property can be repeated an arbitrary number of times, with three kinds of possible 'content-locator' values:

1.) *id-value* URL references - uses *id-value* of an element in the page being annotated. The simplest use of *speakable* has (potentially relative) URL values, referencing identified sections of the document concerned.

2.) CSS Selectors - addresses content in the annotated page, e.g. via class attribute. Use the [[cssSelector]] property.

3.)  XPaths - addresses content via XPaths (assuming an XML view of the content). Use the [[xpath]] property.


For more sophisticated markup of speakable sections beyond simple ID references, either CSS selectors or XPath expressions to pick out document section(s) as speakable. For this
we define a supporting type, [[SpeakableSpecification]]  which is defined to be a possible value of the *speakable* property.

inputs.name: specialty
inputs.label: specialty
inputs.help: One of the domain specialities to which this web page's content applies.

GeoShape.name: GeoShape
GeoShape.help: The geographic shape of a place. A GeoShape can be described using several properties whose values are based on latitude/longitude pairs. Either whitespace or commas can be used to separate latitude and longitude; whitespace should be used when writing a list of several such points.

inputs.name: address
inputs.label: address
inputs.help: Physical address of the item.

inputs.name: addressCountry
inputs.label: addressCountry
inputs.help: The country. For example, USA. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1).

inputs.name: box
inputs.label: box
inputs.help: A box is the area enclosed by the rectangle formed by two points. The first point is the lower corner, the second point is the upper corner. A box is expressed as two points separated by a space character.

inputs.name: circle
inputs.label: circle
inputs.help: A circle is the circular region of a specified radius centered at a specified latitude and longitude. A circle is expressed as a pair followed by a radius in meters.

inputs.name: elevation
inputs.label: elevation
inputs.help: The elevation of a location ([WGS 84](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/World_Geodetic_System)). Values may be of the form 'NUMBER UNIT\_OF\_MEASUREMENT' (e.g., '1,000 m', '3,200 ft') while numbers alone should be assumed to be a value in meters.

inputs.name: line
inputs.label: line
inputs.help: A line is a point-to-point path consisting of two or more points. A line is expressed as a series of two or more point objects separated by space.

inputs.name: polygon
inputs.label: polygon
inputs.help: A polygon is the area enclosed by a point-to-point path for which the starting and ending points are the same. A polygon is expressed as a series of four or more space delimited points where the first and final points are identical.

inputs.name: postalCode
inputs.label: postalCode
inputs.help: The postal code. For example, 94043.

OpinionNewsArticle.name: OpinionNewsArticle
OpinionNewsArticle.help: An [[OpinionNewsArticle]] is a [[NewsArticle]] that primarily expresses opinions rather than journalistic reporting of news and events. For example, a [[NewsArticle]] consisting of a column or [[Blog]]/[[BlogPosting]] entry in the Opinions section of a news publication.

inputs.name: numberOfAccommodationUnits
inputs.label: numberOfAccommodationUnits
inputs.help: Indicates the total (available plus unavailable) number of accommodation units in an [[ApartmentComplex]], or the number of accommodation units for a specific [[FloorPlan]] (within its specific [[ApartmentComplex]]). See also [[numberOfAvailableAccommodationUnits]].

inputs.name: numberOfAvailableAccommodationUnits
inputs.label: numberOfAvailableAccommodationUnits
inputs.help: Indicates the number of available accommodation units in an [[ApartmentComplex]], or the number of accommodation units for a specific [[FloorPlan]] (within its specific [[ApartmentComplex]]). See also [[numberOfAccommodationUnits]].

inputs.name: numberOfBedrooms
inputs.label: numberOfBedrooms
inputs.help: The total integer number of bedrooms in a some [[Accommodation]], [[ApartmentComplex]] or [[FloorPlan]].

inputs.name: petsAllowed
inputs.label: petsAllowed
inputs.help: Indicates whether pets are allowed to enter the accommodation or lodging business. More detailed information can be put in a text value.

inputs.name: tourBookingPage
inputs.label: tourBookingPage
inputs.help: A page providing information on how to book a tour of some [[Place]], such as an [[Accommodation]] or [[ApartmentComplex]] in a real estate setting, as well as other kinds of tours as appropriate.

MenuItem.name: MenuItem
MenuItem.help: A food or drink item listed in a menu or menu section.

inputs.name: menuAddOn
inputs.label: menuAddOn
inputs.help: Additional menu item(s) such as a side dish of salad or side order of fries that can be added to this menu item. Additionally it can be a menu section containing allowed add-on menu items for this menu item.

inputs.name: nutrition
inputs.label: nutrition
inputs.help: Nutrition information about the recipe or menu item.

inputs.name: offers
inputs.label: offers
inputs.help: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

inputs.name: suitableForDiet
inputs.label: suitableForDiet
inputs.help: Indicates a dietary restriction or guideline for which this recipe or menu item is suitable, e.g. diabetic, halal etc.

inputs.name: alumni
inputs.label: alumni
inputs.help: Alumni of an organization.

Claim.name: Claim
Claim.help:
A [[Claim]] in Schema.org represents a specific, factually-oriented claim that could be the [[itemReviewed]] in a [[ClaimReview]]. The content of a claim can be summarized with the [[text]] property. Variations on well known claims can have their common identity indicated via [[sameAs]] links, and summarized with a [[name]]. Ideally, a [[Claim]] description includes enough contextual information to minimize the risk of ambiguity or inclarity. In practice, many claims are better understood in the context in which they appear or the interpretations provided by claim reviews.

  Beyond [[ClaimReview]], the Claim type can be associated with related creative works - for example a [[ScholarlyArticle]] or [[Question]] might be [[about]] some [[Claim]].

  At this time, Schema.org does not define any types of relationship between claims. This is a natural area for future exploration.

inputs.name: appearance
inputs.label: appearance
inputs.help: Indicates an occurrence of a [[Claim]] in some [[CreativeWork]].

inputs.name: claimInterpreter
inputs.label: claimInterpreter
inputs.help:
For a [[Claim]] interpreted from [[MediaObject]] content
    sed to indicate a claim contained, implied or refined from the content of a [[MediaObject]].

inputs.name: firstAppearance
inputs.label: firstAppearance
inputs.help: Indicates the first known occurrence of a [[Claim]] in some [[CreativeWork]].

AnatomicalSystem.name: AnatomicalSystem
AnatomicalSystem.help: An anatomical system is a group of anatomical structures that work together to perform a certain task. Anatomical systems, such as organ systems, are one organizing principle of anatomy, and can include circulatory, digestive, endocrine, integumentary, immune, lymphatic, muscular, nervous, reproductive, respiratory, skeletal, urinary, vestibular, and other systems.

inputs.name: associatedPathophysiology
inputs.label: associatedPathophysiology
inputs.help: If applicable, a description of the pathophysiology associated with the anatomical system, including potential abnormal changes in the mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions of the system.

inputs.name: comprisedOf
inputs.label: comprisedOf
inputs.help: Specifying something physically contained by something else. Typically used here for the underlying anatomical structures, such as organs, that comprise the anatomical system.

inputs.name: relatedCondition
inputs.label: relatedCondition
inputs.help: A medical condition associated with this anatomy.

inputs.name: relatedStructure
inputs.label: relatedStructure
inputs.help: Related anatomical structure(s) that are not part of the system but relate or connect to it, such as vascular bundles associated with an organ system.

inputs.name: relatedTherapy
inputs.label: relatedTherapy
inputs.help: A medical therapy related to this anatomy.

Diet.name: Diet
Diet.help: A strategy of regulating the intake of food to achieve or maintain a specific health-related goal.

inputs.name: dietFeatures
inputs.label: dietFeatures
inputs.help: Nutritional information specific to the dietary plan. May include dietary recommendations on what foods to avoid, what foods to consume, and specific alterations/deviations from the USDA or other regulatory body's approved dietary guidelines.

inputs.name: endorsers
inputs.label: endorsers
inputs.help: People or organizations that endorse the plan.

inputs.name: expertConsiderations
inputs.label: expertConsiderations
inputs.help: Medical expert advice related to the plan.

inputs.name: physiologicalBenefits
inputs.label: physiologicalBenefits
inputs.help: Specific physiologic benefits associated to the plan.

inputs.name: risks
inputs.label: risks
inputs.help: Specific physiologic risks associated to the diet plan.

Residence.name: Residence
Residence.help: The place where a person lives.

inputs.name: accommodationFloorPlan
inputs.label: accommodationFloorPlan
inputs.help: A floorplan of some [[Accommodation]].

VitalSign.name: VitalSign
VitalSign.help: Vital signs are measures of various physiological functions in order to assess the most basic body functions.

Intangible.name: Intangible
Intangible.help: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things such as quantities, structured values, etc.

AddAction.name: AddAction
AddAction.help: The act of editing by adding an object to a collection.

ProductModel.name: ProductModel
ProductModel.help: A datasheet or vendor specification of a product (in the sense of a prototypical description).

inputs.name: isVariantOf
inputs.label: isVariantOf
inputs.help: Indicates the kind of product that this is a variant of. In the case of [[ProductModel]], this is a pointer (from a ProductModel) to a base product from which this product is a variant. It is safe to infer that the variant inherits all product features from the base model, unless defined locally. This is not transitive. In the case of a [[ProductGroup]], the group description also serves as a template, representing a set of Products that vary on explicitly defined, specific dimensions only (so it defines both a set of variants, as well as which values distinguish amongst those variants). When used with [[ProductGroup]], this property can apply to any [[Product]] included in the group.

inputs.name: predecessorOf
inputs.label: predecessorOf
inputs.help: A pointer from a previous, often discontinued variant of the product to its newer variant.

inputs.name: successorOf
inputs.label: successorOf
inputs.help: A pointer from a newer variant of a product  to its previous, often discontinued predecessor.

PresentationDigitalDocument.name: PresentationDigitalDocument
PresentationDigitalDocument.help: A file containing slides or used for a presentation.

inputs.name: foodEstablishment
inputs.label: foodEstablishment
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The specific food establishment where the action occurred.

inputs.name: foodEvent
inputs.label: foodEvent
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The specific food event where the action occurred.

inputs.name: recipe
inputs.label: recipe
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. The recipe/instructions used to perform the action.

CommentAction.name: CommentAction
CommentAction.help: The act of generating a comment about a subject.

inputs.name: resultComment
inputs.label: resultComment
inputs.help: A sub property of result. The Comment created or sent as a result of this action.

LegalService.name: LegalService
LegalService.help: A LegalService is a business that provides legally-oriented services, advice and representation, e.g. law firms.\n\nAs a [[LocalBusiness]] it can be described as a [[provider]] of one or more [[Service]]\(s).

BackgroundNewsArticle.name: BackgroundNewsArticle
BackgroundNewsArticle.help: A [[NewsArticle]] providing historical context, definition and detail on a specific topic (aka "explainer" or "backgrounder"). For example, an in-depth article or frequently-asked-questions ([FAQ](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FAQ)) document on topics such as Climate Change or the European Union. Other kinds of background material from a non-news setting are often described using [[Book]] or [[Article]], in particular [[ScholarlyArticle]]. See also [[NewsArticle]] for related vocabulary from a learning/education perspective.

Syllabus.name: Syllabus
Syllabus.help: A syllabus that describes the material covered in a course, often with several such sections per [[Course]] so that a distinct [[timeRequired]] can be provided for that section of the [[Course]].

ApplyAction.name: ApplyAction
ApplyAction.help:
The act of registering to an organization/service without the guarantee to receive it.

Related actions:

* [[RegisterAction]]: Unlike RegisterAction, ApplyAction has no guarantees that the application will be accepted.

inputs.name: applicationCategory
inputs.label: applicationCategory
inputs.help: Type of software application, e.g. 'Game, Multimedia'.

inputs.name: applicationSubCategory
inputs.label: applicationSubCategory
inputs.help: Subcategory of the application, e.g. 'Arcade Game'.

inputs.name: applicationSuite
inputs.label: applicationSuite
inputs.help: The name of the application suite to which the application belongs (e.g. Excel belongs to Office).

inputs.name: availableOnDevice
inputs.label: availableOnDevice
inputs.help: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

inputs.name: countriesNotSupported
inputs.label: countriesNotSupported
inputs.help: Countries for which the application is not supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

inputs.name: countriesSupported
inputs.label: countriesSupported
inputs.help: Countries for which the application is supported. You can also provide the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

inputs.name: device
inputs.label: device
inputs.help: Device required to run the application. Used in cases where a specific make/model is required to run the application.

inputs.name: downloadUrl
inputs.label: downloadUrl
inputs.help: If the file can be downloaded, URL to download the binary.

inputs.name: featureList
inputs.label: featureList
inputs.help: Features or modules provided by this application (and possibly required by other applications).

inputs.name: fileSize
inputs.label: fileSize
inputs.help: Size of the application / package (e.g. 18MB). In the absence of a unit (MB, KB etc.), KB will be assumed.

inputs.name: installUrl
inputs.label: installUrl
inputs.help: URL at which the app may be installed, if different from the URL of the item.

inputs.name: memoryRequirements
inputs.label: memoryRequirements
inputs.help: Minimum memory requirements.

inputs.name: operatingSystem
inputs.label: operatingSystem
inputs.help: Operating systems supported (Windows 7, OS X 10.6, Android 1.6).

inputs.name: permissions
inputs.label: permissions
inputs.help: Permission(s) required to run the app (for example, a mobile app may require full internet access or may run only on wifi).

inputs.name: processorRequirements
inputs.label: processorRequirements
inputs.help: Processor architecture required to run the application (e.g. IA64).

inputs.name: releaseNotes
inputs.label: releaseNotes
inputs.help: Description of what changed in this version.

inputs.name: requirements
inputs.label: requirements
inputs.help: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

inputs.name: screenshot
inputs.label: screenshot
inputs.help: A link to a screenshot image of the app.

inputs.name: softwareAddOn
inputs.label: softwareAddOn
inputs.help: Additional content for a software application.

inputs.name: softwareHelp
inputs.label: softwareHelp
inputs.help: Software application help.

inputs.name: softwareRequirements
inputs.label: softwareRequirements
inputs.help: Component dependency requirements for application. This includes runtime environments and shared libraries that are not included in the application distribution package, but required to run the application (examples: DirectX, Java or .NET runtime).

inputs.name: softwareVersion
inputs.label: softwareVersion
inputs.help: Version of the software instance.

inputs.name: storageRequirements
inputs.label: storageRequirements
inputs.help: Storage requirements (free space required).

inputs.name: supportingData
inputs.label: supportingData
inputs.help: Supporting data for a SoftwareApplication.

Quiz.name: Quiz
Quiz.help: Quiz: A test of knowledge, skills and abilities.

Person.name: Person
Person.help: A person (alive, dead, undead, or fictional).

inputs.name: additionalName
inputs.label: additionalName
inputs.help: An additional name for a Person, can be used for a middle name.

inputs.name: address
inputs.label: address
inputs.help: Physical address of the item.

inputs.name: affiliation
inputs.label: affiliation
inputs.help: An organization that this person is affiliated with. For example, a school/university, a club, or a team.

inputs.name: agentInteractionStatistic
inputs.label: agentInteractionStatistic
inputs.help: The number of completed interactions for this entity, in a particular role (the 'agent'), in a particular action (indicated in the statistic), and in a particular context (i.e. interactionService).

inputs.name: alumniOf
inputs.label: alumniOf
inputs.help: An organization that the person is an alumni of.

inputs.name: award
inputs.label: award
inputs.help: An award won by or for this item.

inputs.name: awards
inputs.label: awards
inputs.help: Awards won by or for this item.

inputs.name: birthDate
inputs.label: birthDate
inputs.help: Date of birth.

inputs.name: birthPlace
inputs.label: birthPlace
inputs.help: The place where the person was born.

inputs.name: brand
inputs.label: brand
inputs.help: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

inputs.name: callSign
inputs.label: callSign
inputs.help: A [callsign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Call_sign), as used in broadcasting and radio communications to identify people, radio and TV stations, or vehicles.

inputs.name: children
inputs.label: children
inputs.help: A child of the person.

inputs.name: colleague
inputs.label: colleague
inputs.help: A colleague of the person.

inputs.name: colleagues
inputs.label: colleagues
inputs.help: A colleague of the person.

inputs.name: contactPoint
inputs.label: contactPoint
inputs.help: A contact point for a person or organization.

inputs.name: contactPoints
inputs.label: contactPoints
inputs.help: A contact point for a person or organization.

inputs.name: deathDate
inputs.label: deathDate
inputs.help: Date of death.

inputs.name: deathPlace
inputs.label: deathPlace
inputs.help: The place where the person died.

inputs.name: duns
inputs.label: duns
inputs.help: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

inputs.name: email
inputs.label: email
inputs.help: Email address.

inputs.name: familyName
inputs.label: familyName
inputs.help: Family name. In the U.S., the last name of a Person.

inputs.name: faxNumber
inputs.label: faxNumber
inputs.help: The fax number.

inputs.name: follows
inputs.label: follows
inputs.help: The most generic uni-directional social relation.

inputs.name: funder
inputs.label: funder
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

inputs.name: funding
inputs.label: funding
inputs.help: A [[Grant]] that directly or indirectly provide funding or sponsorship for this item. See also [[ownershipFundingInfo]].

inputs.name: gender
inputs.label: gender
inputs.help: Gender of something, typically a [[Person]], but possibly also fictional characters, animals, etc. While http://schema.org/Male and http://schema.org/Female may be used, text strings are also acceptable for people who do not identify as a binary gender. The [[gender]] property can also be used in an extended sense to cover e.g. the gender of sports teams. As with the gender of individuals, we do not try to enumerate all possibilities. A mixed-gender [[SportsTeam]] can be indicated with a text value of "Mixed".

inputs.name: givenName
inputs.label: givenName
inputs.help: Given name. In the U.S., the first name of a Person.

inputs.name: globalLocationNumber
inputs.label: globalLocationNumber
inputs.help: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

inputs.name: hasCertification
inputs.label: hasCertification
inputs.help: Certification information about a product, organization, service, place, or person.

inputs.name: hasCredential
inputs.label: hasCredential
inputs.help: A credential awarded to the Person or Organization.

inputs.name: hasOccupation
inputs.label: hasOccupation
inputs.help: The Person's occupation. For past professions, use Role for expressing dates.

inputs.name: hasOfferCatalog
inputs.label: hasOfferCatalog
inputs.help: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

inputs.name: hasPOS
inputs.label: hasPOS
inputs.help: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

inputs.name: height
inputs.label: height
inputs.help: The height of the item.

inputs.name: homeLocation
inputs.label: homeLocation
inputs.help: A contact location for a person's residence.

inputs.name: honorificPrefix
inputs.label: honorificPrefix
inputs.help: An honorific prefix preceding a Person's name such as Dr/Mrs/Mr.

inputs.name: honorificSuffix
inputs.label: honorificSuffix
inputs.help: An honorific suffix following a Person's name such as M.D./PhD/MSCSW.

inputs.name: interactionStatistic
inputs.label: interactionStatistic
inputs.help: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

inputs.name: isicV4
inputs.label: isicV4
inputs.help: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

inputs.name: jobTitle
inputs.label: jobTitle
inputs.help: The job title of the person (for example, Financial Manager).

inputs.name: knows
inputs.label: knows
inputs.help: The most generic bi-directional social/work relation.

inputs.name: knowsAbout
inputs.label: knowsAbout
inputs.help: Of a [[Person]], and less typically of an [[Organization]], to indicate a topic that is known about - suggesting possible expertise but not implying it. We do not distinguish skill levels here, or relate this to educational content, events, objectives or [[JobPosting]] descriptions.

inputs.name: knowsLanguage
inputs.label: knowsLanguage
inputs.help: Of a [[Person]], and less typically of an [[Organization]], to indicate a known language. We do not distinguish skill levels or reading/writing/speaking/signing here. Use language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).

inputs.name: makesOffer
inputs.label: makesOffer
inputs.help: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person.

inputs.name: memberOf
inputs.label: memberOf
inputs.help: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs.

inputs.name: naics
inputs.label: naics
inputs.help: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

inputs.name: nationality
inputs.label: nationality
inputs.help: Nationality of the person.

inputs.name: netWorth
inputs.label: netWorth
inputs.help: The total financial value of the person as calculated by subtracting assets from liabilities.

inputs.name: owns
inputs.label: owns
inputs.help: Products owned by the organization or person.

inputs.name: parent
inputs.label: parent
inputs.help: A parent of this person.

inputs.name: parents
inputs.label: parents
inputs.help: A parents of the person.

inputs.name: performerIn
inputs.label: performerIn
inputs.help: Event that this person is a performer or participant in.

inputs.name: publishingPrinciples
inputs.label: publishingPrinciples
inputs.help:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual, e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

inputs.name: relatedTo
inputs.label: relatedTo
inputs.help: The most generic familial relation.

inputs.name: seeks
inputs.label: seeks
inputs.help: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

inputs.name: sibling
inputs.label: sibling
inputs.help: A sibling of the person.

inputs.name: siblings
inputs.label: siblings
inputs.help: A sibling of the person.

inputs.name: sponsor
inputs.label: sponsor
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. E.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

inputs.name: spouse
inputs.label: spouse
inputs.help: The person's spouse.

inputs.name: taxID
inputs.label: taxID
inputs.help: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

inputs.name: telephone
inputs.label: telephone
inputs.help: The telephone number.

inputs.name: vatID
inputs.label: vatID
inputs.help: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

inputs.name: weight
inputs.label: weight
inputs.help: The weight of the product or person.

inputs.name: workLocation
inputs.label: workLocation
inputs.help: A contact location for a person's place of work.

inputs.name: worksFor
inputs.label: worksFor
inputs.help: Organizations that the person works for.

SportsActivityLocation.name: SportsActivityLocation
SportsActivityLocation.help: A sports location, such as a playing field.

ReportedDoseSchedule.name: ReportedDoseSchedule
ReportedDoseSchedule.help: A patient-reported or observed dosing schedule for a drug or supplement.

Vessel.name: Vessel
Vessel.help: A component of the human body circulatory system comprised of an intricate network of hollow tubes that transport blood throughout the entire body.

RecommendedDoseSchedule.name: RecommendedDoseSchedule
RecommendedDoseSchedule.help: A recommended dosing schedule for a drug or supplement as prescribed or recommended by an authority or by the drug/supplement's manufacturer. Capture the recommending authority in the recognizingAuthority property of MedicalEntity.

inputs.name: calories
inputs.label: calories
inputs.help: The number of calories.

inputs.name: carbohydrateContent
inputs.label: carbohydrateContent
inputs.help: The number of grams of carbohydrates.

inputs.name: cholesterolContent
inputs.label: cholesterolContent
inputs.help: The number of milligrams of cholesterol.

inputs.name: fatContent
inputs.label: fatContent
inputs.help: The number of grams of fat.

inputs.name: fiberContent
inputs.label: fiberContent
inputs.help: The number of grams of fiber.

inputs.name: proteinContent
inputs.label: proteinContent
inputs.help: The number of grams of protein.

inputs.name: saturatedFatContent
inputs.label: saturatedFatContent
inputs.help: The number of grams of saturated fat.

inputs.name: servingSize
inputs.label: servingSize
inputs.help: The serving size, in terms of the number of volume or mass.

inputs.name: sodiumContent
inputs.label: sodiumContent
inputs.help: The number of milligrams of sodium.

inputs.name: sugarContent
inputs.label: sugarContent
inputs.help: The number of grams of sugar.

inputs.name: transFatContent
inputs.label: transFatContent
inputs.help: The number of grams of trans fat.

inputs.name: unsaturatedFatContent
inputs.label: unsaturatedFatContent
inputs.help: The number of grams of unsaturated fat.

MaximumDoseSchedule.name: MaximumDoseSchedule
MaximumDoseSchedule.help: The maximum dosing schedule considered safe for a drug or supplement as recommended by an authority or by the drug/supplement's manufacturer. Capture the recommending authority in the recognizingAuthority property of MedicalEntity.

DataFeedItem.name: DataFeedItem
DataFeedItem.help: A single item within a larger data feed.

inputs.name: dateCreated
inputs.label: dateCreated
inputs.help: The date on which the CreativeWork was created or the item was added to a DataFeed.

inputs.name: dateDeleted
inputs.label: dateDeleted
inputs.help: The datetime the item was removed from the DataFeed.

inputs.name: dateModified
inputs.label: dateModified
inputs.help: The date on which the CreativeWork was most recently modified or when the item's entry was modified within a DataFeed.

inputs.name: item
inputs.label: item
inputs.help: An entity represented by an entry in a list or data feed (e.g. an 'artist' in a list of 'artists').

PhysicalExam.name: PhysicalExam
PhysicalExam.help: A type of physical examination of a patient performed by a physician.

ReceiveAction.name: ReceiveAction
ReceiveAction.help:
The act of physically/electronically taking delivery of an object that has been transferred from an origin to a destination. Reciprocal of SendAction.

Related actions:

* [[SendAction]]: The reciprocal of ReceiveAction.
* [[TakeAction]]: Unlike TakeAction, ReceiveAction does not imply that the ownership has been transferred (e.g. I can receive a package, but it does not mean the package is now mine).

inputs.name: deliveryMethod
inputs.label: deliveryMethod
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. The method of delivery.

inputs.name: sender
inputs.label: sender
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the sending end of the action.

CDCPMDRecord.name: CDCPMDRecord
CDCPMDRecord.help:
A CDCPMDRecord is a data structure representing a record in a CDC tabular data format
      used for hospital data reporting. See [documentation](/docs/cdc-covid.html) for details, and the linked CDC materials for authoritative
      definitions used as the source here.

inputs.name: cvdCollectionDate
inputs.label: cvdCollectionDate
inputs.help: collectiondate - Date for which patient counts are reported.

inputs.name: cvdFacilityCounty
inputs.label: cvdFacilityCounty
inputs.help: Name of the County of the NHSN facility that this data record applies to. Use [[cvdFacilityId]] to identify the facility. To provide other details, [[healthcareReportingData]] can be used on a [[Hospital]] entry.

inputs.name: cvdFacilityId
inputs.label: cvdFacilityId
inputs.help: Identifier of the NHSN facility that this data record applies to. Use [[cvdFacilityCounty]] to indicate the county. To provide other details, [[healthcareReportingData]] can be used on a [[Hospital]] entry.

inputs.name: cvdNumBeds
inputs.label: cvdNumBeds
inputs.help: numbeds - HOSPITAL INPATIENT BEDS: Inpatient beds, including all staffed, licensed, and overflow (surge) beds used for inpatients.

inputs.name: cvdNumBedsOcc
inputs.label: cvdNumBedsOcc
inputs.help: numbedsocc - HOSPITAL INPATIENT BED OCCUPANCY: Total number of staffed inpatient beds that are occupied.

inputs.name: cvdNumC19Died
inputs.label: cvdNumC19Died
inputs.help: numc19died - DEATHS: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who died in the hospital, ED, or any overflow location.

inputs.name: cvdNumC19HOPats
inputs.label: cvdNumC19HOPats
inputs.help: numc19hopats - HOSPITAL ONSET: Patients hospitalized in an NHSN inpatient care location with onset of suspected or confirmed COVID-19 14 or more days after hospitalization.

inputs.name: cvdNumC19HospPats
inputs.label: cvdNumC19HospPats
inputs.help: numc19hosppats - HOSPITALIZED: Patients currently hospitalized in an inpatient care location who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19.

inputs.name: cvdNumC19MechVentPats
inputs.label: cvdNumC19MechVentPats
inputs.help: numc19mechventpats - HOSPITALIZED and VENTILATED: Patients hospitalized in an NHSN inpatient care location who have suspected or confirmed COVID-19 and are on a mechanical ventilator.

inputs.name: cvdNumC19OFMechVentPats
inputs.label: cvdNumC19OFMechVentPats
inputs.help: numc19ofmechventpats - ED/OVERFLOW and VENTILATED: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who are in the ED or any overflow location awaiting an inpatient bed and on a mechanical ventilator.

inputs.name: cvdNumC19OverflowPats
inputs.label: cvdNumC19OverflowPats
inputs.help: numc19overflowpats - ED/OVERFLOW: Patients with suspected or confirmed COVID-19 who are in the ED or any overflow location awaiting an inpatient bed.

inputs.name: cvdNumICUBeds
inputs.label: cvdNumICUBeds
inputs.help: numicubeds - ICU BEDS: Total number of staffed inpatient intensive care unit (ICU) beds.

inputs.name: cvdNumICUBedsOcc
inputs.label: cvdNumICUBedsOcc
inputs.help: numicubedsocc - ICU BED OCCUPANCY: Total number of staffed inpatient ICU beds that are occupied.

inputs.name: cvdNumTotBeds
inputs.label: cvdNumTotBeds
inputs.help: numtotbeds - ALL HOSPITAL BEDS: Total number of all inpatient and outpatient beds, including all staffed, ICU, licensed, and overflow (surge) beds used for inpatients or outpatients.

inputs.name: cvdNumVent
inputs.label: cvdNumVent
inputs.help: numvent - MECHANICAL VENTILATORS: Total number of ventilators available.

inputs.name: cvdNumVentUse
inputs.label: cvdNumVentUse
inputs.help: numventuse - MECHANICAL VENTILATORS IN USE: Total number of ventilators in use.

inputs.name: datePosted
inputs.label: datePosted
inputs.help: Publication date of an online listing.

PhysicalActivityCategory.name: PhysicalActivityCategory
PhysicalActivityCategory.help: Categories of physical activity, organized by physiologic classification.

GovernmentService.name: GovernmentService
GovernmentService.help: A service provided by a government organization, e.g. food stamps, veterans benefits, etc.

inputs.name: jurisdiction
inputs.label: jurisdiction
inputs.help: Indicates a legal jurisdiction, e.g. of some legislation, or where some government service is based.

inputs.name: serviceOperator
inputs.label: serviceOperator
inputs.help: The operating organization, if different from the provider.  This enables the representation of services that are provided by an organization, but operated by another organization like a subcontractor.

MedicalOrganization.name: MedicalOrganization
MedicalOrganization.help: A medical organization (physical or not), such as hospital, institution or clinic.

inputs.name: healthPlanNetworkId
inputs.label: healthPlanNetworkId
inputs.help: Name or unique ID of network. (Networks are often reused across different insurance plans.)

inputs.name: isAcceptingNewPatients
inputs.label: isAcceptingNewPatients
inputs.help: Whether the provider is accepting new patients.

inputs.name: medicalSpecialty
inputs.label: medicalSpecialty
inputs.help: A medical specialty of the provider.

PhysicalActivity.name: PhysicalActivity
PhysicalActivity.help: Any bodily activity that enhances or maintains physical fitness and overall health and wellness. Includes activity that is part of daily living and routine, structured exercise, and exercise prescribed as part of a medical treatment or recovery plan.

inputs.name: associatedAnatomy
inputs.label: associatedAnatomy
inputs.help: The anatomy of the underlying organ system or structures associated with this entity.

inputs.name: category
inputs.label: category
inputs.help: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

inputs.name: epidemiology
inputs.label: epidemiology
inputs.help: The characteristics of associated patients, such as age, gender, race etc.

inputs.name: pathophysiology
inputs.label: pathophysiology
inputs.help: Changes in the normal mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions that are associated with this activity or condition.

Series.name: Series
Series.help: A Series in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. See also [[CreativeWorkSeries]], [[EventSeries]].

ImageGallery.name: ImageGallery
ImageGallery.help: Web page type: Image gallery page.

DrawAction.name: DrawAction
DrawAction.help: The act of producing a visual/graphical representation of an object, typically with a pen/pencil and paper as instruments.

MedicalContraindication.name: MedicalContraindication
MedicalContraindication.help: A condition or factor that serves as a reason to withhold a certain medical therapy. Contraindications can be absolute (there are no reasonable circumstances for undertaking a course of action) or relative (the patient is at higher risk of complications, but these risks may be outweighed by other considerations or mitigated by other measures).

Quotation.name: Quotation
Quotation.help: A quotation. Often but not necessarily from some written work, attributable to a real world author and - if associated with a fictional character - to any fictional Person. Use [[isBasedOn]] to link to source/origin. The [[recordedIn]] property can be used to reference a Quotation from an [[Event]].

inputs.name: spokenByCharacter
inputs.label: spokenByCharacter
inputs.help: The (e.g. fictional) character, Person or Organization to whom the quotation is attributed within the containing CreativeWork.

PropertyValue.name: PropertyValue
PropertyValue.help: A property-value pair, e.g. representing a feature of a product or place. Use the 'name' property for the name of the property. If there is an additional human-readable version of the value, put that into the 'description' property.\n\n Always use specific schema.org properties when a) they exist and b) you can populate them. Using PropertyValue as a substitute will typically not trigger the same effect as using the original, specific property.

inputs.name: maxValue
inputs.label: maxValue
inputs.help: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

inputs.name: measurementMethod
inputs.label: measurementMethod
inputs.help: A subproperty of [[measurementTechnique]] that can be used for specifying specific methods, in particular via [[MeasurementMethodEnum]].

inputs.name: measurementTechnique
inputs.label: measurementTechnique
inputs.help:
A technique, method or technology used in an [[Observation]], [[StatisticalVariable]] or [[Dataset]] (or [[DataDownload]], [[DataCatalog]]), corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (for datasets, described using [[variableMeasured]]; for [[Observation]], a [[StatisticalVariable]]). Often but not necessarily each [[variableMeasured]] will have an explicit representation as (or mapping to) an property such as those defined in Schema.org, or other RDF vocabularies and "knowledge graphs". In that case the subproperty of [[variableMeasured]] called [[measuredProperty]] is applicable.
    
The [[measurementTechnique]] property helps when extra clarification is needed about how a [[measuredProperty]] was measured. This is oriented towards scientific and scholarly dataset publication but may have broader applicability; it is not intended as a full representation of measurement, but can often serve as a high level summary for dataset discovery. 

For example, if [[variableMeasured]] is: molecule concentration, [[measurementTechnique]] could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence". If the [[variableMeasured]] is "depression rating", the [[measurementTechnique]] could be "Zung Scale" or "HAM-D" or "Beck Depression Inventory". 

If there are several [[variableMeasured]] properties recorded for some given data object, use a [[PropertyValue]] for each [[variableMeasured]] and attach the corresponding [[measurementTechnique]]. The value can also be from an enumeration, organized as a [[MeasurementMetholdEnumeration]].

inputs.name: minValue
inputs.label: minValue
inputs.help: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

inputs.name: propertyID
inputs.label: propertyID
inputs.help:
A commonly used identifier for the characteristic represented by the property, e.g. a manufacturer or a standard code for a property. propertyID can be
(1) a prefixed string, mainly meant to be used with standards for product properties; (2) a site-specific, non-prefixed string (e.g. the primary key of the property or the vendor-specific ID of the property), or (3)
a URL indicating the type of the property, either pointing to an external vocabulary, or a Web resource that describes the property (e.g. a glossary entry).
Standards bodies should promote a standard prefix for the identifiers of properties from their standards.

inputs.name: unitCode
inputs.label: unitCode
inputs.help: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

inputs.name: unitText
inputs.label: unitText
inputs.help: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

inputs.name: value
inputs.label: value
inputs.help:
The value of a [[QuantitativeValue]] (including [[Observation]]) or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

inputs.name: valueReference
inputs.label: valueReference
inputs.help: A secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature or a type of measurement.

RadioBroadcastService.name: RadioBroadcastService
RadioBroadcastService.help: A delivery service through which radio content is provided via broadcast over the air or online.

CommunicateAction.name: CommunicateAction
CommunicateAction.help: The act of conveying information to another person via a communication medium (instrument) such as speech, email, or telephone conversation.

inputs.name: about
inputs.label: about
inputs.help: The subject matter of the content.

inputs.name: inLanguage
inputs.label: inLanguage
inputs.help: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

inputs.name: language
inputs.label: language
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. The language used on this action.

inputs.name: recipient
inputs.label: recipient
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

EndorsementRating.name: EndorsementRating
EndorsementRating.help:
An EndorsementRating is a rating that expresses some level of endorsement, for example inclusion in a "critic's pick" blog, a
"Like" or "+1" on a social network. It can be considered the [[result]] of an [[EndorseAction]] in which the [[object]] of the action is rated positively by
some [[agent]]. As is common elsewhere in schema.org, it is sometimes more useful to describe the results of such an action without explicitly describing the [[Action]].

An [[EndorsementRating]] may be part of a numeric scale or organized system, but this is not required: having an explicit type for indicating a positive,
endorsement rating is particularly useful in the absence of numeric scales as it helps consumers understand that the rating is broadly positive.

AchieveAction.name: AchieveAction
AchieveAction.help: The act of accomplishing something via previous efforts. It is an instantaneous action rather than an ongoing process.

BoatReservation.name: BoatReservation
BoatReservation.help:
A reservation for boat travel.

Note: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

WarrantyPromise.name: WarrantyPromise
WarrantyPromise.help: A structured value representing the duration and scope of services that will be provided to a customer free of charge in case of a defect or malfunction of a product.

inputs.name: durationOfWarranty
inputs.label: durationOfWarranty
inputs.help: The duration of the warranty promise. Common unitCode values are ANN for year, MON for months, or DAY for days.

inputs.name: warrantyScope
inputs.label: warrantyScope
inputs.help: The scope of the warranty promise.

Protein.name: Protein
Protein.help: Protein is here used in its widest possible definition, as classes of amino acid based molecules. Amyloid-beta Protein in human (UniProt P05067), eukaryota (e.g. an OrthoDB group) or even a single molecule that one can point to are all of type :Protein. A protein can thus be a subclass of another protein, e.g. :Protein as a UniProt record can have multiple isoforms inside it which would also be :Protein. They can be imagined, synthetic, hypothetical or naturally occurring.

inputs.name: hasBioPolymerSequence
inputs.label: hasBioPolymerSequence
inputs.help: A symbolic representation of a BioChemEntity. For example, a nucleotide sequence of a Gene or an amino acid sequence of a Protein.

ResumeAction.name: ResumeAction
ResumeAction.help: The act of resuming a device or application which was formerly paused (e.g. resume music playback or resume a timer).

PreventionIndication.name: PreventionIndication
PreventionIndication.help: An indication for preventing an underlying condition, symptom, etc.

SeekToAction.name: SeekToAction
SeekToAction.help: This is the [[Action]] of navigating to a specific [[startOffset]] timestamp within a [[VideoObject]], typically represented with a URL template structure.

inputs.name: startOffset
inputs.label: startOffset
inputs.help: The start time of the clip expressed as the number of seconds from the beginning of the work.

ExerciseAction.name: ExerciseAction
ExerciseAction.help: The act of participating in exertive activity for the purposes of improving health and fitness.

inputs.name: course
inputs.label: course
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The course where this action was taken.

inputs.name: diet
inputs.label: diet
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. The diet used in this action.

inputs.name: distance
inputs.label: distance
inputs.help: The distance travelled, e.g. exercising or travelling.

inputs.name: exerciseCourse
inputs.label: exerciseCourse
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The course where this action was taken.

inputs.name: exercisePlan
inputs.label: exercisePlan
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. The exercise plan used on this action.

inputs.name: exerciseRelatedDiet
inputs.label: exerciseRelatedDiet
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. The diet used in this action.

inputs.name: exerciseType
inputs.label: exerciseType
inputs.help: Type(s) of exercise or activity, such as strength training, flexibility training, aerobics, cardiac rehabilitation, etc.

inputs.name: fromLocation
inputs.label: fromLocation
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The original location of the object or the agent before the action.

inputs.name: opponent
inputs.label: opponent
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The opponent on this action.

inputs.name: sportsActivityLocation
inputs.label: sportsActivityLocation
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The sports activity location where this action occurred.

inputs.name: sportsEvent
inputs.label: sportsEvent
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The sports event where this action occurred.

inputs.name: sportsTeam
inputs.label: sportsTeam
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The sports team that participated on this action.

inputs.name: toLocation
inputs.label: toLocation
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

Thesis.name: Thesis
Thesis.help: A thesis or dissertation document submitted in support of candidature for an academic degree or professional qualification.

inputs.name: inSupportOf
inputs.label: inSupportOf
inputs.help: Qualification, candidature, degree, application that Thesis supports.

SchoolDistrict.name: SchoolDistrict
SchoolDistrict.help: A School District is an administrative area for the administration of schools.

EmergencyService.name: EmergencyService
EmergencyService.help: An emergency service, such as a fire station or ER.

State.name: State
State.help: A state or province of a country.

MedicalScholarlyArticle.name: MedicalScholarlyArticle
MedicalScholarlyArticle.help: A scholarly article in the medical domain.

inputs.name: publicationType
inputs.label: publicationType
inputs.help: The type of the medical article, taken from the US NLM MeSH publication type catalog. See also [MeSH documentation](http://www.nlm.nih.gov/mesh/pubtypes.html).

inputs.name: feesAndCommissionsSpecification
inputs.label: feesAndCommissionsSpecification
inputs.help: Description of fees, commissions, and other terms applied either to a class of financial product, or by a financial service organization.

ConstraintNode.name: ConstraintNode
ConstraintNode.help:
The ConstraintNode type is provided to support usecases in which a node in a structured data graph is described with properties which appear to describe a single entity, but are being used in a situation where they serve a more abstract purpose. A [[ConstraintNode]] can be described using [[constraintProperty]] and [[numConstraints]]. These constraint properties can serve a 
    variety of purposes, and their values may sometimes be understood to indicate sets of possible values rather than single, exact and specific values.

inputs.name: constraintProperty
inputs.label: constraintProperty
inputs.help: Indicates a property used as a constraint. For example, in the definition of a [[StatisticalVariable]]. The value is a property, either from within Schema.org or from other compatible (e.g. RDF) systems such as DataCommons.org or Wikidata.org.

inputs.name: numConstraints
inputs.label: numConstraints
inputs.help: Indicates the number of constraints property values defined for a particular [[ConstraintNode]] such as [[StatisticalVariable]]. This helps applications understand if they have access to a sufficiently complete description of a [[StatisticalVariable]] or other construct that is defined using properties on template-style nodes.

LocationFeatureSpecification.name: LocationFeatureSpecification
LocationFeatureSpecification.help: Specifies a location feature by providing a structured value representing a feature of an accommodation as a property-value pair of varying degrees of formality.

inputs.name: hoursAvailable
inputs.label: hoursAvailable
inputs.help: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

inputs.name: validFrom
inputs.label: validFrom
inputs.help: The date when the item becomes valid.

inputs.name: validThrough
inputs.label: validThrough
inputs.help: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

CheckInAction.name: CheckInAction
CheckInAction.help:
The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their arrival by registering/confirming for a previously reserved service (e.g. flight check-in) or at a place (e.g. hotel), possibly resulting in a result (boarding pass, etc).

Related actions:

* [[CheckOutAction]]: The antonym of CheckInAction.
* [[ArriveAction]]: Unlike ArriveAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the start of a previously reserved service.
* [[ConfirmAction]]: Unlike ConfirmAction, CheckInAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the *start* of a previously reserved service rather than its validity/existence.

HealthPlanCostSharingSpecification.name: HealthPlanCostSharingSpecification
HealthPlanCostSharingSpecification.help: A description of costs to the patient under a given network or formulary.

inputs.name: healthPlanCoinsuranceOption
inputs.label: healthPlanCoinsuranceOption
inputs.help: Whether the coinsurance applies before or after deductible, etc. TODO: Is this a closed set?

inputs.name: healthPlanCoinsuranceRate
inputs.label: healthPlanCoinsuranceRate
inputs.help: The rate of coinsurance expressed as a number between 0.0 and 1.0.

inputs.name: healthPlanCopay
inputs.label: healthPlanCopay
inputs.help: The copay amount.

inputs.name: healthPlanCopayOption
inputs.label: healthPlanCopayOption
inputs.help: Whether the copay is before or after deductible, etc. TODO: Is this a closed set?

inputs.name: healthPlanPharmacyCategory
inputs.label: healthPlanPharmacyCategory
inputs.help: The category or type of pharmacy associated with this cost sharing.

MediaGallery.name: MediaGallery
MediaGallery.help: Web page type: Media gallery page. A mixed-media page that can contain media such as images, videos, and other multimedia.

ReservationPackage.name: ReservationPackage
ReservationPackage.help: A group of multiple reservations with common values for all sub-reservations.

inputs.name: subReservation
inputs.label: subReservation
inputs.help: The individual reservations included in the package. Typically a repeated property.

LodgingReservation.name: LodgingReservation
LodgingReservation.help: A reservation for lodging at a hotel, motel, inn, etc.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

inputs.name: checkinTime
inputs.label: checkinTime
inputs.help: The earliest someone may check into a lodging establishment.

inputs.name: checkoutTime
inputs.label: checkoutTime
inputs.help: The latest someone may check out of a lodging establishment.

inputs.name: lodgingUnitDescription
inputs.label: lodgingUnitDescription
inputs.help: A full description of the lodging unit.

inputs.name: lodgingUnitType
inputs.label: lodgingUnitType
inputs.help: Textual description of the unit type (including suite vs. room, size of bed, etc.).

inputs.name: numAdults
inputs.label: numAdults
inputs.help: The number of adults staying in the unit.

inputs.name: numChildren
inputs.label: numChildren
inputs.help: The number of children staying in the unit.

Attorney.name: Attorney
Attorney.help: Professional service: Attorney. \n\nThis type is deprecated - [[LegalService]] is more inclusive and less ambiguous.

TouristAttraction.name: TouristAttraction
TouristAttraction.help: A tourist attraction.  In principle any Thing can be a [[TouristAttraction]], from a [[Mountain]] and [[LandmarksOrHistoricalBuildings]] to a [[LocalBusiness]].  This Type can be used on its own to describe a general [[TouristAttraction]], or be used as an [[additionalType]] to add tourist attraction properties to any other type.  (See examples below)

inputs.name: availableLanguage
inputs.label: availableLanguage
inputs.help: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]].

inputs.name: touristType
inputs.label: touristType
inputs.help: Attraction suitable for type(s) of tourist. E.g. children, visitors from a particular country, etc.

ComicStory.name: ComicStory
ComicStory.help:
The term "story" is any indivisible, re-printable
    	unit of a comic, including the interior stories, covers, and backmatter. Most
    	comics have at least two stories: a cover (ComicCoverArt) and an interior story.

inputs.name: artist
inputs.label: artist
inputs.help:
The primary artist for a work
    	in a medium other than pencils or digital line art--for example, if the
    	primary artwork is done in watercolors or digital paints.

inputs.name: colorist
inputs.label: colorist
inputs.help: The individual who adds color to inked drawings.

inputs.name: inker
inputs.label: inker
inputs.help: The individual who traces over the pencil drawings in ink after pencils are complete.

inputs.name: letterer
inputs.label: letterer
inputs.help: The individual who adds lettering, including speech balloons and sound effects, to artwork.

inputs.name: penciler
inputs.label: penciler
inputs.help: The individual who draws the primary narrative artwork.

HomeAndConstructionBusiness.name: HomeAndConstructionBusiness
HomeAndConstructionBusiness.help:
A construction business.

A HomeAndConstructionBusiness is a [[LocalBusiness]] that provides services around homes and buildings.

As a [[LocalBusiness]] it can be described as a [[provider]] of one or more [[Service]]\(s).

TextDigitalDocument.name: TextDigitalDocument
TextDigitalDocument.help: A file composed primarily of text.

MedicalTrial.name: MedicalTrial
MedicalTrial.help: A medical trial is a type of medical study that uses a scientific process to compare the safety and efficacy of medical therapies or medical procedures. In general, medical trials are controlled and subjects are allocated at random to the different treatment and/or control groups.

inputs.name: trialDesign
inputs.label: trialDesign
inputs.help: Specifics about the trial design (enumerated).

PerformingGroup.name: PerformingGroup
PerformingGroup.help: A performance group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a circus.

Drug.name: Drug
Drug.help: A chemical or biologic substance, used as a medical therapy, that has a physiological effect on an organism. Here the term drug is used interchangeably with the term medicine although clinical knowledge makes a clear difference between them.

inputs.name: activeIngredient
inputs.label: activeIngredient
inputs.help: An active ingredient, typically chemical compounds and/or biologic substances.

inputs.name: administrationRoute
inputs.label: administrationRoute
inputs.help: A route by which this drug may be administered, e.g. 'oral'.

inputs.name: alcoholWarning
inputs.label: alcoholWarning
inputs.help: Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to consumption of alcohol while taking this drug.

inputs.name: availableStrength
inputs.label: availableStrength
inputs.help: An available dosage strength for the drug.

inputs.name: breastfeedingWarning
inputs.label: breastfeedingWarning
inputs.help: Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to this drug's use by breastfeeding mothers.

inputs.name: clincalPharmacology
inputs.label: clincalPharmacology
inputs.help: Description of the absorption and elimination of drugs, including their concentration (pharmacokinetics, pK) and biological effects (pharmacodynamics, pD).

inputs.name: clinicalPharmacology
inputs.label: clinicalPharmacology
inputs.help: Description of the absorption and elimination of drugs, including their concentration (pharmacokinetics, pK) and biological effects (pharmacodynamics, pD).

inputs.name: dosageForm
inputs.label: dosageForm
inputs.help: A dosage form in which this drug/supplement is available, e.g. 'tablet', 'suspension', 'injection'.

inputs.name: doseSchedule
inputs.label: doseSchedule
inputs.help: A dosing schedule for the drug for a given population, either observed, recommended, or maximum dose based on the type used.

inputs.name: drugClass
inputs.label: drugClass
inputs.help: The class of drug this belongs to (e.g., statins).

inputs.name: drugUnit
inputs.label: drugUnit
inputs.help: The unit in which the drug is measured, e.g. '5 mg tablet'.

inputs.name: foodWarning
inputs.label: foodWarning
inputs.help: Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to consumption of specific foods while taking this drug.

inputs.name: includedInHealthInsurancePlan
inputs.label: includedInHealthInsurancePlan
inputs.help: The insurance plans that cover this drug.

inputs.name: interactingDrug
inputs.label: interactingDrug
inputs.help: Another drug that is known to interact with this drug in a way that impacts the effect of this drug or causes a risk to the patient. Note: disease interactions are typically captured as contraindications.

inputs.name: isAvailableGenerically
inputs.label: isAvailableGenerically
inputs.help: True if the drug is available in a generic form (regardless of name).

inputs.name: isProprietary
inputs.label: isProprietary
inputs.help: True if this item's name is a proprietary/brand name (vs. generic name).

inputs.name: labelDetails
inputs.label: labelDetails
inputs.help: Link to the drug's label details.

inputs.name: legalStatus
inputs.label: legalStatus
inputs.help: The drug or supplement's legal status, including any controlled substance schedules that apply.

inputs.name: maximumIntake
inputs.label: maximumIntake
inputs.help: Recommended intake of this supplement for a given population as defined by a specific recommending authority.

inputs.name: mechanismOfAction
inputs.label: mechanismOfAction
inputs.help: The specific biochemical interaction through which this drug or supplement produces its pharmacological effect.

inputs.name: nonProprietaryName
inputs.label: nonProprietaryName
inputs.help: The generic name of this drug or supplement.

inputs.name: overdosage
inputs.label: overdosage
inputs.help: Any information related to overdose on a drug, including signs or symptoms, treatments, contact information for emergency response.

inputs.name: pregnancyCategory
inputs.label: pregnancyCategory
inputs.help: Pregnancy category of this drug.

inputs.name: pregnancyWarning
inputs.label: pregnancyWarning
inputs.help: Any precaution, guidance, contraindication, etc. related to this drug's use during pregnancy.

inputs.name: prescribingInfo
inputs.label: prescribingInfo
inputs.help: Link to prescribing information for the drug.

inputs.name: prescriptionStatus
inputs.label: prescriptionStatus
inputs.help: Indicates the status of drug prescription, e.g. local catalogs classifications or whether the drug is available by prescription or over-the-counter, etc.

inputs.name: proprietaryName
inputs.label: proprietaryName
inputs.help: Proprietary name given to the diet plan, typically by its originator or creator.

inputs.name: relatedDrug
inputs.label: relatedDrug
inputs.help: Any other drug related to this one, for example commonly-prescribed alternatives.

inputs.name: rxcui
inputs.label: rxcui
inputs.help: The RxCUI drug identifier from RXNORM.

inputs.name: warning
inputs.label: warning
inputs.help: Any FDA or other warnings about the drug (text or URL).

ComicCoverArt.name: ComicCoverArt
ComicCoverArt.help: The artwork on the cover of a comic.

ViewAction.name: ViewAction
ViewAction.help: The act of consuming static visual content.

SubscribeAction.name: SubscribeAction
SubscribeAction.help:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates pushed to.

Related actions:

* [[FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, SubscribeAction implies that the subscriber acts as a passive agent being constantly/actively pushed for updates.
* [[RegisterAction]]: Unlike RegisterAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
* [[JoinAction]]: Unlike JoinAction, SubscribeAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.

LocalBusiness.name: LocalBusiness
LocalBusiness.help: A particular physical business or branch of an organization. Examples of LocalBusiness include a restaurant, a particular branch of a restaurant chain, a branch of a bank, a medical practice, a club, a bowling alley, etc.

inputs.name: branchOf
inputs.label: branchOf
inputs.help: The larger organization that this local business is a branch of, if any. Not to be confused with (anatomical) [[branch]].

inputs.name: currenciesAccepted
inputs.label: currenciesAccepted
inputs.help: The currency accepted.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

inputs.name: openingHours
inputs.label: openingHours
inputs.help: The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'. * Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: ```Mo```, ```Tu```, ```We```, ```Th```, ```Fr```, ```Sa```, ```Su```. * Times are specified using 24:00 format.
