For example, 3pm is specified as ```15:00```, 10am as ```10:00```. * Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>. * If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.

inputs.name: paymentAccepted
inputs.label: paymentAccepted
inputs.help: Cash, Credit Card, Cryptocurrency, Local Exchange Tradings System, etc.

inputs.name: priceRange
inputs.label: priceRange
inputs.help: The price range of the business, for example ```$$$```.

CheckOutAction.name: CheckOutAction
CheckOutAction.help:
The act of an agent communicating (service provider, social media, etc) their departure of a previously reserved service (e.g. flight check-in) or place (e.g. hotel).

Related actions:

* [[CheckInAction]]: The antonym of CheckOutAction.
* [[DepartAction]]: Unlike DepartAction, CheckOutAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the end of a previously reserved service.
* [[CancelAction]]: Unlike CancelAction, CheckOutAction implies that the agent is informing/confirming the end of a previously reserved service.

LearningResource.name: LearningResource
LearningResource.help:
The LearningResource type can be used to indicate [[CreativeWork]]s (whether physical or digital) that have a particular and explicit orientation towards learning, education, skill acquisition, and other educational purposes.

[[LearningResource]] is expected to be used as an addition to a primary type such as [[Book]], [[VideoObject]], [[Product]] etc.

[[EducationEvent]] serves a similar purpose for event-like things (e.g. a [[Trip]]). A [[LearningResource]] may be created as a result of an [[EducationEvent]], for example by recording one.

inputs.name: assesses
inputs.label: assesses
inputs.help: The item being described is intended to assess the competency or learning outcome defined by the referenced term.

inputs.name: competencyRequired
inputs.label: competencyRequired
inputs.help: Knowledge, skill, ability or personal attribute that must be demonstrated by a person or other entity in order to do something such as earn an Educational Occupational Credential or understand a LearningResource.

inputs.name: educationalAlignment
inputs.label: educationalAlignment
inputs.help:
An alignment to an established educational framework.

This property should not be used where the nature of the alignment can be described using a simple property, for example to express that a resource [[teaches]] or [[assesses]] a competency.

inputs.name: educationalLevel
inputs.label: educationalLevel
inputs.help: The level in terms of progression through an educational or training context. Examples of educational levels include 'beginner', 'intermediate' or 'advanced', and formal sets of level indicators.

inputs.name: educationalUse
inputs.label: educationalUse
inputs.help: The purpose of a work in the context of education; for example, 'assignment', 'group work'.

inputs.name: learningResourceType
inputs.label: learningResourceType
inputs.help: The predominant type or kind characterizing the learning resource. For example, 'presentation', 'handout'.

inputs.name: teaches
inputs.label: teaches
inputs.help: The item being described is intended to help a person learn the competency or learning outcome defined by the referenced term.

OrganizeAction.name: OrganizeAction
OrganizeAction.help: The act of manipulating/administering/supervising/controlling one or more objects.

GiveAction.name: GiveAction
GiveAction.help:
The act of transferring ownership of an object to a destination. Reciprocal of TakeAction.

Related actions:

* [[TakeAction]]: Reciprocal of GiveAction.
* [[SendAction]]: Unlike SendAction, GiveAction implies that ownership is being transferred (e.g. I may send my laptop to you, but that doesn't mean I'm giving it to you).

inputs.name: recipient
inputs.label: recipient
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

GeoCircle.name: GeoCircle
GeoCircle.help:
A GeoCircle is a GeoShape representing a circular geographic area. As it is a GeoShape
          it provides the simple textual property 'circle', but also allows the combination of postalCode alongside geoRadius.
          The center of the circle can be indicated via the 'geoMidpoint' property, or more approximately using 'address', 'postalCode'.

inputs.name: geoMidpoint
inputs.label: geoMidpoint
inputs.help: Indicates the GeoCoordinates at the centre of a GeoShape, e.g. GeoCircle.

inputs.name: geoRadius
inputs.label: geoRadius
inputs.help: Indicates the approximate radius of a GeoCircle (metres unless indicated otherwise via Distance notation).

GovernmentPermit.name: GovernmentPermit
GovernmentPermit.help: A permit issued by a government agency.

EventSeries.name: EventSeries
EventSeries.help:
A series of [[Event]]s. Included events can relate with the series using the [[superEvent]] property.

An EventSeries is a collection of events that share some unifying characteristic. For example, "The Olympic Games" is a series, which
is repeated regularly. The "2012 London Olympics" can be presented both as an [[Event]] in the series "Olympic Games", and as an
[[EventSeries]] that included a number of sporting competitions as Events.

The nature of the association between the events in an [[EventSeries]] can vary, but typical examples could
include a thematic event series (e.g. topical meetups or classes), or a series of regular events that share a location, attendee group and/or organizers.

EventSeries has been defined as a kind of Event to make it easy for publishers to use it in an Event context without
worrying about which kinds of series are really event-like enough to call an Event. In general an EventSeries
may seem more Event-like when the period of time is compact and when aspects such as location are fixed, but
it may also sometimes prove useful to describe a longer-term series as an Event.

Organization.name: Organization
Organization.help: An organization such as a school, NGO, corporation, club, etc.

inputs.name: actionableFeedbackPolicy
inputs.label: actionableFeedbackPolicy
inputs.help: For a [[NewsMediaOrganization]] or other news-related [[Organization]], a statement about public engagement activities (for news media, the newsroom’s), including involving the public - digitally or otherwise -- in coverage decisions, reporting and activities after publication.

inputs.name: address
inputs.label: address
inputs.help: Physical address of the item.

inputs.name: agentInteractionStatistic
inputs.label: agentInteractionStatistic
inputs.help: The number of completed interactions for this entity, in a particular role (the 'agent'), in a particular action (indicated in the statistic), and in a particular context (i.e. interactionService).

inputs.name: aggregateRating
inputs.label: aggregateRating
inputs.help: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

inputs.name: alumni
inputs.label: alumni
inputs.help: Alumni of an organization.

inputs.name: areaServed
inputs.label: areaServed
inputs.help: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

inputs.name: award
inputs.label: award
inputs.help: An award won by or for this item.

inputs.name: awards
inputs.label: awards
inputs.help: Awards won by or for this item.

inputs.name: brand
inputs.label: brand
inputs.help: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

inputs.name: contactPoint
inputs.label: contactPoint
inputs.help: A contact point for a person or organization.

inputs.name: contactPoints
inputs.label: contactPoints
inputs.help: A contact point for a person or organization.

inputs.name: correctionsPolicy
inputs.label: correctionsPolicy
inputs.help: For an [[Organization]] (e.g. [[NewsMediaOrganization]]), a statement describing (in news media, the newsroom’s) disclosure and correction policy for errors.

inputs.name: department
inputs.label: department
inputs.help: A relationship between an organization and a department of that organization, also described as an organization (allowing different urls, logos, opening hours). For example: a store with a pharmacy, or a bakery with a cafe.

inputs.name: dissolutionDate
inputs.label: dissolutionDate
inputs.help: The date that this organization was dissolved.

inputs.name: diversityPolicy
inputs.label: diversityPolicy
inputs.help: Statement on diversity policy by an [[Organization]] e.g. a [[NewsMediaOrganization]]. For a [[NewsMediaOrganization]], a statement describing the newsroom’s diversity policy on both staffing and sources, typically providing staffing data.

inputs.name: diversityStaffingReport
inputs.label: diversityStaffingReport
inputs.help: For an [[Organization]] (often but not necessarily a [[NewsMediaOrganization]]), a report on staffing diversity issues. In a news context this might be for example ASNE or RTDNA (US) reports, or self-reported.

inputs.name: duns
inputs.label: duns
inputs.help: The Dun & Bradstreet DUNS number for identifying an organization or business person.

inputs.name: email
inputs.label: email
inputs.help: Email address.

inputs.name: employee
inputs.label: employee
inputs.help: Someone working for this organization.

inputs.name: employees
inputs.label: employees
inputs.help: People working for this organization.

inputs.name: ethicsPolicy
inputs.label: ethicsPolicy
inputs.help: Statement about ethics policy, e.g. of a [[NewsMediaOrganization]] regarding journalistic and publishing practices, or of a [[Restaurant]], a page describing food source policies. In the case of a [[NewsMediaOrganization]], an ethicsPolicy is typically a statement describing the personal, organizational, and corporate standards of behavior expected by the organization.

inputs.name: event
inputs.label: event
inputs.help: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

inputs.name: events
inputs.label: events
inputs.help: Upcoming or past events associated with this place or organization.

inputs.name: faxNumber
inputs.label: faxNumber
inputs.help: The fax number.

inputs.name: founder
inputs.label: founder
inputs.help: A person who founded this organization.

inputs.name: founders
inputs.label: founders
inputs.help: A person who founded this organization.

inputs.name: foundingDate
inputs.label: foundingDate
inputs.help: The date that this organization was founded.

inputs.name: foundingLocation
inputs.label: foundingLocation
inputs.help: The place where the Organization was founded.

inputs.name: funder
inputs.label: funder
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

inputs.name: funding
inputs.label: funding
inputs.help: A [[Grant]] that directly or indirectly provide funding or sponsorship for this item. See also [[ownershipFundingInfo]].

inputs.name: globalLocationNumber
inputs.label: globalLocationNumber
inputs.help: The [Global Location Number](http://www.gs1.org/gln) (GLN, sometimes also referred to as International Location Number or ILN) of the respective organization, person, or place. The GLN is a 13-digit number used to identify parties and physical locations.

inputs.name: hasCertification
inputs.label: hasCertification
inputs.help: Certification information about a product, organization, service, place, or person.

inputs.name: hasCredential
inputs.label: hasCredential
inputs.help: A credential awarded to the Person or Organization.

inputs.name: hasMerchantReturnPolicy
inputs.label: hasMerchantReturnPolicy
inputs.help: Specifies a MerchantReturnPolicy that may be applicable.

inputs.name: hasOfferCatalog
inputs.label: hasOfferCatalog
inputs.help: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

inputs.name: hasPOS
inputs.label: hasPOS
inputs.help: Points-of-Sales operated by the organization or person.

inputs.name: interactionStatistic
inputs.label: interactionStatistic
inputs.help: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication. The most specific child type of InteractionCounter should be used.

inputs.name: isicV4
inputs.label: isicV4
inputs.help: The International Standard of Industrial Classification of All Economic Activities (ISIC), Revision 4 code for a particular organization, business person, or place.

inputs.name: iso6523Code
inputs.label: iso6523Code
inputs.help: An organization identifier as defined in [ISO 6523(-1)](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO/IEC_6523). The identifier should be in the `XXXX:YYYYYY:ZZZ` or `XXXX:YYYYYY`format. Where `XXXX` is a 4 digit _ICD_ (International Code Designator), `YYYYYY` is an _OID_ (Organization Identifier) with all formatting characters (dots, dashes, spaces) removed with a maximal length of 35 characters, and `ZZZ` is an optional OPI (Organization Part Identifier) with a maximum length of 35 characters. The various components (ICD, OID, OPI) are joined with a colon character (ASCII `0x3a`). Note that many existing organization identifiers defined as attributes like [leiCode](http://schema.org/leiCode) (`0199`), [duns](http://schema.org/duns) (`0060`) or [GLN](http://schema.org/globalLocationNumber) (`0088`) can be expressed using ISO-6523. If possible, ISO-6523 codes should be preferred to populating [vatID](http://schema.org/vatID) or [taxID](http://schema.org/taxID), as ISO identifiers are less ambiguous.

inputs.name: keywords
inputs.label: keywords
inputs.help: Keywords or tags used to describe some item. Multiple textual entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas, or by repeating the property.

inputs.name: knowsAbout
inputs.label: knowsAbout
inputs.help: Of a [[Person]], and less typically of an [[Organization]], to indicate a topic that is known about - suggesting possible expertise but not implying it. We do not distinguish skill levels here, or relate this to educational content, events, objectives or [[JobPosting]] descriptions.

inputs.name: knowsLanguage
inputs.label: knowsLanguage
inputs.help: Of a [[Person]], and less typically of an [[Organization]], to indicate a known language. We do not distinguish skill levels or reading/writing/speaking/signing here. Use language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).

inputs.name: legalName
inputs.label: legalName
inputs.help: The official name of the organization, e.g. the registered company name.

inputs.name: leiCode
inputs.label: leiCode
inputs.help: An organization identifier that uniquely identifies a legal entity as defined in ISO 17442.

inputs.name: location
inputs.label: location
inputs.help: The location of, for example, where an event is happening, where an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

inputs.name: logo
inputs.label: logo
inputs.help: An associated logo.

inputs.name: makesOffer
inputs.label: makesOffer
inputs.help: A pointer to products or services offered by the organization or person.

inputs.name: member
inputs.label: member
inputs.help: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.

inputs.name: memberOf
inputs.label: memberOf
inputs.help: An Organization (or ProgramMembership) to which this Person or Organization belongs.

inputs.name: members
inputs.label: members
inputs.help: A member of this organization.

inputs.name: naics
inputs.label: naics
inputs.help: The North American Industry Classification System (NAICS) code for a particular organization or business person.

inputs.name: nonprofitStatus
inputs.label: nonprofitStatus
inputs.help: nonprofitStatus indicates the legal status of a non-profit organization in its primary place of business.

inputs.name: numberOfEmployees
inputs.label: numberOfEmployees
inputs.help: The number of employees in an organization, e.g. business.

inputs.name: ownershipFundingInfo
inputs.label: ownershipFundingInfo
inputs.help: For an [[Organization]] (often but not necessarily a [[NewsMediaOrganization]]), a description of organizational ownership structure; funding and grants. In a news/media setting, this is with particular reference to editorial independence.   Note that the [[funder]] is also available and can be used to make basic funder information machine-readable.

inputs.name: owns
inputs.label: owns
inputs.help: Products owned by the organization or person.

inputs.name: parentOrganization
inputs.label: parentOrganization
inputs.help: The larger organization that this organization is a [[subOrganization]] of, if any.

inputs.name: publishingPrinciples
inputs.label: publishingPrinciples
inputs.help:
The publishingPrinciples property indicates (typically via [[URL]]) a document describing the editorial principles of an [[Organization]] (or individual, e.g. a [[Person]] writing a blog) that relate to their activities as a publisher, e.g. ethics or diversity policies. When applied to a [[CreativeWork]] (e.g. [[NewsArticle]]) the principles are those of the party primarily responsible for the creation of the [[CreativeWork]].

While such policies are most typically expressed in natural language, sometimes related information (e.g. indicating a [[funder]]) can be expressed using schema.org terminology.

inputs.name: review
inputs.label: review
inputs.help: A review of the item.

inputs.name: reviews
inputs.label: reviews
inputs.help: Review of the item.

inputs.name: seeks
inputs.label: seeks
inputs.help: A pointer to products or services sought by the organization or person (demand).

inputs.name: serviceArea
inputs.label: serviceArea
inputs.help: The geographic area where the service is provided.

inputs.name: slogan
inputs.label: slogan
inputs.help: A slogan or motto associated with the item.

inputs.name: sponsor
inputs.label: sponsor
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. E.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

inputs.name: subOrganization
inputs.label: subOrganization
inputs.help: A relationship between two organizations where the first includes the second, e.g., as a subsidiary. See also: the more specific 'department' property.

inputs.name: taxID
inputs.label: taxID
inputs.help: The Tax / Fiscal ID of the organization or person, e.g. the TIN in the US or the CIF/NIF in Spain.

inputs.name: telephone
inputs.label: telephone
inputs.help: The telephone number.

inputs.name: unnamedSourcesPolicy
inputs.label: unnamedSourcesPolicy
inputs.help: For an [[Organization]] (typically a [[NewsMediaOrganization]]), a statement about policy on use of unnamed sources and the decision process required.

inputs.name: vatID
inputs.label: vatID
inputs.help: The Value-added Tax ID of the organization or person.

Recipe.name: Recipe
Recipe.help: A recipe. For dietary restrictions covered by the recipe, a few common restrictions are enumerated via [[suitableForDiet]]. The [[keywords]] property can also be used to add more detail.

inputs.name: cookTime
inputs.label: cookTime
inputs.help: The time it takes to actually cook the dish, in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: cookingMethod
inputs.label: cookingMethod
inputs.help: The method of cooking, such as Frying, Steaming, ...

inputs.name: ingredients
inputs.label: ingredients
inputs.help: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.

inputs.name: nutrition
inputs.label: nutrition
inputs.help: Nutrition information about the recipe or menu item.

inputs.name: recipeCategory
inputs.label: recipeCategory
inputs.help: The category of the recipe—for example, appetizer, entree, etc.

inputs.name: recipeCuisine
inputs.label: recipeCuisine
inputs.help: The cuisine of the recipe (for example, French or Ethiopian).

inputs.name: recipeIngredient
inputs.label: recipeIngredient
inputs.help: A single ingredient used in the recipe, e.g. sugar, flour or garlic.

inputs.name: recipeInstructions
inputs.label: recipeInstructions
inputs.help: A step in making the recipe, in the form of a single item (document, video, etc.) or an ordered list with HowToStep and/or HowToSection items.

inputs.name: recipeYield
inputs.label: recipeYield
inputs.help: The quantity produced by the recipe (for example, number of people served, number of servings, etc).

inputs.name: suitableForDiet
inputs.label: suitableForDiet
inputs.help: Indicates a dietary restriction or guideline for which this recipe or menu item is suitable, e.g. diabetic, halal etc.

SeaBodyOfWater.name: SeaBodyOfWater
SeaBodyOfWater.help: A sea (for example, the Caspian sea).

UserCheckins.name: UserCheckins
UserCheckins.help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

ClaimReview.name: ClaimReview
ClaimReview.help: A fact-checking review of claims made (or reported) in some creative work (referenced via itemReviewed).

inputs.name: claimReviewed
inputs.label: claimReviewed
inputs.help: A short summary of the specific claims reviewed in a ClaimReview.

ShortStory.name: ShortStory
ShortStory.help: Short story or tale. A brief work of literature, usually written in narrative prose.

PrependAction.name: PrependAction
PrependAction.help: The act of inserting at the beginning if an ordered collection.

Table.name: Table
Table.help: A table on a Web page.

OwnershipInfo.name: OwnershipInfo
OwnershipInfo.help: A structured value providing information about when a certain organization or person owned a certain product.

inputs.name: acquiredFrom
inputs.label: acquiredFrom
inputs.help: The organization or person from which the product was acquired.

inputs.name: ownedFrom
inputs.label: ownedFrom
inputs.help: The date and time of obtaining the product.

inputs.name: ownedThrough
inputs.label: ownedThrough
inputs.help: The date and time of giving up ownership on the product.

inputs.name: typeOfGood
inputs.label: typeOfGood
inputs.help: The product that this structured value is referring to.

SportsOrganization.name: SportsOrganization
SportsOrganization.help: Represents the collection of all sports organizations, including sports teams, governing bodies, and sports associations.

inputs.name: sport
inputs.label: sport
inputs.help: A type of sport (e.g. Baseball).

PriceComponentTypeEnumeration.name: PriceComponentTypeEnumeration
PriceComponentTypeEnumeration.help: Enumerates different price components that together make up the total price for an offered product.

MusicAlbumProductionType.name: MusicAlbumProductionType
MusicAlbumProductionType.help: Classification of the album by its type of content: soundtrack, live album, studio album, etc.

WinAction.name: WinAction
WinAction.help: The act of achieving victory in a competitive activity.

inputs.name: loser
inputs.label: loser
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The loser of the action.

CarUsageType.name: CarUsageType
CarUsageType.help: A value indicating a special usage of a car, e.g. commercial rental, driving school, or as a taxi.

Apartment.name: Apartment
Apartment.help: An apartment (in American English) or flat (in British English) is a self-contained housing unit (a type of residential real estate) that occupies only part of a building (source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Apartment).

inputs.name: numberOfRooms
inputs.label: numberOfRooms
inputs.help:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

inputs.name: occupancy
inputs.label: occupancy
inputs.help:
The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person).
Typical unit code(s): C62 for person.

inputs.name: mapType
inputs.label: mapType
inputs.help: Indicates the kind of Map, from the MapCategoryType Enumeration.

AgreeAction.name: AgreeAction
AgreeAction.help: The act of expressing a consistency of opinion with the object. An agent agrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

OnlineBusiness.name: OnlineBusiness
OnlineBusiness.help: A particular online business, either standalone or the online part of a broader organization. Examples include an eCommerce site, an online travel booking site, an online learning site, an online logistics and shipping provider, an online (virtual) doctor, etc.

Message.name: Message
Message.help: A single message from a sender to one or more organizations or people.

inputs.name: bccRecipient
inputs.label: bccRecipient
inputs.help: A sub property of recipient. The recipient blind copied on a message.

inputs.name: ccRecipient
inputs.label: ccRecipient
inputs.help: A sub property of recipient. The recipient copied on a message.

inputs.name: dateRead
inputs.label: dateRead
inputs.help: The date/time at which the message has been read by the recipient if a single recipient exists.

inputs.name: dateReceived
inputs.label: dateReceived
inputs.help: The date/time the message was received if a single recipient exists.

inputs.name: dateSent
inputs.label: dateSent
inputs.help: The date/time at which the message was sent.

inputs.name: messageAttachment
inputs.label: messageAttachment
inputs.help: A CreativeWork attached to the message.

inputs.name: recipient
inputs.label: recipient
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

inputs.name: sender
inputs.label: sender
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the sending end of the action.

inputs.name: toRecipient
inputs.label: toRecipient
inputs.help: A sub property of recipient. The recipient who was directly sent the message.

SocialMediaPosting.name: SocialMediaPosting
SocialMediaPosting.help: A post to a social media platform, including blog posts, tweets, Facebook posts, etc.

inputs.name: sharedContent
inputs.label: sharedContent
inputs.help: A CreativeWork such as an image, video, or audio clip shared as part of this posting.

MedicalTest.name: MedicalTest
MedicalTest.help: Any medical test, typically performed for diagnostic purposes.

inputs.name: affectedBy
inputs.label: affectedBy
inputs.help: Drugs that affect the test's results.

inputs.name: normalRange
inputs.label: normalRange
inputs.help: Range of acceptable values for a typical patient, when applicable.

inputs.name: signDetected
inputs.label: signDetected
inputs.help: A sign detected by the test.

inputs.name: usedToDiagnose
inputs.label: usedToDiagnose
inputs.help: A condition the test is used to diagnose.

inputs.name: usesDevice
inputs.label: usesDevice
inputs.help: Device used to perform the test.

PaintAction.name: PaintAction
PaintAction.help: The act of producing a painting, typically with paint and canvas as instruments.

DrugStrength.name: DrugStrength
DrugStrength.help: A specific strength in which a medical drug is available in a specific country.

inputs.name: activeIngredient
inputs.label: activeIngredient
inputs.help: An active ingredient, typically chemical compounds and/or biologic substances.

inputs.name: availableIn
inputs.label: availableIn
inputs.help: The location in which the strength is available.

inputs.name: maximumIntake
inputs.label: maximumIntake
inputs.help: Recommended intake of this supplement for a given population as defined by a specific recommending authority.

inputs.name: strengthUnit
inputs.label: strengthUnit
inputs.help: The units of an active ingredient's strength, e.g. mg.

inputs.name: strengthValue
inputs.label: strengthValue
inputs.help: The value of an active ingredient's strength, e.g. 325.

ArchiveComponent.name: ArchiveComponent
ArchiveComponent.help: An intangible type to be applied to any archive content, carrying with it a set of properties required to describe archival items and collections.

inputs.name: holdingArchive
inputs.label: holdingArchive
inputs.help: [[ArchiveOrganization]] that holds, keeps or maintains the [[ArchiveComponent]].

inputs.name: itemLocation
inputs.label: itemLocation
inputs.help: Current location of the item.

LegislationObject.name: LegislationObject
LegislationObject.help: A specific object or file containing a Legislation. Note that the same Legislation can be published in multiple files. For example, a digitally signed PDF, a plain PDF and an HTML version.

inputs.name: legislationLegalValue
inputs.label: legislationLegalValue
inputs.help: The legal value of this legislation file. The same legislation can be written in multiple files with different legal values. Typically a digitally signed PDF have a "stronger" legal value than the HTML file of the same act.

UserPlays.name: UserPlays
UserPlays.help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

UKNonprofitType.name: UKNonprofitType
UKNonprofitType.help: UKNonprofitType: Non-profit organization type originating from the United Kingdom.

UserPageVisits.name: UserPageVisits
UserPageVisits.help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

BedType.name: BedType
BedType.help: A type of bed. This is used for indicating the bed or beds available in an accommodation.

MedicalEnumeration.name: MedicalEnumeration
MedicalEnumeration.help: Enumerations related to health and the practice of medicine: A concept that is used to attribute a quality to another concept, as a qualifier, a collection of items or a listing of all of the elements of a set in medicine practice.

RadioClip.name: RadioClip
RadioClip.help: A short radio program or a segment/part of a radio program.

ReturnMethodEnumeration.name: ReturnMethodEnumeration
ReturnMethodEnumeration.help: Enumerates several types of product return methods.

WPFooter.name: WPFooter
WPFooter.help: The footer section of the page.

WebContent.name: WebContent
WebContent.help: WebContent is a type representing all [[WebPage]], [[WebSite]] and [[WebPageElement]] content. It is sometimes the case that detailed distinctions between Web pages, sites and their parts are not always important or obvious. The  [[WebContent]] type makes it easier to describe Web-addressable content without requiring such distinctions to always be stated. (The intent is that the existing types [[WebPage]], [[WebSite]] and [[WebPageElement]] will eventually be declared as subtypes of [[WebContent]].)

LinkRole.name: LinkRole
LinkRole.help: A Role that represents a Web link, e.g. as expressed via the 'url' property. Its linkRelationship property can indicate URL-based and plain textual link types, e.g. those in IANA link registry or others such as 'amphtml'. This structure provides a placeholder where details from HTML's link element can be represented outside of HTML, e.g. in JSON-LD feeds.

inputs.name: inLanguage
inputs.label: inLanguage
inputs.help: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

inputs.name: linkRelationship
inputs.label: linkRelationship
inputs.help: Indicates the relationship type of a Web link.

SearchAction.name: SearchAction
SearchAction.help:
The act of searching for an object.

Related actions:

* [[FindAction]]: SearchAction generally leads to a FindAction, but not necessarily.

inputs.name: query
inputs.label: query
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. The query used on this action.

OfferCatalog.name: OfferCatalog
OfferCatalog.help: An OfferCatalog is an ItemList that contains related Offers and/or further OfferCatalogs that are offeredBy the same provider.

BoatTrip.name: BoatTrip
BoatTrip.help: A trip on a commercial ferry line.

inputs.name: arrivalBoatTerminal
inputs.label: arrivalBoatTerminal
inputs.help: The terminal or port from which the boat arrives.

inputs.name: departureBoatTerminal
inputs.label: departureBoatTerminal
inputs.help: The terminal or port from which the boat departs.

MedicalEvidenceLevel.name: MedicalEvidenceLevel
MedicalEvidenceLevel.help: Level of evidence for a medical guideline. Enumerated type.

Demand.name: Demand
Demand.help: A demand entity represents the public, not necessarily binding, not necessarily exclusive, announcement by an organization or person to seek a certain type of goods or services. For describing demand using this type, the very same properties used for Offer apply.

inputs.name: acceptedPaymentMethod
inputs.label: acceptedPaymentMethod
inputs.help: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.

inputs.name: advanceBookingRequirement
inputs.label: advanceBookingRequirement
inputs.help: The amount of time that is required between accepting the offer and the actual usage of the resource or service.

inputs.name: areaServed
inputs.label: areaServed
inputs.help: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

inputs.name: asin
inputs.label: asin
inputs.help:
An Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN) is a 10-character alphanumeric unique identifier assigned by Amazon.com and its partners for product identification within the Amazon organization (summary from [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_Standard_Identification_Number)'s article).

Note also that this is a definition for how to include ASINs in Schema.org data, and not a definition of ASINs in general - see documentation from Amazon for authoritative details.
ASINs are most commonly encoded as text strings, but the [asin] property supports URL/URI as potential values too.

inputs.name: availability
inputs.label: availability
inputs.help: The availability of this item—for example In stock, Out of stock, Pre-order, etc.

inputs.name: availabilityEnds
inputs.label: availabilityEnds
inputs.help: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

inputs.name: availabilityStarts
inputs.label: availabilityStarts
inputs.help: The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

inputs.name: availableAtOrFrom
inputs.label: availableAtOrFrom
inputs.help: The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.g. store locations).

inputs.name: availableDeliveryMethod
inputs.label: availableDeliveryMethod
inputs.help: The delivery method(s) available for this offer.

inputs.name: businessFunction
inputs.label: businessFunction
inputs.help: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

inputs.name: deliveryLeadTime
inputs.label: deliveryLeadTime
inputs.help: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup.

inputs.name: eligibleCustomerType
inputs.label: eligibleCustomerType
inputs.help: The type(s) of customers for which the given offer is valid.

inputs.name: eligibleDuration
inputs.label: eligibleDuration
inputs.help: The duration for which the given offer is valid.

inputs.name: eligibleQuantity
inputs.label: eligibleQuantity
inputs.help: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

inputs.name: eligibleRegion
inputs.label: eligibleRegion
inputs.help: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

inputs.name: eligibleTransactionVolume
inputs.label: eligibleTransactionVolume
inputs.help: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

inputs.name: gtin
inputs.label: gtin
inputs.help:
A Global Trade Item Number ([GTIN](https://www.gs1.org/standards/id-keys/gtin)). GTINs identify trade items, including products and services, using numeric identification codes.

The GS1 [digital link specifications](https://www.gs1.org/standards/Digital-Link/) express GTINs as URLs (URIs, IRIs, etc.). Details including regular expression examples can be found in, Section 6 of the GS1 URI Syntax specification; see also [schema.org tracking issue](https://github.com/schemaorg/schemaorg/issues/3156#issuecomment-1209522809) for schema.org-specific discussion. A correct [[gtin]] value should be a valid GTIN, which means that it should be an all-numeric string of either 8, 12, 13 or 14 digits, or a "GS1 Digital Link" URL based on such a string. The numeric component should also have a [valid GS1 check digit](https://www.gs1.org/services/check-digit-calculator) and meet the other rules for valid GTINs. See also [GS1's GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) and [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_Trade_Item_Number) for more details. Left-padding of the gtin values is not required or encouraged. The [[gtin]] property generalizes the earlier [[gtin8]], [[gtin12]], [[gtin13]], and [[gtin14]] properties.

Note also that this is a definition for how to include GTINs in Schema.org data, and not a definition of GTINs in general - see the GS1 documentation for authoritative details.

inputs.name: gtin12
inputs.label: gtin12
inputs.help: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: gtin13
inputs.label: gtin13
inputs.help: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceding zero. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: gtin14
inputs.label: gtin14
inputs.help: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: gtin8
inputs.label: gtin8
inputs.help: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: includesObject
inputs.label: includesObject
inputs.help: This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in  an [[Offer]] or [[ProductCollection]].

inputs.name: ineligibleRegion
inputs.label: ineligibleRegion
inputs.help: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

inputs.name: inventoryLevel
inputs.label: inventoryLevel
inputs.help: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.

inputs.name: itemCondition
inputs.label: itemCondition
inputs.help: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition specifying the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer. Also used for product return policies to specify the condition of products accepted for returns.

inputs.name: itemOffered
inputs.label: itemOffered
inputs.help: An item being offered (or demanded). The transactional nature of the offer or demand is documented using [[businessFunction]], e.g. sell, lease etc. While several common expected types are listed explicitly in this definition, others can be used. Using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

inputs.name: mpn
inputs.label: mpn
inputs.help: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

inputs.name: priceSpecification
inputs.label: priceSpecification
inputs.help: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

inputs.name: seller
inputs.label: seller
inputs.help: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

inputs.name: serialNumber
inputs.label: serialNumber
inputs.help: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

inputs.name: sku
inputs.label: sku
inputs.help: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

inputs.name: validFrom
inputs.label: validFrom
inputs.help: The date when the item becomes valid.

inputs.name: validThrough
inputs.label: validThrough
inputs.help: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

inputs.name: warranty
inputs.label: warranty
inputs.help: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

StructuredValue.name: StructuredValue
StructuredValue.help: Structured values are used when the value of a property has a more complex structure than simply being a textual value or a reference to another thing.

UserReview.name: UserReview
UserReview.help: A review created by an end-user (e.g. consumer, purchaser, attendee etc.), in contrast with [[CriticReview]].

DigitalPlatformEnumeration.name: DigitalPlatformEnumeration
DigitalPlatformEnumeration.help: Enumerates some common technology platforms, for use with properties such as [[actionPlatform]]. It is not supposed to be comprehensive - when a suitable code is not enumerated here, textual or URL values can be used instead. These codes are at a fairly high level and do not deal with versioning and other nuance. Additional codes can be suggested [in github](https://github.com/schemaorg/schemaorg/issues/3057).

CourseInstance.name: CourseInstance
CourseInstance.help: An instance of a [[Course]] which is distinct from other instances because it is offered at a different time or location or through different media or modes of study or to a specific section of students.

inputs.name: courseMode
inputs.label: courseMode
inputs.help: The medium or means of delivery of the course instance or the mode of study, either as a text label (e.g. "online", "onsite" or "blended"; "synchronous" or "asynchronous"; "full-time" or "part-time") or as a URL reference to a term from a controlled vocabulary (e.g. https://ceds.ed.gov/element/001311#Asynchronous).

inputs.name: courseSchedule
inputs.label: courseSchedule
inputs.help: Represents the length and pace of a course, expressed as a [[Schedule]].

inputs.name: courseWorkload
inputs.label: courseWorkload
inputs.help: The amount of work expected of students taking the course, often provided as a figure per week or per month, and may be broken down by type. For example, "2 hours of lectures, 1 hour of lab work and 3 hours of independent study per week".

inputs.name: instructor
inputs.label: instructor
inputs.help: A person assigned to instruct or provide instructional assistance for the [[CourseInstance]].

OpeningHoursSpecification.name: OpeningHoursSpecification
OpeningHoursSpecification.help:
A structured value providing information about the opening hours of a place or a certain service inside a place.


The place is __open__ if the [[opens]] property is specified, and __closed__ otherwise.

If the value for the [[closes]] property is less than the value for the [[opens]] property then the hour range is assumed to span over the next day.

inputs.name: closes
inputs.label: closes
inputs.help: The closing hour of the place or service on the given day(s) of the week.

inputs.name: dayOfWeek
inputs.label: dayOfWeek
inputs.help: The day of the week for which these opening hours are valid.

inputs.name: opens
inputs.label: opens
inputs.help: The opening hour of the place or service on the given day(s) of the week.

inputs.name: validFrom
inputs.label: validFrom
inputs.help: The date when the item becomes valid.

inputs.name: validThrough
inputs.label: validThrough
inputs.help: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

CategoryCodeSet.name: CategoryCodeSet
CategoryCodeSet.help: A set of Category Code values.

inputs.name: hasCategoryCode
inputs.label: hasCategoryCode
inputs.help: A Category code contained in this code set.

DrugCostCategory.name: DrugCostCategory
DrugCostCategory.help: Enumerated categories of medical drug costs.

Landform.name: Landform
Landform.help: A landform or physical feature.  Landform elements include mountains, plains, lakes, rivers, seascape and oceanic waterbody interface features such as bays, peninsulas, seas and so forth, including sub-aqueous terrain features such as submersed mountain ranges, volcanoes, and the great ocean basins.

MedicalRiskFactor.name: MedicalRiskFactor
MedicalRiskFactor.help: A risk factor is anything that increases a person's likelihood of developing or contracting a disease, medical condition, or complication.

inputs.name: increasesRiskOf
inputs.label: increasesRiskOf
inputs.help: The condition, complication, etc. influenced by this factor.

MedicalConditionStage.name: MedicalConditionStage
MedicalConditionStage.help: A stage of a medical condition, such as 'Stage IIIa'.

inputs.name: stageAsNumber
inputs.label: stageAsNumber
inputs.help: The stage represented as a number, e.g. 3.

inputs.name: subStageSuffix
inputs.label: subStageSuffix
inputs.help: The substage, e.g. 'a' for Stage IIIa.

MedicalProcedure.name: MedicalProcedure
MedicalProcedure.help: A process of care used in either a diagnostic, therapeutic, preventive or palliative capacity that relies on invasive (surgical), non-invasive, or other techniques.

inputs.name: bodyLocation
inputs.label: bodyLocation
inputs.help: Location in the body of the anatomical structure.

inputs.name: followup
inputs.label: followup
inputs.help: Typical or recommended followup care after the procedure is performed.

inputs.name: howPerformed
inputs.label: howPerformed
inputs.help: How the procedure is performed.

inputs.name: preparation
inputs.label: preparation
inputs.help: Typical preparation that a patient must undergo before having the procedure performed.

inputs.name: procedureType
inputs.label: procedureType
inputs.help: The type of procedure, for example Surgical, Noninvasive, or Percutaneous.

inputs.name: status
inputs.label: status
inputs.help: The status of the study (enumerated).

inputs.name: assesses
inputs.label: assesses
inputs.help: The item being described is intended to assess the competency or learning outcome defined by the referenced term.

inputs.name: educationalLevel
inputs.label: educationalLevel
inputs.help: The level in terms of progression through an educational or training context. Examples of educational levels include 'beginner', 'intermediate' or 'advanced', and formal sets of level indicators.

inputs.name: teaches
inputs.label: teaches
inputs.help: The item being described is intended to help a person learn the competency or learning outcome defined by the referenced term.

LegalForceStatus.name: LegalForceStatus
LegalForceStatus.help: A list of possible statuses for the legal force of a legislation.

MusicRecording.name: MusicRecording
MusicRecording.help: A music recording (track), usually a single song.

inputs.name: byArtist
inputs.label: byArtist
inputs.help: The artist that performed this album or recording.

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: duration
inputs.help: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: inAlbum
inputs.label: inAlbum
inputs.help: The album to which this recording belongs.

inputs.name: inPlaylist
inputs.label: inPlaylist
inputs.help: The playlist to which this recording belongs.

inputs.name: isrcCode
inputs.label: isrcCode
inputs.help: The International Standard Recording Code for the recording.

inputs.name: recordingOf
inputs.label: recordingOf
inputs.help: The composition this track is a recording of.

HealthInsurancePlan.name: HealthInsurancePlan
HealthInsurancePlan.help: A US-style health insurance plan, including PPOs, EPOs, and HMOs.

inputs.name: benefitsSummaryUrl
inputs.label: benefitsSummaryUrl
inputs.help: The URL that goes directly to the summary of benefits and coverage for the specific standard plan or plan variation.

inputs.name: contactPoint
inputs.label: contactPoint
inputs.help: A contact point for a person or organization.

inputs.name: healthPlanDrugOption
inputs.label: healthPlanDrugOption
inputs.help: TODO.

inputs.name: healthPlanDrugTier
inputs.label: healthPlanDrugTier
inputs.help: The tier(s) of drugs offered by this formulary or insurance plan.

inputs.name: healthPlanId
inputs.label: healthPlanId
inputs.help: The 14-character, HIOS-generated Plan ID number. (Plan IDs must be unique, even across different markets.)

inputs.name: healthPlanMarketingUrl
inputs.label: healthPlanMarketingUrl
inputs.help: The URL that goes directly to the plan brochure for the specific standard plan or plan variation.

inputs.name: includesHealthPlanFormulary
inputs.label: includesHealthPlanFormulary
inputs.help: Formularies covered by this plan.

inputs.name: includesHealthPlanNetwork
inputs.label: includesHealthPlanNetwork
inputs.help: Networks covered by this plan.

inputs.name: usesHealthPlanIdStandard
inputs.label: usesHealthPlanIdStandard
inputs.help: The standard for interpreting the Plan ID. The preferred is "HIOS". See the Centers for Medicare & Medicaid Services for more details.

MedicalDevice.name: MedicalDevice
MedicalDevice.help: Any object used in a medical capacity, such as to diagnose or treat a patient.

inputs.name: adverseOutcome
inputs.label: adverseOutcome
inputs.help: A possible complication and/or side effect of this therapy. If it is known that an adverse outcome is serious (resulting in death, disability, or permanent damage; requiring hospitalization; or otherwise life-threatening or requiring immediate medical attention), tag it as a seriousAdverseOutcome instead.

inputs.name: contraindication
inputs.label: contraindication
inputs.help: A contraindication for this therapy.

inputs.name: postOp
inputs.label: postOp
inputs.help: A description of the postoperative procedures, care, and/or followups for this device.

inputs.name: preOp
inputs.label: preOp
inputs.help: A description of the workup, testing, and other preparations required before implanting this device.

inputs.name: procedure
inputs.label: procedure
inputs.help: A description of the procedure involved in setting up, using, and/or installing the device.

inputs.name: seriousAdverseOutcome
inputs.label: seriousAdverseOutcome
inputs.help: A possible serious complication and/or serious side effect of this therapy. Serious adverse outcomes include those that are life-threatening; result in death, disability, or permanent damage; require hospitalization or prolong existing hospitalization; cause congenital anomalies or birth defects; or jeopardize the patient and may require medical or surgical intervention to prevent one of the outcomes in this definition.

SteeringPositionValue.name: SteeringPositionValue
SteeringPositionValue.help: A value indicating a steering position.

DDxElement.name: DDxElement
DDxElement.help: An alternative, closely-related condition typically considered later in the differential diagnosis process along with the signs that are used to distinguish it.

inputs.name: diagnosis
inputs.label: diagnosis
inputs.help: One or more alternative conditions considered in the differential diagnosis process as output of a diagnosis process.

inputs.name: distinguishingSign
inputs.label: distinguishingSign
inputs.help: One of a set of signs and symptoms that can be used to distinguish this diagnosis from others in the differential diagnosis.

DefenceEstablishment.name: DefenceEstablishment
DefenceEstablishment.help: A defence establishment, such as an army or navy base.

TakeAction.name: TakeAction
TakeAction.help:
The act of gaining ownership of an object from an origin. Reciprocal of GiveAction.

Related actions:

* [[GiveAction]]: The reciprocal of TakeAction.
* [[ReceiveAction]]: Unlike ReceiveAction, TakeAction implies that ownership has been transferred.

Report.name: Report
Report.help: A Report generated by governmental or non-governmental organization.

inputs.name: reportNumber
inputs.label: reportNumber
inputs.help: The number or other unique designator assigned to a Report by the publishing organization.

UserInteraction.name: UserInteraction
UserInteraction.help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

MotorizedBicycle.name: MotorizedBicycle
MotorizedBicycle.help: A motorized bicycle is a bicycle with an attached motor used to power the vehicle, or to assist with pedaling.

WebAPI.name: WebAPI
WebAPI.help: An application programming interface accessible over Web/Internet technologies.

inputs.name: documentation
inputs.label: documentation
inputs.help: Further documentation describing the Web API in more detail.

AdministrativeArea.name: AdministrativeArea
AdministrativeArea.help: A geographical region, typically under the jurisdiction of a particular government.

DiagnosticProcedure.name: DiagnosticProcedure
DiagnosticProcedure.help: A medical procedure intended primarily for diagnostic, as opposed to therapeutic, purposes.

BedDetails.name: BedDetails
BedDetails.help: An entity holding detailed information about the available bed types, e.g. the quantity of twin beds for a hotel room. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you can use bed directly with a text. See also [[BedType]] (under development).

inputs.name: numberOfBeds
inputs.label: numberOfBeds
inputs.help: The quantity of the given bed type available in the HotelRoom, Suite, House, or Apartment.

inputs.name: typeOfBed
inputs.label: typeOfBed
inputs.help: The type of bed to which the BedDetail refers, i.e. the type of bed available in the quantity indicated by quantity.

HealthAspectEnumeration.name: HealthAspectEnumeration
HealthAspectEnumeration.help: HealthAspectEnumeration enumerates several aspects of health content online, each of which might be described using [[hasHealthAspect]] and [[HealthTopicContent]].

EventAttendanceModeEnumeration.name: EventAttendanceModeEnumeration
EventAttendanceModeEnumeration.help: An EventAttendanceModeEnumeration value is one of potentially several modes of organising an event, relating to whether it is online or offline.

PawnShop.name: PawnShop
PawnShop.help: A shop that will buy, or lend money against the security of, personal possessions.

ProgramMembership.name: ProgramMembership
ProgramMembership.help: Used to describe membership in a loyalty programs (e.g. "StarAliance"), traveler clubs (e.g. "AAA"), purchase clubs ("Safeway Club"), etc.

inputs.name: hostingOrganization
inputs.label: hostingOrganization
inputs.help: The organization (airline, travelers' club, etc.) the membership is made with.

inputs.name: member
inputs.label: member
inputs.help: A member of an Organization or a ProgramMembership. Organizations can be members of organizations; ProgramMembership is typically for individuals.

inputs.name: members
inputs.label: members
inputs.help: A member of this organization.

inputs.name: membershipNumber
inputs.label: membershipNumber
inputs.help: A unique identifier for the membership.

inputs.name: membershipPointsEarned
inputs.label: membershipPointsEarned
inputs.help: The number of membership points earned by the member. If necessary, the unitText can be used to express the units the points are issued in. (E.g. stars, miles, etc.)

inputs.name: programName
inputs.label: programName
inputs.help: The program providing the membership.

EmployerAggregateRating.name: EmployerAggregateRating
EmployerAggregateRating.help: An aggregate rating of an Organization related to its role as an employer.

Project.name: Project
Project.help:
An enterprise (potentially individual but typically collaborative), planned to achieve a particular aim.
Use properties from [[Organization]], [[subOrganization]]/[[parentOrganization]] to indicate project sub-structures.

HobbyShop.name: HobbyShop
HobbyShop.help: A store that sells materials useful or necessary for various hobbies.

UpdateAction.name: UpdateAction
UpdateAction.help: The act of managing by changing/editing the state of the object.

inputs.name: collection
inputs.label: collection
inputs.help: A sub property of object. The collection target of the action.

inputs.name: targetCollection
inputs.label: targetCollection
inputs.help: A sub property of object. The collection target of the action.

DietarySupplement.name: DietarySupplement
DietarySupplement.help: A product taken by mouth that contains a dietary ingredient intended to supplement the diet. Dietary ingredients may include vitamins, minerals, herbs or other botanicals, amino acids, and substances such as enzymes, organ tissues, glandulars and metabolites.

inputs.name: activeIngredient
inputs.label: activeIngredient
inputs.help: An active ingredient, typically chemical compounds and/or biologic substances.

inputs.name: isProprietary
inputs.label: isProprietary
inputs.help: True if this item's name is a proprietary/brand name (vs. generic name).

inputs.name: legalStatus
inputs.label: legalStatus
inputs.help: The drug or supplement's legal status, including any controlled substance schedules that apply.

inputs.name: maximumIntake
inputs.label: maximumIntake
inputs.help: Recommended intake of this supplement for a given population as defined by a specific recommending authority.

inputs.name: mechanismOfAction
inputs.label: mechanismOfAction
inputs.help: The specific biochemical interaction through which this drug or supplement produces its pharmacological effect.

inputs.name: nonProprietaryName
inputs.label: nonProprietaryName
inputs.help: The generic name of this drug or supplement.

inputs.name: proprietaryName
inputs.label: proprietaryName
inputs.help: Proprietary name given to the diet plan, typically by its originator or creator.

inputs.name: recommendedIntake
inputs.label: recommendedIntake
inputs.help: Recommended intake of this supplement for a given population as defined by a specific recommending authority.

inputs.name: safetyConsideration
inputs.label: safetyConsideration
inputs.help: Any potential safety concern associated with the supplement. May include interactions with other drugs and foods, pregnancy, breastfeeding, known adverse reactions, and documented efficacy of the supplement.

inputs.name: targetPopulation
inputs.label: targetPopulation
inputs.help: Characteristics of the population for which this is intended, or which typically uses it, e.g. 'adults'.

CompleteDataFeed.name: CompleteDataFeed
CompleteDataFeed.help:
A [[CompleteDataFeed]] is a [[DataFeed]] whose standard representation includes content for every item currently in the feed.

This is the equivalent of Atom's element as defined in Feed Paging and Archiving [RFC 5005](https://tools.ietf.org/html/rfc5005), for example (and as defined for Atom), when using data from a feed that represents a collection of items that varies over time (e.g. "Top Twenty Records") there is no need to have newer entries mixed in alongside older, obsolete entries. By marking this feed as a CompleteDataFeed, old entries can be safely discarded when the feed is refreshed, since we can assume the feed has provided descriptions for all current items.

IPTCDigitalSourceEnumeration.name: IPTCDigitalSourceEnumeration
IPTCDigitalSourceEnumeration.help: IPTC "Digital Source" codes for use with the [[digitalSourceType]] property, providing information about the source for a digital media object. In general these codes are not declared here to be mutually exclusive, although some combinations would be contradictory if applied simultaneously, or might be considered mutually incompatible by upstream maintainers of the definitions. See the IPTC documentation for detailed definitions of all terms.

AssessAction.name: AssessAction
AssessAction.help: The act of forming one's opinion, reaction or sentiment.

Vehicle.name: Vehicle
Vehicle.help: A vehicle is a device that is designed or used to transport people or cargo over land, water, air, or through space.

inputs.name: accelerationTime
inputs.label: accelerationTime
inputs.help:
The time needed to accelerate the vehicle from a given start velocity to a given target velocity.

Typical unit code(s): SEC for seconds

* Note: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for seconds/0..100 km/h or seconds/0..60 mph. Simply use "SEC" for seconds and indicate the velocities in the [[name]] of the [[QuantitativeValue]], or use [[valueReference]] with a [[QuantitativeValue]] of 0..60 mph or 0..100 km/h to specify the reference speeds.

inputs.name: bodyType
inputs.label: bodyType
inputs.help: Indicates the design and body style of the vehicle (e.g. station wagon, hatchback, etc.).

inputs.name: callSign
inputs.label: callSign
inputs.help: A [callsign](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Call_sign), as used in broadcasting and radio communications to identify people, radio and TV stations, or vehicles.

inputs.name: cargoVolume
inputs.label: cargoVolume
inputs.help:
The available volume for cargo or luggage. For automobiles, this is usually the trunk volume.

Typical unit code(s): LTR for liters, FTQ for cubic foot/feet

Note: You can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

inputs.name: dateVehicleFirstRegistered
inputs.label: dateVehicleFirstRegistered
inputs.help: The date of the first registration of the vehicle with the respective public authorities.

inputs.name: driveWheelConfiguration
inputs.label: driveWheelConfiguration
inputs.help: The drive wheel configuration, i.e. which roadwheels will receive torque from the vehicle's engine via the drivetrain.

inputs.name: emissionsCO2
inputs.label: emissionsCO2
inputs.help: The CO2 emissions in g/km. When used in combination with a QuantitativeValue, put "g/km" into the unitText property of that value, since there is no UN/CEFACT Common Code for "g/km".

inputs.name: fuelCapacity
inputs.label: fuelCapacity
inputs.help: The capacity of the fuel tank or in the case of electric cars, the battery. If there are multiple components for storage, this should indicate the total of all storage of the same type.\n\nTypical unit code(s): LTR for liters, GLL of US gallons, GLI for UK / imperial gallons, AMH for ampere-hours (for electrical vehicles).

inputs.name: fuelConsumption
inputs.label: fuelConsumption
inputs.help:
The amount of fuel consumed for traveling a particular distance or temporal duration with the given vehicle (e.g. liters per 100 km).

* Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for liters per 100 km.  Use [[unitText]] to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. L/100 km.
* Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, [[fuelConsumption]] (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and [[fuelEfficiency]] (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
* Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use [[valueReference]] to link the value for the fuel consumption to another value.

inputs.name: fuelEfficiency
inputs.label: fuelEfficiency
inputs.help:
The distance traveled per unit of fuel used; most commonly miles per gallon (mpg) or kilometers per liter (km/L).

* Note 1: There are unfortunately no standard unit codes for miles per gallon or kilometers per liter. Use [[unitText]] to indicate the unit of measurement, e.g. mpg or km/L.
* Note 2: There are two ways of indicating the fuel consumption, [[fuelConsumption]] (e.g. 8 liters per 100 km) and [[fuelEfficiency]] (e.g. 30 miles per gallon). They are reciprocal.
* Note 3: Often, the absolute value is useful only when related to driving speed ("at 80 km/h") or usage pattern ("city traffic"). You can use [[valueReference]] to link the value for the fuel economy to another value.

inputs.name: fuelType
inputs.label: fuelType
inputs.help: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

inputs.name: knownVehicleDamages
inputs.label: knownVehicleDamages
inputs.help: A textual description of known damages, both repaired and unrepaired.

inputs.name: meetsEmissionStandard
inputs.label: meetsEmissionStandard
inputs.help: Indicates that the vehicle meets the respective emission standard.

inputs.name: mileageFromOdometer
inputs.label: mileageFromOdometer
inputs.help: The total distance travelled by the particular vehicle since its initial production, as read from its odometer.\n\nTypical unit code(s): KMT for kilometers, SMI for statute miles.

inputs.name: modelDate
inputs.label: modelDate
inputs.help: The release date of a vehicle model (often used to differentiate versions of the same make and model).

inputs.name: numberOfAirbags
inputs.label: numberOfAirbags
inputs.help: The number or type of airbags in the vehicle.

inputs.name: numberOfAxles
inputs.label: numberOfAxles
inputs.help: The number of axles.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62.

inputs.name: numberOfDoors
inputs.label: numberOfDoors
inputs.help: The number of doors.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62.

inputs.name: numberOfForwardGears
inputs.label: numberOfForwardGears
inputs.help: The total number of forward gears available for the transmission system of the vehicle.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62.

inputs.name: numberOfPreviousOwners
inputs.label: numberOfPreviousOwners
inputs.help: The number of owners of the vehicle, including the current one.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62.

inputs.name: payload
inputs.label: payload
inputs.help:
The permitted weight of passengers and cargo, EXCLUDING the weight of the empty vehicle.

Typical unit code(s): KGM for kilogram, LBR for pound

* Note 1: Many databases specify the permitted TOTAL weight instead, which is the sum of [[weight]] and [[payload]]
* Note 2: You can indicate additional information in the [[name]] of the [[QuantitativeValue]] node.
* Note 3: You may also link to a [[QualitativeValue]] node that provides additional information using [[valueReference]].
* Note 4: Note that you can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

inputs.name: productionDate
inputs.label: productionDate
inputs.help: The date of production of the item, e.g. vehicle.

inputs.name: purchaseDate
inputs.label: purchaseDate
inputs.help: The date the item, e.g. vehicle, was purchased by the current owner.

inputs.name: seatingCapacity
inputs.label: seatingCapacity
inputs.help: The number of persons that can be seated (e.g. in a vehicle), both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62 for persons.

inputs.name: speed
inputs.label: speed
inputs.help:
The speed range of the vehicle. If the vehicle is powered by an engine, the upper limit of the speed range (indicated by [[maxValue]]) should be the maximum speed achievable under regular conditions.

Typical unit code(s): KMH for km/h, HM for mile per hour (0.447 04 m/s), KNT for knot

*Note 1: Use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate the range. Typically, the minimal value is zero.
* Note 2: There are many different ways of measuring the speed range. You can link to information about how the given value has been determined using the [[valueReference]] property.

inputs.name: steeringPosition
inputs.label: steeringPosition
inputs.help: The position of the steering wheel or similar device (mostly for cars).

inputs.name: tongueWeight
inputs.label: tongueWeight
inputs.help:
The permitted vertical load (TWR) of a trailer attached to the vehicle. Also referred to as Tongue Load Rating (TLR) or Vertical Load Rating (VLR).

Typical unit code(s): KGM for kilogram, LBR for pound

* Note 1: You can indicate additional information in the [[name]] of the [[QuantitativeValue]] node.
* Note 2: You may also link to a [[QualitativeValue]] node that provides additional information using [[valueReference]].
* Note 3: Note that you can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

inputs.name: trailerWeight
inputs.label: trailerWeight
inputs.help:
The permitted weight of a trailer attached to the vehicle.

Typical unit code(s): KGM for kilogram, LBR for pound
* Note 1: You can indicate additional information in the [[name]] of the [[QuantitativeValue]] node.
* Note 2: You may also link to a [[QualitativeValue]] node that provides additional information using [[valueReference]].
* Note 3: Note that you can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

inputs.name: vehicleConfiguration
inputs.label: vehicleConfiguration
inputs.help: A short text indicating the configuration of the vehicle, e.g. '5dr hatchback ST 2.5 MT 225 hp' or 'limited edition'.

inputs.name: vehicleEngine
inputs.label: vehicleEngine
inputs.help: Information about the engine or engines of the vehicle.

inputs.name: vehicleIdentificationNumber
inputs.label: vehicleIdentificationNumber
inputs.help: The Vehicle Identification Number (VIN) is a unique serial number used by the automotive industry to identify individual motor vehicles.

inputs.name: vehicleInteriorColor
inputs.label: vehicleInteriorColor
inputs.help: The color or color combination of the interior of the vehicle.

inputs.name: vehicleInteriorType
inputs.label: vehicleInteriorType
inputs.help: The type or material of the interior of the vehicle (e.g. synthetic fabric, leather, wood, etc.). While most interior types are characterized by the material used, an interior type can also be based on vehicle usage or target audience.

inputs.name: vehicleModelDate
inputs.label: vehicleModelDate
inputs.help: The release date of a vehicle model (often used to differentiate versions of the same make and model).

inputs.name: vehicleSeatingCapacity
inputs.label: vehicleSeatingCapacity
inputs.help: The number of passengers that can be seated in the vehicle, both in terms of the physical space available, and in terms of limitations set by law.\n\nTypical unit code(s): C62 for persons.

inputs.name: vehicleSpecialUsage
inputs.label: vehicleSpecialUsage
inputs.help: Indicates whether the vehicle has been used for special purposes, like commercial rental, driving school, or as a taxi. The legislation in many countries requires this information to be revealed when offering a car for sale.

inputs.name: vehicleTransmission
inputs.label: vehicleTransmission
inputs.help: The type of component used for transmitting the power from a rotating power source to the wheels or other relevant component(s) ("gearbox" for cars).

inputs.name: weightTotal
inputs.label: weightTotal
inputs.help:
The permitted total weight of the loaded vehicle, including passengers and cargo and the weight of the empty vehicle.

Typical unit code(s): KGM for kilogram, LBR for pound

* Note 1: You can indicate additional information in the [[name]] of the [[QuantitativeValue]] node.
* Note 2: You may also link to a [[QualitativeValue]] node that provides additional information using [[valueReference]].
* Note 3: Note that you can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

inputs.name: wheelbase
inputs.label: wheelbase
inputs.help: The distance between the centers of the front and rear wheels.\n\nTypical unit code(s): CMT for centimeters, MTR for meters, INH for inches, FOT for foot/feet.

VacationRental.name: VacationRental
VacationRental.help: A kind of lodging business that focuses on renting single properties for limited time.

Enumeration.name: Enumeration
Enumeration.help: Lists or enumerations—for example, a list of cuisines or music genres, etc.

inputs.name: supersededBy
inputs.label: supersededBy
inputs.help: Relates a term (i.e. a property, class or enumeration) to one that supersedes it.

ProfessionalService.name: ProfessionalService
ProfessionalService.help:
Original definition: "provider of professional services."\n\nThe general [[ProfessionalService]] type for local businesses was deprecated due to confusion with [[Service]]. For reference, the types that it included were: [[Dentist]],
        [[AccountingService]], [[Attorney]], [[Notary]], as well as types for several kinds of [[HomeAndConstructionBusiness]]: [[Electrician]], [[GeneralContractor]],
        [[HousePainter]], [[Locksmith]], [[Plumber]], [[RoofingContractor]]. [[LegalService]] was introduced as a more inclusive supertype of [[Attorney]].

GamePlayMode.name: GamePlayMode
GamePlayMode.help: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.

Legislation.name: Legislation
Legislation.help: A legal document such as an act, decree, bill, etc. (enforceable or not) or a component of a legal act (like an article).

inputs.name: jurisdiction
inputs.label: jurisdiction
inputs.help: Indicates a legal jurisdiction, e.g. of some legislation, or where some government service is based.

inputs.name: legislationApplies
inputs.label: legislationApplies
inputs.help: Indicates that this legislation (or part of a legislation) somehow transfers another legislation in a different legislative context. This is an informative link, and it has no legal value. For legally-binding links of transposition, use the legislationTransposes property. For example an informative consolidated law of a European Union's member state "applies" the consolidated version of the European Directive implemented in it.

inputs.name: legislationChanges
inputs.label: legislationChanges
inputs.help: Another legislation that this legislation changes. This encompasses the notions of amendment, replacement, correction, repeal, or other types of change. This may be a direct change (textual or non-textual amendment) or a consequential or indirect change. The property is to be used to express the existence of a change relationship between two acts rather than the existence of a consolidated version of the text that shows the result of the change. For consolidation relationships, use the legislationConsolidates property.

inputs.name: legislationConsolidates
inputs.label: legislationConsolidates
inputs.help: Indicates another legislation taken into account in this consolidated legislation (which is usually the product of an editorial process that revises the legislation). This property should be used multiple times to refer to both the original version or the previous consolidated version, and to the legislations making the change.

inputs.name: legislationDate
inputs.label: legislationDate
inputs.help: The date of adoption or signature of the legislation. This is the date at which the text is officially aknowledged to be a legislation, even though it might not even be published or in force.

inputs.name: legislationDateVersion
inputs.label: legislationDateVersion
inputs.help: The point-in-time at which the provided description of the legislation is valid (e.g.: when looking at the law on the 2016-04-07 (= dateVersion), I get the consolidation of 2015-04-12 of the "National Insurance Contributions Act 2015")

inputs.name: legislationIdentifier
inputs.label: legislationIdentifier
inputs.help: An identifier for the legislation. This can be either a string-based identifier, like the CELEX at EU level or the NOR in France, or a web-based, URL/URI identifier, like an ELI (European Legislation Identifier) or an URN-Lex.

inputs.name: legislationJurisdiction
inputs.label: legislationJurisdiction
inputs.help: The jurisdiction from which the legislation originates.

inputs.name: legislationLegalForce
inputs.label: legislationLegalForce
inputs.help: Whether the legislation is currently in force, not in force, or partially in force.

inputs.name: legislationPassedBy
inputs.label: legislationPassedBy
inputs.help: The person or organization that originally passed or made the law: typically parliament (for primary legislation) or government (for secondary legislation). This indicates the "legal author" of the law, as opposed to its physical author.

inputs.name: legislationResponsible
inputs.label: legislationResponsible
inputs.help: An individual or organization that has some kind of responsibility for the legislation. Typically the ministry who is/was in charge of elaborating the legislation, or the adressee for potential questions about the legislation once it is published.

inputs.name: legislationTransposes
inputs.label: legislationTransposes
inputs.help: Indicates that this legislation (or part of legislation) fulfills the objectives set by another legislation, by passing appropriate implementation measures. Typically, some legislations of European Union's member states or regions transpose European Directives. This indicates a legally binding link between the 2 legislations.

inputs.name: legislationType
inputs.label: legislationType
inputs.help: The type of the legislation. Examples of values are "law", "act", "directive", "decree", "regulation", "statutory instrument", "loi organique", "règlement grand-ducal", etc., depending on the country.

inputs.name: athlete
inputs.label: athlete
inputs.help: A person that acts as performing member of a sports team; a player as opposed to a coach.

inputs.name: coach
inputs.label: coach
inputs.help: A person that acts in a coaching role for a sports team.

inputs.name: gender
inputs.label: gender
inputs.help: Gender of something, typically a [[Person]], but possibly also fictional characters, animals, etc. While http://schema.org/Male and http://schema.org/Female may be used, text strings are also acceptable for people who do not identify as a binary gender. The [[gender]] property can also be used in an extended sense to cover e.g. the gender of sports teams. As with the gender of individuals, we do not try to enumerate all possibilities. A mixed-gender [[SportsTeam]] can be indicated with a text value of "Mixed".

PublicToilet.name: PublicToilet
PublicToilet.help: A public toilet is a room or small building containing one or more toilets (and possibly also urinals) which is available for use by the general public, or by customers or employees of certain businesses.

JoinAction.name: JoinAction
JoinAction.help:
An agent joins an event/group with participants/friends at a location.

Related actions:

* [[RegisterAction]]: Unlike RegisterAction, JoinAction refers to joining a group/team of people.
