* [[SubscribeAction]]: Unlike SubscribeAction, JoinAction does not imply that you'll be receiving updates.
* [[FollowAction]]: Unlike FollowAction, JoinAction does not imply that you'll be polling for updates.

inputs.name: event
inputs.label: event
inputs.help: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

WearableMeasurementTypeEnumeration.name: WearableMeasurementTypeEnumeration
WearableMeasurementTypeEnumeration.help: Enumerates common types of measurement for wearables products.

Motel.name: Motel
Motel.help:
A motel.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

CheckAction.name: CheckAction
CheckAction.help: An agent inspects, determines, investigates, inquires, or examines an object's accuracy, quality, condition, or state.

inputs.name: dataset
inputs.label: dataset
inputs.help: A dataset contained in this catalog.

inputs.name: measurementMethod
inputs.label: measurementMethod
inputs.help: A subproperty of [[measurementTechnique]] that can be used for specifying specific methods, in particular via [[MeasurementMethodEnum]].

inputs.name: measurementTechnique
inputs.label: measurementTechnique
inputs.help:
A technique, method or technology used in an [[Observation]], [[StatisticalVariable]] or [[Dataset]] (or [[DataDownload]], [[DataCatalog]]), corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (for datasets, described using [[variableMeasured]]; for [[Observation]], a [[StatisticalVariable]]). Often but not necessarily each [[variableMeasured]] will have an explicit representation as (or mapping to) an property such as those defined in Schema.org, or other RDF vocabularies and "knowledge graphs". In that case the subproperty of [[variableMeasured]] called [[measuredProperty]] is applicable.
    
The [[measurementTechnique]] property helps when extra clarification is needed about how a [[measuredProperty]] was measured. This is oriented towards scientific and scholarly dataset publication but may have broader applicability; it is not intended as a full representation of measurement, but can often serve as a high level summary for dataset discovery. 

For example, if [[variableMeasured]] is: molecule concentration, [[measurementTechnique]] could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence". If the [[variableMeasured]] is "depression rating", the [[measurementTechnique]] could be "Zung Scale" or "HAM-D" or "Beck Depression Inventory". 

If there are several [[variableMeasured]] properties recorded for some given data object, use a [[PropertyValue]] for each [[variableMeasured]] and attach the corresponding [[measurementTechnique]]. The value can also be from an enumeration, organized as a [[MeasurementMetholdEnumeration]].

FindAction.name: FindAction
FindAction.help:
The act of finding an object.

Related actions:

* [[SearchAction]]: FindAction is generally lead by a SearchAction, but not necessarily.

Physician.name: Physician
Physician.help: An individual physician or a physician's office considered as a [[MedicalOrganization]].

inputs.name: availableService
inputs.label: availableService
inputs.help: A medical service available from this provider.

inputs.name: hospitalAffiliation
inputs.label: hospitalAffiliation
inputs.help: A hospital with which the physician or office is affiliated.

inputs.name: medicalSpecialty
inputs.label: medicalSpecialty
inputs.help: A medical specialty of the provider.

inputs.name: occupationalCategory
inputs.label: occupationalCategory
inputs.help:
A category describing the job, preferably using a term from a taxonomy such as [BLS O*NET-SOC](http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html), [ISCO-08](https://www.ilo.org/public/english/bureau/stat/isco/isco08/) or similar, with the property repeated for each applicable value. Ideally the taxonomy should be identified, and both the textual label and formal code for the category should be provided.\n
Note: for historical reasons, any textual label and formal code provided as a literal may be assumed to be from O*NET-SOC.

inputs.name: usNPI
inputs.label: usNPI
inputs.help: A National Provider Identifier (NPI) is a unique 10-digit identification number issued to health care providers in the United States by the Centers for Medicare and Medicaid Services.

BoatTerminal.name: BoatTerminal
BoatTerminal.help: A terminal for boats, ships, and other water vessels.

CreativeWorkSeason.name: CreativeWorkSeason
CreativeWorkSeason.help: A media season, e.g. TV, radio, video game etc.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: director
inputs.label: director
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: endDate
inputs.label: endDate
inputs.help: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: episode
inputs.label: episode
inputs.help: An episode of a TV, radio or game media within a series or season.

inputs.name: episodes
inputs.label: episodes
inputs.help: An episode of a TV/radio series or season.

inputs.name: numberOfEpisodes
inputs.label: numberOfEpisodes
inputs.help: The number of episodes in this season or series.

inputs.name: partOfSeries
inputs.label: partOfSeries
inputs.help: The series to which this episode or season belongs.

inputs.name: productionCompany
inputs.label: productionCompany
inputs.help: The production company or studio responsible for the item, e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

inputs.name: seasonNumber
inputs.label: seasonNumber
inputs.help: Position of the season within an ordered group of seasons.

inputs.name: startDate
inputs.label: startDate
inputs.help: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: trailer
inputs.label: trailer
inputs.help: The trailer of a movie or TV/radio series, season, episode, etc.

Suite.name: Suite
Suite.help:
A suite in a hotel or other public accommodation, denotes a class of luxury accommodations, the key feature of which is multiple rooms (source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Suite_(hotel)).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

inputs.name: bed
inputs.label: bed
inputs.help:
The type of bed or beds included in the accommodation. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you use bed directly with a text.
      If you want to indicate the quantity of a certain kind of bed, use an instance of BedDetails. For more detailed information, use the amenityFeature property.

inputs.name: numberOfRooms
inputs.label: numberOfRooms
inputs.help:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

inputs.name: occupancy
inputs.label: occupancy
inputs.help:
The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person).
Typical unit code(s): C62 for person.

ItemPage.name: ItemPage
ItemPage.help: A page devoted to a single item, such as a particular product or hotel.

Gene.name: Gene
Gene.help: A discrete unit of inheritance which affects one or more biological traits (Source: [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Gene)). Examples include FOXP2 (Forkhead box protein P2), SCARNA21 (small Cajal body-specific RNA 21), A- (agouti genotype).

inputs.name: alternativeOf
inputs.label: alternativeOf
inputs.help: Another gene which is a variation of this one.

inputs.name: encodesBioChemEntity
inputs.label: encodesBioChemEntity
inputs.help: Another BioChemEntity encoded by this one.

inputs.name: expressedIn
inputs.label: expressedIn
inputs.help: Tissue, organ, biological sample, etc in which activity of this gene has been observed experimentally. For example brain, digestive system.

inputs.name: hasBioPolymerSequence
inputs.label: hasBioPolymerSequence
inputs.help: A symbolic representation of a BioChemEntity. For example, a nucleotide sequence of a Gene or an amino acid sequence of a Protein.

AdvertiserContentArticle.name: AdvertiserContentArticle
AdvertiserContentArticle.help: An [[Article]] that an external entity has paid to place or to produce to its specifications. Includes [advertorials](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Advertorial), sponsored content, native advertising and other paid content.

Reservoir.name: Reservoir
Reservoir.help: A reservoir of water, typically an artificially created lake, like the Lake Kariba reservoir.

Taxon.name: Taxon
Taxon.help: A set of organisms asserted to represent a natural cohesive biological unit.

inputs.name: childTaxon
inputs.label: childTaxon
inputs.help: Closest child taxa of the taxon in question.

inputs.name: hasDefinedTerm
inputs.label: hasDefinedTerm
inputs.help: A Defined Term contained in this term set.

inputs.name: parentTaxon
inputs.label: parentTaxon
inputs.help: Closest parent taxon of the taxon in question.

inputs.name: taxonRank
inputs.label: taxonRank
inputs.help: The taxonomic rank of this taxon given preferably as a URI from a controlled vocabulary – typically the ranks from TDWG TaxonRank ontology or equivalent Wikidata URIs.

LeaveAction.name: LeaveAction
LeaveAction.help:
An agent leaves an event / group with participants/friends at a location.

Related actions:

* [[JoinAction]]: The antonym of LeaveAction.
* [[UnRegisterAction]]: Unlike UnRegisterAction, LeaveAction implies leaving a group/team of people rather than a service.

inputs.name: event
inputs.label: event
inputs.help: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

BodyOfWater.name: BodyOfWater
BodyOfWater.help: A body of water, such as a sea, ocean, or lake.

OrganizationRole.name: OrganizationRole
OrganizationRole.help: A subclass of Role used to describe roles within organizations.

inputs.name: numberedPosition
inputs.label: numberedPosition
inputs.help: A number associated with a role in an organization, for example, the number on an athlete's jersey.

WearableSizeSystemEnumeration.name: WearableSizeSystemEnumeration
WearableSizeSystemEnumeration.help: Enumerates common size systems specific for wearable products.

inputs.name: browserRequirements
inputs.label: browserRequirements
inputs.help: Specifies browser requirements in human-readable text. For example, 'requires HTML5 support'.

MiddleSchool.name: MiddleSchool
MiddleSchool.help: A middle school (typically for children aged around 11-14, although this varies somewhat).

HyperToc.name: HyperToc
HyperToc.help: A HyperToc represents a hypertext table of contents for complex media objects, such as [[VideoObject]], [[AudioObject]]. Items in the table of contents are indicated using the [[tocEntry]] property, and typed [[HyperTocEntry]]. For cases where the same larger work is split into multiple files, [[associatedMedia]] can be used on individual [[HyperTocEntry]] items.

inputs.name: associatedMedia
inputs.label: associatedMedia
inputs.help: A media object that encodes this CreativeWork. This property is a synonym for encoding.

inputs.name: tocEntry
inputs.label: tocEntry
inputs.help: Indicates a [[HyperTocEntry]] in a [[HyperToc]].

inputs.name: iataCode
inputs.label: iataCode
inputs.help: IATA identifier for an airline or airport.

inputs.name: icaoCode
inputs.label: icaoCode
inputs.help: ICAO identifier for an airport.

CreditCard.name: CreditCard
CreditCard.help:
A card payment method of a particular brand or name.  Used to mark up a particular payment method and/or the financial product/service that supplies the card account.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#AmericanExpress
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DinersClub
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Discover
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#JCB
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#MasterCard
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#VISA

PhysicalTherapy.name: PhysicalTherapy
PhysicalTherapy.help: A process of progressive physical care and rehabilitation aimed at improving a health condition.

Manuscript.name: Manuscript
Manuscript.help: A book, document, or piece of music written by hand rather than typed or printed.

FoodService.name: FoodService
FoodService.help: A food service, like breakfast, lunch, or dinner.

RsvpResponseType.name: RsvpResponseType
RsvpResponseType.help: RsvpResponseType is an enumeration type whose instances represent responding to an RSVP request.

PublicationEvent.name: PublicationEvent
PublicationEvent.help: A PublicationEvent corresponds indifferently to the event of publication for a CreativeWork of any type, e.g. a broadcast event, an on-demand event, a book/journal publication via a variety of delivery media.

inputs.name: free
inputs.label: free
inputs.help: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

inputs.name: publishedBy
inputs.label: publishedBy
inputs.help: An agent associated with the publication event.

inputs.name: publishedOn
inputs.label: publishedOn
inputs.help: A broadcast service associated with the publication event.

inputs.name: aircraft
inputs.label: aircraft
inputs.help: The kind of aircraft (e.g., "Boeing 747").

inputs.name: arrivalAirport
inputs.label: arrivalAirport
inputs.help: The airport where the flight terminates.

inputs.name: arrivalGate
inputs.label: arrivalGate
inputs.help: Identifier of the flight's arrival gate.

inputs.name: arrivalTerminal
inputs.label: arrivalTerminal
inputs.help: Identifier of the flight's arrival terminal.

inputs.name: boardingPolicy
inputs.label: boardingPolicy
inputs.help: The type of boarding policy used by the airline (e.g. zone-based or group-based).

inputs.name: carrier
inputs.label: carrier
inputs.help: 'carrier' is an out-dated term indicating the 'provider' for parcel delivery and flights.

inputs.name: departureAirport
inputs.label: departureAirport
inputs.help: The airport where the flight originates.

inputs.name: departureGate
inputs.label: departureGate
inputs.help: Identifier of the flight's departure gate.

inputs.name: departureTerminal
inputs.label: departureTerminal
inputs.help: Identifier of the flight's departure terminal.

inputs.name: estimatedFlightDuration
inputs.label: estimatedFlightDuration
inputs.help: The estimated time the flight will take.

inputs.name: flightDistance
inputs.label: flightDistance
inputs.help: The distance of the flight.

inputs.name: flightNumber
inputs.label: flightNumber
inputs.help: The unique identifier for a flight including the airline IATA code. For example, if describing United flight 110, where the IATA code for United is 'UA', the flightNumber is 'UA110'.

inputs.name: mealService
inputs.label: mealService
inputs.help: Description of the meals that will be provided or available for purchase.

inputs.name: seller
inputs.label: seller
inputs.help: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

inputs.name: webCheckinTime
inputs.label: webCheckinTime
inputs.help: The time when a passenger can check into the flight online.

TieAction.name: TieAction
TieAction.help: The act of reaching a draw in a competitive activity.

ReviewNewsArticle.name: ReviewNewsArticle
ReviewNewsArticle.help: A [[NewsArticle]] and [[CriticReview]] providing a professional critic's assessment of a service, product, performance, or artistic or literary work.

VideoGallery.name: VideoGallery
VideoGallery.help: Web page type: Video gallery page.

OfferForPurchase.name: OfferForPurchase
OfferForPurchase.help:
An [[OfferForPurchase]] in Schema.org represents an [[Offer]] to sell something, i.e. an [[Offer]] whose
  [[businessFunction]] is [sell](http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.). See [Good Relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GoodRelations) for
  background on the underlying concepts.

MobilePhoneStore.name: MobilePhoneStore
MobilePhoneStore.help: A store that sells mobile phones and related accessories.

DayOfWeek.name: DayOfWeek
DayOfWeek.help:
The day of the week, e.g. used to specify to which day the opening hours of an OpeningHoursSpecification refer.

Originally, URLs from [GoodRelations](http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1) were used (for [[Monday]], [[Tuesday]], [[Wednesday]], [[Thursday]], [[Friday]], [[Saturday]], [[Sunday]] plus a special entry for [[PublicHolidays]]); these have now been integrated directly into schema.org.

TextObject.name: TextObject
TextObject.help: A text file. The text can be unformatted or contain markup, html, etc.

MedicalCode.name: MedicalCode
MedicalCode.help: A code for a medical entity.

inputs.name: codeValue
inputs.label: codeValue
inputs.help: A short textual code that uniquely identifies the value.

inputs.name: codingSystem
inputs.label: codingSystem
inputs.help: The coding system, e.g. 'ICD-10'.

TVEpisode.name: TVEpisode
TVEpisode.help: A TV episode which can be part of a series or season.

inputs.name: countryOfOrigin
inputs.label: countryOfOrigin
inputs.help:
The country of origin of something, including products as well as creative  works such as movie and TV content.

In the case of TV and movie, this would be the country of the principle offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie. For other kinds of [[CreativeWork]] it is difficult to provide fully general guidance, and properties such as [[contentLocation]] and [[locationCreated]] may be more applicable.

In the case of products, the country of origin of the product. The exact interpretation of this may vary by context and product type, and cannot be fully enumerated here.

inputs.name: partOfTVSeries
inputs.label: partOfTVSeries
inputs.help: The TV series to which this episode or season belongs.

inputs.name: subtitleLanguage
inputs.label: subtitleLanguage
inputs.help: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in [IETF BCP 47 standard format](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).

inputs.name: titleEIDR
inputs.label: titleEIDR
inputs.help:
An [EIDR](https://eidr.org/) (Entertainment Identifier Registry) [[identifier]] representing at the most general/abstract level, a work of film or television.

For example, the motion picture known as "Ghostbusters" has a titleEIDR of  "10.5240/7EC7-228A-510A-053E-CBB8-J". This title (or work) may have several variants, which EIDR calls "edits". See [[editEIDR]].

Since schema.org types like [[Movie]], [[TVEpisode]], [[TVSeason]], and [[TVSeries]] can be used for both works and their multiple expressions, it is possible to use [[titleEIDR]] alone (for a general description), or alongside [[editEIDR]] for a more edit-specific description.

AssignAction.name: AssignAction
AssignAction.help: The act of allocating an action/event/task to some destination (someone or something).

MediaSubscription.name: MediaSubscription
MediaSubscription.help: A subscription which allows a user to access media including audio, video, books, etc.

inputs.name: authenticator
inputs.label: authenticator
inputs.help: The Organization responsible for authenticating the user's subscription. For example, many media apps require a cable/satellite provider to authenticate your subscription before playing media.

inputs.name: expectsAcceptanceOf
inputs.label: expectsAcceptanceOf
inputs.help: An Offer which must be accepted before the user can perform the Action. For example, the user may need to buy a movie before being able to watch it.

Certification.name: Certification
Certification.help: A Certification is an official and authoritative statement about a subject, for example a product, service, person, or organization. A certification is typically issued by an indendent certification body, for example a professional organization or government. It formally attests certain characteristics about the subject, for example Organizations can be ISO certified, Food products can be certified Organic or Vegan, a Person can be a certified professional, a Place can be certified for food processing. There are certifications for many domains: regulatory, organizational, recycling, food, efficiency, educational, ecological, etc. A certification is a form of credential, as are accreditations and licenses. Mapped from the [gs1:CertificationDetails](https://www.gs1.org/voc/CertificationDetails) class in the GS1 Web Vocabulary.

inputs.name: about
inputs.label: about
inputs.help: The subject matter of the content.

inputs.name: auditDate
inputs.label: auditDate
inputs.help: Date when a certification was last audited. See also  [gs1:certificationAuditDate](https://www.gs1.org/voc/certificationAuditDate).

inputs.name: certificationIdentification
inputs.label: certificationIdentification
inputs.help: Identifier of a certification instance (as registered with an independent certification body). Typically this identifier can be used to consult and verify the certification instance. See also [gs1:certificationIdentification](https://www.gs1.org/voc/certificationIdentification).

inputs.name: certificationStatus
inputs.label: certificationStatus
inputs.help: Indicates the current status of a certification: active or inactive. See also  [gs1:certificationStatus](https://www.gs1.org/voc/certificationStatus).

inputs.name: datePublished
inputs.label: datePublished
inputs.help: Date of first publication or broadcast. For example the date a [[CreativeWork]] was broadcast or a [[Certification]] was issued.

inputs.name: expires
inputs.label: expires
inputs.help: Date the content expires and is no longer useful or available. For example a [[VideoObject]] or [[NewsArticle]] whose availability or relevance is time-limited, a [[ClaimReview]] fact check whose publisher wants to indicate that it may no longer be relevant (or helpful to highlight) after some date, or a [[Certification]] the validity has expired.

inputs.name: hasMeasurement
inputs.label: hasMeasurement
inputs.help: A measurement of an item, For example, the inseam of pants, the wheel size of a bicycle, the gauge of a screw, or the carbon footprint measured for certification by an authority. Usually an exact measurement, but can also be a range of measurements for adjustable products, for example belts and ski bindings.

inputs.name: issuedBy
inputs.label: issuedBy
inputs.help: The organization issuing the item, for example a [[Permit]], [[Ticket]], or [[Certification]].

inputs.name: logo
inputs.label: logo
inputs.help: An associated logo.

inputs.name: validFrom
inputs.label: validFrom
inputs.help: The date when the item becomes valid.

inputs.name: validIn
inputs.label: validIn
inputs.help: The geographic area where the item is valid. Applies for example to a [[Permit]], a [[Certification]], or an [[EducationalOccupationalCredential]].

PerformingArtsTheater.name: PerformingArtsTheater
PerformingArtsTheater.help: A theater or other performing art center.

MoneyTransfer.name: MoneyTransfer
MoneyTransfer.help: The act of transferring money from one place to another place. This may occur electronically or physically.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.label: amount
inputs.help: The amount of money.

inputs.name: beneficiaryBank
inputs.label: beneficiaryBank
inputs.help: A bank or bank’s branch, financial institution or international financial institution operating the beneficiary’s bank account or releasing funds for the beneficiary.

NewsArticle.name: NewsArticle
NewsArticle.help:
A NewsArticle is an article whose content reports news, or provides background context and supporting materials for understanding the news.

A more detailed overview of [schema.org News markup](/docs/news.html) is also available.

inputs.name: dateline
inputs.label: dateline
inputs.help:
A [dateline](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dateline) is a brief piece of text included in news articles that describes where and when the story was written or filed though the date is often omitted. Sometimes only a placename is provided.

Structured representations of dateline-related information can also be expressed more explicitly using [[locationCreated]] (which represents where a work was created, e.g. where a news report was written).  For location depicted or described in the content, use [[contentLocation]].

Dateline summaries are oriented more towards human readers than towards automated processing, and can vary substantially. Some examples: "BEIRUT, Lebanon, June 2.", "Paris, France", "December 19, 2017 11:43AM Reporting from Washington", "Beijing/Moscow", "QUEZON CITY, Philippines".

inputs.name: printColumn
inputs.label: printColumn
inputs.help: The number of the column in which the NewsArticle appears in the print edition.

inputs.name: printEdition
inputs.label: printEdition
inputs.help: The edition of the print product in which the NewsArticle appears.

inputs.name: printPage
inputs.label: printPage
inputs.help: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the name of the page on which the article is found. Please note that this field is intended for the exact page name (e.g. A5, B18).

inputs.name: printSection
inputs.label: printSection
inputs.help: If this NewsArticle appears in print, this field indicates the print section in which the article appeared.

DiscussionForumPosting.name: DiscussionForumPosting
DiscussionForumPosting.help: A posting to a discussion forum.

LoseAction.name: LoseAction
LoseAction.help: The act of being defeated in a competitive activity.

inputs.name: winner
inputs.label: winner
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The winner of the action.

LiveBlogPosting.name: LiveBlogPosting
LiveBlogPosting.help: A [[LiveBlogPosting]] is a [[BlogPosting]] intended to provide a rolling textual coverage of an ongoing event through continuous updates.

inputs.name: coverageEndTime
inputs.label: coverageEndTime
inputs.help: The time when the live blog will stop covering the Event. Note that coverage may continue after the Event concludes.

inputs.name: coverageStartTime
inputs.label: coverageStartTime
inputs.help: The time when the live blog will begin covering the Event. Note that coverage may begin before the Event's start time. The LiveBlogPosting may also be created before coverage begins.

inputs.name: liveBlogUpdate
inputs.label: liveBlogUpdate
inputs.help: An update to the LiveBlog.

ArchiveOrganization.name: ArchiveOrganization
ArchiveOrganization.help: An organization with archival holdings. An organization which keeps and preserves archival material and typically makes it accessible to the public.

inputs.name: archiveHeld
inputs.label: archiveHeld
inputs.help: Collection, [fonds](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Fonds), or item held, kept or maintained by an [[ArchiveOrganization]].

VideoGame.name: VideoGame
VideoGame.help: A video game is an electronic game that involves human interaction with a user interface to generate visual feedback on a video device.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: actors
inputs.label: actors
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: cheatCode
inputs.label: cheatCode
inputs.help: Cheat codes to the game.

inputs.name: director
inputs.label: director
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: directors
inputs.label: directors
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: gameEdition
inputs.label: gameEdition
inputs.help: The edition of a video game.

inputs.name: gamePlatform
inputs.label: gamePlatform
inputs.help: The electronic systems used to play video games.

inputs.name: gameServer
inputs.label: gameServer
inputs.help: The server on which  it is possible to play the game.

inputs.name: gameTip
inputs.label: gameTip
inputs.help: Links to tips, tactics, etc.

inputs.name: musicBy
inputs.label: musicBy
inputs.help: The composer of the soundtrack.

inputs.name: playMode
inputs.label: playMode
inputs.help: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.  The game can be marked as multi-player, co-op and single-player at the same time.

inputs.name: trailer
inputs.label: trailer
inputs.help: The trailer of a movie or TV/radio series, season, episode, etc.

AppendAction.name: AppendAction
AppendAction.help: The act of inserting at the end if an ordered collection.

TVClip.name: TVClip
TVClip.help: A short TV program or a segment/part of a TV program.

inputs.name: partOfTVSeries
inputs.label: partOfTVSeries
inputs.help: The TV series to which this episode or season belongs.

WPHeader.name: WPHeader
WPHeader.help: The header section of the page.

DrugLegalStatus.name: DrugLegalStatus
DrugLegalStatus.help: The legal availability status of a medical drug.

inputs.name: applicableLocation
inputs.label: applicableLocation
inputs.help: The location in which the status applies.

PodcastSeason.name: PodcastSeason
PodcastSeason.help: A single season of a podcast. Many podcasts do not break down into separate seasons. In that case, PodcastSeries should be used.

ProductGroup.name: ProductGroup
ProductGroup.help:
A ProductGroup represents a group of [[Product]]s that vary only in certain well-described ways, such as by [[size]], [[color]], [[material]] etc.

While a ProductGroup itself is not directly offered for sale, the various varying products that it represents can be. The ProductGroup serves as a prototype or template, standing in for all of the products who have an [[isVariantOf]] relationship to it. As such, properties (including additional types) can be applied to the ProductGroup to represent characteristics shared by each of the (possibly very many) variants. Properties that reference a ProductGroup are not included in this mechanism; neither are the following specific properties [[variesBy]], [[hasVariant]], [[url]].

inputs.name: hasVariant
inputs.label: hasVariant
inputs.help: Indicates a [[Product]] that is a member of this [[ProductGroup]] (or [[ProductModel]]).

inputs.name: productGroupID
inputs.label: productGroupID
inputs.help: Indicates a textual identifier for a ProductGroup.

inputs.name: variesBy
inputs.label: variesBy
inputs.help: Indicates the property or properties by which the variants in a [[ProductGroup]] vary, e.g. their size, color etc. Schema.org properties can be referenced by their short name e.g. "color"; terms defined elsewhere can be referenced with their URIs.

MarryAction.name: MarryAction
MarryAction.help: The act of marrying a person.

MedicalWebPage.name: MedicalWebPage
MedicalWebPage.help: A web page that provides medical information.

inputs.name: aspect
inputs.label: aspect
inputs.help: An aspect of medical practice that is considered on the page, such as 'diagnosis', 'treatment', 'causes', 'prognosis', 'etiology', 'epidemiology', etc.

inputs.name: medicalAudience
inputs.label: medicalAudience
inputs.help: Medical audience for page.

BloodTest.name: BloodTest
BloodTest.help: A medical test performed on a sample of a patient's blood.

MonetaryAmount.name: MonetaryAmount
MonetaryAmount.help: A monetary value or range. This type can be used to describe an amount of money such as $50 USD, or a range as in describing a bank account being suitable for a balance between £1,000 and £1,000,000 GBP, or the value of a salary, etc. It is recommended to use [[PriceSpecification]] Types to describe the price of an Offer, Invoice, etc.

inputs.name: currency
inputs.label: currency
inputs.help: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

inputs.name: maxValue
inputs.label: maxValue
inputs.help: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

inputs.name: minValue
inputs.label: minValue
inputs.help: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

inputs.name: validFrom
inputs.label: validFrom
inputs.help: The date when the item becomes valid.

inputs.name: validThrough
inputs.label: validThrough
inputs.help: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

inputs.name: value
inputs.label: value
inputs.help:
The value of a [[QuantitativeValue]] (including [[Observation]]) or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

MedicalIntangible.name: MedicalIntangible
MedicalIntangible.help: A utility class that serves as the umbrella for a number of 'intangible' things in the medical space.

CoverArt.name: CoverArt
CoverArt.help: The artwork on the outer surface of a CreativeWork.

ContactPointOption.name: ContactPointOption
ContactPointOption.help: Enumerated options related to a ContactPoint.

CreativeWorkSeries.name: CreativeWorkSeries
CreativeWorkSeries.help:
A CreativeWorkSeries in schema.org is a group of related items, typically but not necessarily of the same kind. CreativeWorkSeries are usually organized into some order, often chronological. Unlike [[ItemList]] which is a general purpose data structure for lists of things, the emphasis with CreativeWorkSeries is on published materials (written e.g. books and periodicals, or media such as TV, radio and games).

Specific subtypes are available for describing [[TVSeries]], [[RadioSeries]], [[MovieSeries]], [[BookSeries]], [[Periodical]] and [[VideoGameSeries]]. In each case, the [[hasPart]] / [[isPartOf]] properties can be used to relate the CreativeWorkSeries to its parts. The general CreativeWorkSeries type serves largely just to organize these more specific and practical subtypes.

It is common for properties applicable to an item from the series to be usefully applied to the containing group. Schema.org attempts to anticipate some of these cases, but publishers should be free to apply properties of the series parts to the series as a whole wherever they seem appropriate.

inputs.name: endDate
inputs.label: endDate
inputs.help: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: issn
inputs.label: issn
inputs.help: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

inputs.name: startDate
inputs.label: startDate
inputs.help: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

PlaceOfWorship.name: PlaceOfWorship
PlaceOfWorship.help: Place of worship, such as a church, synagogue, or mosque.

DefinedTermSet.name: DefinedTermSet
DefinedTermSet.help: A set of defined terms, for example a set of categories or a classification scheme, a glossary, dictionary or enumeration.

inputs.name: hasDefinedTerm
inputs.label: hasDefinedTerm
inputs.help: A Defined Term contained in this term set.

ReturnLabelSourceEnumeration.name: ReturnLabelSourceEnumeration
ReturnLabelSourceEnumeration.help: Enumerates several types of return labels for product returns.

ScheduleAction.name: ScheduleAction
ScheduleAction.help:
Scheduling future actions, events, or tasks.

Related actions:

* [[ReserveAction]]: Unlike ReserveAction, ScheduleAction allocates future actions (e.g. an event, a task, etc) towards a time slot / spatial allocation.

Patient.name: Patient
Patient.help: A patient is any person recipient of health care services.

inputs.name: diagnosis
inputs.label: diagnosis
inputs.help: One or more alternative conditions considered in the differential diagnosis process as output of a diagnosis process.

inputs.name: drug
inputs.label: drug
inputs.help: Specifying a drug or medicine used in a medication procedure.

inputs.name: healthCondition
inputs.label: healthCondition
inputs.help: Specifying the health condition(s) of a patient, medical study, or other target audience.

StatisticalVariable.name: StatisticalVariable
StatisticalVariable.help: [[StatisticalVariable]] represents any type of statistical metric that can be measured at a place and time. The usage pattern for [[StatisticalVariable]] is typically expressed using [[Observation]] with an explicit [[populationType]], which is a type, typically drawn from Schema.org. Each [[StatisticalVariable]] is marked as a [[ConstraintNode]], meaning that some properties (those listed using [[constraintProperty]]) serve in this setting solely to define the statistical variable rather than literally describe a specific person, place or thing. For example, a [[StatisticalVariable]] Median_Height_Person_Female representing the median height of women, could be written as follows: the population type is [[Person]]; the measuredProperty [[height]]; the [[statType]] [[median]]; the [[gender]] [[Female]]. It is important to note that there are many kinds of scientific quantitative observation which are not fully, perfectly or unambiguously described following this pattern, or with solely Schema.org terminology. The approach taken here is designed to allow partial, incremental or minimal description of [[StatisticalVariable]]s, and the use of detailed sets of entity and property IDs from external repositories. The [[measurementMethod]], [[unitCode]] and [[unitText]] properties can also be used to clarify the specific nature and notation of an observed measurement.

inputs.name: measuredProperty
inputs.label: measuredProperty
inputs.help: The measuredProperty of an [[Observation]], typically via its [[StatisticalVariable]]. There are various kinds of applicable [[Property]]: a schema.org property, a property from other RDF-compatible systems, e.g. W3C RDF Data Cube, Data Commons, Wikidata, or schema.org extensions such as [GS1's](https://www.gs1.org/voc/?show=properties).

inputs.name: measurementDenominator
inputs.label: measurementDenominator
inputs.help: Identifies the denominator variable when an observation represents a ratio or percentage.

inputs.name: measurementMethod
inputs.label: measurementMethod
inputs.help: A subproperty of [[measurementTechnique]] that can be used for specifying specific methods, in particular via [[MeasurementMethodEnum]].

inputs.name: measurementQualifier
inputs.label: measurementQualifier
inputs.help: Provides additional qualification to an observation. For example, a GDP observation measures the Nominal value.

inputs.name: measurementTechnique
inputs.label: measurementTechnique
inputs.help:
A technique, method or technology used in an [[Observation]], [[StatisticalVariable]] or [[Dataset]] (or [[DataDownload]], [[DataCatalog]]), corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (for datasets, described using [[variableMeasured]]; for [[Observation]], a [[StatisticalVariable]]). Often but not necessarily each [[variableMeasured]] will have an explicit representation as (or mapping to) an property such as those defined in Schema.org, or other RDF vocabularies and "knowledge graphs". In that case the subproperty of [[variableMeasured]] called [[measuredProperty]] is applicable.
    
The [[measurementTechnique]] property helps when extra clarification is needed about how a [[measuredProperty]] was measured. This is oriented towards scientific and scholarly dataset publication but may have broader applicability; it is not intended as a full representation of measurement, but can often serve as a high level summary for dataset discovery. 

For example, if [[variableMeasured]] is: molecule concentration, [[measurementTechnique]] could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence". If the [[variableMeasured]] is "depression rating", the [[measurementTechnique]] could be "Zung Scale" or "HAM-D" or "Beck Depression Inventory". 

If there are several [[variableMeasured]] properties recorded for some given data object, use a [[PropertyValue]] for each [[variableMeasured]] and attach the corresponding [[measurementTechnique]]. The value can also be from an enumeration, organized as a [[MeasurementMetholdEnumeration]].

inputs.name: populationType
inputs.label: populationType
inputs.help: Indicates the populationType common to all members of a [[StatisticalPopulation]] or all cases within the scope of a [[StatisticalVariable]].

inputs.name: statType
inputs.label: statType
inputs.help: Indicates the kind of statistic represented by a [[StatisticalVariable]], e.g. mean, count etc. The value of statType is a property, either from within Schema.org (e.g. [[count]], [[median]], [[marginOfError]], [[maxValue]], [[minValue]]) or from other compatible (e.g. RDF) systems such as DataCommons.org or Wikidata.org.

EducationalOccupationalProgram.name: EducationalOccupationalProgram
EducationalOccupationalProgram.help: A program offered by an institution which determines the learning progress to achieve an outcome, usually a credential like a degree or certificate. This would define a discrete set of opportunities (e.g., job, courses) that together constitute a program with a clear start, end, set of requirements, and transition to a new occupational opportunity (e.g., a job), or sometimes a higher educational opportunity (e.g., an advanced degree).

inputs.name: applicationDeadline
inputs.label: applicationDeadline
inputs.help: The date at which the program stops collecting applications for the next enrollment cycle.

inputs.name: applicationStartDate
inputs.label: applicationStartDate
inputs.help: The date at which the program begins collecting applications for the next enrollment cycle.

inputs.name: dayOfWeek
inputs.label: dayOfWeek
inputs.help: The day of the week for which these opening hours are valid.

inputs.name: educationalCredentialAwarded
inputs.label: educationalCredentialAwarded
inputs.help: A description of the qualification, award, certificate, diploma or other educational credential awarded as a consequence of successful completion of this course or program.

inputs.name: educationalProgramMode
inputs.label: educationalProgramMode
inputs.help: Similar to courseMode, the medium or means of delivery of the program as a whole. The value may either be a text label (e.g. "online", "onsite" or "blended"; "synchronous" or "asynchronous"; "full-time" or "part-time") or a URL reference to a term from a controlled vocabulary (e.g. https://ceds.ed.gov/element/001311#Asynchronous ).

inputs.name: endDate
inputs.label: endDate
inputs.help: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: financialAidEligible
inputs.label: financialAidEligible
inputs.help: A financial aid type or program which students may use to pay for tuition or fees associated with the program.

inputs.name: hasCourse
inputs.label: hasCourse
inputs.help: A course or class that is one of the learning opportunities that constitute an educational / occupational program. No information is implied about whether the course is mandatory or optional; no guarantee is implied about whether the course will be available to everyone on the program.

inputs.name: maximumEnrollment
inputs.label: maximumEnrollment
inputs.help: The maximum number of students who may be enrolled in the program.

inputs.name: numberOfCredits
inputs.label: numberOfCredits
inputs.help: The number of credits or units awarded by a Course or required to complete an EducationalOccupationalProgram.

inputs.name: occupationalCategory
inputs.label: occupationalCategory
inputs.help:
A category describing the job, preferably using a term from a taxonomy such as [BLS O*NET-SOC](http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html), [ISCO-08](https://www.ilo.org/public/english/bureau/stat/isco/isco08/) or similar, with the property repeated for each applicable value. Ideally the taxonomy should be identified, and both the textual label and formal code for the category should be provided.\n
Note: for historical reasons, any textual label and formal code provided as a literal may be assumed to be from O*NET-SOC.

inputs.name: occupationalCredentialAwarded
inputs.label: occupationalCredentialAwarded
inputs.help: A description of the qualification, award, certificate, diploma or other occupational credential awarded as a consequence of successful completion of this course or program.

inputs.name: offers
inputs.label: offers
inputs.help: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

inputs.name: programPrerequisites
inputs.label: programPrerequisites
inputs.help: Prerequisites for enrolling in the program.

inputs.name: programType
inputs.label: programType
inputs.help: The type of educational or occupational program. For example, classroom, internship, alternance, etc.

inputs.name: provider
inputs.label: provider
inputs.help: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

inputs.name: salaryUponCompletion
inputs.label: salaryUponCompletion
inputs.help: The expected salary upon completing the training.

inputs.name: startDate
inputs.label: startDate
inputs.help: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: termDuration
inputs.label: termDuration
inputs.help: The amount of time in a term as defined by the institution. A term is a length of time where students take one or more classes. Semesters and quarters are common units for term.

inputs.name: termsPerYear
inputs.label: termsPerYear
inputs.help: The number of times terms of study are offered per year. Semesters and quarters are common units for term. For example, if the student can only take 2 semesters for the program in one year, then termsPerYear should be 2.

inputs.name: timeOfDay
inputs.label: timeOfDay
inputs.help: The time of day the program normally runs. For example, "evenings".

inputs.name: timeToComplete
inputs.label: timeToComplete
inputs.help: The expected length of time to complete the program if attending full-time.

inputs.name: trainingSalary
inputs.label: trainingSalary
inputs.help: The estimated salary earned while in the program.

inputs.name: typicalCreditsPerTerm
inputs.label: typicalCreditsPerTerm
inputs.help: The number of credits or units a full-time student would be expected to take in 1 term however 'term' is defined by the institution.

CollegeOrUniversity.name: CollegeOrUniversity
CollegeOrUniversity.help: A college, university, or other third-level educational institution.

inputs.name: screenCount
inputs.label: screenCount
inputs.help: The number of screens in the movie theater.

DeliveryEvent.name: DeliveryEvent
DeliveryEvent.help: An event involving the delivery of an item.

inputs.name: accessCode
inputs.label: accessCode
inputs.help: Password, PIN, or access code needed for delivery (e.g. from a locker).

inputs.name: availableFrom
inputs.label: availableFrom
inputs.help: When the item is available for pickup from the store, locker, etc.

inputs.name: availableThrough
inputs.label: availableThrough
inputs.help: After this date, the item will no longer be available for pickup.

inputs.name: hasDeliveryMethod
inputs.label: hasDeliveryMethod
inputs.help: Method used for delivery or shipping.

BusTrip.name: BusTrip
BusTrip.help: A trip on a commercial bus line.

inputs.name: arrivalBusStop
inputs.label: arrivalBusStop
inputs.help: The stop or station from which the bus arrives.

inputs.name: busName
inputs.label: busName
inputs.help: The name of the bus (e.g. Bolt Express).

inputs.name: busNumber
inputs.label: busNumber
inputs.help: The unique identifier for the bus.

inputs.name: departureBusStop
inputs.label: departureBusStop
inputs.help: The stop or station from which the bus departs.

HowToDirection.name: HowToDirection
HowToDirection.help: A direction indicating a single action to do in the instructions for how to achieve a result.

inputs.name: afterMedia
inputs.label: afterMedia
inputs.help: A media object representing the circumstances after performing this direction.

inputs.name: beforeMedia
inputs.label: beforeMedia
inputs.help: A media object representing the circumstances before performing this direction.

inputs.name: duringMedia
inputs.label: duringMedia
inputs.help: A media object representing the circumstances while performing this direction.

inputs.name: performTime
inputs.label: performTime
inputs.help: The length of time it takes to perform instructions or a direction (not including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: prepTime
inputs.label: prepTime
inputs.help: The length of time it takes to prepare the items to be used in instructions or a direction, in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: supply
inputs.label: supply
inputs.help: A sub-property of instrument. A supply consumed when performing instructions or a direction.

inputs.name: tool
inputs.label: tool
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. An object used (but not consumed) when performing instructions or a direction.

inputs.name: totalTime
inputs.label: totalTime
inputs.help: The total time required to perform instructions or a direction (including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

DepartAction.name: DepartAction
DepartAction.help: The act of  departing from a place. An agent departs from a fromLocation for a destination, optionally with participants.

ServiceChannel.name: ServiceChannel
ServiceChannel.help: A means for accessing a service, e.g. a government office location, web site, or phone number.

inputs.name: availableLanguage
inputs.label: availableLanguage
inputs.help: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]].

inputs.name: processingTime
inputs.label: processingTime
inputs.help: Estimated processing time for the service using this channel.

inputs.name: providesService
inputs.label: providesService
inputs.help: The service provided by this channel.

inputs.name: serviceLocation
inputs.label: serviceLocation
inputs.help: The location (e.g. civic structure, local business, etc.) where a person can go to access the service.

inputs.name: servicePhone
inputs.label: servicePhone
inputs.help: The phone number to use to access the service.

inputs.name: servicePostalAddress
inputs.label: servicePostalAddress
inputs.help: The address for accessing the service by mail.

inputs.name: serviceSmsNumber
inputs.label: serviceSmsNumber
inputs.help: The number to access the service by text message.

inputs.name: serviceUrl
inputs.label: serviceUrl
inputs.help: The website to access the service.

HealthPlanFormulary.name: HealthPlanFormulary
HealthPlanFormulary.help: For a given health insurance plan, the specification for costs and coverage of prescription drugs.

inputs.name: healthPlanCostSharing
inputs.label: healthPlanCostSharing
inputs.help: The costs to the patient for services under this network or formulary.

inputs.name: healthPlanDrugTier
inputs.label: healthPlanDrugTier
inputs.help: The tier(s) of drugs offered by this formulary or insurance plan.

inputs.name: offersPrescriptionByMail
inputs.label: offersPrescriptionByMail
inputs.help: Whether prescriptions can be delivered by mail.

Grant.name: Grant
Grant.help:
A grant, typically financial or otherwise quantifiable, of resources. Typically a [[funder]] sponsors some [[MonetaryAmount]] to an [[Organization]] or [[Person]],
    sometimes not necessarily via a dedicated or long-lived [[Project]], resulting in one or more outputs, or [[fundedItem]]s. For financial sponsorship, indicate the [[funder]] of a [[MonetaryGrant]]. For non-financial support, indicate [[sponsor]] of [[Grant]]s of resources (e.g. office space).

Grants support  activities directed towards some agreed collective goals, often but not always organized as [[Project]]s. Long-lived projects are sometimes sponsored by a variety of grants over time, but it is also common for a project to be associated with a single grant.

The amount of a [[Grant]] is represented using [[amount]] as a [[MonetaryAmount]].

inputs.name: fundedItem
inputs.label: fundedItem
inputs.help: Indicates something directly or indirectly funded or sponsored through a [[Grant]]. See also [[ownershipFundingInfo]].

inputs.name: funder
inputs.label: funder
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

inputs.name: sponsor
inputs.label: sponsor
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. E.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

SizeSystemEnumeration.name: SizeSystemEnumeration
SizeSystemEnumeration.help: Enumerates common size systems for different categories of products, for example "EN-13402" or "UK" for wearables or "Imperial" for screws.

DrugPregnancyCategory.name: DrugPregnancyCategory
DrugPregnancyCategory.help: Categories that represent an assessment of the risk of fetal injury due to a drug or pharmaceutical used as directed by the mother during pregnancy.

EngineSpecification.name: EngineSpecification
EngineSpecification.help: Information about the engine of the vehicle. A vehicle can have multiple engines represented by multiple engine specification entities.

inputs.name: engineDisplacement
inputs.label: engineDisplacement
inputs.help:
The volume swept by all of the pistons inside the cylinders of an internal combustion engine in a single movement. 

Typical unit code(s): CMQ for cubic centimeter, LTR for liters, INQ for cubic inches
* Note 1: You can link to information about how the given value has been determined using the [[valueReference]] property.
* Note 2: You can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

inputs.name: enginePower
inputs.label: enginePower
inputs.help:
The power of the vehicle's engine.
    Typical unit code(s): KWT for kilowatt, BHP for brake horsepower, N12 for metric horsepower (PS, with 1 PS = 735,49875 W)

* Note 1: There are many different ways of measuring an engine's power. For an overview, see  [http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horsepower#Engine\_power\_test\_codes](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Horsepower#Engine_power_test_codes).
* Note 2: You can link to information about how the given value has been determined using the [[valueReference]] property.
* Note 3: You can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

inputs.name: engineType
inputs.label: engineType
inputs.help: The type of engine or engines powering the vehicle.

inputs.name: fuelType
inputs.label: fuelType
inputs.help: The type of fuel suitable for the engine or engines of the vehicle. If the vehicle has only one engine, this property can be attached directly to the vehicle.

inputs.name: torque
inputs.label: torque
inputs.help:
The torque (turning force) of the vehicle's engine.

Typical unit code(s): NU for newton metre (N m), F17 for pound-force per foot, or F48 for pound-force per inch

* Note 1: You can link to information about how the given value has been determined (e.g. reference RPM) using the [[valueReference]] property.
* Note 2: You can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

PaymentMethod.name: PaymentMethod
PaymentMethod.help:
A payment method is a standardized procedure for transferring the monetary amount for a purchase. Payment methods are characterized by the legal and technical structures used, and by the organization or group carrying out the transaction.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByBankTransferInAdvance
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ByInvoice
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Cash
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#CheckInAdvance
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#COD
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DirectDebit
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#GoogleCheckout
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PayPal
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PaySwarm

PriceSpecification.name: PriceSpecification
PriceSpecification.help: A structured value representing a price or price range. Typically, only the subclasses of this type are used for markup. It is recommended to use [[MonetaryAmount]] to describe independent amounts of money such as a salary, credit card limits, etc.

inputs.name: eligibleQuantity
inputs.label: eligibleQuantity
inputs.help: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

inputs.name: eligibleTransactionVolume
inputs.label: eligibleTransactionVolume
inputs.help: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

inputs.name: maxPrice
inputs.label: maxPrice
inputs.help: The highest price if the price is a range.

inputs.name: minPrice
inputs.label: minPrice
inputs.help: The lowest price if the price is a range.

inputs.name: price
inputs.label: price
inputs.help:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

* Use the [[priceCurrency]] property (with standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR") instead of including [ambiguous symbols](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign#Currencies_that_use_the_dollar_or_peso_sign) such as '$' in the value.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
* Note that both [RDFa](http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/#using-the-content-attribute) and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similar Unicode symbols.

inputs.name: priceCurrency
inputs.label: priceCurrency
inputs.help: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

inputs.name: validFrom
inputs.label: validFrom
inputs.help: The date when the item becomes valid.

inputs.name: validThrough
inputs.label: validThrough
inputs.help: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

inputs.name: valueAddedTaxIncluded
inputs.label: valueAddedTaxIncluded
inputs.help: Specifies whether the applicable value-added tax (VAT) is included in the price specification or not.

AMRadioChannel.name: AMRadioChannel
AMRadioChannel.help: A radio channel that uses AM.

PaymentChargeSpecification.name: PaymentChargeSpecification
PaymentChargeSpecification.help: The costs of settling the payment using a particular payment method.

inputs.name: appliesToDeliveryMethod
inputs.label: appliesToDeliveryMethod
inputs.help: The delivery method(s) to which the delivery charge or payment charge specification applies.

inputs.name: appliesToPaymentMethod
inputs.label: appliesToPaymentMethod
inputs.help: The payment method(s) to which the payment charge specification applies.

ItemAvailability.name: ItemAvailability
ItemAvailability.help: A list of possible product availability options.

ParentAudience.name: ParentAudience
ParentAudience.help: A set of characteristics describing parents, who can be interested in viewing some content.

inputs.name: childMaxAge
inputs.label: childMaxAge
inputs.help: Maximal age of the child.

inputs.name: childMinAge
inputs.label: childMinAge
inputs.help: Minimal age of the child.

HowToStep.name: HowToStep
HowToStep.help: A step in the instructions for how to achieve a result. It is an ordered list with HowToDirection and/or HowToTip items.

ApprovedIndication.name: ApprovedIndication
ApprovedIndication.help: An indication for a medical therapy that has been formally specified or approved by a regulatory body that regulates use of the therapy; for example, the US FDA approves indications for most drugs in the US.

MedicalRiskScore.name: MedicalRiskScore
MedicalRiskScore.help: A simple system that adds up the number of risk factors to yield a score that is associated with prognosis, e.g. CHAD score, TIMI risk score.

inputs.name: algorithm
inputs.label: algorithm
inputs.help: The algorithm or rules to follow to compute the score.

PodcastEpisode.name: PodcastEpisode
PodcastEpisode.help: A single episode of a podcast series.

MeasurementTypeEnumeration.name: MeasurementTypeEnumeration
MeasurementTypeEnumeration.help: Enumeration of common measurement types (or dimensions), for example "chest" for a person, "inseam" for pants, "gauge" for screws, or "wheel" for bicycles.

DiagnosticLab.name: DiagnosticLab
DiagnosticLab.help: A medical laboratory that offers on-site or off-site diagnostic services.

inputs.name: availableTest
inputs.label: availableTest
inputs.help: A diagnostic test or procedure offered by this lab.

HotelRoom.name: HotelRoom
HotelRoom.help:
A hotel room is a single room in a hotel.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

inputs.name: bed
inputs.label: bed
inputs.help:
The type of bed or beds included in the accommodation. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you use bed directly with a text.
      If you want to indicate the quantity of a certain kind of bed, use an instance of BedDetails. For more detailed information, use the amenityFeature property.

inputs.name: occupancy
inputs.label: occupancy
inputs.help:
The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person).
Typical unit code(s): C62 for person.

Thing.name: Thing
Thing.help: The most generic type of item.

inputs.name: additionalType
inputs.label: additionalType
inputs.help: An additional type for the item, typically used for adding more specific types from external vocabularies in microdata syntax. This is a relationship between something and a class that the thing is in. Typically the value is a URI-identified RDF class, and in this case corresponds to the use of rdf:type in RDF. Text values can be used sparingly, for cases where useful information can be added without their being an appropriate schema to reference. In the case of text values, the class label should follow the schema.org style guide.

inputs.name: alternateName
inputs.label: alternateName
inputs.help: An alias for the item.

inputs.name: description
inputs.label: description
inputs.help: A description of the item.

inputs.name: disambiguatingDescription
inputs.label: disambiguatingDescription
inputs.help: A sub property of description. A short description of the item used to disambiguate from other, similar items. Information from other properties (in particular, name) may be necessary for the description to be useful for disambiguation.

inputs.name: identifier
inputs.label: identifier
inputs.help: The identifier property represents any kind of identifier for any kind of [[Thing]], such as ISBNs, GTIN codes, UUIDs etc. Schema.org provides dedicated properties for representing many of these, either as textual strings or as URL (URI) links. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#identifierBg) for more details.

inputs.name: image
inputs.label: image
inputs.help: An image of the item. This can be a [[URL]] or a fully described [[ImageObject]].

inputs.name: mainEntityOfPage
inputs.label: mainEntityOfPage
inputs.help: Indicates a page (or other CreativeWork) for which this thing is the main entity being described. See [background notes](/docs/datamodel.html#mainEntityBackground) for details.

inputs.name: name
inputs.label: name
inputs.help: The name of the item.

inputs.name: potentialAction
inputs.label: potentialAction
inputs.help: Indicates a potential Action, which describes an idealized action in which this thing would play an 'object' role.

inputs.name: sameAs
inputs.label: sameAs
inputs.help: URL of a reference Web page that unambiguously indicates the item's identity. E.g. the URL of the item's Wikipedia page, Wikidata entry, or official website.

inputs.name: subjectOf
inputs.label: subjectOf
inputs.help: A CreativeWork or Event about this Thing.

inputs.name: url
inputs.label: url
inputs.help: URL of the item.

WearAction.name: WearAction
WearAction.help: The act of dressing oneself in clothing.

Event.name: Event
Event.help: An event happening at a certain time and location, such as a concert, lecture, or festival. Ticketing information may be added via the [[offers]] property. Repeated events may be structured as separate Event objects.

inputs.name: about
inputs.label: about
inputs.help: The subject matter of the content.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: aggregateRating
inputs.label: aggregateRating
inputs.help: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

inputs.name: attendee
inputs.label: attendee
inputs.help: A person or organization attending the event.

inputs.name: attendees
inputs.label: attendees
inputs.help: A person attending the event.

inputs.name: audience
inputs.label: audience
inputs.help: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

inputs.name: composer
inputs.label: composer
inputs.help: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

inputs.name: contributor
inputs.label: contributor
inputs.help: A secondary contributor to the CreativeWork or Event.

inputs.name: director
inputs.label: director
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: doorTime
inputs.label: doorTime
inputs.help: The time admission will commence.

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: duration
inputs.help: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: endDate
inputs.label: endDate
inputs.help: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: eventAttendanceMode
inputs.label: eventAttendanceMode
inputs.help: The eventAttendanceMode of an event indicates whether it occurs online, offline, or a mix.

inputs.name: eventSchedule
inputs.label: eventSchedule
inputs.help:
Associates an [[Event]] with a [[Schedule]]. There are circumstances where it is preferable to share a schedule for a series of
      repeating events rather than data on the individual events themselves. For example, a website or application might prefer to publish a schedule for a weekly
      gym class rather than provide data on every event. A schedule could be processed by applications to add forthcoming events to a calendar. An [[Event]] that
      is associated with a [[Schedule]] using this property should not have [[startDate]] or [[endDate]] properties. These are instead defined within the associated
      [[Schedule]], this avoids any ambiguity for clients using the data. The property might have repeated values to specify different schedules, e.g. for different months
      or seasons.

inputs.name: eventStatus
inputs.label: eventStatus
inputs.help: An eventStatus of an event represents its status; particularly useful when an event is cancelled or rescheduled.

inputs.name: funder
inputs.label: funder
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports (sponsors) something through some kind of financial contribution.

inputs.name: funding
inputs.label: funding
inputs.help: A [[Grant]] that directly or indirectly provide funding or sponsorship for this item. See also [[ownershipFundingInfo]].

inputs.name: inLanguage
inputs.label: inLanguage
inputs.help: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

inputs.name: isAccessibleForFree
inputs.label: isAccessibleForFree
inputs.help: A flag to signal that the item, event, or place is accessible for free.

inputs.name: keywords
inputs.label: keywords
inputs.help: Keywords or tags used to describe some item. Multiple textual entries in a keywords list are typically delimited by commas, or by repeating the property.

inputs.name: location
inputs.label: location
inputs.help: The location of, for example, where an event is happening, where an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

inputs.name: maximumAttendeeCapacity
inputs.label: maximumAttendeeCapacity
inputs.help: The total number of individuals that may attend an event or venue.

inputs.name: maximumPhysicalAttendeeCapacity
inputs.label: maximumPhysicalAttendeeCapacity
inputs.help: The maximum physical attendee capacity of an [[Event]] whose [[eventAttendanceMode]] is [[OfflineEventAttendanceMode]] (or the offline aspects, in the case of a [[MixedEventAttendanceMode]]).

inputs.name: maximumVirtualAttendeeCapacity
inputs.label: maximumVirtualAttendeeCapacity
inputs.help: The maximum virtual attendee capacity of an [[Event]] whose [[eventAttendanceMode]] is [[OnlineEventAttendanceMode]] (or the online aspects, in the case of a [[MixedEventAttendanceMode]]).

inputs.name: offers
inputs.label: offers
inputs.help: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

inputs.name: organizer
inputs.label: organizer
inputs.help: An organizer of an Event.

inputs.name: performer
inputs.label: performer
inputs.help: A performer at the event—for example, a presenter, musician, musical group or actor.

inputs.name: performers
inputs.label: performers
inputs.help: The main performer or performers of the event—for example, a presenter, musician, or actor.

inputs.name: previousStartDate
inputs.label: previousStartDate
inputs.help: Used in conjunction with eventStatus for rescheduled or cancelled events. This property contains the previously scheduled start date. For rescheduled events, the startDate property should be used for the newly scheduled start date. In the (rare) case of an event that has been postponed and rescheduled multiple times, this field may be repeated.

inputs.name: recordedIn
inputs.label: recordedIn
inputs.help: The CreativeWork that captured all or part of this Event.

inputs.name: remainingAttendeeCapacity
inputs.label: remainingAttendeeCapacity
inputs.help: The number of attendee places for an event that remain unallocated.

inputs.name: review
inputs.label: review
inputs.help: A review of the item.

inputs.name: sponsor
inputs.label: sponsor
inputs.help: A person or organization that supports a thing through a pledge, promise, or financial contribution. E.g. a sponsor of a Medical Study or a corporate sponsor of an event.

inputs.name: startDate
inputs.label: startDate
inputs.help: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: subEvent
inputs.label: subEvent
inputs.help: An Event that is part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each of which is a subEvent of the conference.

inputs.name: subEvents
inputs.label: subEvents
inputs.help: Events that are a part of this event. For example, a conference event includes many presentations, each subEvents of the conference.

inputs.name: superEvent
inputs.label: superEvent
inputs.help: An event that this event is a part of. For example, a collection of individual music performances might each have a music festival as their superEvent.

inputs.name: translator
inputs.label: translator
inputs.help: Organization or person who adapts a creative work to different languages, regional differences and technical requirements of a target market, or that translates during some event.

inputs.name: typicalAgeRange
inputs.label: typicalAgeRange
inputs.help: The typical expected age range, e.g. '7-9', '11-'.

inputs.name: workFeatured
inputs.label: workFeatured
inputs.help:
A work featured in some event, e.g. exhibited in an ExhibitionEvent.
       Specific subproperties are available for workPerformed (e.g. a play), or a workPresented (a Movie at a ScreeningEvent).

inputs.name: workPerformed
inputs.label: workPerformed
inputs.help: A work performed in some event, for example a play performed in a TheaterEvent.

WebPageElement.name: WebPageElement
WebPageElement.help: A web page element, like a table or an image.

inputs.name: cssSelector
inputs.label: cssSelector
inputs.help: A CSS selector, e.g. of a [[SpeakableSpecification]] or [[WebPageElement]]. In the latter case, multiple matches within a page can constitute a single conceptual "Web page element".

inputs.name: xpath
inputs.label: xpath
inputs.help: An XPath, e.g. of a [[SpeakableSpecification]] or [[WebPageElement]]. In the latter case, multiple matches within a page can constitute a single conceptual "Web page element".

House.name: House
House.help: A house is a building or structure that has the ability to be occupied for habitation by humans or other creatures (source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/House).

inputs.name: numberOfRooms
inputs.label: numberOfRooms
inputs.help:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

ReturnAction.name: ReturnAction
ReturnAction.help: The act of returning to the origin that which was previously received (concrete objects) or taken (ownership).

inputs.name: recipient
inputs.label: recipient
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

TrainReservation.name: TrainReservation
TrainReservation.help: A reservation for train travel.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

inputs.name: caption
inputs.label: caption
inputs.help: The caption for this object. For downloadable machine formats (closed caption, subtitles etc.) use MediaObject and indicate the [[encodingFormat]].

inputs.name: embeddedTextCaption
inputs.label: embeddedTextCaption
inputs.help: Represents textual captioning from a [[MediaObject]], e.g. text of a 'meme'.

inputs.name: exifData
inputs.label: exifData
inputs.help: exif data for this object.

inputs.name: representativeOfPage
inputs.label: representativeOfPage
inputs.help: Indicates whether this image is representative of the content of the page.

BusinessFunction.name: BusinessFunction
BusinessFunction.help:
The business function specifies the type of activity or access (i.e., the bundle of rights) offered by the organization or business person through the offer. Typical are sell, rental or lease, maintenance or repair, manufacture / produce, recycle / dispose, engineering / construction, or installation. Proprietary specifications of access rights are also instances of this class.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ConstructionInstallation
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Dispose
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#LeaseOut
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Maintain
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#ProvideService
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Repair
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Buy

MonetaryAmountDistribution.name: MonetaryAmountDistribution
MonetaryAmountDistribution.help: A statistical distribution of monetary amounts.

inputs.name: currency
inputs.label: currency
