inputs.help: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

BorrowAction.name: BorrowAction
BorrowAction.help:
The act of obtaining an object under an agreement to return it at a later date. Reciprocal of LendAction.

Related actions:

* [[LendAction]]: Reciprocal of BorrowAction.

inputs.name: lender
inputs.label: lender
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The person that lends the object being borrowed.

ImageObjectSnapshot.name: ImageObjectSnapshot
ImageObjectSnapshot.help: A specific and exact (byte-for-byte) version of an [[ImageObject]]. Two byte-for-byte identical files, for the purposes of this type, considered identical. If they have different embedded metadata (e.g. XMP, EXIF) the files will differ. Different external facts about the files, e.g. creator or dateCreated that aren't represented in their actual content, do not affect this notion of identity.

Role.name: Role
Role.help: Represents additional information about a relationship or property. For example a Role can be used to say that a 'member' role linking some SportsTeam to a player occurred during a particular time period. Or that a Person's 'actor' role in a Movie was for some particular characterName. Such properties can be attached to a Role entity, which is then associated with the main entities using ordinary properties like 'member' or 'actor'.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/06/introducing-role.html).

inputs.name: endDate
inputs.label: endDate
inputs.help: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: namedPosition
inputs.label: namedPosition
inputs.help: A position played, performed or filled by a person or organization, as part of an organization. For example, an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

inputs.name: roleName
inputs.label: roleName
inputs.help: A role played, performed or filled by a person or organization. For example, the team of creators for a comic book might fill the roles named 'inker', 'penciller', and 'letterer'; or an athlete in a SportsTeam might play in the position named 'Quarterback'.

inputs.name: startDate
inputs.label: startDate
inputs.help: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

PodcastSeries.name: PodcastSeries
PodcastSeries.help: A podcast is an episodic series of digital audio or video files which a user can download and listen to.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: webFeed
inputs.label: webFeed
inputs.help: The URL for a feed, e.g. associated with a podcast series, blog, or series of date-stamped updates. This is usually RSS or Atom.

UserLikes.name: UserLikes
UserLikes.help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

TouristTrip.name: TouristTrip
TouristTrip.help:
A tourist trip. A created itinerary of visits to one or more places of interest ([[TouristAttraction]]/[[TouristDestination]]) often linked by a similar theme, geographic area, or interest to a particular [[touristType]]. The [UNWTO](http://www2.unwto.org/) defines tourism trip as the Trip taken by visitors.
  (See examples below.)

inputs.name: touristType
inputs.label: touristType
inputs.help: Attraction suitable for type(s) of tourist. E.g. children, visitors from a particular country, etc.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: actors
inputs.label: actors
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: characterAttribute
inputs.label: characterAttribute
inputs.help: A piece of data that represents a particular aspect of a fictional character (skill, power, character points, advantage, disadvantage).

inputs.name: cheatCode
inputs.label: cheatCode
inputs.help: Cheat codes to the game.

inputs.name: containsSeason
inputs.label: containsSeason
inputs.help: A season that is part of the media series.

inputs.name: director
inputs.label: director
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: directors
inputs.label: directors
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: episode
inputs.label: episode
inputs.help: An episode of a TV, radio or game media within a series or season.

inputs.name: episodes
inputs.label: episodes
inputs.help: An episode of a TV/radio series or season.

inputs.name: gameItem
inputs.label: gameItem
inputs.help: An item is an object within the game world that can be collected by a player or, occasionally, a non-player character.

inputs.name: gameLocation
inputs.label: gameLocation
inputs.help: Real or fictional location of the game (or part of game).

inputs.name: gamePlatform
inputs.label: gamePlatform
inputs.help: The electronic systems used to play video games.

inputs.name: musicBy
inputs.label: musicBy
inputs.help: The composer of the soundtrack.

inputs.name: numberOfEpisodes
inputs.label: numberOfEpisodes
inputs.help: The number of episodes in this season or series.

inputs.name: numberOfPlayers
inputs.label: numberOfPlayers
inputs.help: Indicate how many people can play this game (minimum, maximum, or range).

inputs.name: numberOfSeasons
inputs.label: numberOfSeasons
inputs.help: The number of seasons in this series.

inputs.name: playMode
inputs.label: playMode
inputs.help: Indicates whether this game is multi-player, co-op or single-player.  The game can be marked as multi-player, co-op and single-player at the same time.

inputs.name: productionCompany
inputs.label: productionCompany
inputs.help: The production company or studio responsible for the item, e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

inputs.name: quest
inputs.label: quest
inputs.help: The task that a player-controlled character, or group of characters may complete in order to gain a reward.

inputs.name: season
inputs.label: season
inputs.help: A season in a media series.

inputs.name: seasons
inputs.label: seasons
inputs.help: A season in a media series.

inputs.name: trailer
inputs.label: trailer
inputs.help: The trailer of a movie or TV/radio series, season, episode, etc.

Vein.name: Vein
Vein.help: A type of blood vessel that specifically carries blood to the heart.

inputs.name: drainsTo
inputs.label: drainsTo
inputs.help: The vasculature that the vein drains into.

inputs.name: regionDrained
inputs.label: regionDrained
inputs.help: The anatomical or organ system drained by this vessel; generally refers to a specific part of an organ.

inputs.name: tributary
inputs.label: tributary
inputs.help: The anatomical or organ system that the vein flows into; a larger structure that the vein connects to.

MediaManipulationRatingEnumeration.name: MediaManipulationRatingEnumeration
MediaManipulationRatingEnumeration.help: Codes for use with the [[mediaAuthenticityCategory]] property, indicating the authenticity of a media object (in the context of how it was published or shared). In general these codes are not mutually exclusive, although some combinations (such as 'original' versus 'transformed', 'edited' and 'staged') would be contradictory if applied in the same [[MediaReview]]. Note that the application of these codes is with regard to a piece of media shared or published in a particular context.

Quantity.name: Quantity
Quantity.help: Quantities such as distance, time, mass, weight, etc. Particular instances of say Mass are entities like '3 kg' or '4 milligrams'.

inputs.name: codeValue
inputs.label: codeValue
inputs.help: A short textual code that uniquely identifies the value.

inputs.name: inCodeSet
inputs.label: inCodeSet
inputs.help: A [[CategoryCodeSet]] that contains this category code.

IndividualProduct.name: IndividualProduct
IndividualProduct.help: A single, identifiable product instance (e.g. a laptop with a particular serial number).

inputs.name: serialNumber
inputs.label: serialNumber
inputs.help: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

DownloadAction.name: DownloadAction
DownloadAction.help: The act of downloading an object.

SuspendAction.name: SuspendAction
SuspendAction.help: The act of momentarily pausing a device or application (e.g. pause music playback or pause a timer).

LymphaticVessel.name: LymphaticVessel
LymphaticVessel.help: A type of blood vessel that specifically carries lymph fluid unidirectionally toward the heart.

inputs.name: originatesFrom
inputs.label: originatesFrom
inputs.help: The vasculature the lymphatic structure originates, or afferents, from.

inputs.name: regionDrained
inputs.label: regionDrained
inputs.help: The anatomical or organ system drained by this vessel; generally refers to a specific part of an organ.

inputs.name: runsTo
inputs.label: runsTo
inputs.help: The vasculature the lymphatic structure runs, or efferents, to.

HowToTip.name: HowToTip
HowToTip.help: An explanation in the instructions for how to achieve a result. It provides supplementary information about a technique, supply, author's preference, etc. It can explain what could be done, or what should not be done, but doesn't specify what should be done (see HowToDirection).

SearchRescueOrganization.name: SearchRescueOrganization
SearchRescueOrganization.help: A Search and Rescue organization of some kind.

ScreeningEvent.name: ScreeningEvent
ScreeningEvent.help: A screening of a movie or other video.

inputs.name: subtitleLanguage
inputs.label: subtitleLanguage
inputs.help: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in [IETF BCP 47 standard format](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).

inputs.name: videoFormat
inputs.label: videoFormat
inputs.help: The type of screening or video broadcast used (e.g. IMAX, 3D, SD, HD, etc.).

inputs.name: workPresented
inputs.label: workPresented
inputs.help: The movie presented during this event.

OnDemandEvent.name: OnDemandEvent
OnDemandEvent.help: A publication event, e.g. catch-up TV or radio podcast, during which a program is available on-demand.

HowToItem.name: HowToItem
HowToItem.help: An item used as either a tool or supply when performing the instructions for how to achieve a result.

inputs.name: requiredQuantity
inputs.label: requiredQuantity
inputs.help: The required quantity of the item(s).

BodyMeasurementTypeEnumeration.name: BodyMeasurementTypeEnumeration
BodyMeasurementTypeEnumeration.help: Enumerates types (or dimensions) of a person's body measurements, for example for fitting of clothes.

LendAction.name: LendAction
LendAction.help:
The act of providing an object under an agreement that it will be returned at a later date. Reciprocal of BorrowAction.

Related actions:

* [[BorrowAction]]: Reciprocal of LendAction.

inputs.name: borrower
inputs.label: borrower
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The person that borrows the object being lent.

AmpStory.name: AmpStory
AmpStory.help: A creative work with a visual storytelling format intended to be viewed online, particularly on mobile devices.

inputs.name: educationalRole
inputs.label: educationalRole
inputs.help: An educationalRole of an EducationalAudience.

FundingScheme.name: FundingScheme
FundingScheme.help:
A FundingScheme combines organizational, project and policy aspects of grant-based funding
    that sets guidelines, principles and mechanisms to support other kinds of projects and activities.
    Funding is typically organized via [[Grant]] funding. Examples of funding schemes: Swiss Priority Programmes (SPPs); EU Framework 7 (FP7); Horizon 2020; the NIH-R01 Grant Program; Wellcome institutional strategic support fund. For large scale public sector funding, the management and administration of grant awards is often handled by other, dedicated, organizations - [[FundingAgency]]s such as ERC, REA, ...

inputs.name: tickerSymbol
inputs.label: tickerSymbol
inputs.help: The exchange traded instrument associated with a Corporation object. The tickerSymbol is expressed as an exchange and an instrument name separated by a space character. For the exchange component of the tickerSymbol attribute, we recommend using the controlled vocabulary of Market Identifier Codes (MIC) specified in ISO 15022.

Chapter.name: Chapter
Chapter.help: One of the sections into which a book is divided. A chapter usually has a section number or a name.

inputs.name: pageEnd
inputs.label: pageEnd
inputs.help: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

inputs.name: pageStart
inputs.label: pageStart
inputs.help: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

inputs.name: pagination
inputs.label: pagination
inputs.help: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

FAQPage.name: FAQPage
FAQPage.help: A [[FAQPage]] is a [[WebPage]] presenting one or more "[Frequently asked questions](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/FAQ)" (see also [[QAPage]]).

MedicalProcedureType.name: MedicalProcedureType
MedicalProcedureType.help: An enumeration that describes different types of medical procedures.

CivicStructure.name: CivicStructure
CivicStructure.help: A public structure, such as a town hall or concert hall.

inputs.name: openingHours
inputs.label: openingHours
inputs.help: The general opening hours for a business. Opening hours can be specified as a weekly time range, starting with days, then times per day. Multiple days can be listed with commas ',' separating each day. Day or time ranges are specified using a hyphen '-'. * Days are specified using the following two-letter combinations: ```Mo```, ```Tu```, ```We```, ```Th```, ```Fr```, ```Sa```, ```Su```. * Times are specified using 24:00 format. For example, 3pm is specified as ```15:00```, 10am as ```10:00```. * Here is an example: <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Tu,Th 16:00-20:00">Tuesdays and Thursdays 4-8pm</time>. * If a business is open 7 days a week, then it can be specified as <time itemprop="openingHours" datetime="Mo-Su">Monday through Sunday, all day</time>.

PaymentCard.name: PaymentCard
PaymentCard.help: A payment method using a credit, debit, store or other card to associate the payment with an account.

inputs.name: cashBack
inputs.label: cashBack
inputs.help: A cardholder benefit that pays the cardholder a small percentage of their net expenditures.

inputs.name: contactlessPayment
inputs.label: contactlessPayment
inputs.help: A secure method for consumers to purchase products or services via debit, credit or smartcards by using RFID or NFC technology.

inputs.name: floorLimit
inputs.label: floorLimit
inputs.help: A floor limit is the amount of money above which credit card transactions must be authorized.

inputs.name: monthlyMinimumRepaymentAmount
inputs.label: monthlyMinimumRepaymentAmount
inputs.help: The minimum payment is the lowest amount of money that one is required to pay on a credit card statement each month.

Game.name: Game
Game.help: The Game type represents things which are games. These are typically rule-governed recreational activities, e.g. role-playing games in which players assume the role of characters in a fictional setting.

inputs.name: characterAttribute
inputs.label: characterAttribute
inputs.help: A piece of data that represents a particular aspect of a fictional character (skill, power, character points, advantage, disadvantage).

inputs.name: gameItem
inputs.label: gameItem
inputs.help: An item is an object within the game world that can be collected by a player or, occasionally, a non-player character.

inputs.name: gameLocation
inputs.label: gameLocation
inputs.help: Real or fictional location of the game (or part of game).

inputs.name: numberOfPlayers
inputs.label: numberOfPlayers
inputs.help: Indicate how many people can play this game (minimum, maximum, or range).

inputs.name: quest
inputs.label: quest
inputs.help: The task that a player-controlled character, or group of characters may complete in order to gain a reward.

Barcode.name: Barcode
Barcode.help: An image of a visual machine-readable code such as a barcode or QR code.

BusinessEntityType.name: BusinessEntityType
BusinessEntityType.help:
A business entity type is a conceptual entity representing the legal form, the size, the main line of business, the position in the value chain, or any combination thereof, of an organization or business person.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Business
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Enduser
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#PublicInstitution
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Reseller

Audience.name: Audience
Audience.help: Intended audience for an item, i.e. the group for whom the item was created.

inputs.name: audienceType
inputs.label: audienceType
inputs.help: The target group associated with a given audience (e.g. veterans, car owners, musicians, etc.).

inputs.name: geographicArea
inputs.label: geographicArea
inputs.help: The geographic area associated with the audience.

UnitPriceSpecification.name: UnitPriceSpecification
UnitPriceSpecification.help: The price asked for a given offer by the respective organization or person.

inputs.name: billingDuration
inputs.label: billingDuration
inputs.help: Specifies for how long this price (or price component) will be billed. Can be used, for example, to model the contractual duration of a subscription or payment plan. Type can be either a Duration or a Number (in which case the unit of measurement, for example month, is specified by the unitCode property).

inputs.name: billingIncrement
inputs.label: billingIncrement
inputs.help: This property specifies the minimal quantity and rounding increment that will be the basis for the billing. The unit of measurement is specified by the unitCode property.

inputs.name: billingStart
inputs.label: billingStart
inputs.help: Specifies after how much time this price (or price component) becomes valid and billing starts. Can be used, for example, to model a price increase after the first year of a subscription. The unit of measurement is specified by the unitCode property.

inputs.name: priceComponentType
inputs.label: priceComponentType
inputs.help: Identifies a price component (for example, a line item on an invoice), part of the total price for an offer.

inputs.name: priceType
inputs.label: priceType
inputs.help: Defines the type of a price specified for an offered product, for example a list price, a (temporary) sale price or a manufacturer suggested retail price. If multiple prices are specified for an offer the [[priceType]] property can be used to identify the type of each such specified price. The value of priceType can be specified as a value from enumeration PriceTypeEnumeration or as a free form text string for price types that are not already predefined in PriceTypeEnumeration.

inputs.name: referenceQuantity
inputs.label: referenceQuantity
inputs.help: The reference quantity for which a certain price applies, e.g. 1 EUR per 4 kWh of electricity. This property is a replacement for unitOfMeasurement for the advanced cases where the price does not relate to a standard unit.

inputs.name: unitCode
inputs.label: unitCode
inputs.help: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

inputs.name: unitText
inputs.label: unitText
inputs.help: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

Action.name: Action
Action.help: An action performed by a direct agent and indirect participants upon a direct object. Optionally happens at a location with the help of an inanimate instrument. The execution of the action may produce a result. Specific action sub-type documentation specifies the exact expectation of each argument/role.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/04/announcing-schemaorg-actions.html) and [Actions overview document](http://schema.org/docs/actions.html).

inputs.name: actionStatus
inputs.label: actionStatus
inputs.help: Indicates the current disposition of the Action.

inputs.name: agent
inputs.label: agent
inputs.help: The direct performer or driver of the action (animate or inanimate). E.g. *John* wrote a book.

inputs.name: endTime
inputs.label: endTime
inputs.help: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

inputs.name: error
inputs.label: error
inputs.help: For failed actions, more information on the cause of the failure.

inputs.name: instrument
inputs.label: instrument
inputs.help: The object that helped the agent perform the action. E.g. John wrote a book with *a pen*.

inputs.name: location
inputs.label: location
inputs.help: The location of, for example, where an event is happening, where an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

inputs.name: object
inputs.label: object
inputs.help: The object upon which the action is carried out, whose state is kept intact or changed. Also known as the semantic roles patient, affected or undergoer (which change their state) or theme (which doesn't). E.g. John read *a book*.

inputs.name: participant
inputs.label: participant
inputs.help: Other co-agents that participated in the action indirectly. E.g. John wrote a book with *Steve*.

inputs.name: provider
inputs.label: provider
inputs.help: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

inputs.name: result
inputs.label: result
inputs.help: The result produced in the action. E.g. John wrote *a book*.

inputs.name: startTime
inputs.label: startTime
inputs.help: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

inputs.name: target
inputs.label: target
inputs.help: Indicates a target EntryPoint, or url, for an Action.

MapCategoryType.name: MapCategoryType
MapCategoryType.help: An enumeration of several kinds of Map.

SoftwareSourceCode.name: SoftwareSourceCode
SoftwareSourceCode.help: Computer programming source code. Example: Full (compile ready) solutions, code snippet samples, scripts, templates.

inputs.name: codeRepository
inputs.label: codeRepository
inputs.help: Link to the repository where the un-compiled, human readable code and related code is located (SVN, GitHub, CodePlex).

inputs.name: codeSampleType
inputs.label: codeSampleType
inputs.help: What type of code sample: full (compile ready) solution, code snippet, inline code, scripts, template.

inputs.name: programmingLanguage
inputs.label: programmingLanguage
inputs.help: The computer programming language.

inputs.name: runtime
inputs.label: runtime
inputs.help: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (example: Java v1, Python 2.3, .NET Framework 3.0).

inputs.name: runtimePlatform
inputs.label: runtimePlatform
inputs.help: Runtime platform or script interpreter dependencies (example: Java v1, Python 2.3, .NET Framework 3.0).

inputs.name: sampleType
inputs.label: sampleType
inputs.help: What type of code sample: full (compile ready) solution, code snippet, inline code, scripts, template.

inputs.name: targetProduct
inputs.label: targetProduct
inputs.help: Target Operating System / Product to which the code applies.  If applies to several versions, just the product name can be used.

PlayGameAction.name: PlayGameAction
PlayGameAction.help: The act of playing a video game.

inputs.name: gameAvailabilityType
inputs.label: gameAvailabilityType
inputs.help: Indicates the availability type of the game content associated with this action, such as whether it is a full version or a demo.

MedicalSignOrSymptom.name: MedicalSignOrSymptom
MedicalSignOrSymptom.help: Any feature associated or not with a medical condition. In medicine a symptom is generally subjective while a sign is objective.

inputs.name: possibleTreatment
inputs.label: possibleTreatment
inputs.help: A possible treatment to address this condition, sign or symptom.

NoteDigitalDocument.name: NoteDigitalDocument
NoteDigitalDocument.help: A file containing a note, primarily for the author.

Guide.name: Guide
Guide.help: [[Guide]] is a page or article that recommends specific products or services, or aspects of a thing for a user to consider. A [[Guide]] may represent a Buying Guide and detail aspects of products or services for a user to consider. A [[Guide]] may represent a Product Guide and recommend specific products or services. A [[Guide]] may represent a Ranked List and recommend specific products or services with ranking.

inputs.name: reviewAspect
inputs.label: reviewAspect
inputs.help: This Review or Rating is relevant to this part or facet of the itemReviewed.

HVACBusiness.name: HVACBusiness
HVACBusiness.help: A business that provides Heating, Ventilation and Air Conditioning services.

GovernmentOffice.name: GovernmentOffice
GovernmentOffice.help: A government office—for example, an IRS or DMV office.

OfferItemCondition.name: OfferItemCondition
OfferItemCondition.help: A list of possible conditions for the item.

PsychologicalTreatment.name: PsychologicalTreatment
PsychologicalTreatment.help: A process of care relying upon counseling, dialogue and communication  aimed at improving a mental health condition without use of drugs.

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: duration
inputs.help: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: median
inputs.label: median
inputs.help: The median value.

inputs.name: percentile10
inputs.label: percentile10
inputs.help: The 10th percentile value.

inputs.name: percentile25
inputs.label: percentile25
inputs.help: The 25th percentile value.

inputs.name: percentile75
inputs.label: percentile75
inputs.help: The 75th percentile value.

inputs.name: percentile90
inputs.label: percentile90
inputs.help: The 90th percentile value.

AggregateRating.name: AggregateRating
AggregateRating.help: The average rating based on multiple ratings or reviews.

inputs.name: itemReviewed
inputs.label: itemReviewed
inputs.help: The item that is being reviewed/rated.

inputs.name: ratingCount
inputs.label: ratingCount
inputs.help: The count of total number of ratings.

inputs.name: reviewCount
inputs.label: reviewCount
inputs.help: The count of total number of reviews.

CompoundPriceSpecification.name: CompoundPriceSpecification
CompoundPriceSpecification.help: A compound price specification is one that bundles multiple prices that all apply in combination for different dimensions of consumption. Use the name property of the attached unit price specification for indicating the dimension of a price component (e.g. "electricity" or "final cleaning").

inputs.name: priceComponent
inputs.label: priceComponent
inputs.help: This property links to all [[UnitPriceSpecification]] nodes that apply in parallel for the [[CompoundPriceSpecification]] node.

inputs.name: priceType
inputs.label: priceType
inputs.help: Defines the type of a price specified for an offered product, for example a list price, a (temporary) sale price or a manufacturer suggested retail price. If multiple prices are specified for an offer the [[priceType]] property can be used to identify the type of each such specified price. The value of priceType can be specified as a value from enumeration PriceTypeEnumeration or as a free form text string for price types that are not already predefined in PriceTypeEnumeration.

PerformAction.name: PerformAction
PerformAction.help: The act of participating in performance arts.

inputs.name: entertainmentBusiness
inputs.label: entertainmentBusiness
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The entertainment business where the action occurred.

UserTweets.name: UserTweets
UserTweets.help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

inputs.name: numberOfRooms
inputs.label: numberOfRooms
inputs.help:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

inputs.name: occupancy
inputs.label: occupancy
inputs.help:
The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person).
Typical unit code(s): C62 for person.

Ligament.name: Ligament
Ligament.help: A short band of tough, flexible, fibrous connective tissue that functions to connect multiple bones, cartilages, and structurally support joints.

WorkersUnion.name: WorkersUnion
WorkersUnion.help: A Workers Union (also known as a Labor Union, Labour Union, or Trade Union) is an organization that promotes the interests of its worker members by collectively bargaining with management, organizing, and political lobbying.

MedicalIndication.name: MedicalIndication
MedicalIndication.help: A condition or factor that indicates use of a medical therapy, including signs, symptoms, risk factors, anatomical states, etc.

BookFormatType.name: BookFormatType
BookFormatType.help: The publication format of the book.

FMRadioChannel.name: FMRadioChannel
FMRadioChannel.help: A radio channel that uses FM.

EatAction.name: EatAction
EatAction.help: The act of swallowing solid objects.

RVPark.name: RVPark
RVPark.help: A place offering space for "Recreational Vehicles", Caravans, mobile homes and the like.

PalliativeProcedure.name: PalliativeProcedure
PalliativeProcedure.help: A medical procedure intended primarily for palliative purposes, aimed at relieving the symptoms of an underlying health condition.

inputs.name: abridged
inputs.label: abridged
inputs.help: Indicates whether the book is an abridged edition.

inputs.name: bookEdition
inputs.label: bookEdition
inputs.help: The edition of the book.

inputs.name: bookFormat
inputs.label: bookFormat
inputs.help: The format of the book.

inputs.name: illustrator
inputs.label: illustrator
inputs.help: The illustrator of the book.

inputs.name: isbn
inputs.label: isbn
inputs.help: The ISBN of the book.

inputs.name: numberOfPages
inputs.label: numberOfPages
inputs.help: The number of pages in the book.

TVSeason.name: TVSeason
TVSeason.help: Season dedicated to TV broadcast and associated online delivery.

inputs.name: countryOfOrigin
inputs.label: countryOfOrigin
inputs.help:
The country of origin of something, including products as well as creative  works such as movie and TV content.

In the case of TV and movie, this would be the country of the principle offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie. For other kinds of [[CreativeWork]] it is difficult to provide fully general guidance, and properties such as [[contentLocation]] and [[locationCreated]] may be more applicable.

In the case of products, the country of origin of the product. The exact interpretation of this may vary by context and product type, and cannot be fully enumerated here.

inputs.name: partOfTVSeries
inputs.label: partOfTVSeries
inputs.help: The TV series to which this episode or season belongs.

inputs.name: titleEIDR
inputs.label: titleEIDR
inputs.help:
An [EIDR](https://eidr.org/) (Entertainment Identifier Registry) [[identifier]] representing at the most general/abstract level, a work of film or television.

For example, the motion picture known as "Ghostbusters" has a titleEIDR of  "10.5240/7EC7-228A-510A-053E-CBB8-J". This title (or work) may have several variants, which EIDR calls "edits". See [[editEIDR]].

Since schema.org types like [[Movie]], [[TVEpisode]], [[TVSeason]], and [[TVSeries]] can be used for both works and their multiple expressions, it is possible to use [[titleEIDR]] alone (for a general description), or alongside [[editEIDR]] for a more edit-specific description.

LegislativeBuilding.name: LegislativeBuilding
LegislativeBuilding.help: A legislative building—for example, the state capitol.

BedAndBreakfast.name: BedAndBreakfast
BedAndBreakfast.help:
Bed and breakfast.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

Invoice.name: Invoice
Invoice.help: A statement of the money due for goods or services; a bill.

inputs.name: accountId
inputs.label: accountId
inputs.help: The identifier for the account the payment will be applied to.

inputs.name: billingPeriod
inputs.label: billingPeriod
inputs.help: The time interval used to compute the invoice.

inputs.name: broker
inputs.label: broker
inputs.help: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

inputs.name: category
inputs.label: category
inputs.help: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

inputs.name: confirmationNumber
inputs.label: confirmationNumber
inputs.help: A number that confirms the given order or payment has been received.

inputs.name: customer
inputs.label: customer
inputs.help: Party placing the order or paying the invoice.

inputs.name: minimumPaymentDue
inputs.label: minimumPaymentDue
inputs.help: The minimum payment required at this time.

inputs.name: paymentDue
inputs.label: paymentDue
inputs.help: The date that payment is due.

inputs.name: paymentDueDate
inputs.label: paymentDueDate
inputs.help: The date that payment is due.

inputs.name: paymentMethod
inputs.label: paymentMethod
inputs.help: The name of the credit card or other method of payment for the order.

inputs.name: paymentMethodId
inputs.label: paymentMethodId
inputs.help: An identifier for the method of payment used (e.g. the last 4 digits of the credit card).

inputs.name: paymentStatus
inputs.label: paymentStatus
inputs.help: The status of payment; whether the invoice has been paid or not.

inputs.name: provider
inputs.label: provider
inputs.help: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

inputs.name: referencesOrder
inputs.label: referencesOrder
inputs.help: The Order(s) related to this Invoice. One or more Orders may be combined into a single Invoice.

inputs.name: scheduledPaymentDate
inputs.label: scheduledPaymentDate
inputs.help: The date the invoice is scheduled to be paid.

inputs.name: totalPaymentDue
inputs.label: totalPaymentDue
inputs.help: The total amount due.

SpecialAnnouncement.name: SpecialAnnouncement
SpecialAnnouncement.help:
A SpecialAnnouncement combines a simple date-stamped textual information update
      with contextualized Web links and other structured data.  It represents an information update made by a
      locally-oriented organization, for example schools, pharmacies, healthcare providers,  community groups, police,
      local government.

For work in progress guidelines on Coronavirus-related markup see [this doc](https://docs.google.com/document/d/14ikaGCKxo50rRM7nvKSlbUpjyIk2WMQd3IkB1lItlrM/edit#).

The motivating scenario for SpecialAnnouncement is the [Coronavirus pandemic](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/2019%E2%80%9320_coronavirus_pandemic), and the initial vocabulary is oriented to this urgent situation. Schema.org
expect to improve the markup iteratively as it is deployed and as feedback emerges from use. In addition to our
usual [Github entry](https://github.com/schemaorg/schemaorg/issues/2490), feedback comments can also be provided in [this document](https://docs.google.com/document/d/1fpdFFxk8s87CWwACs53SGkYv3aafSxz_DTtOQxMrBJQ/edit#).


While this schema is designed to communicate urgent crisis-related information, it is not the same as an emergency warning technology like [CAP](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Common_Alerting_Protocol), although there may be overlaps. The intent is to cover
the kinds of everyday practical information being posted to existing websites during an emergency situation.

Several kinds of information can be provided:

We encourage the provision of "name", "text", "datePosted", "expires" (if appropriate), "category" and
"url" as a simple baseline. It is important to provide a value for "category" where possible, most ideally as a well known
URL from Wikipedia or Wikidata. In the case of the 2019-2020 Coronavirus pandemic, this should be "https://en.wikipedia.org/w/index.php?title=2019-20\_coronavirus\_pandemic" or "https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Q81068910".

For many of the possible properties, values can either be simple links or an inline description, depending on whether a summary is available. For a link, provide just the URL of the appropriate page as the property's value. For an inline description, use a [[WebContent]] type, and provide the url as a property of that, alongside at least a simple "[[text]]" summary of the page. It is
unlikely that a single SpecialAnnouncement will need all of the possible properties simultaneously.

We expect that in many cases the page referenced might contain more specialized structured data, e.g. contact info, [[openingHours]], [[Event]], [[FAQPage]] etc. By linking to those pages from a [[SpecialAnnouncement]] you can help make it clearer that the events are related to the situation (e.g. Coronavirus) indicated by the [[category]] property of the [[SpecialAnnouncement]].

Many [[SpecialAnnouncement]]s will relate to particular regions and to identifiable local organizations. Use [[spatialCoverage]] for the region, and [[announcementLocation]] to indicate specific [[LocalBusiness]]es and [[CivicStructure]]s. If the announcement affects both a particular region and a specific location (for example, a library closure that serves an entire region), use both [[spatialCoverage]] and [[announcementLocation]].

The [[about]] property can be used to indicate entities that are the focus of the announcement. We now recommend using [[about]] only
for representing non-location entities (e.g. a [[Course]] or a [[RadioStation]]). For places, use [[announcementLocation]] and [[spatialCoverage]]. Consumers of this markup should be aware that the initial design encouraged the use of [[about]] for locations too.

The basic content of [[SpecialAnnouncement]] is similar to that of an [RSS](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/RSS) or [Atom](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Atom_(Web_standard)) feed. For publishers without such feeds, basic feed-like information can be shared by posting
[[SpecialAnnouncement]] updates in a page, e.g. using JSON-LD. For sites with Atom/RSS functionality, you can point to a feed
with the [[webFeed]] property. This can be a simple URL, or an inline [[DataFeed]] object, with [[encodingFormat]] providing
media type information, e.g. "application/rss+xml" or "application/atom+xml".

inputs.name: announcementLocation
inputs.label: announcementLocation
inputs.help: Indicates a specific [[CivicStructure]] or [[LocalBusiness]] associated with the SpecialAnnouncement. For example, a specific testing facility or business with special opening hours. For a larger geographic region like a quarantine of an entire region, use [[spatialCoverage]].

inputs.name: category
inputs.label: category
inputs.help: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

inputs.name: datePosted
inputs.label: datePosted
inputs.help: Publication date of an online listing.

inputs.name: diseasePreventionInfo
inputs.label: diseasePreventionInfo
inputs.help: Information about disease prevention.

inputs.name: diseaseSpreadStatistics
inputs.label: diseaseSpreadStatistics
inputs.help:
Statistical information about the spread of a disease, either as [[WebContent]], or
  described directly as a [[Dataset]], or the specific [[Observation]]s in the dataset. When a [[WebContent]] URL is
  provided, the page indicated might also contain more such markup.

inputs.name: gettingTestedInfo
inputs.label: gettingTestedInfo
inputs.help: Information about getting tested (for a [[MedicalCondition]]), e.g. in the context of a pandemic.

inputs.name: governmentBenefitsInfo
inputs.label: governmentBenefitsInfo
inputs.help: governmentBenefitsInfo provides information about government benefits associated with a SpecialAnnouncement.

inputs.name: newsUpdatesAndGuidelines
inputs.label: newsUpdatesAndGuidelines
inputs.help: Indicates a page with news updates and guidelines. This could often be (but is not required to be) the main page containing [[SpecialAnnouncement]] markup on a site.

inputs.name: publicTransportClosuresInfo
inputs.label: publicTransportClosuresInfo
inputs.help: Information about public transport closures.

inputs.name: quarantineGuidelines
inputs.label: quarantineGuidelines
inputs.help: Guidelines about quarantine rules, e.g. in the context of a pandemic.

inputs.name: schoolClosuresInfo
inputs.label: schoolClosuresInfo
inputs.help: Information about school closures.

inputs.name: travelBans
inputs.label: travelBans
inputs.help: Information about travel bans, e.g. in the context of a pandemic.

inputs.name: webFeed
inputs.label: webFeed
inputs.help: The URL for a feed, e.g. associated with a podcast series, blog, or series of date-stamped updates. This is usually RSS or Atom.

MerchantReturnPolicySeasonalOverride.name: MerchantReturnPolicySeasonalOverride
MerchantReturnPolicySeasonalOverride.help: A seasonal override of a return policy, for example used for holidays.

inputs.name: endDate
inputs.label: endDate
inputs.help: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: merchantReturnDays
inputs.label: merchantReturnDays
inputs.help: Specifies either a fixed return date or the number of days (from the delivery date) that a product can be returned. Used when the [[returnPolicyCategory]] property is specified as [[MerchantReturnFiniteReturnWindow]].

inputs.name: returnPolicyCategory
inputs.label: returnPolicyCategory
inputs.help: Specifies an applicable return policy (from an enumeration).

inputs.name: startDate
inputs.label: startDate
inputs.help: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

DeleteAction.name: DeleteAction
DeleteAction.help: The act of editing a recipient by removing one of its objects.

VirtualLocation.name: VirtualLocation
VirtualLocation.help: An online or virtual location for attending events. For example, one may attend an online seminar or educational event. While a virtual location may be used as the location of an event, virtual locations should not be confused with physical locations in the real world.

DeliveryMethod.name: DeliveryMethod
DeliveryMethod.help:
A delivery method is a standardized procedure for transferring the product or service to the destination of fulfillment chosen by the customer. Delivery methods are characterized by the means of transportation used, and by the organization or group that is the contracting party for the sending organization or person.

Commonly used values:

* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeDirectDownload
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeFreight
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeMail
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModeOwnFleet
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DeliveryModePickUp
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#DHL
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#FederalExpress
* http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#UPS

Ticket.name: Ticket
Ticket.help: Used to describe a ticket to an event, a flight, a bus ride, etc.

inputs.name: dateIssued
inputs.label: dateIssued
inputs.help: The date the ticket was issued.

inputs.name: issuedBy
inputs.label: issuedBy
inputs.help: The organization issuing the item, for example a [[Permit]], [[Ticket]], or [[Certification]].

inputs.name: priceCurrency
inputs.label: priceCurrency
inputs.help: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

inputs.name: ticketNumber
inputs.label: ticketNumber
inputs.help: The unique identifier for the ticket.

inputs.name: ticketToken
inputs.label: ticketToken
inputs.help: Reference to an asset (e.g., Barcode, QR code image or PDF) usable for entrance.

inputs.name: ticketedSeat
inputs.label: ticketedSeat
inputs.help: The seat associated with the ticket.

inputs.name: totalPrice
inputs.label: totalPrice
inputs.help:
The total price for the reservation or ticket, including applicable taxes, shipping, etc.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

inputs.name: underName
inputs.label: underName
inputs.help: The person or organization the reservation or ticket is for.

InsertAction.name: InsertAction
InsertAction.help: The act of adding at a specific location in an ordered collection.

inputs.name: toLocation
inputs.label: toLocation
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

SizeSpecification.name: SizeSpecification
SizeSpecification.help: Size related properties of a product, typically a size code ([[name]]) and optionally a [[sizeSystem]], [[sizeGroup]], and product measurements ([[hasMeasurement]]). In addition, the intended audience can be defined through [[suggestedAge]], [[suggestedGender]], and suggested body measurements ([[suggestedMeasurement]]).

inputs.name: hasMeasurement
inputs.label: hasMeasurement
inputs.help: A measurement of an item, For example, the inseam of pants, the wheel size of a bicycle, the gauge of a screw, or the carbon footprint measured for certification by an authority. Usually an exact measurement, but can also be a range of measurements for adjustable products, for example belts and ski bindings.

inputs.name: sizeGroup
inputs.label: sizeGroup
inputs.help: The size group (also known as "size type") for a product's size. Size groups are common in the fashion industry to define size segments and suggested audiences for wearable products. Multiple values can be combined, for example "men's big and tall", "petite maternity" or "regular".

inputs.name: sizeSystem
inputs.label: sizeSystem
inputs.help: The size system used to identify a product's size. Typically either a standard (for example, "GS1" or "ISO-EN13402"), country code (for example "US" or "JP"), or a measuring system (for example "Metric" or "Imperial").

inputs.name: suggestedAge
inputs.label: suggestedAge
inputs.help: The age or age range for the intended audience or person, for example 3-12 months for infants, 1-5 years for toddlers.

inputs.name: suggestedGender
inputs.label: suggestedGender
inputs.help: The suggested gender of the intended person or audience, for example "male", "female", or "unisex".

inputs.name: suggestedMeasurement
inputs.label: suggestedMeasurement
inputs.help: A suggested range of body measurements for the intended audience or person, for example inseam between 32 and 34 inches or height between 170 and 190 cm. Typically found on a size chart for wearable products.

SheetMusic.name: SheetMusic
SheetMusic.help: Printed music, as opposed to performed or recorded music.

Room.name: Room
Room.help:
A room is a distinguishable space within a structure, usually separated from other spaces by interior walls (source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Room).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

EducationalOccupationalCredential.name: EducationalOccupationalCredential
EducationalOccupationalCredential.help: An educational or occupational credential. A diploma, academic degree, certification, qualification, badge, etc., that may be awarded to a person or other entity that meets the requirements defined by the credentialer.

inputs.name: competencyRequired
inputs.label: competencyRequired
inputs.help: Knowledge, skill, ability or personal attribute that must be demonstrated by a person or other entity in order to do something such as earn an Educational Occupational Credential or understand a LearningResource.

inputs.name: credentialCategory
inputs.label: credentialCategory
inputs.help: The category or type of credential being described, for example "degree”, “certificate”, “badge”, or more specific term.

inputs.name: educationalLevel
inputs.label: educationalLevel
inputs.help: The level in terms of progression through an educational or training context. Examples of educational levels include 'beginner', 'intermediate' or 'advanced', and formal sets of level indicators.

inputs.name: recognizedBy
inputs.label: recognizedBy
inputs.help: An organization that acknowledges the validity, value or utility of a credential. Note: recognition may include a process of quality assurance or accreditation.

inputs.name: validFor
inputs.label: validFor
inputs.help: The duration of validity of a permit or similar thing.

inputs.name: validIn
inputs.label: validIn
inputs.help: The geographic area where the item is valid. Applies for example to a [[Permit]], a [[Certification]], or an [[EducationalOccupationalCredential]].

inputs.name: actionAccessibilityRequirement
inputs.label: actionAccessibilityRequirement
inputs.help: A set of requirements that must be fulfilled in order to perform an Action. If more than one value is specified, fulfilling one set of requirements will allow the Action to be performed.

inputs.name: expectsAcceptanceOf
inputs.label: expectsAcceptanceOf
inputs.help: An Offer which must be accepted before the user can perform the Action. For example, the user may need to buy a movie before being able to watch it.

OccupationalTherapy.name: OccupationalTherapy
OccupationalTherapy.help: A treatment of people with physical, emotional, or social problems, using purposeful activity to help them overcome or learn to deal with their problems.

ContactPoint.name: ContactPoint
ContactPoint.help: A contact point—for example, a Customer Complaints department.

inputs.name: areaServed
inputs.label: areaServed
inputs.help: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

inputs.name: availableLanguage
inputs.label: availableLanguage
inputs.help: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]].

inputs.name: contactOption
inputs.label: contactOption
inputs.help: An option available on this contact point (e.g. a toll-free number or support for hearing-impaired callers).

inputs.name: contactType
inputs.label: contactType
inputs.help: A person or organization can have different contact points, for different purposes. For example, a sales contact point, a PR contact point and so on. This property is used to specify the kind of contact point.

inputs.name: email
inputs.label: email
inputs.help: Email address.

inputs.name: faxNumber
inputs.label: faxNumber
inputs.help: The fax number.

inputs.name: hoursAvailable
inputs.label: hoursAvailable
inputs.help: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

inputs.name: productSupported
inputs.label: productSupported
inputs.help: The product or service this support contact point is related to (such as product support for a particular product line). This can be a specific product or product line (e.g. "iPhone") or a general category of products or services (e.g. "smartphones").

inputs.name: serviceArea
inputs.label: serviceArea
inputs.help: The geographic area where the service is provided.

inputs.name: telephone
inputs.label: telephone
inputs.help: The telephone number.

MathSolver.name: MathSolver
MathSolver.help: A math solver which is capable of solving a subset of mathematical problems.

inputs.name: mathExpression
inputs.label: mathExpression
inputs.help: A mathematical expression (e.g. 'x^2-3x=0') that may be solved for a specific variable, simplified, or transformed. This can take many formats, e.g. LaTeX, Ascii-Math, or math as you would write with a keyboard.

SatiricalArticle.name: SatiricalArticle
SatiricalArticle.help: An [[Article]] whose content is primarily [[satirical]](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Satire) in nature, i.e. unlikely to be literally true. A satirical article is sometimes but not necessarily also a [[NewsArticle]]. [[ScholarlyArticle]]s are also sometimes satirized.

MedicalRiskEstimator.name: MedicalRiskEstimator
MedicalRiskEstimator.help: Any rule set or interactive tool for estimating the risk of developing a complication or condition.

inputs.name: estimatesRiskOf
inputs.label: estimatesRiskOf
inputs.help: The condition, complication, or symptom whose risk is being estimated.

inputs.name: includedRiskFactor
inputs.label: includedRiskFactor
inputs.help: A modifiable or non-modifiable risk factor included in the calculation, e.g. age, coexisting condition.

DriveWheelConfigurationValue.name: DriveWheelConfigurationValue
DriveWheelConfigurationValue.help: A value indicating which roadwheels will receive torque.

Canal.name: Canal
Canal.help: A canal, like the Panama Canal.

ImagingTest.name: ImagingTest
ImagingTest.help: Any medical imaging modality typically used for diagnostic purposes.

inputs.name: imagingTechnique
inputs.label: imagingTechnique
inputs.help: Imaging technique used.

DrugCost.name: DrugCost
DrugCost.help: The cost per unit of a medical drug. Note that this type is not meant to represent the price in an offer of a drug for sale; see the Offer type for that. This type will typically be used to tag wholesale or average retail cost of a drug, or maximum reimbursable cost. Costs of medical drugs vary widely depending on how and where they are paid for, so while this type captures some of the variables, costs should be used with caution by consumers of this schema's markup.

inputs.name: applicableLocation
inputs.label: applicableLocation
inputs.help: The location in which the status applies.

inputs.name: costCategory
inputs.label: costCategory
inputs.help: The category of cost, such as wholesale, retail, reimbursement cap, etc.

inputs.name: costCurrency
inputs.label: costCurrency
inputs.help: The currency (in 3-letter) of the drug cost. See: http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217.

inputs.name: costOrigin
inputs.label: costOrigin
inputs.help: Additional details to capture the origin of the cost data. For example, 'Medicare Part B'.

inputs.name: costPerUnit
inputs.label: costPerUnit
inputs.help: The cost per unit of the drug.

inputs.name: drugUnit
inputs.label: drugUnit
inputs.help: The unit in which the drug is measured, e.g. '5 mg tablet'.

inputs.name: monthsOfExperience
inputs.label: monthsOfExperience
inputs.help: Indicates the minimal number of months of experience required for a position.

PlanAction.name: PlanAction
PlanAction.help: The act of planning the execution of an event/task/action/reservation/plan to a future date.

inputs.name: scheduledTime
inputs.label: scheduledTime
inputs.help: The time the object is scheduled to.

AggregateOffer.name: AggregateOffer
AggregateOffer.help: When a single product is associated with multiple offers (for example, the same pair of shoes is offered by different merchants), then AggregateOffer can be used.\n\nNote: AggregateOffers are normally expected to associate multiple offers that all share the same defined [[businessFunction]] value, or default to http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell if businessFunction is not explicitly defined.

inputs.name: highPrice
inputs.label: highPrice
inputs.help:
The highest price of all offers available.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

inputs.name: lowPrice
inputs.label: lowPrice
inputs.help:
The lowest price of all offers available.

Usage guidelines:

* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

inputs.name: offerCount
inputs.label: offerCount
inputs.help: The number of offers for the product.

inputs.name: offers
inputs.label: offers
inputs.help: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

Play.name: Play
Play.help: A play is a form of literature, usually consisting of dialogue between characters, intended for theatrical performance rather than just reading. Note: A performance of a Play would be a [[TheaterEvent]] or [[BroadcastEvent]] - the *Play* being the [[workPerformed]].

VoteAction.name: VoteAction
VoteAction.help: The act of expressing a preference from a fixed/finite/structured set of choices/options.

inputs.name: candidate
inputs.label: candidate
inputs.help: A sub property of object. The candidate subject of this action.

PhotographAction.name: PhotographAction
PhotographAction.help: The act of capturing still images of objects using a camera.

HealthPlanNetwork.name: HealthPlanNetwork
HealthPlanNetwork.help: A US-style health insurance plan network.

inputs.name: healthPlanCostSharing
inputs.label: healthPlanCostSharing
inputs.help: The costs to the patient for services under this network or formulary.

inputs.name: healthPlanNetworkId
inputs.label: healthPlanNetworkId
inputs.help: Name or unique ID of network. (Networks are often reused across different insurance plans.)

inputs.name: healthPlanNetworkTier
inputs.label: healthPlanNetworkTier
inputs.help: The tier(s) for this network.

IndividualPhysician.name: IndividualPhysician
IndividualPhysician.help:
An individual medical practitioner. For their official address use [[address]], for affiliations to hospitals use [[hospitalAffiliation]]. 
The [[practicesAt]] property can be used to indicate [[MedicalOrganization]] hospitals, clinics, pharmacies etc. where this physician practices.

inputs.name: practicesAt
inputs.label: practicesAt
inputs.help: A [[MedicalOrganization]] where the [[IndividualPhysician]] practices.

CancelAction.name: CancelAction
CancelAction.help:
The act of asserting that a future event/action is no longer going to happen.

Related actions:

* [[ConfirmAction]]: The antonym of CancelAction.

Service.name: Service
Service.help: A service provided by an organization, e.g. delivery service, print services, etc.

inputs.name: aggregateRating
inputs.label: aggregateRating
inputs.help: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

inputs.name: areaServed
inputs.label: areaServed
inputs.help: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

inputs.name: audience
inputs.label: audience
inputs.help: An intended audience, i.e. a group for whom something was created.

inputs.name: availableChannel
inputs.label: availableChannel
inputs.help: A means of accessing the service (e.g. a phone bank, a web site, a location, etc.).

inputs.name: award
inputs.label: award
inputs.help: An award won by or for this item.

inputs.name: brand
inputs.label: brand
inputs.help: The brand(s) associated with a product or service, or the brand(s) maintained by an organization or business person.

inputs.name: broker
inputs.label: broker
inputs.help: An entity that arranges for an exchange between a buyer and a seller.  In most cases a broker never acquires or releases ownership of a product or service involved in an exchange.  If it is not clear whether an entity is a broker, seller, or buyer, the latter two terms are preferred.

inputs.name: category
inputs.label: category
inputs.help: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

inputs.name: hasCertification
inputs.label: hasCertification
inputs.help: Certification information about a product, organization, service, place, or person.

inputs.name: hasOfferCatalog
inputs.label: hasOfferCatalog
inputs.help: Indicates an OfferCatalog listing for this Organization, Person, or Service.

inputs.name: hoursAvailable
inputs.label: hoursAvailable
inputs.help: The hours during which this service or contact is available.

inputs.name: isRelatedTo
inputs.label: isRelatedTo
inputs.help: A pointer to another, somehow related product (or multiple products).

inputs.name: isSimilarTo
inputs.label: isSimilarTo
inputs.help: A pointer to another, functionally similar product (or multiple products).

inputs.name: logo
inputs.label: logo
inputs.help: An associated logo.

inputs.name: offers
inputs.label: offers
inputs.help: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

inputs.name: produces
inputs.label: produces
inputs.help: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

inputs.name: provider
inputs.label: provider
inputs.help: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

inputs.name: providerMobility
inputs.label: providerMobility
inputs.help: Indicates the mobility of a provided service (e.g. 'static', 'dynamic').

inputs.name: review
inputs.label: review
inputs.help: A review of the item.

inputs.name: serviceArea
inputs.label: serviceArea
inputs.help: The geographic area where the service is provided.

inputs.name: serviceAudience
inputs.label: serviceAudience
inputs.help: The audience eligible for this service.

inputs.name: serviceOutput
inputs.label: serviceOutput
inputs.help: The tangible thing generated by the service, e.g. a passport, permit, etc.

inputs.name: serviceType
inputs.label: serviceType
inputs.help: The type of service being offered, e.g. veterans' benefits, emergency relief, etc.

inputs.name: slogan
inputs.label: slogan
inputs.help: A slogan or motto associated with the item.

inputs.name: termsOfService
inputs.label: termsOfService
inputs.help: Human-readable terms of service documentation.

Accommodation.name: Accommodation
Accommodation.help:
An accommodation is a place that can accommodate human beings, e.g. a hotel room, a camping pitch, or a meeting room. Many accommodations are for overnight stays, but this is not a mandatory requirement. For more specific types of accommodations not defined in schema.org, one can use [[additionalType]] with external vocabularies.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

inputs.name: accommodationCategory
inputs.label: accommodationCategory
inputs.help: Category of an [[Accommodation]], following real estate conventions, e.g. RESO (see [PropertySubType](https://ddwiki.reso.org/display/DDW17/PropertySubType+Field), and [PropertyType](https://ddwiki.reso.org/display/DDW17/PropertyType+Field) fields  for suggested values).

inputs.name: accommodationFloorPlan
inputs.label: accommodationFloorPlan
inputs.help: A floorplan of some [[Accommodation]].

inputs.name: amenityFeature
inputs.label: amenityFeature
inputs.help: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

inputs.name: bed
inputs.label: bed
inputs.help:
The type of bed or beds included in the accommodation. For the single case of just one bed of a certain type, you use bed directly with a text.
      If you want to indicate the quantity of a certain kind of bed, use an instance of BedDetails. For more detailed information, use the amenityFeature property.

inputs.name: floorLevel
inputs.label: floorLevel
inputs.help:
The floor level for an [[Accommodation]] in a multi-storey building. Since counting
  systems [vary internationally](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Storey#Consecutive_number_floor_designations), the local system should be used where possible.

inputs.name: floorSize
inputs.label: floorSize
inputs.help:
The size of the accommodation, e.g. in square meter or squarefoot.
Typical unit code(s): MTK for square meter, FTK for square foot, or YDK for square yard.

inputs.name: leaseLength
inputs.label: leaseLength
inputs.help: Length of the lease for some [[Accommodation]], either particular to some [[Offer]] or in some cases intrinsic to the property.

inputs.name: numberOfBathroomsTotal
inputs.label: numberOfBathroomsTotal
inputs.help: The total integer number of bathrooms in some [[Accommodation]], following real estate conventions as [documented in RESO](https://ddwiki.reso.org/display/DDW17/BathroomsTotalInteger+Field): "The simple sum of the number of bathrooms. For example for a property with two Full Bathrooms and one Half Bathroom, the Bathrooms Total Integer will be 3.". See also [[numberOfRooms]].

inputs.name: numberOfBedrooms
inputs.label: numberOfBedrooms
inputs.help: The total integer number of bedrooms in a some [[Accommodation]], [[ApartmentComplex]] or [[FloorPlan]].

inputs.name: numberOfFullBathrooms
inputs.label: numberOfFullBathrooms
inputs.help: Number of full bathrooms - The total number of full and ¾ bathrooms in an [[Accommodation]]. This corresponds to the [BathroomsFull field in RESO](https://ddwiki.reso.org/display/DDW17/BathroomsFull+Field).

inputs.name: numberOfPartialBathrooms
inputs.label: numberOfPartialBathrooms
inputs.help: Number of partial bathrooms - The total number of half and ¼ bathrooms in an [[Accommodation]]. This corresponds to the [BathroomsPartial field in RESO](https://ddwiki.reso.org/display/DDW17/BathroomsPartial+Field).

inputs.name: numberOfRooms
inputs.label: numberOfRooms
inputs.help:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

inputs.name: occupancy
inputs.label: occupancy
inputs.help:
The allowed total occupancy for the accommodation in persons (including infants etc). For individual accommodations, this is not necessarily the legal maximum but defines the permitted usage as per the contractual agreement (e.g. a double room used by a single person).
Typical unit code(s): C62 for person.

inputs.name: permittedUsage
inputs.label: permittedUsage
inputs.help: Indications regarding the permitted usage of the accommodation.

inputs.name: petsAllowed
inputs.label: petsAllowed
inputs.help: Indicates whether pets are allowed to enter the accommodation or lodging business. More detailed information can be put in a text value.

inputs.name: tourBookingPage
inputs.label: tourBookingPage
inputs.help: A page providing information on how to book a tour of some [[Place]], such as an [[Accommodation]] or [[ApartmentComplex]] in a real estate setting, as well as other kinds of tours as appropriate.

inputs.name: yearBuilt
inputs.label: yearBuilt
inputs.help: The year an [[Accommodation]] was constructed. This corresponds to the [YearBuilt field in RESO](https://ddwiki.reso.org/display/DDW17/YearBuilt+Field).

InviteAction.name: InviteAction
InviteAction.help: The act of asking someone to attend an event. Reciprocal of RsvpAction.

inputs.name: event
inputs.label: event
inputs.help: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

Brand.name: Brand
Brand.help: A brand is a name used by an organization or business person for labeling a product, product group, or similar.

inputs.name: aggregateRating
inputs.label: aggregateRating
inputs.help: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

inputs.name: logo
inputs.label: logo
inputs.help: An associated logo.

inputs.name: review
inputs.label: review
inputs.help: A review of the item.

inputs.name: slogan
inputs.label: slogan
inputs.help: A slogan or motto associated with the item.

Nerve.name: Nerve
Nerve.help: A common pathway for the electrochemical nerve impulses that are transmitted along each of the axons.

inputs.name: branch
inputs.label: branch
inputs.help: The branches that delineate from the nerve bundle. Not to be confused with [[branchOf]].

inputs.name: nerveMotor
inputs.label: nerveMotor
inputs.help: The neurological pathway extension that involves muscle control.

inputs.name: sensoryUnit
inputs.label: sensoryUnit
inputs.help: The neurological pathway extension that inputs and sends information to the brain or spinal cord.

inputs.name: sourcedFrom
inputs.label: sourcedFrom
inputs.help: The neurological pathway that originates the neurons.

VideoGameClip.name: VideoGameClip
VideoGameClip.help: A short segment/part of a video game.

ConfirmAction.name: ConfirmAction
ConfirmAction.help:
The act of notifying someone that a future event/action is going to happen as expected.

Related actions:

* [[CancelAction]]: The antonym of ConfirmAction.

RefundTypeEnumeration.name: RefundTypeEnumeration
RefundTypeEnumeration.help: Enumerates several kinds of product return refund types.

EntryPoint.name: EntryPoint
EntryPoint.help: An entry point, within some Web-based protocol.

inputs.name: actionApplication
inputs.label: actionApplication
inputs.help: An application that can complete the request.

inputs.name: actionPlatform
inputs.label: actionPlatform
inputs.help: The high level platform(s) where the Action can be performed for the given URL. To specify a specific application or operating system instance, use actionApplication.

inputs.name: application
inputs.label: application
inputs.help: An application that can complete the request.

inputs.name: contentType
inputs.label: contentType
inputs.help: The supported content type(s) for an EntryPoint response.

inputs.name: encodingType
inputs.label: encodingType
inputs.help: The supported encoding type(s) for an EntryPoint request.

inputs.name: httpMethod
inputs.label: httpMethod
inputs.help: An HTTP method that specifies the appropriate HTTP method for a request to an HTTP EntryPoint. Values are capitalized strings as used in HTTP.

inputs.name: urlTemplate
inputs.label: urlTemplate
inputs.help: An url template (RFC6570) that will be used to construct the target of the execution of the action.

inputs.name: composer
inputs.label: composer
inputs.help: The person or organization who wrote a composition, or who is the composer of a work performed at some event.

inputs.name: firstPerformance
inputs.label: firstPerformance
inputs.help: The date and place the work was first performed.

inputs.name: includedComposition
inputs.label: includedComposition
inputs.help: Smaller compositions included in this work (e.g. a movement in a symphony).

inputs.name: iswcCode
inputs.label: iswcCode
inputs.help: The International Standard Musical Work Code for the composition.

inputs.name: lyricist
inputs.label: lyricist
inputs.help: The person who wrote the words.

inputs.name: lyrics
inputs.label: lyrics
inputs.help: The words in the song.

inputs.name: musicArrangement
inputs.label: musicArrangement
inputs.help: An arrangement derived from the composition.

inputs.name: musicCompositionForm
inputs.label: musicCompositionForm
inputs.help: The type of composition (e.g. overture, sonata, symphony, etc.).

inputs.name: musicalKey
inputs.label: musicalKey
inputs.help: The key, mode, or scale this composition uses.

inputs.name: recordedAs
inputs.label: recordedAs
inputs.help: An audio recording of the work.

BoardingPolicyType.name: BoardingPolicyType
BoardingPolicyType.help: A type of boarding policy used by an airline.

Trip.name: Trip
Trip.help: A trip or journey. An itinerary of visits to one or more places.

inputs.name: arrivalTime
inputs.label: arrivalTime
inputs.help: The expected arrival time.

inputs.name: departureTime
inputs.label: departureTime
inputs.help: The expected departure time.

inputs.name: itinerary
inputs.label: itinerary
inputs.help: Destination(s) ( [[Place]] ) that make up a trip. For a trip where destination order is important use [[ItemList]] to specify that order (see examples).

inputs.name: offers
inputs.label: offers
inputs.help: An offer to provide this item—for example, an offer to sell a product, rent the DVD of a movie, perform a service, or give away tickets to an event. Use [[businessFunction]] to indicate the kind of transaction offered, i.e. sell, lease, etc. This property can also be used to describe a [[Demand]]. While this property is listed as expected on a number of common types, it can be used in others. In that case, using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

inputs.name: partOfTrip
inputs.label: partOfTrip
inputs.help: Identifies that this [[Trip]] is a subTrip of another Trip.  For example Day 1, Day 2, etc. of a multi-day trip.

inputs.name: provider
inputs.label: provider
inputs.help: The service provider, service operator, or service performer; the goods producer. Another party (a seller) may offer those services or goods on behalf of the provider. A provider may also serve as the seller.

inputs.name: subTrip
inputs.label: subTrip
inputs.help: Identifies a [[Trip]] that is a subTrip of this Trip.  For example Day 1, Day 2, etc. of a multi-day trip.

inputs.name: tripOrigin
inputs.label: tripOrigin
inputs.help: The location of origin of the trip, prior to any destination(s).

InfectiousDisease.name: InfectiousDisease
InfectiousDisease.help: An infectious disease is a clinically evident human disease resulting from the presence of pathogenic microbial agents, like pathogenic viruses, pathogenic bacteria, fungi, protozoa, multicellular parasites, and prions. To be considered an infectious disease, such pathogens are known to be able to cause this disease.

inputs.name: infectiousAgent
inputs.label: infectiousAgent
inputs.help: The actual infectious agent, such as a specific bacterium.

inputs.name: infectiousAgentClass
inputs.label: infectiousAgentClass
inputs.help: The class of infectious agent (bacteria, prion, etc.) that causes the disease.

inputs.name: transmissionMethod
inputs.label: transmissionMethod
inputs.help: How the disease spreads, either as a route or vector, for example 'direct contact', 'Aedes aegypti', etc.

Dataset.name: Dataset
Dataset.help: A body of structured information describing some topic(s) of interest.

inputs.name: catalog
inputs.label: catalog
inputs.help: A data catalog which contains this dataset.

inputs.name: datasetTimeInterval
inputs.label: datasetTimeInterval
inputs.help: The range of temporal applicability of a dataset, e.g. for a 2011 census dataset, the year 2011 (in ISO 8601 time interval format).

inputs.name: distribution
inputs.label: distribution
inputs.help: A downloadable form of this dataset, at a specific location, in a specific format. This property can be repeated if different variations are available. There is no expectation that different downloadable distributions must contain exactly equivalent information (see also [DCAT](https://www.w3.org/TR/vocab-dcat-3/#Class:Distribution) on this point). Different distributions might include or exclude different subsets of the entire dataset, for example.

inputs.name: includedDataCatalog
inputs.label: includedDataCatalog
inputs.help: A data catalog which contains this dataset (this property was previously 'catalog', preferred name is now 'includedInDataCatalog').

inputs.name: includedInDataCatalog
inputs.label: includedInDataCatalog
inputs.help: A data catalog which contains this dataset.

inputs.name: issn
inputs.label: issn
inputs.help: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

inputs.name: measurementMethod
inputs.label: measurementMethod
