inputs.help: A subproperty of [[measurementTechnique]] that can be used for specifying specific methods, in particular via [[MeasurementMethodEnum]].

inputs.name: measurementTechnique
inputs.label: measurementTechnique
inputs.help:
A technique, method or technology used in an [[Observation]], [[StatisticalVariable]] or [[Dataset]] (or [[DataDownload]], [[DataCatalog]]), corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (for datasets, described using [[variableMeasured]]; for [[Observation]], a [[StatisticalVariable]]). Often but not necessarily each [[variableMeasured]] will have an explicit representation as (or mapping to) an property such as those defined in Schema.org, or other RDF vocabularies and "knowledge graphs". In that case the subproperty of [[variableMeasured]] called [[measuredProperty]] is applicable.
    
The [[measurementTechnique]] property helps when extra clarification is needed about how a [[measuredProperty]] was measured. This is oriented towards scientific and scholarly dataset publication but may have broader applicability; it is not intended as a full representation of measurement, but can often serve as a high level summary for dataset discovery. 

For example, if [[variableMeasured]] is: molecule concentration, [[measurementTechnique]] could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence". If the [[variableMeasured]] is "depression rating", the [[measurementTechnique]] could be "Zung Scale" or "HAM-D" or "Beck Depression Inventory". 

If there are several [[variableMeasured]] properties recorded for some given data object, use a [[PropertyValue]] for each [[variableMeasured]] and attach the corresponding [[measurementTechnique]]. The value can also be from an enumeration, organized as a [[MeasurementMetholdEnumeration]].

inputs.name: resultOf
inputs.label: resultOf
inputs.help: Inverse of property result

inputs.name: variableMeasured
inputs.label: variableMeasured
inputs.help: The variableMeasured property can indicate (repeated as necessary) the  variables that are measured in some dataset, either described as text or as pairs of identifier and description using PropertyValue, or more explicitly as a [[StatisticalVariable]].

Conversation.name: Conversation
Conversation.help: One or more messages between organizations or people on a particular topic. Individual messages can be linked to the conversation with isPartOf or hasPart properties.

MortgageLoan.name: MortgageLoan
MortgageLoan.help: A loan in which property or real estate is used as collateral. (A loan securitized against some real estate.)

inputs.name: domiciledMortgage
inputs.label: domiciledMortgage
inputs.help: Whether borrower is a resident of the jurisdiction where the property is located.

inputs.name: loanMortgageMandateAmount
inputs.label: loanMortgageMandateAmount
inputs.help: Amount of mortgage mandate that can be converted into a proper mortgage at a later stage.

Airline.name: Airline
Airline.help: An organization that provides flights for passengers.

inputs.name: boardingPolicy
inputs.label: boardingPolicy
inputs.help: The type of boarding policy used by the airline (e.g. zone-based or group-based).

inputs.name: iataCode
inputs.label: iataCode
inputs.help: IATA identifier for an airline or airport.

MedicalStudyStatus.name: MedicalStudyStatus
MedicalStudyStatus.help: The status of a medical study. Enumerated type.

ChemicalSubstance.name: ChemicalSubstance
ChemicalSubstance.help: A chemical substance is 'a portion of matter of constant composition, composed of molecular entities of the same type or of different types' (source: [ChEBI:59999](https://www.ebi.ac.uk/chebi/searchId.do?chebiId=59999)).

inputs.name: chemicalComposition
inputs.label: chemicalComposition
inputs.help: The chemical composition describes the identity and relative ratio of the chemical elements that make up the substance.

inputs.name: chemicalRole
inputs.label: chemicalRole
inputs.help: A role played by the BioChemEntity within a chemical context.

inputs.name: potentialUse
inputs.label: potentialUse
inputs.help: Intended use of the BioChemEntity by humans.

BrokerageAccount.name: BrokerageAccount
BrokerageAccount.help: An account that allows an investor to deposit funds and place investment orders with a licensed broker or brokerage firm.

Class.name: Class
Class.help: A class, also often called a 'Type'; equivalent to rdfs:Class.

inputs.name: supersededBy
inputs.label: supersededBy
inputs.help: Relates a term (i.e. a property, class or enumeration) to one that supersedes it.

WantAction.name: WantAction
WantAction.help: The act of expressing a desire about the object. An agent wants an object.

Observation.name: Observation
Observation.help:
Instances of the class [[Observation]] are used to specify observations about an entity at a particular time. The principal properties of an [[Observation]] are [[observationAbout]], [[measuredProperty]], [[statType]], [[value] and [[observationDate]]  and [[measuredProperty]]. Some but not all Observations represent a [[QuantitativeValue]]. Quantitative observations can be about a [[StatisticalVariable]], which is an abstract specification about which we can make observations that are grounded at a particular location and time. 
    
Observations can also encode a subset of simple RDF-like statements (its observationAbout, a StatisticalVariable, defining the measuredPoperty; its observationAbout property indicating the entity the statement is about, and [[value]] )

In the context of a quantitative knowledge graph, typical properties could include [[measuredProperty]], [[observationAbout]], [[observationDate]], [[value]], [[unitCode]], [[unitText]], [[measurementMethod]].

inputs.name: marginOfError
inputs.label: marginOfError
inputs.help: A [[marginOfError]] for an [[Observation]].

inputs.name: measuredProperty
inputs.label: measuredProperty
inputs.help: The measuredProperty of an [[Observation]], typically via its [[StatisticalVariable]]. There are various kinds of applicable [[Property]]: a schema.org property, a property from other RDF-compatible systems, e.g. W3C RDF Data Cube, Data Commons, Wikidata, or schema.org extensions such as [GS1's](https://www.gs1.org/voc/?show=properties).

inputs.name: measurementDenominator
inputs.label: measurementDenominator
inputs.help: Identifies the denominator variable when an observation represents a ratio or percentage.

inputs.name: measurementMethod
inputs.label: measurementMethod
inputs.help: A subproperty of [[measurementTechnique]] that can be used for specifying specific methods, in particular via [[MeasurementMethodEnum]].

inputs.name: measurementQualifier
inputs.label: measurementQualifier
inputs.help: Provides additional qualification to an observation. For example, a GDP observation measures the Nominal value.

inputs.name: measurementTechnique
inputs.label: measurementTechnique
inputs.help:
A technique, method or technology used in an [[Observation]], [[StatisticalVariable]] or [[Dataset]] (or [[DataDownload]], [[DataCatalog]]), corresponding to the method used for measuring the corresponding variable(s) (for datasets, described using [[variableMeasured]]; for [[Observation]], a [[StatisticalVariable]]). Often but not necessarily each [[variableMeasured]] will have an explicit representation as (or mapping to) an property such as those defined in Schema.org, or other RDF vocabularies and "knowledge graphs". In that case the subproperty of [[variableMeasured]] called [[measuredProperty]] is applicable.
    
The [[measurementTechnique]] property helps when extra clarification is needed about how a [[measuredProperty]] was measured. This is oriented towards scientific and scholarly dataset publication but may have broader applicability; it is not intended as a full representation of measurement, but can often serve as a high level summary for dataset discovery. 

For example, if [[variableMeasured]] is: molecule concentration, [[measurementTechnique]] could be: "mass spectrometry" or "nmr spectroscopy" or "colorimetry" or "immunofluorescence". If the [[variableMeasured]] is "depression rating", the [[measurementTechnique]] could be "Zung Scale" or "HAM-D" or "Beck Depression Inventory". 

If there are several [[variableMeasured]] properties recorded for some given data object, use a [[PropertyValue]] for each [[variableMeasured]] and attach the corresponding [[measurementTechnique]]. The value can also be from an enumeration, organized as a [[MeasurementMetholdEnumeration]].

inputs.name: observationAbout
inputs.label: observationAbout
inputs.help: The [[observationAbout]] property identifies an entity, often a [[Place]], associated with an [[Observation]].

inputs.name: observationDate
inputs.label: observationDate
inputs.help: The observationDate of an [[Observation]].

inputs.name: observationPeriod
inputs.label: observationPeriod
inputs.help: The length of time an Observation took place over. The format follows `P[0-9]*[Y|M|D|h|m|s]`. For example, P1Y is Period 1 Year, P3M is Period 3 Months, P3h is Period 3 hours.

inputs.name: variableMeasured
inputs.label: variableMeasured
inputs.help: The variableMeasured property can indicate (repeated as necessary) the  variables that are measured in some dataset, either described as text or as pairs of identifier and description using PropertyValue, or more explicitly as a [[StatisticalVariable]].

TreatmentIndication.name: TreatmentIndication
TreatmentIndication.help: An indication for treating an underlying condition, symptom, etc.

ProductCollection.name: ProductCollection
ProductCollection.help: A set of products (either [[ProductGroup]]s or specific variants) that are listed together e.g. in an [[Offer]].

inputs.name: includesObject
inputs.label: includesObject
inputs.help: This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in  an [[Offer]] or [[ProductCollection]].

UserDownloads.name: UserDownloads
UserDownloads.help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

inputs.name: albumProductionType
inputs.label: albumProductionType
inputs.help: Classification of the album by its type of content: soundtrack, live album, studio album, etc.

inputs.name: albumRelease
inputs.label: albumRelease
inputs.help: A release of this album.

inputs.name: albumReleaseType
inputs.label: albumReleaseType
inputs.help: The kind of release which this album is: single, EP or album.

inputs.name: byArtist
inputs.label: byArtist
inputs.help: The artist that performed this album or recording.

WatchAction.name: WatchAction
WatchAction.help: The act of consuming dynamic/moving visual content.

MediaObject.name: MediaObject
MediaObject.help: A media object, such as an image, video, audio, or text object embedded in a web page or a downloadable dataset i.e. DataDownload. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

inputs.name: associatedArticle
inputs.label: associatedArticle
inputs.help: A NewsArticle associated with the Media Object.

inputs.name: bitrate
inputs.label: bitrate
inputs.help: The bitrate of the media object.

inputs.name: contentSize
inputs.label: contentSize
inputs.help: File size in (mega/kilo)bytes.

inputs.name: contentUrl
inputs.label: contentUrl
inputs.help: Actual bytes of the media object, for example the image file or video file.

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: duration
inputs.help: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: embedUrl
inputs.label: embedUrl
inputs.help: A URL pointing to a player for a specific video. In general, this is the information in the ```src``` element of an ```embed``` tag and should not be the same as the content of the ```loc``` tag.

inputs.name: encodesCreativeWork
inputs.label: encodesCreativeWork
inputs.help: The CreativeWork encoded by this media object.

inputs.name: encodingFormat
inputs.label: encodingFormat
inputs.help:
Media type typically expressed using a MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) and [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types)), e.g. application/zip for a SoftwareApplication binary, audio/mpeg for .mp3 etc.

In cases where a [[CreativeWork]] has several media type representations, [[encoding]] can be used to indicate each [[MediaObject]] alongside particular [[encodingFormat]] information.

Unregistered or niche encoding and file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia/Wikidata entry.

inputs.name: endTime
inputs.label: endTime
inputs.help: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

inputs.name: fileOf
inputs.label: fileOf
inputs.help: Links from a File to its containing Object.

inputs.name: height
inputs.label: height
inputs.help: The height of the item.

inputs.name: ineligibleRegion
inputs.label: ineligibleRegion
inputs.help: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

inputs.name: interpretedAsClaim
inputs.label: interpretedAsClaim
inputs.help: Used to indicate a specific claim contained, implied, translated or refined from the content of a [[MediaObject]] or other [[CreativeWork]]. The interpreting party can be indicated using [[claimInterpreter]].

inputs.name: playerType
inputs.label: playerType
inputs.help: Player type required—for example, Flash or Silverlight.

inputs.name: productionCompany
inputs.label: productionCompany
inputs.help: The production company or studio responsible for the item, e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

inputs.name: regionsAllowed
inputs.label: regionsAllowed
inputs.help: The regions where the media is allowed. If not specified, then it's assumed to be allowed everywhere. Specify the countries in [ISO 3166 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166).

inputs.name: requiresSubscription
inputs.label: requiresSubscription
inputs.help: Indicates if use of the media require a subscription  (either paid or free). Allowed values are ```true``` or ```false``` (note that an earlier version had 'yes', 'no').

inputs.name: resultOf
inputs.label: resultOf
inputs.help: Inverse of property result

inputs.name: sha256
inputs.label: sha256
inputs.help: The [SHA-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SHA-2) SHA256 hash of the content of the item. For example, a zero-length input has value 'e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855'.

inputs.name: startTime
inputs.label: startTime
inputs.help: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

inputs.name: uploadDate
inputs.label: uploadDate
inputs.help: Date (including time if available) when this media object was uploaded to this site.

inputs.name: width
inputs.label: width
inputs.help: The width of the item.

Drawing.name: Drawing
Drawing.help: A picture or diagram made with a pencil, pen, or crayon rather than paint.

Energy.name: Energy
Energy.help: Properties that take Energy as values are of the form '<Number> <Energy unit of measure>'.

EmployeeRole.name: EmployeeRole
EmployeeRole.help: A subclass of OrganizationRole used to describe employee relationships.

inputs.name: baseSalary
inputs.label: baseSalary
inputs.help: The base salary of the job or of an employee in an EmployeeRole.

inputs.name: salaryCurrency
inputs.label: salaryCurrency
inputs.help: The currency (coded using [ISO 4217](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217)) used for the main salary information in this job posting or for this employee.

inputs.name: caption
inputs.label: caption
inputs.help: The caption for this object. For downloadable machine formats (closed caption, subtitles etc.) use MediaObject and indicate the [[encodingFormat]].

inputs.name: embeddedTextCaption
inputs.label: embeddedTextCaption
inputs.help: Represents textual captioning from a [[MediaObject]], e.g. text of a 'meme'.

inputs.name: transcript
inputs.label: transcript
inputs.help: If this MediaObject is an AudioObject or VideoObject, the transcript of that object.

SomeProducts.name: SomeProducts
SomeProducts.help: A placeholder for multiple similar products of the same kind.

inputs.name: inventoryLevel
inputs.label: inventoryLevel
inputs.help: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.

BroadcastEvent.name: BroadcastEvent
BroadcastEvent.help: An over the air or online broadcast event.

inputs.name: broadcastOfEvent
inputs.label: broadcastOfEvent
inputs.help: The event being broadcast such as a sporting event or awards ceremony.

inputs.name: isLiveBroadcast
inputs.label: isLiveBroadcast
inputs.help: True if the broadcast is of a live event.

inputs.name: subtitleLanguage
inputs.label: subtitleLanguage
inputs.help: Languages in which subtitles/captions are available, in [IETF BCP 47 standard format](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47).

inputs.name: videoFormat
inputs.label: videoFormat
inputs.help: The type of screening or video broadcast used (e.g. IMAX, 3D, SD, HD, etc.).

UserComments.name: UserComments
UserComments.help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

inputs.name: commentText
inputs.label: commentText
inputs.help: The text of the UserComment.

inputs.name: commentTime
inputs.label: commentTime
inputs.help: The time at which the UserComment was made.

inputs.name: creator
inputs.label: creator
inputs.help: The creator/author of this CreativeWork. This is the same as the Author property for CreativeWork.

inputs.name: discusses
inputs.label: discusses
inputs.help: Specifies the CreativeWork associated with the UserComment.

inputs.name: replyToUrl
inputs.label: replyToUrl
inputs.help: The URL at which a reply may be posted to the specified UserComment.

TaxiReservation.name: TaxiReservation
TaxiReservation.help: A reservation for a taxi.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations. For offers of tickets, use [[Offer]].

inputs.name: partySize
inputs.label: partySize
inputs.help: Number of people the reservation should accommodate.

inputs.name: pickupLocation
inputs.label: pickupLocation
inputs.help: Where a taxi will pick up a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

inputs.name: pickupTime
inputs.label: pickupTime
inputs.help: When a taxi will pick up a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

FloorPlan.name: FloorPlan
FloorPlan.help: A FloorPlan is an explicit representation of a collection of similar accommodations, allowing the provision of common information (room counts, sizes, layout diagrams) and offers for rental or sale. In typical use, some [[ApartmentComplex]] has an [[accommodationFloorPlan]] which is a [[FloorPlan]].  A FloorPlan is always in the context of a particular place, either a larger [[ApartmentComplex]] or a single [[Apartment]]. The visual/spatial aspects of a floor plan (i.e. room layout, [see wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Floor_plan)) can be indicated using [[image]].

inputs.name: amenityFeature
inputs.label: amenityFeature
inputs.help: An amenity feature (e.g. a characteristic or service) of the Accommodation. This generic property does not make a statement about whether the feature is included in an offer for the main accommodation or available at extra costs.

inputs.name: floorSize
inputs.label: floorSize
inputs.help:
The size of the accommodation, e.g. in square meter or squarefoot.
Typical unit code(s): MTK for square meter, FTK for square foot, or YDK for square yard.

inputs.name: isPlanForApartment
inputs.label: isPlanForApartment
inputs.help: Indicates some accommodation that this floor plan describes.

inputs.name: layoutImage
inputs.label: layoutImage
inputs.help: A schematic image showing the floorplan layout.

inputs.name: numberOfAccommodationUnits
inputs.label: numberOfAccommodationUnits
inputs.help: Indicates the total (available plus unavailable) number of accommodation units in an [[ApartmentComplex]], or the number of accommodation units for a specific [[FloorPlan]] (within its specific [[ApartmentComplex]]). See also [[numberOfAvailableAccommodationUnits]].

inputs.name: numberOfAvailableAccommodationUnits
inputs.label: numberOfAvailableAccommodationUnits
inputs.help: Indicates the number of available accommodation units in an [[ApartmentComplex]], or the number of accommodation units for a specific [[FloorPlan]] (within its specific [[ApartmentComplex]]). See also [[numberOfAccommodationUnits]].

inputs.name: numberOfBathroomsTotal
inputs.label: numberOfBathroomsTotal
inputs.help: The total integer number of bathrooms in some [[Accommodation]], following real estate conventions as [documented in RESO](https://ddwiki.reso.org/display/DDW17/BathroomsTotalInteger+Field): "The simple sum of the number of bathrooms. For example for a property with two Full Bathrooms and one Half Bathroom, the Bathrooms Total Integer will be 3.". See also [[numberOfRooms]].

inputs.name: numberOfBedrooms
inputs.label: numberOfBedrooms
inputs.help: The total integer number of bedrooms in a some [[Accommodation]], [[ApartmentComplex]] or [[FloorPlan]].

inputs.name: numberOfFullBathrooms
inputs.label: numberOfFullBathrooms
inputs.help: Number of full bathrooms - The total number of full and ¾ bathrooms in an [[Accommodation]]. This corresponds to the [BathroomsFull field in RESO](https://ddwiki.reso.org/display/DDW17/BathroomsFull+Field).

inputs.name: numberOfPartialBathrooms
inputs.label: numberOfPartialBathrooms
inputs.help: Number of partial bathrooms - The total number of half and ¼ bathrooms in an [[Accommodation]]. This corresponds to the [BathroomsPartial field in RESO](https://ddwiki.reso.org/display/DDW17/BathroomsPartial+Field).

inputs.name: numberOfRooms
inputs.label: numberOfRooms
inputs.help:
The number of rooms (excluding bathrooms and closets) of the accommodation or lodging business.
Typical unit code(s): ROM for room or C62 for no unit. The type of room can be put in the unitText property of the QuantitativeValue.

inputs.name: petsAllowed
inputs.label: petsAllowed
inputs.help: Indicates whether pets are allowed to enter the accommodation or lodging business. More detailed information can be put in a text value.

HowToSection.name: HowToSection
HowToSection.help: A sub-grouping of steps in the instructions for how to achieve a result (e.g. steps for making a pie crust within a pie recipe).

inputs.name: steps
inputs.label: steps
inputs.help: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection (originally misnamed 'steps'; 'step' is preferred).

MedicalClinic.name: MedicalClinic
MedicalClinic.help: A facility, often associated with a hospital or medical school, that is devoted to the specific diagnosis and/or healthcare. Previously limited to outpatients but with evolution it may be open to inpatients as well.

inputs.name: availableService
inputs.label: availableService
inputs.help: A medical service available from this provider.

inputs.name: medicalSpecialty
inputs.label: medicalSpecialty
inputs.help: A medical specialty of the provider.

ItemList.name: ItemList
ItemList.help: A list of items of any sort—for example, Top 10 Movies About Weathermen, or Top 100 Party Songs. Not to be confused with HTML lists, which are often used only for formatting.

inputs.name: itemListElement
inputs.label: itemListElement
inputs.help:
For itemListElement values, you can use simple strings (e.g. "Peter", "Paul", "Mary"), existing entities, or use ListItem.

Text values are best if the elements in the list are plain strings. Existing entities are best for a simple, unordered list of existing things in your data. ListItem is used with ordered lists when you want to provide additional context about the element in that list or when the same item might be in different places in different lists.

Note: The order of elements in your mark-up is not sufficient for indicating the order or elements.  Use ListItem with a 'position' property in such cases.

inputs.name: itemListOrder
inputs.label: itemListOrder
inputs.help: Type of ordering (e.g. Ascending, Descending, Unordered).

inputs.name: numberOfItems
inputs.label: numberOfItems
inputs.help: The number of items in an ItemList. Note that some descriptions might not fully describe all items in a list (e.g., multi-page pagination); in such cases, the numberOfItems would be for the entire list.

PeopleAudience.name: PeopleAudience
PeopleAudience.help: A set of characteristics belonging to people, e.g. who compose an item's target audience.

inputs.name: healthCondition
inputs.label: healthCondition
inputs.help: Specifying the health condition(s) of a patient, medical study, or other target audience.

inputs.name: requiredGender
inputs.label: requiredGender
inputs.help: Audiences defined by a person's gender.

inputs.name: requiredMaxAge
inputs.label: requiredMaxAge
inputs.help: Audiences defined by a person's maximum age.

inputs.name: requiredMinAge
inputs.label: requiredMinAge
inputs.help: Audiences defined by a person's minimum age.

inputs.name: suggestedAge
inputs.label: suggestedAge
inputs.help: The age or age range for the intended audience or person, for example 3-12 months for infants, 1-5 years for toddlers.

inputs.name: suggestedGender
inputs.label: suggestedGender
inputs.help: The suggested gender of the intended person or audience, for example "male", "female", or "unisex".

inputs.name: suggestedMaxAge
inputs.label: suggestedMaxAge
inputs.help: Maximum recommended age in years for the audience or user.

inputs.name: suggestedMeasurement
inputs.label: suggestedMeasurement
inputs.help: A suggested range of body measurements for the intended audience or person, for example inseam between 32 and 34 inches or height between 170 and 190 cm. Typically found on a size chart for wearable products.

inputs.name: suggestedMinAge
inputs.label: suggestedMinAge
inputs.help: Minimum recommended age in years for the audience or user.

HowTo.name: HowTo
HowTo.help: Instructions that explain how to achieve a result by performing a sequence of steps.

inputs.name: estimatedCost
inputs.label: estimatedCost
inputs.help: The estimated cost of the supply or supplies consumed when performing instructions.

inputs.name: performTime
inputs.label: performTime
inputs.help: The length of time it takes to perform instructions or a direction (not including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: prepTime
inputs.label: prepTime
inputs.help: The length of time it takes to prepare the items to be used in instructions or a direction, in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: step
inputs.label: step
inputs.help: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection.

inputs.name: steps
inputs.label: steps
inputs.help: A single step item (as HowToStep, text, document, video, etc.) or a HowToSection (originally misnamed 'steps'; 'step' is preferred).

inputs.name: supply
inputs.label: supply
inputs.help: A sub-property of instrument. A supply consumed when performing instructions or a direction.

inputs.name: tool
inputs.label: tool
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. An object used (but not consumed) when performing instructions or a direction.

inputs.name: totalTime
inputs.label: totalTime
inputs.help: The total time required to perform instructions or a direction (including time to prepare the supplies), in [ISO 8601 duration format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: yield
inputs.label: yield
inputs.help: The quantity that results by performing instructions. For example, a paper airplane, 10 personalized candles.

MenuSection.name: MenuSection
MenuSection.help: A sub-grouping of food or drink items in a menu. E.g. courses (such as 'Dinner', 'Breakfast', etc.), specific type of dishes (such as 'Meat', 'Vegan', 'Drinks', etc.), or some other classification made by the menu provider.

inputs.name: hasMenuItem
inputs.label: hasMenuItem
inputs.help: A food or drink item contained in a menu or menu section.

inputs.name: hasMenuSection
inputs.label: hasMenuSection
inputs.help: A subgrouping of the menu (by dishes, course, serving time period, etc.).

GeospatialGeometry.name: GeospatialGeometry
GeospatialGeometry.help: (Eventually to be defined as) a supertype of GeoShape designed to accommodate definitions from Geo-Spatial best practices.

inputs.name: geoContains
inputs.label: geoContains
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a containing geometry to a contained geometry. "a contains b iff no points of b lie in the exterior of a, and at least one point of the interior of b lies in the interior of a". As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoCoveredBy
inputs.label: geoCoveredBy
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that covers it. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoCovers
inputs.label: geoCovers
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a covering geometry to a covered geometry. "Every point of b is a point of (the interior or boundary of) a". As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoCrosses
inputs.label: geoCrosses
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that crosses it: "a crosses b: they have some but not all interior points in common, and the dimension of the intersection is less than that of at least one of them". As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoDisjoint
inputs.label: geoDisjoint
inputs.help: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) are topologically disjoint: "they have no point in common. They form a set of disconnected geometries." (A symmetric relationship, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).)

inputs.name: geoEquals
inputs.label: geoEquals
inputs.help: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) are topologically equal, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM). "Two geometries are topologically equal if their interiors intersect and no part of the interior or boundary of one geometry intersects the exterior of the other" (a symmetric relationship).

inputs.name: geoIntersects
inputs.label: geoIntersects
inputs.help: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) have at least one point in common. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoOverlaps
inputs.label: geoOverlaps
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to another that geospatially overlaps it, i.e. they have some but not all points in common. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: geoTouches
inputs.label: geoTouches
inputs.help: Represents spatial relations in which two geometries (or the places they represent) touch: "they have at least one boundary point in common, but no interior points." (A symmetric relationship, as defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).)

inputs.name: geoWithin
inputs.label: geoWithin
inputs.help: Represents a relationship between two geometries (or the places they represent), relating a geometry to one that contains it, i.e. it is inside (i.e. within) its interior. As defined in [DE-9IM](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/DE-9IM).

inputs.name: acceptsReservations
inputs.label: acceptsReservations
inputs.help: Indicates whether a FoodEstablishment accepts reservations. Values can be Boolean, an URL at which reservations can be made or (for backwards compatibility) the strings ```Yes``` or ```No```.

inputs.name: hasMenu
inputs.label: hasMenu
inputs.help: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

inputs.name: menu
inputs.label: menu
inputs.help: Either the actual menu as a structured representation, as text, or a URL of the menu.

inputs.name: servesCuisine
inputs.label: servesCuisine
inputs.help: The cuisine of the restaurant.

inputs.name: starRating
inputs.label: starRating
inputs.help: An official rating for a lodging business or food establishment, e.g. from national associations or standards bodies. Use the author property to indicate the rating organization, e.g. as an Organization with name such as (e.g. HOTREC, DEHOGA, WHR, or Hotelstars).

MerchantReturnPolicy.name: MerchantReturnPolicy
MerchantReturnPolicy.help: A MerchantReturnPolicy provides information about product return policies associated with an [[Organization]], [[Product]], or [[Offer]].

inputs.name: additionalProperty
inputs.label: additionalProperty
inputs.help: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristic of the entity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

inputs.name: applicableCountry
inputs.label: applicableCountry
inputs.help: A country where a particular merchant return policy applies to, for example the two-letter ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code.

inputs.name: customerRemorseReturnFees
inputs.label: customerRemorseReturnFees
inputs.help: The type of return fees if the product is returned due to customer remorse.

inputs.name: customerRemorseReturnLabelSource
inputs.label: customerRemorseReturnLabelSource
inputs.help: The method (from an enumeration) by which the customer obtains a return shipping label for a product returned due to customer remorse.

inputs.name: customerRemorseReturnShippingFeesAmount
inputs.label: customerRemorseReturnShippingFeesAmount
inputs.help: The amount of shipping costs if a product is returned due to customer remorse. Applicable when property [[customerRemorseReturnFees]] equals [[ReturnShippingFees]].

inputs.name: inStoreReturnsOffered
inputs.label: inStoreReturnsOffered
inputs.help: Are in-store returns offered? (For more advanced return methods use the [[returnMethod]] property.)

inputs.name: itemCondition
inputs.label: itemCondition
inputs.help: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition specifying the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer. Also used for product return policies to specify the condition of products accepted for returns.

inputs.name: itemDefectReturnFees
inputs.label: itemDefectReturnFees
inputs.help: The type of return fees for returns of defect products.

inputs.name: itemDefectReturnLabelSource
inputs.label: itemDefectReturnLabelSource
inputs.help: The method (from an enumeration) by which the customer obtains a return shipping label for a defect product.

inputs.name: itemDefectReturnShippingFeesAmount
inputs.label: itemDefectReturnShippingFeesAmount
inputs.help: Amount of shipping costs for defect product returns. Applicable when property [[itemDefectReturnFees]] equals [[ReturnShippingFees]].

inputs.name: merchantReturnDays
inputs.label: merchantReturnDays
inputs.help: Specifies either a fixed return date or the number of days (from the delivery date) that a product can be returned. Used when the [[returnPolicyCategory]] property is specified as [[MerchantReturnFiniteReturnWindow]].

inputs.name: merchantReturnLink
inputs.label: merchantReturnLink
inputs.help: Specifies a Web page or service by URL, for product returns.

inputs.name: refundType
inputs.label: refundType
inputs.help: A refund type, from an enumerated list.

inputs.name: restockingFee
inputs.label: restockingFee
inputs.help: Use [[MonetaryAmount]] to specify a fixed restocking fee for product returns, or use [[Number]] to specify a percentage of the product price paid by the customer.

inputs.name: returnFees
inputs.label: returnFees
inputs.help: The type of return fees for purchased products (for any return reason).

inputs.name: returnLabelSource
inputs.label: returnLabelSource
inputs.help: The method (from an enumeration) by which the customer obtains a return shipping label for a product returned for any reason.

inputs.name: returnMethod
inputs.label: returnMethod
inputs.help: The type of return method offered, specified from an enumeration.

inputs.name: returnPolicyCategory
inputs.label: returnPolicyCategory
inputs.help: Specifies an applicable return policy (from an enumeration).

inputs.name: returnPolicyCountry
inputs.label: returnPolicyCountry
inputs.help: The country where the product has to be sent to for returns, for example "Ireland" using the [[name]] property of [[Country]]. You can also provide the two-letter [ISO 3166-1 alpha-2 country code](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166-1). Note that this can be different from the country where the product was originally shipped from or sent to.

inputs.name: returnPolicySeasonalOverride
inputs.label: returnPolicySeasonalOverride
inputs.help: Seasonal override of a return policy.

inputs.name: returnShippingFeesAmount
inputs.label: returnShippingFeesAmount
inputs.help: Amount of shipping costs for product returns (for any reason). Applicable when property [[returnFees]] equals [[ReturnShippingFees]].

DataFeed.name: DataFeed
DataFeed.help: A single feed providing structured information about one or more entities or topics.

inputs.name: dataFeedElement
inputs.label: dataFeedElement
inputs.help: An item within a data feed. Data feeds may have many elements.

Article.name: Article
Article.help: An article, such as a news article or piece of investigative report. Newspapers and magazines have articles of many different types and this is intended to cover them all.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

inputs.name: articleBody
inputs.label: articleBody
inputs.help: The actual body of the article.

inputs.name: articleSection
inputs.label: articleSection
inputs.help: Articles may belong to one or more 'sections' in a magazine or newspaper, such as Sports, Lifestyle, etc.

inputs.name: backstory
inputs.label: backstory
inputs.help: For an [[Article]], typically a [[NewsArticle]], the backstory property provides a textual summary giving a brief explanation of why and how an article was created. In a journalistic setting this could include information about reporting process, methods, interviews, data sources, etc.

inputs.name: pageEnd
inputs.label: pageEnd
inputs.help: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

inputs.name: pageStart
inputs.label: pageStart
inputs.help: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

inputs.name: pagination
inputs.label: pagination
inputs.help: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

inputs.name: speakable
inputs.label: speakable
inputs.help:
Indicates sections of a Web page that are particularly 'speakable' in the sense of being highlighted as being especially appropriate for text-to-speech conversion. Other sections of a page may also be usefully spoken in particular circumstances; the 'speakable' property serves to indicate the parts most likely to be generally useful for speech.

The *speakable* property can be repeated an arbitrary number of times, with three kinds of possible 'content-locator' values:

1.) *id-value* URL references - uses *id-value* of an element in the page being annotated. The simplest use of *speakable* has (potentially relative) URL values, referencing identified sections of the document concerned.

2.) CSS Selectors - addresses content in the annotated page, e.g. via class attribute. Use the [[cssSelector]] property.

3.)  XPaths - addresses content via XPaths (assuming an XML view of the content). Use the [[xpath]] property.


For more sophisticated markup of speakable sections beyond simple ID references, either CSS selectors or XPath expressions to pick out document section(s) as speakable. For this
we define a supporting type, [[SpeakableSpecification]]  which is defined to be a possible value of the *speakable* property.

inputs.name: wordCount
inputs.label: wordCount
inputs.help: The number of words in the text of the Article.

TransferAction.name: TransferAction
TransferAction.help: The act of transferring/moving (abstract or concrete) animate or inanimate objects from one place to another.

inputs.name: fromLocation
inputs.label: fromLocation
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The original location of the object or the agent before the action.

inputs.name: toLocation
inputs.label: toLocation
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

Course.name: Course
Course.help: A description of an educational course which may be offered as distinct instances which take place at different times or take place at different locations, or be offered through different media or modes of study. An educational course is a sequence of one or more educational events and/or creative works which aims to build knowledge, competence or ability of learners.

inputs.name: availableLanguage
inputs.label: availableLanguage
inputs.help: A language someone may use with or at the item, service or place. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[inLanguage]].

inputs.name: courseCode
inputs.label: courseCode
inputs.help: The identifier for the [[Course]] used by the course [[provider]] (e.g. CS101 or 6.001).

inputs.name: coursePrerequisites
inputs.label: coursePrerequisites
inputs.help: Requirements for taking the Course. May be completion of another [[Course]] or a textual description like "permission of instructor". Requirements may be a pre-requisite competency, referenced using [[AlignmentObject]].

inputs.name: educationalCredentialAwarded
inputs.label: educationalCredentialAwarded
inputs.help: A description of the qualification, award, certificate, diploma or other educational credential awarded as a consequence of successful completion of this course or program.

inputs.name: financialAidEligible
inputs.label: financialAidEligible
inputs.help: A financial aid type or program which students may use to pay for tuition or fees associated with the program.

inputs.name: hasCourseInstance
inputs.label: hasCourseInstance
inputs.help: An offering of the course at a specific time and place or through specific media or mode of study or to a specific section of students.

inputs.name: numberOfCredits
inputs.label: numberOfCredits
inputs.help: The number of credits or units awarded by a Course or required to complete an EducationalOccupationalProgram.

inputs.name: occupationalCredentialAwarded
inputs.label: occupationalCredentialAwarded
inputs.help: A description of the qualification, award, certificate, diploma or other occupational credential awarded as a consequence of successful completion of this course or program.

inputs.name: syllabusSections
inputs.label: syllabusSections
inputs.help: Indicates (typically several) Syllabus entities that lay out what each section of the overall course will cover.

inputs.name: totalHistoricalEnrollment
inputs.label: totalHistoricalEnrollment
inputs.help: The total number of students that have enrolled in the history of the course.

ComicIssue.name: ComicIssue
ComicIssue.help:
Individual comic issues are serially published as
    	part of a larger series. For the sake of consistency, even one-shot issues
    	belong to a series comprised of a single issue. All comic issues can be
    	uniquely identified by: the combination of the name and volume number of the
    	series to which the issue belongs; the issue number; and the variant
    	description of the issue (if any).

inputs.name: artist
inputs.label: artist
inputs.help:
The primary artist for a work
    	in a medium other than pencils or digital line art--for example, if the
    	primary artwork is done in watercolors or digital paints.

inputs.name: colorist
inputs.label: colorist
inputs.help: The individual who adds color to inked drawings.

inputs.name: inker
inputs.label: inker
inputs.help: The individual who traces over the pencil drawings in ink after pencils are complete.

inputs.name: letterer
inputs.label: letterer
inputs.help: The individual who adds lettering, including speech balloons and sound effects, to artwork.

inputs.name: penciler
inputs.label: penciler
inputs.help: The individual who draws the primary narrative artwork.

inputs.name: variantCover
inputs.label: variantCover
inputs.help:
A description of the variant cover
    	for the issue, if the issue is a variant printing. For example, "Bryan Hitch
    	Variant Cover" or "2nd Printing Variant".

AnalysisNewsArticle.name: AnalysisNewsArticle
AnalysisNewsArticle.help: An AnalysisNewsArticle is a [[NewsArticle]] that, while based on factual reporting, incorporates the expertise of the author/producer, offering interpretations and conclusions.

Specialty.name: Specialty
Specialty.help: Any branch of a field in which people typically develop specific expertise, usually after significant study, time, and effort.

AccountingService.name: AccountingService
AccountingService.help: Accountancy business.\n\nAs a [[LocalBusiness]] it can be described as a [[provider]] of one or more [[Service]]\(s).

AcceptAction.name: AcceptAction
AcceptAction.help:
The act of committing to/adopting an object.

Related actions:

* [[RejectAction]]: The antonym of AcceptAction.

DepositAccount.name: DepositAccount
DepositAccount.help: A type of Bank Account with a main purpose of depositing funds to gain interest or other benefits.

TravelAction.name: TravelAction
TravelAction.help: The act of traveling from a fromLocation to a destination by a specified mode of transport, optionally with participants.

inputs.name: distance
inputs.label: distance
inputs.help: The distance travelled, e.g. exercising or travelling.

FinancialProduct.name: FinancialProduct
FinancialProduct.help: A product provided to consumers and businesses by financial institutions such as banks, insurance companies, brokerage firms, consumer finance companies, and investment companies which comprise the financial services industry.

inputs.name: annualPercentageRate
inputs.label: annualPercentageRate
inputs.help: The annual rate that is charged for borrowing (or made by investing), expressed as a single percentage number that represents the actual yearly cost of funds over the term of a loan. This includes any fees or additional costs associated with the transaction.

inputs.name: feesAndCommissionsSpecification
inputs.label: feesAndCommissionsSpecification
inputs.help: Description of fees, commissions, and other terms applied either to a class of financial product, or by a financial service organization.

inputs.name: interestRate
inputs.label: interestRate
inputs.help: The interest rate, charged or paid, applicable to the financial product. Note: This is different from the calculated annualPercentageRate.

CurrencyConversionService.name: CurrencyConversionService
CurrencyConversionService.help: A service to convert funds from one currency to another currency.

QualitativeValue.name: QualitativeValue
QualitativeValue.help: A predefined value for a product characteristic, e.g. the power cord plug type 'US' or the garment sizes 'S', 'M', 'L', and 'XL'.

inputs.name: additionalProperty
inputs.label: additionalProperty
inputs.help: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristic of the entity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

inputs.name: equal
inputs.label: equal
inputs.help: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is equal to the object.

inputs.name: greater
inputs.label: greater
inputs.help: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is greater than the object.

inputs.name: greaterOrEqual
inputs.label: greaterOrEqual
inputs.help: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is greater than or equal to the object.

inputs.name: lesser
inputs.label: lesser
inputs.help: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is lesser than the object.

inputs.name: lesserOrEqual
inputs.label: lesserOrEqual
inputs.help: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is lesser than or equal to the object.

inputs.name: nonEqual
inputs.label: nonEqual
inputs.help: This ordering relation for qualitative values indicates that the subject is not equal to the object.

inputs.name: valueReference
inputs.label: valueReference
inputs.help: A secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature or a type of measurement.

FoodEstablishmentReservation.name: FoodEstablishmentReservation
FoodEstablishmentReservation.help: A reservation to dine at a food-related business.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

inputs.name: endTime
inputs.label: endTime
inputs.help: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

inputs.name: partySize
inputs.label: partySize
inputs.help: Number of people the reservation should accommodate.

inputs.name: startTime
inputs.label: startTime
inputs.help: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

MedicalImagingTechnique.name: MedicalImagingTechnique
MedicalImagingTechnique.help: Any medical imaging modality typically used for diagnostic purposes. Enumerated type.

Blog.name: Blog
Blog.help: A [blog](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Blog), sometimes known as a "weblog". Note that the individual posts ([[BlogPosting]]s) in a [[Blog]] are often colloquially referred to by the same term.

inputs.name: blogPost
inputs.label: blogPost
inputs.help: A posting that is part of this blog.

inputs.name: blogPosts
inputs.label: blogPosts
inputs.help: Indicates a post that is part of a [[Blog]]. Note that historically, what we term a "Blog" was once known as a "weblog", and that what we term a "BlogPosting" is now often colloquially referred to as a "blog".

inputs.name: issn
inputs.label: issn
inputs.help: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

AnatomicalStructure.name: AnatomicalStructure
AnatomicalStructure.help: Any part of the human body, typically a component of an anatomical system. Organs, tissues, and cells are all anatomical structures.

inputs.name: associatedPathophysiology
inputs.label: associatedPathophysiology
inputs.help: If applicable, a description of the pathophysiology associated with the anatomical system, including potential abnormal changes in the mechanical, physical, and biochemical functions of the system.

inputs.name: bodyLocation
inputs.label: bodyLocation
inputs.help: Location in the body of the anatomical structure.

inputs.name: connectedTo
inputs.label: connectedTo
inputs.help: Other anatomical structures to which this structure is connected.

inputs.name: diagram
inputs.label: diagram
inputs.help: An image containing a diagram that illustrates the structure and/or its component substructures and/or connections with other structures.

inputs.name: partOfSystem
inputs.label: partOfSystem
inputs.help: The anatomical or organ system that this structure is part of.

inputs.name: relatedCondition
inputs.label: relatedCondition
inputs.help: A medical condition associated with this anatomy.

inputs.name: relatedTherapy
inputs.label: relatedTherapy
inputs.help: A medical therapy related to this anatomy.

inputs.name: subStructure
inputs.label: subStructure
inputs.help: Component (sub-)structure(s) that comprise this anatomical structure.

Comment.name: Comment
Comment.help: A comment on an item - for example, a comment on a blog post. The comment's content is expressed via the [[text]] property, and its topic via [[about]], properties shared with all CreativeWorks.

inputs.name: downvoteCount
inputs.label: downvoteCount
inputs.help: The number of downvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

inputs.name: parentItem
inputs.label: parentItem
inputs.help: The parent of a question, answer or item in general. Typically used for Q/A discussion threads e.g. a chain of comments with the first comment being an [[Article]] or other [[CreativeWork]]. See also [[comment]] which points from something to a comment about it.

inputs.name: sharedContent
inputs.label: sharedContent
inputs.help: A CreativeWork such as an image, video, or audio clip shared as part of this posting.

inputs.name: upvoteCount
inputs.label: upvoteCount
inputs.help: The number of upvotes this question, answer or comment has received from the community.

ActionAccessSpecification.name: ActionAccessSpecification
ActionAccessSpecification.help: A set of requirements that must be fulfilled in order to perform an Action.

inputs.name: availabilityEnds
inputs.label: availabilityEnds
inputs.help: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

inputs.name: availabilityStarts
inputs.label: availabilityStarts
inputs.help: The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

inputs.name: category
inputs.label: category
inputs.help: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

inputs.name: eligibleRegion
inputs.label: eligibleRegion
inputs.help: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

inputs.name: expectsAcceptanceOf
inputs.label: expectsAcceptanceOf
inputs.help: An Offer which must be accepted before the user can perform the Action. For example, the user may need to buy a movie before being able to watch it.

inputs.name: ineligibleRegion
inputs.label: ineligibleRegion
inputs.help: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

inputs.name: requiresSubscription
inputs.label: requiresSubscription
inputs.help: Indicates if use of the media require a subscription  (either paid or free). Allowed values are ```true``` or ```false``` (note that an earlier version had 'yes', 'no').

DeliveryChargeSpecification.name: DeliveryChargeSpecification
DeliveryChargeSpecification.help: The price for the delivery of an offer using a particular delivery method.

inputs.name: appliesToDeliveryMethod
inputs.label: appliesToDeliveryMethod
inputs.help: The delivery method(s) to which the delivery charge or payment charge specification applies.

inputs.name: areaServed
inputs.label: areaServed
inputs.help: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

inputs.name: eligibleRegion
inputs.label: eligibleRegion
inputs.help: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

inputs.name: ineligibleRegion
inputs.label: ineligibleRegion
inputs.help: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

MedicalGuidelineContraindication.name: MedicalGuidelineContraindication
MedicalGuidelineContraindication.help: A guideline contraindication that designates a process as harmful and where quality of the data supporting the contraindication is sound.

MoveAction.name: MoveAction
MoveAction.help:
The act of an agent relocating to a place.

Related actions:

* [[TransferAction]]: Unlike TransferAction, the subject of the move is a living Person or Organization rather than an inanimate object.

inputs.name: fromLocation
inputs.label: fromLocation
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The original location of the object or the agent before the action.

inputs.name: toLocation
inputs.label: toLocation
inputs.help: A sub property of location. The final location of the object or the agent after the action.

OfferShippingDetails.name: OfferShippingDetails
OfferShippingDetails.help:
OfferShippingDetails represents information about shipping destinations.

Multiple of these entities can be used to represent different shipping rates for different destinations:

One entity for Alaska/Hawaii. A different one for continental US. A different one for all France.

Multiple of these entities can be used to represent different shipping costs and delivery times.

Two entities that are identical but differ in rate and time:

E.g. Cheaper and slower: $5 in 5-7 days
or Fast and expensive: $15 in 1-2 days.

inputs.name: deliveryTime
inputs.label: deliveryTime
inputs.help: The total delay between the receipt of the order and the goods reaching the final customer.

inputs.name: depth
inputs.label: depth
inputs.help: The depth of the item.

inputs.name: doesNotShip
inputs.label: doesNotShip
inputs.help: Indicates when shipping to a particular [[shippingDestination]] is not available.

inputs.name: height
inputs.label: height
inputs.help: The height of the item.

inputs.name: shippingDestination
inputs.label: shippingDestination
inputs.help: indicates (possibly multiple) shipping destinations. These can be defined in several ways, e.g. postalCode ranges.

inputs.name: shippingLabel
inputs.label: shippingLabel
inputs.help: Label to match an [[OfferShippingDetails]] with a [[ShippingRateSettings]] (within the context of a [[shippingSettingsLink]] cross-reference).

inputs.name: shippingOrigin
inputs.label: shippingOrigin
inputs.help: Indicates the origin of a shipment, i.e. where it should be coming from.

inputs.name: shippingRate
inputs.label: shippingRate
inputs.help: The shipping rate is the cost of shipping to the specified destination. Typically, the maxValue and currency values (of the [[MonetaryAmount]]) are most appropriate.

inputs.name: shippingSettingsLink
inputs.label: shippingSettingsLink
inputs.help: Link to a page containing [[ShippingRateSettings]] and [[DeliveryTimeSettings]] details.

inputs.name: transitTimeLabel
inputs.label: transitTimeLabel
inputs.help: Label to match an [[OfferShippingDetails]] with a [[DeliveryTimeSettings]] (within the context of a [[shippingSettingsLink]] cross-reference).

inputs.name: weight
inputs.label: weight
inputs.help: The weight of the product or person.

inputs.name: width
inputs.label: width
inputs.help: The width of the item.

RadiationTherapy.name: RadiationTherapy
RadiationTherapy.help: A process of care using radiation aimed at improving a health condition.

XPathType.name: XPathType
XPathType.help: Text representing an XPath (typically but not necessarily version 1.0).

inputs.name: availableService
inputs.label: availableService
inputs.help: A medical service available from this provider.

inputs.name: healthcareReportingData
inputs.label: healthcareReportingData
inputs.help: Indicates data describing a hospital, e.g. a CDC [[CDCPMDRecord]] or as some kind of [[Dataset]].

inputs.name: medicalSpecialty
inputs.label: medicalSpecialty
inputs.help: A medical specialty of the provider.

DiscoverAction.name: DiscoverAction
DiscoverAction.help: The act of discovering/finding an object.

Distance.name: Distance
Distance.help: Properties that take Distances as values are of the form '<Number> <Length unit of measure>'. E.g., '7 ft'.

Hotel.name: Hotel
Hotel.help:
A hotel is an establishment that provides lodging paid on a short-term basis (source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Hotel).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

RadioSeries.name: RadioSeries
RadioSeries.help: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to radio broadcast and associated online delivery.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: actors
inputs.label: actors
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: containsSeason
inputs.label: containsSeason
inputs.help: A season that is part of the media series.

inputs.name: director
inputs.label: director
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: directors
inputs.label: directors
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: episode
inputs.label: episode
inputs.help: An episode of a TV, radio or game media within a series or season.

inputs.name: episodes
inputs.label: episodes
inputs.help: An episode of a TV/radio series or season.

inputs.name: musicBy
inputs.label: musicBy
inputs.help: The composer of the soundtrack.

inputs.name: numberOfEpisodes
inputs.label: numberOfEpisodes
inputs.help: The number of episodes in this season or series.

inputs.name: numberOfSeasons
inputs.label: numberOfSeasons
inputs.help: The number of seasons in this series.

inputs.name: productionCompany
inputs.label: productionCompany
inputs.help: The production company or studio responsible for the item, e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

inputs.name: season
inputs.label: season
inputs.help: A season in a media series.

inputs.name: seasons
inputs.label: seasons
inputs.help: A season in a media series.

inputs.name: trailer
inputs.label: trailer
inputs.help: The trailer of a movie or TV/radio series, season, episode, etc.

InvestmentFund.name: InvestmentFund
InvestmentFund.help: A company or fund that gathers capital from a number of investors to create a pool of money that is then re-invested into stocks, bonds and other assets.

Joint.name: Joint
Joint.help: The anatomical location at which two or more bones make contact.

inputs.name: biomechnicalClass
inputs.label: biomechnicalClass
inputs.help: The biomechanical properties of the bone.

inputs.name: functionalClass
inputs.label: functionalClass
inputs.help: The degree of mobility the joint allows.

inputs.name: structuralClass
inputs.label: structuralClass
inputs.help: The name given to how bone physically connects to each other.

ShareAction.name: ShareAction
ShareAction.help: The act of distributing content to people for their amusement or edification.

AskAction.name: AskAction
AskAction.help:
The act of posing a question / favor to someone.

Related actions:

* [[ReplyAction]]: Appears generally as a response to AskAction.

inputs.name: question
inputs.label: question
inputs.help: A sub property of object. A question.

Question.name: Question
Question.help: A specific question - e.g. from a user seeking answers online, or collected in a Frequently Asked Questions (FAQ) document.

inputs.name: acceptedAnswer
inputs.label: acceptedAnswer
inputs.help: The answer(s) that has been accepted as best, typically on a Question/Answer site. Sites vary in their selection mechanisms, e.g. drawing on community opinion and/or the view of the Question author.

inputs.name: answerCount
inputs.label: answerCount
inputs.help: The number of answers this question has received.

inputs.name: eduQuestionType
inputs.label: eduQuestionType
inputs.help: For questions that are part of learning resources (e.g. Quiz), eduQuestionType indicates the format of question being given. Example: "Multiple choice", "Open ended", "Flashcard".

inputs.name: parentItem
inputs.label: parentItem
inputs.help: The parent of a question, answer or item in general. Typically used for Q/A discussion threads e.g. a chain of comments with the first comment being an [[Article]] or other [[CreativeWork]]. See also [[comment]] which points from something to a comment about it.

inputs.name: suggestedAnswer
inputs.label: suggestedAnswer
inputs.help: An answer (possibly one of several, possibly incorrect) to a Question, e.g. on a Question/Answer site.

QuoteAction.name: QuoteAction
QuoteAction.help: An agent quotes/estimates/appraises an object/product/service with a price at a location/store.

InfectiousAgentClass.name: InfectiousAgentClass
InfectiousAgentClass.help: Classes of agents or pathogens that transmit infectious diseases. Enumerated type.

StatisticalPopulation.name: StatisticalPopulation
StatisticalPopulation.help:
A StatisticalPopulation is a set of instances of a certain given type that satisfy some set of constraints. The property [[populationType]] is used to specify the type. Any property that can be used on instances of that type can appear on the statistical population. For example, a [[StatisticalPopulation]] representing all [[Person]]s with a [[homeLocation]] of East Podunk California would be described by applying the appropriate [[homeLocation]] and [[populationType]] properties to a [[StatisticalPopulation]] item that stands for that set of people.
The properties [[numConstraints]] and [[constraintProperty]] are used to specify which of the populations properties are used to specify the population. Note that the sense of "population" used here is the general sense of a statistical
population, and does not imply that the population consists of people. For example, a [[populationType]] of [[Event]] or [[NewsArticle]] could be used. See also [[Observation]], where a [[populationType]] such as [[Person]] or [[Event]] can be indicated directly. In most cases it may be better to use [[StatisticalVariable]] instead of [[StatisticalPopulation]].

inputs.name: populationType
inputs.label: populationType
inputs.help: Indicates the populationType common to all members of a [[StatisticalPopulation]] or all cases within the scope of a [[StatisticalVariable]].

EnergyEfficiencyEnumeration.name: EnergyEfficiencyEnumeration
EnergyEfficiencyEnumeration.help: Enumerates energy efficiency levels (also known as "classes" or "ratings") and certifications that are part of several international energy efficiency standards.

HealthTopicContent.name: HealthTopicContent
HealthTopicContent.help: [[HealthTopicContent]] is [[WebContent]] that is about some aspect of a health topic, e.g. a condition, its symptoms or treatments. Such content may be comprised of several parts or sections and use different types of media. Multiple instances of [[WebContent]] (and hence [[HealthTopicContent]]) can be related using [[hasPart]] / [[isPartOf]] where there is some kind of content hierarchy, and their content described with [[about]] and [[mentions]] e.g. building upon the existing [[MedicalCondition]] vocabulary.

inputs.name: hasHealthAspect
inputs.label: hasHealthAspect
inputs.help: Indicates the aspect or aspects specifically addressed in some [[HealthTopicContent]]. For example, that the content is an overview, or that it talks about treatment, self-care, treatments or their side-effects.

PayAction.name: PayAction
PayAction.help: An agent pays a price to a participant.

inputs.name: recipient
inputs.label: recipient
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

BankAccount.name: BankAccount
BankAccount.help: A product or service offered by a bank whereby one may deposit, withdraw or transfer money and in some cases be paid interest.

inputs.name: accountMinimumInflow
inputs.label: accountMinimumInflow
inputs.help: A minimum amount that has to be paid in every month.

inputs.name: accountOverdraftLimit
inputs.label: accountOverdraftLimit
inputs.help: An overdraft is an extension of credit from a lending institution when an account reaches zero. An overdraft allows the individual to continue withdrawing money even if the account has no funds in it. Basically the bank allows people to borrow a set amount of money.

inputs.name: bankAccountType
inputs.label: bankAccountType
inputs.help: The type of a bank account.

MedicalSymptom.name: MedicalSymptom
MedicalSymptom.help: Any complaint sensed and expressed by the patient (therefore defined as subjective)  like stomachache, lower-back pain, or fatigue.

TradeAction.name: TradeAction
TradeAction.help: The act of participating in an exchange of goods and services for monetary compensation. An agent trades an object, product or service with a participant in exchange for a one time or periodic payment.

inputs.name: price
inputs.label: price
inputs.help:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

* Use the [[priceCurrency]] property (with standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR") instead of including [ambiguous symbols](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign#Currencies_that_use_the_dollar_or_peso_sign) such as '$' in the value.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
* Note that both [RDFa](http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/#using-the-content-attribute) and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similar Unicode symbols.

inputs.name: priceCurrency
inputs.label: priceCurrency
inputs.help: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

inputs.name: priceSpecification
inputs.label: priceSpecification
inputs.help: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

MeetingRoom.name: MeetingRoom
MeetingRoom.help:
A meeting room, conference room, or conference hall is a room provided for singular events such as business conferences and meetings (source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Conference_hall).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

CovidTestingFacility.name: CovidTestingFacility
CovidTestingFacility.help:
A CovidTestingFacility is a [[MedicalClinic]] where testing for the COVID-19 Coronavirus
      disease is available. If the facility is being made available from an established [[Pharmacy]], [[Hotel]], or other
      non-medical organization, multiple types can be listed. This makes it easier to re-use existing schema.org information
      about that place, e.g. contact info, address, opening hours. Note that in an emergency, such information may not always be reliable.

ShippingRateSettings.name: ShippingRateSettings
ShippingRateSettings.help: A ShippingRateSettings represents re-usable pieces of shipping information. It is designed for publication on an URL that may be referenced via the [[shippingSettingsLink]] property of an [[OfferShippingDetails]]. Several occurrences can be published, distinguished and matched (i.e. identified/referenced) by their different values for [[shippingLabel]].

inputs.name: doesNotShip
inputs.label: doesNotShip
inputs.help: Indicates when shipping to a particular [[shippingDestination]] is not available.

inputs.name: freeShippingThreshold
inputs.label: freeShippingThreshold
inputs.help: A monetary value above (or at) which the shipping rate becomes free. Intended to be used via an [[OfferShippingDetails]] with [[shippingSettingsLink]] matching this [[ShippingRateSettings]].

inputs.name: isUnlabelledFallback
inputs.label: isUnlabelledFallback
inputs.help: This can be marked 'true' to indicate that some published [[DeliveryTimeSettings]] or [[ShippingRateSettings]] are intended to apply to all [[OfferShippingDetails]] published by the same merchant, when referenced by a [[shippingSettingsLink]] in those settings. It is not meaningful to use a 'true' value for this property alongside a transitTimeLabel (for [[DeliveryTimeSettings]]) or shippingLabel (for [[ShippingRateSettings]]), since this property is for use with unlabelled settings.

inputs.name: shippingDestination
inputs.label: shippingDestination
inputs.help: indicates (possibly multiple) shipping destinations. These can be defined in several ways, e.g. postalCode ranges.

inputs.name: shippingLabel
inputs.label: shippingLabel
inputs.help: Label to match an [[OfferShippingDetails]] with a [[ShippingRateSettings]] (within the context of a [[shippingSettingsLink]] cross-reference).

inputs.name: shippingRate
inputs.label: shippingRate
inputs.help: The shipping rate is the cost of shipping to the specified destination. Typically, the maxValue and currency values (of the [[MonetaryAmount]]) are most appropriate.

DislikeAction.name: DislikeAction
DislikeAction.help: The act of expressing a negative sentiment about the object. An agent dislikes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

VisualArtwork.name: VisualArtwork
VisualArtwork.help: A work of art that is primarily visual in character.

inputs.name: artEdition
inputs.label: artEdition
inputs.help: The number of copies when multiple copies of a piece of artwork are produced - e.g. for a limited edition of 20 prints, 'artEdition' refers to the total number of copies (in this example "20").

inputs.name: artMedium
inputs.label: artMedium
inputs.help: The material used. (E.g. Oil, Watercolour, Acrylic, Linoprint, Marble, Cyanotype, Digital, Lithograph, DryPoint, Intaglio, Pastel, Woodcut, Pencil, Mixed Media, etc.)

inputs.name: artform
inputs.label: artform
inputs.help: e.g. Painting, Drawing, Sculpture, Print, Photograph, Assemblage, Collage, etc.

inputs.name: artist
inputs.label: artist
inputs.help:
The primary artist for a work
    	in a medium other than pencils or digital line art--for example, if the
    	primary artwork is done in watercolors or digital paints.

inputs.name: artworkSurface
inputs.label: artworkSurface
inputs.help: The supporting materials for the artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

inputs.name: colorist
inputs.label: colorist
inputs.help: The individual who adds color to inked drawings.

inputs.name: depth
inputs.label: depth
inputs.help: The depth of the item.

inputs.name: height
inputs.label: height
inputs.help: The height of the item.

inputs.name: inker
inputs.label: inker
inputs.help: The individual who traces over the pencil drawings in ink after pencils are complete.

inputs.name: letterer
inputs.label: letterer
inputs.help: The individual who adds lettering, including speech balloons and sound effects, to artwork.

inputs.name: penciler
inputs.label: penciler
inputs.help: The individual who draws the primary narrative artwork.

inputs.name: surface
inputs.label: surface
inputs.help: A material used as a surface in some artwork, e.g. Canvas, Paper, Wood, Board, etc.

inputs.name: width
inputs.label: width
inputs.help: The width of the item.

MedicalSpecialty.name: MedicalSpecialty
