MedicalSpecialty.help: Any specific branch of medical science or practice. Medical specialities include clinical specialties that pertain to particular organ systems and their respective disease states, as well as allied health specialties. Enumerated type.

BrainStructure.name: BrainStructure
BrainStructure.help: Any anatomical structure which pertains to the soft nervous tissue functioning as the coordinating center of sensation and intellectual and nervous activity.

WPSideBar.name: WPSideBar
WPSideBar.help: A sidebar section of the page.

WorkBasedProgram.name: WorkBasedProgram
WorkBasedProgram.help: A program with both an educational and employment component. Typically based at a workplace and structured around work-based learning, with the aim of instilling competencies related to an occupation. WorkBasedProgram is used to distinguish programs such as apprenticeships from school, college or other classroom based educational programs.

inputs.name: occupationalCategory
inputs.label: occupationalCategory
inputs.help:
A category describing the job, preferably using a term from a taxonomy such as [BLS O*NET-SOC](http://www.onetcenter.org/taxonomy.html), [ISCO-08](https://www.ilo.org/public/english/bureau/stat/isco/isco08/) or similar, with the property repeated for each applicable value. Ideally the taxonomy should be identified, and both the textual label and formal code for the category should be provided.\n
Note: for historical reasons, any textual label and formal code provided as a literal may be assumed to be from O*NET-SOC.

inputs.name: trainingSalary
inputs.label: trainingSalary
inputs.help: The estimated salary earned while in the program.

MedicalRiskCalculator.name: MedicalRiskCalculator
MedicalRiskCalculator.help: A complex mathematical calculation requiring an online calculator, used to assess prognosis. Note: use the url property of Thing to record any URLs for online calculators.

MedicalTrialDesign.name: MedicalTrialDesign
MedicalTrialDesign.help: Design models for medical trials. Enumerated type.

ArriveAction.name: ArriveAction
ArriveAction.help: The act of arriving at a place. An agent arrives at a destination from a fromLocation, optionally with participants.

Offer.name: Offer
Offer.help:
An offer to transfer some rights to an item or to provide a service — for example, an offer to sell tickets to an event, to rent the DVD of a movie, to stream a TV show over the internet, to repair a motorcycle, or to loan a book.

Note: As the [[businessFunction]] property, which identifies the form of offer (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose), defaults to http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell; an Offer without a defined businessFunction value can be assumed to be an offer to sell.

For [GTIN](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin)-related fields, see [Check Digit calculator](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/support/check_digit_calculator) and [validation guide](http://www.gs1us.org/resources/standards/gtin-validation-guide) from [GS1](http://www.gs1.org/).

inputs.name: acceptedPaymentMethod
inputs.label: acceptedPaymentMethod
inputs.help: The payment method(s) accepted by seller for this offer.

inputs.name: addOn
inputs.label: addOn
inputs.help: An additional offer that can only be obtained in combination with the first base offer (e.g. supplements and extensions that are available for a surcharge).

inputs.name: additionalProperty
inputs.label: additionalProperty
inputs.help: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristic of the entity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

inputs.name: advanceBookingRequirement
inputs.label: advanceBookingRequirement
inputs.help: The amount of time that is required between accepting the offer and the actual usage of the resource or service.

inputs.name: aggregateRating
inputs.label: aggregateRating
inputs.help: The overall rating, based on a collection of reviews or ratings, of the item.

inputs.name: areaServed
inputs.label: areaServed
inputs.help: The geographic area where a service or offered item is provided.

inputs.name: asin
inputs.label: asin
inputs.help:
An Amazon Standard Identification Number (ASIN) is a 10-character alphanumeric unique identifier assigned by Amazon.com and its partners for product identification within the Amazon organization (summary from [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Amazon_Standard_Identification_Number)'s article).

Note also that this is a definition for how to include ASINs in Schema.org data, and not a definition of ASINs in general - see documentation from Amazon for authoritative details.
ASINs are most commonly encoded as text strings, but the [asin] property supports URL/URI as potential values too.

inputs.name: availability
inputs.label: availability
inputs.help: The availability of this item—for example In stock, Out of stock, Pre-order, etc.

inputs.name: availabilityEnds
inputs.label: availabilityEnds
inputs.help: The end of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

inputs.name: availabilityStarts
inputs.label: availabilityStarts
inputs.help: The beginning of the availability of the product or service included in the offer.

inputs.name: availableAtOrFrom
inputs.label: availableAtOrFrom
inputs.help: The place(s) from which the offer can be obtained (e.g. store locations).

inputs.name: availableDeliveryMethod
inputs.label: availableDeliveryMethod
inputs.help: The delivery method(s) available for this offer.

inputs.name: businessFunction
inputs.label: businessFunction
inputs.help: The business function (e.g. sell, lease, repair, dispose) of the offer or component of a bundle (TypeAndQuantityNode). The default is http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#Sell.

inputs.name: category
inputs.label: category
inputs.help: A category for the item. Greater signs or slashes can be used to informally indicate a category hierarchy.

inputs.name: checkoutPageURLTemplate
inputs.label: checkoutPageURLTemplate
inputs.help: A URL template (RFC 6570) for a checkout page for an offer. This approach allows merchants to specify a URL for online checkout of the offered product, by interpolating parameters such as the logged in user ID, product ID, quantity, discount code etc. Parameter naming and standardization are not specified here.

inputs.name: deliveryLeadTime
inputs.label: deliveryLeadTime
inputs.help: The typical delay between the receipt of the order and the goods either leaving the warehouse or being prepared for pickup, in case the delivery method is on site pickup.

inputs.name: eligibleCustomerType
inputs.label: eligibleCustomerType
inputs.help: The type(s) of customers for which the given offer is valid.

inputs.name: eligibleDuration
inputs.label: eligibleDuration
inputs.help: The duration for which the given offer is valid.

inputs.name: eligibleQuantity
inputs.label: eligibleQuantity
inputs.help: The interval and unit of measurement of ordering quantities for which the offer or price specification is valid. This allows e.g. specifying that a certain freight charge is valid only for a certain quantity.

inputs.name: eligibleRegion
inputs.label: eligibleRegion
inputs.help: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is valid.\n\nSee also [[ineligibleRegion]].

inputs.name: eligibleTransactionVolume
inputs.label: eligibleTransactionVolume
inputs.help: The transaction volume, in a monetary unit, for which the offer or price specification is valid, e.g. for indicating a minimal purchasing volume, to express free shipping above a certain order volume, or to limit the acceptance of credit cards to purchases to a certain minimal amount.

inputs.name: gtin
inputs.label: gtin
inputs.help:
A Global Trade Item Number ([GTIN](https://www.gs1.org/standards/id-keys/gtin)). GTINs identify trade items, including products and services, using numeric identification codes.

The GS1 [digital link specifications](https://www.gs1.org/standards/Digital-Link/) express GTINs as URLs (URIs, IRIs, etc.). Details including regular expression examples can be found in, Section 6 of the GS1 URI Syntax specification; see also [schema.org tracking issue](https://github.com/schemaorg/schemaorg/issues/3156#issuecomment-1209522809) for schema.org-specific discussion. A correct [[gtin]] value should be a valid GTIN, which means that it should be an all-numeric string of either 8, 12, 13 or 14 digits, or a "GS1 Digital Link" URL based on such a string. The numeric component should also have a [valid GS1 check digit](https://www.gs1.org/services/check-digit-calculator) and meet the other rules for valid GTINs. See also [GS1's GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) and [Wikipedia](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Global_Trade_Item_Number) for more details. Left-padding of the gtin values is not required or encouraged. The [[gtin]] property generalizes the earlier [[gtin8]], [[gtin12]], [[gtin13]], and [[gtin14]] properties.

Note also that this is a definition for how to include GTINs in Schema.org data, and not a definition of GTINs in general - see the GS1 documentation for authoritative details.

inputs.name: gtin12
inputs.label: gtin12
inputs.help: The GTIN-12 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. The GTIN-12 is the 12-digit GS1 Identification Key composed of a U.P.C. Company Prefix, Item Reference, and Check Digit used to identify trade items. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: gtin13
inputs.label: gtin13
inputs.help: The GTIN-13 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This is equivalent to 13-digit ISBN codes and EAN UCC-13. Former 12-digit UPC codes can be converted into a GTIN-13 code by simply adding a preceding zero. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: gtin14
inputs.label: gtin14
inputs.help: The GTIN-14 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: gtin8
inputs.label: gtin8
inputs.help: The GTIN-8 code of the product, or the product to which the offer refers. This code is also known as EAN/UCC-8 or 8-digit EAN. See [GS1 GTIN Summary](http://www.gs1.org/barcodes/technical/idkeys/gtin) for more details.

inputs.name: hasAdultConsideration
inputs.label: hasAdultConsideration
inputs.help: Used to tag an item to be intended or suitable for consumption or use by adults only.

inputs.name: hasMeasurement
inputs.label: hasMeasurement
inputs.help: A measurement of an item, For example, the inseam of pants, the wheel size of a bicycle, the gauge of a screw, or the carbon footprint measured for certification by an authority. Usually an exact measurement, but can also be a range of measurements for adjustable products, for example belts and ski bindings.

inputs.name: hasMerchantReturnPolicy
inputs.label: hasMerchantReturnPolicy
inputs.help: Specifies a MerchantReturnPolicy that may be applicable.

inputs.name: includesObject
inputs.label: includesObject
inputs.help: This links to a node or nodes indicating the exact quantity of the products included in  an [[Offer]] or [[ProductCollection]].

inputs.name: ineligibleRegion
inputs.label: ineligibleRegion
inputs.help: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

inputs.name: inventoryLevel
inputs.label: inventoryLevel
inputs.help: The current approximate inventory level for the item or items.

inputs.name: isFamilyFriendly
inputs.label: isFamilyFriendly
inputs.help: Indicates whether this content is family friendly.

inputs.name: itemCondition
inputs.label: itemCondition
inputs.help: A predefined value from OfferItemCondition specifying the condition of the product or service, or the products or services included in the offer. Also used for product return policies to specify the condition of products accepted for returns.

inputs.name: itemOffered
inputs.label: itemOffered
inputs.help: An item being offered (or demanded). The transactional nature of the offer or demand is documented using [[businessFunction]], e.g. sell, lease etc. While several common expected types are listed explicitly in this definition, others can be used. Using a second type, such as Product or a subtype of Product, can clarify the nature of the offer.

inputs.name: leaseLength
inputs.label: leaseLength
inputs.help: Length of the lease for some [[Accommodation]], either particular to some [[Offer]] or in some cases intrinsic to the property.

inputs.name: mobileUrl
inputs.label: mobileUrl
inputs.help:
The [[mobileUrl]] property is provided for specific situations in which data consumers need to determine whether one of several provided URLs is a dedicated 'mobile site'.

To discourage over-use, and reflecting intial usecases, the property is expected only on [[Product]] and [[Offer]], rather than [[Thing]]. The general trend in web technology is towards [responsive design](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Responsive_web_design) in which content can be flexibly adapted to a wide range of browsing environments. Pages and sites referenced with the long-established [[url]] property should ideally also be usable on a wide variety of devices, including mobile phones. In most cases, it would be pointless and counter productive to attempt to update all [[url]] markup to use [[mobileUrl]] for more mobile-oriented pages. The property is intended for the case when items (primarily [[Product]] and [[Offer]]) have extra URLs hosted on an additional "mobile site" alongside the main one. It should not be taken as an endorsement of this publication style.

inputs.name: mpn
inputs.label: mpn
inputs.help: The Manufacturer Part Number (MPN) of the product, or the product to which the offer refers.

inputs.name: offeredBy
inputs.label: offeredBy
inputs.help: A pointer to the organization or person making the offer.

inputs.name: price
inputs.label: price
inputs.help:
The offer price of a product, or of a price component when attached to PriceSpecification and its subtypes.

Usage guidelines:

* Use the [[priceCurrency]] property (with standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR") instead of including [ambiguous symbols](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Dollar_sign#Currencies_that_use_the_dollar_or_peso_sign) such as '$' in the value.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.
* Note that both [RDFa](http://www.w3.org/TR/xhtml-rdfa-primer/#using-the-content-attribute) and Microdata syntax allow the use of a "content=" attribute for publishing simple machine-readable values alongside more human-friendly formatting.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similar Unicode symbols.

inputs.name: priceCurrency
inputs.label: priceCurrency
inputs.help: The currency of the price, or a price component when attached to [[PriceSpecification]] and its subtypes.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

inputs.name: priceSpecification
inputs.label: priceSpecification
inputs.help: One or more detailed price specifications, indicating the unit price and delivery or payment charges.

inputs.name: priceValidUntil
inputs.label: priceValidUntil
inputs.help: The date after which the price is no longer available.

inputs.name: review
inputs.label: review
inputs.help: A review of the item.

inputs.name: reviews
inputs.label: reviews
inputs.help: Review of the item.

inputs.name: seller
inputs.label: seller
inputs.help: An entity which offers (sells / leases / lends / loans) the services / goods.  A seller may also be a provider.

inputs.name: serialNumber
inputs.label: serialNumber
inputs.help: The serial number or any alphanumeric identifier of a particular product. When attached to an offer, it is a shortcut for the serial number of the product included in the offer.

inputs.name: shippingDetails
inputs.label: shippingDetails
inputs.help: Indicates information about the shipping policies and options associated with an [[Offer]].

inputs.name: sku
inputs.label: sku
inputs.help: The Stock Keeping Unit (SKU), i.e. a merchant-specific identifier for a product or service, or the product to which the offer refers.

inputs.name: validFrom
inputs.label: validFrom
inputs.help: The date when the item becomes valid.

inputs.name: validThrough
inputs.label: validThrough
inputs.help: The date after when the item is not valid. For example the end of an offer, salary period, or a period of opening hours.

inputs.name: warranty
inputs.label: warranty
inputs.help: The warranty promise(s) included in the offer.

WriteAction.name: WriteAction
WriteAction.help: The act of authoring written creative content.

inputs.name: inLanguage
inputs.label: inLanguage
inputs.help: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

inputs.name: language
inputs.label: language
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. The language used on this action.

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: duration
inputs.help: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: readBy
inputs.label: readBy
inputs.help: A person who reads (performs) the audiobook.

ItemListOrderType.name: ItemListOrderType
ItemListOrderType.help: Enumerated for values for itemListOrder for indicating how an ordered ItemList is organized.

Motorcycle.name: Motorcycle
Motorcycle.help: A motorcycle or motorbike is a single-track, two-wheeled motor vehicle.

MedicalSign.name: MedicalSign
MedicalSign.help: Any physical manifestation of a person's medical condition discoverable by objective diagnostic tests or physical examination.

inputs.name: identifyingExam
inputs.label: identifyingExam
inputs.help: A physical examination that can identify this sign.

inputs.name: identifyingTest
inputs.label: identifyingTest
inputs.help: A diagnostic test that can identify this sign.

Schedule.name: Schedule
Schedule.help:
A schedule defines a repeating time period used to describe a regularly occurring [[Event]]. At a minimum a schedule will specify [[repeatFrequency]] which describes the interval between occurrences of the event. Additional information can be provided to specify the schedule more precisely.
      This includes identifying the day(s) of the week or month when the recurring event will take place, in addition to its start and end time. Schedules may also
      have start and end dates to indicate when they are active, e.g. to define a limited calendar of events.

inputs.name: byDay
inputs.label: byDay
inputs.help: Defines the day(s) of the week on which a recurring [[Event]] takes place. May be specified using either [[DayOfWeek]], or alternatively [[Text]] conforming to iCal's syntax for byDay recurrence rules.

inputs.name: byMonth
inputs.label: byMonth
inputs.help: Defines the month(s) of the year on which a recurring [[Event]] takes place. Specified as an [[Integer]] between 1-12. January is 1.

inputs.name: byMonthDay
inputs.label: byMonthDay
inputs.help: Defines the day(s) of the month on which a recurring [[Event]] takes place. Specified as an [[Integer]] between 1-31.

inputs.name: byMonthWeek
inputs.label: byMonthWeek
inputs.help: Defines the week(s) of the month on which a recurring Event takes place. Specified as an Integer between 1-5. For clarity, byMonthWeek is best used in conjunction with byDay to indicate concepts like the first and third Mondays of a month.

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: duration
inputs.help: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: endDate
inputs.label: endDate
inputs.help: The end date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: endTime
inputs.label: endTime
inputs.help: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

inputs.name: exceptDate
inputs.label: exceptDate
inputs.help:
Defines a [[Date]] or [[DateTime]] during which a scheduled [[Event]] will not take place. The property allows exceptions to
      a [[Schedule]] to be specified. If an exception is specified as a [[DateTime]] then only the event that would have started at that specific date and time
      should be excluded from the schedule. If an exception is specified as a [[Date]] then any event that is scheduled for that 24 hour period should be
      excluded from the schedule. This allows a whole day to be excluded from the schedule without having to itemise every scheduled event.

inputs.name: repeatCount
inputs.label: repeatCount
inputs.help: Defines the number of times a recurring [[Event]] will take place.

inputs.name: repeatFrequency
inputs.label: repeatFrequency
inputs.help:
Defines the frequency at which [[Event]]s will occur according to a schedule [[Schedule]]. The intervals between
      events should be defined as a [[Duration]] of time.

inputs.name: scheduleTimezone
inputs.label: scheduleTimezone
inputs.help: Indicates the timezone for which the time(s) indicated in the [[Schedule]] are given. The value provided should be among those listed in the IANA Time Zone Database.

inputs.name: startDate
inputs.label: startDate
inputs.help: The start date and time of the item (in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601)).

inputs.name: startTime
inputs.label: startTime
inputs.help: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

LoanOrCredit.name: LoanOrCredit
LoanOrCredit.help: A financial product for the loaning of an amount of money, or line of credit, under agreed terms and charges.

inputs.name: amount
inputs.label: amount
inputs.help: The amount of money.

inputs.name: currency
inputs.label: currency
inputs.help: The currency in which the monetary amount is expressed.\n\nUse standard formats: [ISO 4217 currency format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_4217), e.g. "USD"; [Ticker symbol](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_cryptocurrencies) for cryptocurrencies, e.g. "BTC"; well known names for [Local Exchange Trading Systems](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Local_exchange_trading_system) (LETS) and other currency types, e.g. "Ithaca HOUR".

inputs.name: gracePeriod
inputs.label: gracePeriod
inputs.help: The period of time after any due date that the borrower has to fulfil its obligations before a default (failure to pay) is deemed to have occurred.

inputs.name: loanRepaymentForm
inputs.label: loanRepaymentForm
inputs.help: A form of paying back money previously borrowed from a lender. Repayment usually takes the form of periodic payments that normally include part principal plus interest in each payment.

inputs.name: loanTerm
inputs.label: loanTerm
inputs.help: The duration of the loan or credit agreement.

inputs.name: loanType
inputs.label: loanType
inputs.help: The type of a loan or credit.

inputs.name: recourseLoan
inputs.label: recourseLoan
inputs.help: The only way you get the money back in the event of default is the security. Recourse is where you still have the opportunity to go back to the borrower for the rest of the money.

inputs.name: renegotiableLoan
inputs.label: renegotiableLoan
inputs.help: Whether the terms for payment of interest can be renegotiated during the life of the loan.

inputs.name: requiredCollateral
inputs.label: requiredCollateral
inputs.help: Assets required to secure loan or credit repayments. It may take form of third party pledge, goods, financial instruments (cash, securities, etc.)

MusicPlaylist.name: MusicPlaylist
MusicPlaylist.help: A collection of music tracks in playlist form.

inputs.name: numTracks
inputs.label: numTracks
inputs.help: The number of tracks in this album or playlist.

inputs.name: track
inputs.label: track
inputs.help: A music recording (track)—usually a single song. If an ItemList is given, the list should contain items of type MusicRecording.

inputs.name: tracks
inputs.label: tracks
inputs.help: A music recording (track)—usually a single song.

OfferForLease.name: OfferForLease
OfferForLease.help:
An [[OfferForLease]] in Schema.org represents an [[Offer]] to lease out something, i.e. an [[Offer]] whose
  [[businessFunction]] is [lease out](http://purl.org/goodrelations/v1#LeaseOut.). See [Good Relations](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/GoodRelations) for
  background on the underlying concepts.

MedicalTestPanel.name: MedicalTestPanel
MedicalTestPanel.help: Any collection of tests commonly ordered together.

inputs.name: subTest
inputs.label: subTest
inputs.help: A component test of the panel.

PublicationVolume.name: PublicationVolume
PublicationVolume.help: A part of a successively published publication such as a periodical or multi-volume work, often numbered. It may represent a time span, such as a year.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

inputs.name: pageEnd
inputs.label: pageEnd
inputs.help: The page on which the work ends; for example "138" or "xvi".

inputs.name: pageStart
inputs.label: pageStart
inputs.help: The page on which the work starts; for example "135" or "xiii".

inputs.name: pagination
inputs.label: pagination
inputs.help: Any description of pages that is not separated into pageStart and pageEnd; for example, "1-6, 9, 55" or "10-12, 46-49".

inputs.name: volumeNumber
inputs.label: volumeNumber
inputs.help: Identifies the volume of publication or multi-part work; for example, "iii" or "2".

UserBlocks.name: UserBlocks
UserBlocks.help: UserInteraction and its subtypes is an old way of talking about users interacting with pages. It is generally better to use [[Action]]-based vocabulary, alongside types such as [[Comment]].

Permit.name: Permit
Permit.help: A permit issued by an organization, e.g. a parking pass.

inputs.name: issuedBy
inputs.label: issuedBy
inputs.help: The organization issuing the item, for example a [[Permit]], [[Ticket]], or [[Certification]].

inputs.name: issuedThrough
inputs.label: issuedThrough
inputs.help: The service through which the permit was granted.

inputs.name: permitAudience
inputs.label: permitAudience
inputs.help: The target audience for this permit.

inputs.name: validFor
inputs.label: validFor
inputs.help: The duration of validity of a permit or similar thing.

inputs.name: validFrom
inputs.label: validFrom
inputs.help: The date when the item becomes valid.

inputs.name: validIn
inputs.label: validIn
inputs.help: The geographic area where the item is valid. Applies for example to a [[Permit]], a [[Certification]], or an [[EducationalOccupationalCredential]].

inputs.name: validUntil
inputs.label: validUntil
inputs.help: The date when the item is no longer valid.

PaymentStatusType.name: PaymentStatusType
PaymentStatusType.help: A specific payment status. For example, PaymentDue, PaymentComplete, etc.

ListItem.name: ListItem
ListItem.help: An list item, e.g. a step in a checklist or how-to description.

inputs.name: item
inputs.label: item
inputs.help: An entity represented by an entry in a list or data feed (e.g. an 'artist' in a list of 'artists').

inputs.name: nextItem
inputs.label: nextItem
inputs.help: A link to the ListItem that follows the current one.

inputs.name: position
inputs.label: position
inputs.help: The position of an item in a series or sequence of items.

inputs.name: previousItem
inputs.label: previousItem
inputs.help: A link to the ListItem that precedes the current one.

DisagreeAction.name: DisagreeAction
DisagreeAction.help: The act of expressing a difference of opinion with the object. An agent disagrees to/about an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

Substance.name: Substance
Substance.help: Any matter of defined composition that has discrete existence, whose origin may be biological, mineral or chemical.

inputs.name: activeIngredient
inputs.label: activeIngredient
inputs.help: An active ingredient, typically chemical compounds and/or biologic substances.

inputs.name: maximumIntake
inputs.label: maximumIntake
inputs.help: Recommended intake of this supplement for a given population as defined by a specific recommending authority.

MedicalAudienceType.name: MedicalAudienceType
MedicalAudienceType.help: Target audiences types for medical web pages. Enumerated type.

DoseSchedule.name: DoseSchedule
DoseSchedule.help: A specific dosing schedule for a drug or supplement.

inputs.name: doseUnit
inputs.label: doseUnit
inputs.help: The unit of the dose, e.g. 'mg'.

inputs.name: doseValue
inputs.label: doseValue
inputs.help: The value of the dose, e.g. 500.

inputs.name: frequency
inputs.label: frequency
inputs.help: How often the dose is taken, e.g. 'daily'.

inputs.name: targetPopulation
inputs.label: targetPopulation
inputs.help: Characteristics of the population for which this is intended, or which typically uses it, e.g. 'adults'.

ReturnFeesEnumeration.name: ReturnFeesEnumeration
ReturnFeesEnumeration.help: Enumerates several kinds of policies for product return fees.

QuantitativeValue.name: QuantitativeValue
QuantitativeValue.help: A point value or interval for product characteristics and other purposes.

inputs.name: additionalProperty
inputs.label: additionalProperty
inputs.help: A property-value pair representing an additional characteristic of the entity, e.g. a product feature or another characteristic for which there is no matching property in schema.org.\n\nNote: Publishers should be aware that applications designed to use specific schema.org properties (e.g. http://schema.org/width, http://schema.org/color, http://schema.org/gtin13, ...) will typically expect such data to be provided using those properties, rather than using the generic property/value mechanism.

inputs.name: maxValue
inputs.label: maxValue
inputs.help: The upper value of some characteristic or property.

inputs.name: minValue
inputs.label: minValue
inputs.help: The lower value of some characteristic or property.

inputs.name: unitCode
inputs.label: unitCode
inputs.help: The unit of measurement given using the UN/CEFACT Common Code (3 characters) or a URL. Other codes than the UN/CEFACT Common Code may be used with a prefix followed by a colon.

inputs.name: unitText
inputs.label: unitText
inputs.help: A string or text indicating the unit of measurement. Useful if you cannot provide a standard unit code for unitCode.

inputs.name: value
inputs.label: value
inputs.help:
The value of a [[QuantitativeValue]] (including [[Observation]]) or property value node.

* For [[QuantitativeValue]] and [[MonetaryAmount]], the recommended type for values is 'Number'.
* For [[PropertyValue]], it can be 'Text', 'Number', 'Boolean', or 'StructuredValue'.
* Use values from 0123456789 (Unicode 'DIGIT ZERO' (U+0030) to 'DIGIT NINE' (U+0039)) rather than superficially similar Unicode symbols.
* Use '.' (Unicode 'FULL STOP' (U+002E)) rather than ',' to indicate a decimal point. Avoid using these symbols as a readability separator.

inputs.name: valueReference
inputs.label: valueReference
inputs.help: A secondary value that provides additional information on the original value, e.g. a reference temperature or a type of measurement.

Season.name: Season
Season.help: A media season, e.g. TV, radio, video game etc.

QAPage.name: QAPage
QAPage.help: A QAPage is a WebPage focussed on a specific Question and its Answer(s), e.g. in a question answering site or documenting Frequently Asked Questions (FAQs).

ListenAction.name: ListenAction
ListenAction.help: The act of consuming audio content.

Resort.name: Resort
Resort.help:
A resort is a place used for relaxation or recreation, attracting visitors for holidays or vacations. Resorts are places, towns or sometimes commercial establishments operated by a single company (source: Wikipedia, the free encyclopedia, see http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Resort).

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

CertificationStatusEnumeration.name: CertificationStatusEnumeration
CertificationStatusEnumeration.help: Enumerates the different statuses of a Certification (Active and Inactive).

BroadcastFrequencySpecification.name: BroadcastFrequencySpecification
BroadcastFrequencySpecification.help: The frequency in MHz and the modulation used for a particular BroadcastService.

inputs.name: broadcastFrequencyValue
inputs.label: broadcastFrequencyValue
inputs.help: The frequency in MHz for a particular broadcast.

inputs.name: broadcastSignalModulation
inputs.label: broadcastSignalModulation
inputs.help: The modulation (e.g. FM, AM, etc) used by a particular broadcast service.

inputs.name: broadcastSubChannel
inputs.label: broadcastSubChannel
inputs.help: The subchannel used for the broadcast.

HowToSupply.name: HowToSupply
HowToSupply.help: A supply consumed when performing the instructions for how to achieve a result.

inputs.name: estimatedCost
inputs.label: estimatedCost
inputs.help: The estimated cost of the supply or supplies consumed when performing instructions.

AudioObjectSnapshot.name: AudioObjectSnapshot
AudioObjectSnapshot.help: A specific and exact (byte-for-byte) version of an [[AudioObject]]. Two byte-for-byte identical files, for the purposes of this type, considered identical. If they have different embedded metadata the files will differ. Different external facts about the files, e.g. creator or dateCreated that aren't represented in their actual content, do not affect this notion of identity.

inputs.name: downPayment
inputs.label: downPayment
inputs.help: a type of payment made in cash during the onset of the purchase of an expensive good/service. The payment typically represents only a percentage of the full purchase price.

inputs.name: earlyPrepaymentPenalty
inputs.label: earlyPrepaymentPenalty
inputs.help: The amount to be paid as a penalty in the event of early payment of the loan.

inputs.name: loanPaymentAmount
inputs.label: loanPaymentAmount
inputs.help: The amount of money to pay in a single payment.

inputs.name: loanPaymentFrequency
inputs.label: loanPaymentFrequency
inputs.help: Frequency of payments due, i.e. number of months between payments. This is defined as a frequency, i.e. the reciprocal of a period of time.

inputs.name: numberOfLoanPayments
inputs.label: numberOfLoanPayments
inputs.help: The number of payments contractually required at origination to repay the loan. For monthly paying loans this is the number of months from the contractual first payment date to the maturity date.

EventStatusType.name: EventStatusType
EventStatusType.help: EventStatusType is an enumeration type whose instances represent several states that an Event may be in.

WebSite.name: WebSite
WebSite.help: A WebSite is a set of related web pages and other items typically served from a single web domain and accessible via URLs.

inputs.name: issn
inputs.label: issn
inputs.help: The International Standard Serial Number (ISSN) that identifies this serial publication. You can repeat this property to identify different formats of, or the linking ISSN (ISSN-L) for, this serial publication.

AuthorizeAction.name: AuthorizeAction
AuthorizeAction.help: The act of granting permission to an object.

inputs.name: recipient
inputs.label: recipient
inputs.help: A sub property of participant. The participant who is at the receiving end of the action.

Campground.name: Campground
Campground.help:
A camping site, campsite, or [[Campground]] is a place used for overnight stay in the outdoors, typically containing individual [[CampingPitch]] locations. \n\n
In British English a campsite is an area, usually divided into a number of pitches, where people can camp overnight using tents or camper vans or caravans; this British English use of the word is synonymous with the American English expression campground. In American English the term campsite generally means an area where an individual, family, group, or military unit can pitch a tent or park a camper; a campground may contain many campsites (source: Wikipedia, see [https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Campsite)).\n\n

See also the dedicated [document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations](/docs/hotels.html).

Newspaper.name: Newspaper
Newspaper.help: A publication containing information about varied topics that are pertinent to general information, a geographic area, or a specific subject matter (i.e. business, culture, education). Often published daily.

TVSeries.name: TVSeries
TVSeries.help: CreativeWorkSeries dedicated to TV broadcast and associated online delivery.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: actors
inputs.label: actors
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: containsSeason
inputs.label: containsSeason
inputs.help: A season that is part of the media series.

inputs.name: countryOfOrigin
inputs.label: countryOfOrigin
inputs.help:
The country of origin of something, including products as well as creative  works such as movie and TV content.

In the case of TV and movie, this would be the country of the principle offices of the production company or individual responsible for the movie. For other kinds of [[CreativeWork]] it is difficult to provide fully general guidance, and properties such as [[contentLocation]] and [[locationCreated]] may be more applicable.

In the case of products, the country of origin of the product. The exact interpretation of this may vary by context and product type, and cannot be fully enumerated here.

inputs.name: director
inputs.label: director
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: directors
inputs.label: directors
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: episode
inputs.label: episode
inputs.help: An episode of a TV, radio or game media within a series or season.

inputs.name: episodes
inputs.label: episodes
inputs.help: An episode of a TV/radio series or season.

inputs.name: musicBy
inputs.label: musicBy
inputs.help: The composer of the soundtrack.

inputs.name: numberOfEpisodes
inputs.label: numberOfEpisodes
inputs.help: The number of episodes in this season or series.

inputs.name: numberOfSeasons
inputs.label: numberOfSeasons
inputs.help: The number of seasons in this series.

inputs.name: productionCompany
inputs.label: productionCompany
inputs.help: The production company or studio responsible for the item, e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

inputs.name: season
inputs.label: season
inputs.help: A season in a media series.

inputs.name: seasons
inputs.label: seasons
inputs.help: A season in a media series.

inputs.name: titleEIDR
inputs.label: titleEIDR
inputs.help:
An [EIDR](https://eidr.org/) (Entertainment Identifier Registry) [[identifier]] representing at the most general/abstract level, a work of film or television.

For example, the motion picture known as "Ghostbusters" has a titleEIDR of  "10.5240/7EC7-228A-510A-053E-CBB8-J". This title (or work) may have several variants, which EIDR calls "edits". See [[editEIDR]].

Since schema.org types like [[Movie]], [[TVEpisode]], [[TVSeason]], and [[TVSeries]] can be used for both works and their multiple expressions, it is possible to use [[titleEIDR]] alone (for a general description), or alongside [[editEIDR]] for a more edit-specific description.

inputs.name: trailer
inputs.label: trailer
inputs.help: The trailer of a movie or TV/radio series, season, episode, etc.

Consortium.name: Consortium
Consortium.help: A Consortium is a membership [[Organization]] whose members are typically Organizations.

Review.name: Review
Review.help: A review of an item - for example, of a restaurant, movie, or store.

inputs.name: associatedClaimReview
inputs.label: associatedClaimReview
inputs.help: An associated [[ClaimReview]], related by specific common content, topic or claim. The expectation is that this property would be most typically used in cases where a single activity is conducting both claim reviews and media reviews, in which case [[relatedMediaReview]] would commonly be used on a [[ClaimReview]], while [[relatedClaimReview]] would be used on [[MediaReview]].

inputs.name: associatedMediaReview
inputs.label: associatedMediaReview
inputs.help: An associated [[MediaReview]], related by specific common content, topic or claim. The expectation is that this property would be most typically used in cases where a single activity is conducting both claim reviews and media reviews, in which case [[relatedMediaReview]] would commonly be used on a [[ClaimReview]], while [[relatedClaimReview]] would be used on [[MediaReview]].

inputs.name: associatedReview
inputs.label: associatedReview
inputs.help: An associated [[Review]].

inputs.name: itemReviewed
inputs.label: itemReviewed
inputs.help: The item that is being reviewed/rated.

inputs.name: negativeNotes
inputs.label: negativeNotes
inputs.help:
Provides negative considerations regarding something, most typically in pro/con lists for reviews (alongside [[positiveNotes]]). For symmetry 

In the case of a [[Review]], the property describes the [[itemReviewed]] from the perspective of the review; in the case of a [[Product]], the product itself is being described. Since product descriptions 
tend to emphasise positive claims, it may be relatively unusual to find [[negativeNotes]] used in this way. Nevertheless for the sake of symmetry, [[negativeNotes]] can be used on [[Product]].

The property values can be expressed either as unstructured text (repeated as necessary), or if ordered, as a list (in which case the most negative is at the beginning of the list).

inputs.name: positiveNotes
inputs.label: positiveNotes
inputs.help:
Provides positive considerations regarding something, for example product highlights or (alongside [[negativeNotes]]) pro/con lists for reviews.

In the case of a [[Review]], the property describes the [[itemReviewed]] from the perspective of the review; in the case of a [[Product]], the product itself is being described.

The property values can be expressed either as unstructured text (repeated as necessary), or if ordered, as a list (in which case the most positive is at the beginning of the list).

inputs.name: reviewAspect
inputs.label: reviewAspect
inputs.help: This Review or Rating is relevant to this part or facet of the itemReviewed.

inputs.name: reviewBody
inputs.label: reviewBody
inputs.help: The actual body of the review.

inputs.name: reviewRating
inputs.label: reviewRating
inputs.help: The rating given in this review. Note that reviews can themselves be rated. The ```reviewRating``` applies to rating given by the review. The [[aggregateRating]] property applies to the review itself, as a creative work.

MusicGroup.name: MusicGroup
MusicGroup.help: A musical group, such as a band, an orchestra, or a choir. Can also be a solo musician.

inputs.name: album
inputs.label: album
inputs.help: A music album.

inputs.name: albums
inputs.label: albums
inputs.help: A collection of music albums.

inputs.name: genre
inputs.label: genre
inputs.help: Genre of the creative work, broadcast channel or group.

inputs.name: musicGroupMember
inputs.label: musicGroupMember
inputs.help: A member of a music group—for example, John, Paul, George, or Ringo.

inputs.name: track
inputs.label: track
inputs.help: A music recording (track)—usually a single song. If an ItemList is given, the list should contain items of type MusicRecording.

inputs.name: tracks
inputs.label: tracks
inputs.help: A music recording (track)—usually a single song.

OrderAction.name: OrderAction
OrderAction.help: An agent orders an object/product/service to be delivered/sent.

inputs.name: deliveryMethod
inputs.label: deliveryMethod
inputs.help: A sub property of instrument. The method of delivery.

APIReference.name: APIReference
APIReference.help: Reference documentation for application programming interfaces (APIs).

inputs.name: assembly
inputs.label: assembly
inputs.help: Library file name, e.g., mscorlib.dll, system.web.dll.

inputs.name: assemblyVersion
inputs.label: assemblyVersion
inputs.help: Associated product/technology version. E.g., .NET Framework 4.5.

inputs.name: executableLibraryName
inputs.label: executableLibraryName
inputs.help: Library file name, e.g., mscorlib.dll, system.web.dll.

inputs.name: programmingModel
inputs.label: programmingModel
inputs.help: Indicates whether API is managed or unmanaged.

inputs.name: targetPlatform
inputs.label: targetPlatform
inputs.help: Type of app development: phone, Metro style, desktop, XBox, etc.

LikeAction.name: LikeAction
LikeAction.help: The act of expressing a positive sentiment about the object. An agent likes an object (a proposition, topic or theme) with participants.

MedicalAudience.name: MedicalAudience
MedicalAudience.help: Target audiences for medical web pages.

PaymentService.name: PaymentService
PaymentService.help: A Service to transfer funds from a person or organization to a beneficiary person or organization.

PriceTypeEnumeration.name: PriceTypeEnumeration
PriceTypeEnumeration.help: Enumerates different price types, for example list price, invoice price, and sale price.

RentalCarReservation.name: RentalCarReservation
RentalCarReservation.help: A reservation for a rental car.\n\nNote: This type is for information about actual reservations, e.g. in confirmation emails or HTML pages with individual confirmations of reservations.

inputs.name: dropoffLocation
inputs.label: dropoffLocation
inputs.help: Where a rental car can be dropped off.

inputs.name: dropoffTime
inputs.label: dropoffTime
inputs.help: When a rental car can be dropped off.

inputs.name: pickupLocation
inputs.label: pickupLocation
inputs.help: Where a taxi will pick up a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

inputs.name: pickupTime
inputs.label: pickupTime
inputs.help: When a taxi will pick up a passenger or a rental car can be picked up.

NLNonprofitType.name: NLNonprofitType
NLNonprofitType.help: NLNonprofitType: Non-profit organization type originating from the Netherlands.

SizeGroupEnumeration.name: SizeGroupEnumeration
SizeGroupEnumeration.help: Enumerates common size groups for various product categories.

inputs.name: awayTeam
inputs.label: awayTeam
inputs.help: The away team in a sports event.

inputs.name: competitor
inputs.label: competitor
inputs.help: A competitor in a sports event.

inputs.name: homeTeam
inputs.label: homeTeam
inputs.help: The home team in a sports event.

inputs.name: sport
inputs.label: sport
inputs.help: A type of sport (e.g. Baseball).

InformAction.name: InformAction
InformAction.help: The act of notifying someone of information pertinent to them, with no expectation of a response.

inputs.name: event
inputs.label: event
inputs.help: Upcoming or past event associated with this place, organization, or action.

Bone.name: Bone
Bone.help: Rigid connective tissue that comprises up the skeletal structure of the human body.

MusicRelease.name: MusicRelease
MusicRelease.help: A MusicRelease is a specific release of a music album.

inputs.name: catalogNumber
inputs.label: catalogNumber
inputs.help: The catalog number for the release.

inputs.name: creditedTo
inputs.label: creditedTo
inputs.help: The group the release is credited to if different than the byArtist. For example, Red and Blue is credited to "Stefani Germanotta Band", but by Lady Gaga.

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: duration
inputs.help: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: musicReleaseFormat
inputs.label: musicReleaseFormat
inputs.help: Format of this release (the type of recording media used, i.e. compact disc, digital media, LP, etc.).

inputs.name: recordLabel
inputs.label: recordLabel
inputs.help: The label that issued the release.

inputs.name: releaseOf
inputs.label: releaseOf
inputs.help: The album this is a release of.

Clip.name: Clip
Clip.help: A short TV or radio program or a segment/part of a program.

inputs.name: actor
inputs.label: actor
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc., or in an event. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: actors
inputs.label: actors
inputs.help: An actor, e.g. in TV, radio, movie, video games etc. Actors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: clipNumber
inputs.label: clipNumber
inputs.help: Position of the clip within an ordered group of clips.

inputs.name: director
inputs.label: director
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video gaming etc. content, or of an event. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: directors
inputs.label: directors
inputs.help: A director of e.g. TV, radio, movie, video games etc. content. Directors can be associated with individual items or with a series, episode, clip.

inputs.name: endOffset
inputs.label: endOffset
inputs.help: The end time of the clip expressed as the number of seconds from the beginning of the work.

inputs.name: musicBy
inputs.label: musicBy
inputs.help: The composer of the soundtrack.

inputs.name: partOfEpisode
inputs.label: partOfEpisode
inputs.help: The episode to which this clip belongs.

inputs.name: partOfSeason
inputs.label: partOfSeason
inputs.help: The season to which this episode belongs.

inputs.name: partOfSeries
inputs.label: partOfSeries
inputs.help: The series to which this episode or season belongs.

inputs.name: startOffset
inputs.label: startOffset
inputs.help: The start time of the clip expressed as the number of seconds from the beginning of the work.

inputs.name: inLanguage
inputs.label: inLanguage
inputs.help: The language of the content or performance or used in an action. Please use one of the language codes from the [IETF BCP 47 standard](http://tools.ietf.org/html/bcp47). See also [[availableLanguage]].

inputs.name: phoneticText
inputs.label: phoneticText
inputs.help: Representation of a text [[textValue]] using the specified [[speechToTextMarkup]]. For example the city name of Houston in IPA: /ˈhjuːstən/.

inputs.name: speechToTextMarkup
inputs.label: speechToTextMarkup
inputs.help: Form of markup used. eg. [SSML](https://www.w3.org/TR/speech-synthesis11) or [IPA](https://www.wikidata.org/wiki/Property:P898).

inputs.name: textValue
inputs.label: textValue
inputs.help: Text value being annotated.

InteractionCounter.name: InteractionCounter
InteractionCounter.help: A summary of how users have interacted with this CreativeWork. In most cases, authors will use a subtype to specify the specific type of interaction.

inputs.name: endTime
inputs.label: endTime
inputs.help: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

inputs.name: interactionService
inputs.label: interactionService
inputs.help: The WebSite or SoftwareApplication where the interactions took place.

inputs.name: interactionType
inputs.label: interactionType
inputs.help: The Action representing the type of interaction. For up votes, +1s, etc. use [[LikeAction]]. For down votes use [[DislikeAction]]. Otherwise, use the most specific Action.

inputs.name: location
inputs.label: location
inputs.help: The location of, for example, where an event is happening, where an organization is located, or where an action takes place.

inputs.name: startTime
inputs.label: startTime
inputs.help: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

inputs.name: userInteractionCount
inputs.label: userInteractionCount
inputs.help: The number of interactions for the CreativeWork using the WebSite or SoftwareApplication.

DeliveryTimeSettings.name: DeliveryTimeSettings
DeliveryTimeSettings.help: A DeliveryTimeSettings represents re-usable pieces of shipping information, relating to timing. It is designed for publication on an URL that may be referenced via the [[shippingSettingsLink]] property of an [[OfferShippingDetails]]. Several occurrences can be published, distinguished (and identified/referenced) by their different values for [[transitTimeLabel]].

inputs.name: deliveryTime
inputs.label: deliveryTime
inputs.help: The total delay between the receipt of the order and the goods reaching the final customer.

inputs.name: isUnlabelledFallback
inputs.label: isUnlabelledFallback
inputs.help: This can be marked 'true' to indicate that some published [[DeliveryTimeSettings]] or [[ShippingRateSettings]] are intended to apply to all [[OfferShippingDetails]] published by the same merchant, when referenced by a [[shippingSettingsLink]] in those settings. It is not meaningful to use a 'true' value for this property alongside a transitTimeLabel (for [[DeliveryTimeSettings]]) or shippingLabel (for [[ShippingRateSettings]]), since this property is for use with unlabelled settings.

inputs.name: shippingDestination
inputs.label: shippingDestination
inputs.help: indicates (possibly multiple) shipping destinations. These can be defined in several ways, e.g. postalCode ranges.

inputs.name: transitTimeLabel
inputs.label: transitTimeLabel
inputs.help: Label to match an [[OfferShippingDetails]] with a [[DeliveryTimeSettings]] (within the context of a [[shippingSettingsLink]] cross-reference).

FollowAction.name: FollowAction
FollowAction.help:
The act of forming a personal connection with someone/something (object) unidirectionally/asymmetrically to get updates polled from.

Related actions:

* [[BefriendAction]]: Unlike BefriendAction, FollowAction implies that the connection is *not* necessarily reciprocal.
* [[SubscribeAction]]: Unlike SubscribeAction, FollowAction implies that the follower acts as an active agent constantly/actively polling for updates.
* [[RegisterAction]]: Unlike RegisterAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in continuing receiving updates from the object.
* [[JoinAction]]: Unlike JoinAction, FollowAction implies that the agent is interested in getting updates from the object.
* [[TrackAction]]: Unlike TrackAction, FollowAction refers to the polling of updates of all aspects of animate objects rather than the location of inanimate objects (e.g. you track a package, but you don't follow it).

inputs.name: followee
inputs.label: followee
inputs.help: A sub property of object. The person or organization being followed.

Car.name: Car
Car.help: A car is a wheeled, self-powered motor vehicle used for transportation.

inputs.name: acrissCode
inputs.label: acrissCode
inputs.help: The ACRISS Car Classification Code is a code used by many car rental companies, for classifying vehicles. ACRISS stands for Association of Car Rental Industry Systems and Standards.

inputs.name: roofLoad
inputs.label: roofLoad
inputs.help:
The permitted total weight of cargo and installations (e.g. a roof rack) on top of the vehicle.

Typical unit code(s): KGM for kilogram, LBR for pound

* Note 1: You can indicate additional information in the [[name]] of the [[QuantitativeValue]] node.
* Note 2: You may also link to a [[QualitativeValue]] node that provides additional information using [[valueReference]]
* Note 3: Note that you can use [[minValue]] and [[maxValue]] to indicate ranges.

UseAction.name: UseAction
UseAction.help: The act of applying an object to its intended purpose.

AskPublicNewsArticle.name: AskPublicNewsArticle
AskPublicNewsArticle.help: A [[NewsArticle]] expressing an open call by a [[NewsMediaOrganization]] asking the public for input, insights, clarifications, anecdotes, documentation, etc., on an issue, for reporting purposes.

Menu.name: Menu
Menu.help: A structured representation of food or drink items available from a FoodEstablishment.

inputs.name: hasMenuItem
inputs.label: hasMenuItem
inputs.help: A food or drink item contained in a menu or menu section.

inputs.name: hasMenuSection
inputs.label: hasMenuSection
inputs.help: A subgrouping of the menu (by dishes, course, serving time period, etc.).

MedicalGuideline.name: MedicalGuideline
MedicalGuideline.help: Any recommendation made by a standard society (e.g. ACC/AHA) or consensus statement that denotes how to diagnose and treat a particular condition. Note: this type should be used to tag the actual guideline recommendation; if the guideline recommendation occurs in a larger scholarly article, use MedicalScholarlyArticle to tag the overall article, not this type. Note also: the organization making the recommendation should be captured in the recognizingAuthority base property of MedicalEntity.

inputs.name: evidenceLevel
inputs.label: evidenceLevel
inputs.help: Strength of evidence of the data used to formulate the guideline (enumerated).

inputs.name: evidenceOrigin
inputs.label: evidenceOrigin
inputs.help: Source of the data used to formulate the guidance, e.g. RCT, consensus opinion, etc.

inputs.name: guidelineDate
inputs.label: guidelineDate
inputs.help: Date on which this guideline's recommendation was made.

inputs.name: guidelineSubject
inputs.label: guidelineSubject
inputs.help: The medical conditions, treatments, etc. that are the subject of the guideline.

CriticReview.name: CriticReview
CriticReview.help: A [[CriticReview]] is a more specialized form of Review written or published by a source that is recognized for its reviewing activities. These can include online columns, travel and food guides, TV and radio shows, blogs and other independent Web sites. [[CriticReview]]s are typically more in-depth and professionally written. For simpler, casually written user/visitor/viewer/customer reviews, it is more appropriate to use the [[UserReview]] type. Review aggregator sites such as Metacritic already separate out the site's user reviews from selected critic reviews that originate from third-party sources.

SiteNavigationElement.name: SiteNavigationElement
SiteNavigationElement.help: A navigation element of the page.

Hostel.name: Hostel
Hostel.help:
A hostel - cheap accommodation, often in shared dormitories.

See also the dedicated document on the use of schema.org for marking up hotels and other forms of accommodations.

RejectAction.name: RejectAction
RejectAction.help:
The act of rejecting to/adopting an object.

Related actions:

* [[AcceptAction]]: The antonym of RejectAction.

Object.name: Object
Object.help: An Object is an intellectual entity, sometimes called a "work", "digital object", etc. Objects have descriptive metadata, access metadata, may contain files and other Objects as member "components". Each level of a work is therefore represented by an Object instance, and is capable of standing on its own, being linked to from Collections and other Objects. Member Objects can be ordered using the ORE Proxy class.

inputs.name: hasFile
inputs.label: hasFile
inputs.help: Links to a File contained by this Object.

inputs.name: hasMember
inputs.label: hasMember
inputs.help: Links to a subsidiary Object or Collection. Typically used to link to component parts, such as a book linking to a page.  Note on transitivity: hasMember is   not defined as transitive, but applications may treat it as transitive as local needs   dictate.

inputs.name: memberOf
inputs.label: memberOf
inputs.help: Links from an Object or Collection to a containing Object or Collection.

inputs.name: ComputationalWorkflow#input
inputs.label: ComputationalWorkflow#input
inputs.help: An input required to use the computational workflow (eg. Excel spreadsheet, BAM file)

inputs.name: ComputationalWorkflow#output
inputs.label: ComputationalWorkflow#output
inputs.help: An output produced by the computational workflow

FormalParameter.name: FormalParameter
FormalParameter.help: A FormalParameter is an identified variable used to stand for the actual value(s) that are consumed/produced by a set of steps

Journal.name: Journal
Journal.help: A publication in any medium issued in successive parts bearing numerical or chronological designations and intended to continue indefinitely, such as a magazine, scholarly journal, or newspaper.\n\nSee also [blog post](http://blog.schema.org/2014/09/schemaorg-support-for-bibliographic_2.html).

RepositoryCollection.name: RepositoryCollection
RepositoryCollection.help: A collection of items, e.g. creative works or products.

inputs.name: collectionSize
inputs.label: collectionSize
inputs.help: The number of items in the [[Collection]].

inputs.name: hasMember
inputs.label: hasMember
inputs.help: Links to a subsidiary Object or Collection. Typically used to link to component parts, such as a book linking to a page.  Note on transitivity: hasMember is   not defined as transitive, but applications may treat it as transitive as local needs   dictate.

inputs.name: memberOf
inputs.label: memberOf
inputs.help: Links from an Object or Collection to a containing Object or Collection.

File.name: File
File.help: A media object, such as an image, video, audio, or text object embedded in a web page or a downloadable dataset i.e. DataDownload. Note that a creative work may have many media objects associated with it on the same web page. For example, a page about a single song (MusicRecording) may have a music video (VideoObject), and a high and low bandwidth audio stream (2 AudioObject's).

inputs.name: associatedArticle
inputs.label: associatedArticle
inputs.help: A NewsArticle associated with the Media Object.

inputs.name: bitrate
inputs.label: bitrate
inputs.help: The bitrate of the media object.

inputs.name: contentSize
inputs.label: contentSize
inputs.help: File size in (mega/kilo)bytes.

inputs.name: contentUrl
inputs.label: contentUrl
inputs.help: Actual bytes of the media object, for example the image file or video file.

inputs.name: duration
inputs.label: duration
inputs.help: The duration of the item (movie, audio recording, event, etc.) in [ISO 8601 date format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_8601).

inputs.name: embedUrl
inputs.label: embedUrl
inputs.help: A URL pointing to a player for a specific video. In general, this is the information in the ```src``` element of an ```embed``` tag and should not be the same as the content of the ```loc``` tag.

inputs.name: encodesCreativeWork
inputs.label: encodesCreativeWork
inputs.help: The CreativeWork encoded by this media object.

inputs.name: encodingFormat
inputs.label: encodingFormat
inputs.help:
Media type typically expressed using a MIME format (see [IANA site](http://www.iana.org/assignments/media-types/media-types.xhtml) and [MDN reference](https://developer.mozilla.org/en-US/docs/Web/HTTP/Basics_of_HTTP/MIME_types)), e.g. application/zip for a SoftwareApplication binary, audio/mpeg for .mp3 etc.

In cases where a [[CreativeWork]] has several media type representations, [[encoding]] can be used to indicate each [[MediaObject]] alongside particular [[encodingFormat]] information.

Unregistered or niche encoding and file formats can be indicated instead via the most appropriate URL, e.g. defining Web page or a Wikipedia/Wikidata entry.

inputs.name: endTime
inputs.label: endTime
inputs.help: The endTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to end. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from January to *December*. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the end of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

inputs.name: fileOf
inputs.label: fileOf
inputs.help: Links from a File to its containing Object.

inputs.name: height
inputs.label: height
inputs.help: The height of the item.

inputs.name: ineligibleRegion
inputs.label: ineligibleRegion
inputs.help: The ISO 3166-1 (ISO 3166-1 alpha-2) or ISO 3166-2 code, the place, or the GeoShape for the geo-political region(s) for which the offer or delivery charge specification is not valid, e.g. a region where the transaction is not allowed.\n\nSee also [[eligibleRegion]].

inputs.name: interpretedAsClaim
inputs.label: interpretedAsClaim
inputs.help: Used to indicate a specific claim contained, implied, translated or refined from the content of a [[MediaObject]] or other [[CreativeWork]]. The interpreting party can be indicated using [[claimInterpreter]].

inputs.name: playerType
inputs.label: playerType
inputs.help: Player type required—for example, Flash or Silverlight.

inputs.name: productionCompany
inputs.label: productionCompany
inputs.help: The production company or studio responsible for the item, e.g. series, video game, episode etc.

inputs.name: regionsAllowed
inputs.label: regionsAllowed
inputs.help: The regions where the media is allowed. If not specified, then it's assumed to be allowed everywhere. Specify the countries in [ISO 3166 format](http://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/ISO_3166).

inputs.name: requiresSubscription
inputs.label: requiresSubscription
inputs.help: Indicates if use of the media require a subscription  (either paid or free). Allowed values are ```true``` or ```false``` (note that an earlier version had 'yes', 'no').

inputs.name: resultOf
inputs.label: resultOf
inputs.help: Inverse of property result

inputs.name: sha256
inputs.label: sha256
inputs.help: The [SHA-2](https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/SHA-2) SHA256 hash of the content of the item. For example, a zero-length input has value 'e3b0c44298fc1c149afbf4c8996fb92427ae41e4649b934ca495991b7852b855'.

inputs.name: startTime
inputs.label: startTime
inputs.help: The startTime of something. For a reserved event or service (e.g. FoodEstablishmentReservation), the time that it is expected to start. For actions that span a period of time, when the action was performed. E.g. John wrote a book from *January* to December. For media, including audio and video, it's the time offset of the start of a clip within a larger file.\n\nNote that Event uses startDate/endDate instead of startTime/endTime, even when describing dates with times. This situation may be clarified in future revisions.

inputs.name: uploadDate
inputs.label: uploadDate
inputs.help: Date (including time if available) when this media object was uploaded to this site.

inputs.name: width
inputs.label: width
inputs.help: The width of the item.

RepositoryObject.name: RepositoryObject
RepositoryObject.help: An Object is an intellectual entity, sometimes called a "work", "digital object", etc. Objects have descriptive metadata, access metadata, may contain files and other Objects as member "components". Each level of a work is therefore represented by an Object instance, and is capable of standing on its own, being linked to from Collections and other Objects. Member Objects can be ordered using the ORE Proxy class.

inputs.name: hasFile
inputs.label: hasFile
inputs.help: Links to a File contained by this Object.

inputs.name: hasMember
inputs.label: hasMember
inputs.help: Links to a subsidiary Object or Collection. Typically used to link to component parts, such as a book linking to a page.  Note on transitivity: hasMember is   not defined as transitive, but applications may treat it as transitive as local needs   dictate.

inputs.name: memberOf
inputs.label: memberOf
inputs.help: Links from an Object or Collection to a containing Object or Collection.
